Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGNorway
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a quiet but interesting and very centrally located street at Montparnasse. Expedient and attentive service at the front desk. Clean and tidy. Self-service bar is a brilliant concept, most convenient. The elevator is as small as they get, even in Paris - but it did the job. Room 50 must be the smallest they have, hard to find a place for the suitcase. However, we will go back, but to a slightly larger room. Toril & Geir

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Sondergaard
Reviews.Content: Just perfect. Only get a room to the back. Streets is very busy in the mornings, but its Paris in the morning. We loved the location and the man working at night was extreemly servise minded and english was no proplem. We finnaly found our Paris hotell after trying many. Location was great, 50 meters to the Metro. Close to Orly airport. 35 euro taxifare at night.. Its cheap..

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeasSouthampton
Reviews.Content: At the risk of repeating others' comments this was a great find courtesy of a Eurostar deal. Only five minutes from the nearest Metro, with plenty of good restaurants and bars in the vicinity. Our room was 'bijou' but perfectly acceptable. All clean and tidy, and a decent bathroom. The staff were all very friendly, helpful and professional, for example printing off maps for us when the one that the hotel provided wasn't detailed enough. The honesty bar was a great idea and great value for good Sancerre (€6 which was very competitive.) All in all, great value in a good location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunil H
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights. 5 minute walk to 2 metro lines, very clean, great shower, free wifi, free cable. Great nearby restaurants, bakeries, grocey stores and cafes. Had good recommendations for restaurants. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Korey R
Reviews.Content: Everyone was super nice and the rooms were small but clean and welcoming. A fun location too -- it is convenient to several metro stops and there are a lot of bars and restaurants nearby, but it wasn't in the middle of tourist hell. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Eurostar Paris Package Deal”
Reviews.Author: Tickythebull_12
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked a package deal through the Eurostar website and travelled with 2 friends in February 2012. We read the reviews for Hotel Lenox on tripadvisor and the Hotel did not disappoint. We stayed for three nights and at the time Paris was bitterly cold, staying below freezing for pretty much the entire stay. We love the Eurostar experience and the link up they have with this Hotel made the trip extremely good value. We left Kent on the morning of the 6th Feb, the journey was delayed very slightly due to the extreme weather conditions. Arriving in Paris at Gare Du Nord we made our way to the Metro and purchased 4 tickets to Vavin, good value on the Metro with a one way ticket at 1.70 euros each. The metro stop, Vavin, is only around 100 metres from The Hotel, the time on the tube is about twenty minutes and the trains are very frequent, you never have to wait for more than a few minutes. On arrival at the Hotel we were earlier than the usual check in time by about 2 hours but the efficient lady on reception informed that one room was ready and the other would soon be ready so we dumped our cases in the available room and went off to explore Paris. The Hotel is in a great location on the south side of Paris, its a long walk down to the Seine and the city centre but there is so much to see along the way. The Hotel is surrounded by very good eateries and bars, we were spolit for choice and some very good food during our stay. We did not take up the option of breakfast at the hotel but found a nice sandwich bar just down the road that served great coffee, pastries, paninis and superb cakes. Our room was very nice, clean comfortable, warm and quite well appointed, we did pay for the club rooms when booking on the eurostar website because we had read that generally rooms are very small in Paris hotels. Most afternoons after sightseeing we did take advantage of the hotel bar, a good selection of drinks, clean and comfortable surroundings. We duly filled out the honesty bar forms. Most evenings we would meet in the bar before departing to a local restaurant. In all a good hotel in a good location, we loved Paris and would like to return one day but not during the middle of winter.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Loopylalaland
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel, rooms small but perfectly formed. Not 5* but not 5* price either. Really liked the area around the hotel ate in this area each night as much better value than elsewhere. Would go back to this hotel next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: ismunn
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel as a surprise trip for my wife. We travelled with Eurostar and this was one of the options. Having read all the positive reviews, I booked two nights at the Lenox Montparnasse and was really pleased I did. The Hotel is just off the Montparnasse Boulevard and we took the metro to the Vavin stop. We arrived slightly early for check-in, but we were warmly greeted by the receptionist. There were several others checking in, so she addressed us all in English. She jokingly said that people were coming in waves of languages, making life easier. Our room wasn't quite ready, so we waited in the lounge and offered tea and coffee. Ten minutes later, we were given a key, WiFi access for two devices and breakfast options (which we didn't take). We had also been upgraded to larger room too! The room itself was clean with tea making facilities, nice bathroom and street side view. The television had films on demand for free. I really cannot say how much I was impressed with the service and the hotel. We had never been to France before and we were made to feel so welcome. They appreciated us speaking French, but spoke in English. It was very well located and landed up walking everywhere rather than using the metro. There was a wide selection of cafes, bakeries and a shopping centre close by and yet, the hotel room was quiet and we slept well. If you are considering a trip to Paris, definitely add this hotel to your itinerary and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: Well I just got back yesterday from a 3 night stay in Paris with my boyfriend, neither of us had stayed in Paris before so we asked around and got a couple of recommendations but didn't like the reviews on here of the 1s that were originally suggested to us. I found this hotel by accident as it came up as an option when I was booking the Eurostar & after checking it out on here we decided that it looked like a lovely hotel & booked ourselves in for a club room with a special offer where we got breakfast for free. We turned up on Wednesday about 10am as we were on an early Eurostar trip, this was 4 hours earlier than normal check in. The previous occupants had just checked out of their room so we were asked to return in an hour to allow housekeeping to ensure it was cleaned & ready for us, we left our suitcase in their luggage room & went off for a bit of a wonder around the neighbourhood. We accidentally came across the Montparnasse tower which we didn't realise was so close to the hotel & decided to go to the top & look. There was also a little market on the way back to the hotel & we found a Metro station on Line 6 which was about 5 mins walk from the hotel, along with the Line 4 Metro station that we had originally got off at which was about 3 minutes in the other direction-wonderfully located for getting around Paris. In the same road as the hotel there was a cheese shop, plenty of restaurants & pubs, a couple of souvenir shops, wine shop, 2 mini market/supermarket shops & 2 bakeries plus a tobacconist just round the corner along with a whole range of everything you could ever need! Once we were checked in we took our things upstairs & unpacked and got settled in, we were on the 2nd floor overlooking the courtyard at the back and found that it was a decent size room & good sized bathroom but the bath was quite small, more than adequate for a holiday though! There are a few reviews that say the rooms were too small, well my boyfriend & I are both bigger than average & we had no problems with the room size, the bed was lovely to sleep in too! The room was very clean, thoroughly cleaned & clean towels each day too. Also had a little safe in the wardrobe which was ideal for us to leave a few bits in while we were out & about for the day! The only downside was that the bath screen didn't really go far enough back when having a shower as we always ended up with a bit of a puddle but was nothing a towel on the floor couldn't solve. It was also a fairly warm room & we couldn't seem to get the air con to make it cooler so we opened the window instead & it was fine other than around 6 am when the building behind us must have been having deliveries & it was quite loud but I was already awake by then & my boyfriend slept through the noise! Free WiFi codes were given to us when we arrived & mine was no problem, my boyfriends didn't work 1st time so he went down to reception & they sorted him out a new log in code etc. We were also told that if we wanted to print we could do so free of charge down to the printer by reception, also the films were free which was lovely as it allowed us to lay & watch them late in the evening after our days out without having to spend a fortune to do so! The staff on the front desk were very helpful & spoke good English which was good as my French is a bit rusty & my boyfriend doesn't know anything other than the 3 essentials I got him to remember, please, thanks and sorry! The breakfast was great too, lovely range of food for my boyfriend to fill up on before a long day out & about, typical continental buffet breakfast really-bacon, sausages, scrambled egg, cheeses, ham, salami, cereal, milk, yoghurt, orange juice, grapefruit juice, rolls, toast, croissants, pain on chocolate/raisin chocolate milk, tea, coffee, jams, marmalade, fruit, mustard & ketchup, everything you could need really! They also had their honesty bar & free tea/coffee in the afternoon/evening but we didn't use this as we weren't in the hotel much during the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel & will hopefully be returning in the future as it was exactly what we wanted and was so central that it made getting a bit really easy!

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien”
Reviews.Author: Eric M
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 great nights at Lenox Montparnasse. Wonderful and knowledgeable staff were more than wiling to assist with reservations, tours, airport transfers and restaurant recommendations. Convenient location with 2 metro stops nearby not to mention cafes, restaurants, boulangeries, and a laundromat. As with any major metropolitan city, rooms were smallish but perfectly fine. Street was noisy -- but people were having fun; hey, it's Paris! The doors to the Juliette balcony provided good sound attenuation. Walls between rooms were a tad thin but after a day of walking that magnificent city and some great French wine, who noticed? We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jdwillis81
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Paris and stayed for eight nights at the Lenox Montparnasse (15 rue Delambre). This hotel was perfect for a couple. By European reputation, I expected a small bed, but when we arrived we found a queen and it seemed most beds had similar. We had a room on the street side and could open our window to the cool weather and the active street scene below. It became a little noisy late and in the early morning with street cleaning, but we were used to the noise since we live in Austin. Rue Delambre sits between Boulevard Montparnasse and Edgar Quinet and La Gaite. It was an easy walk to several nice bistros, cafes and around the corner from Creperie Josselin (a dynamite crepe restaurant). Delambre has a few cafes and two boucheries that had some tasty pastries. The hotel is also situated between two Metro stops (Edgar Quinet (6 train) and Vavin (4 train)) which made it convenient for getting most everywhere in Paris. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HungryandHipinBrazil
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse is exactly where you expect to stay when you dream of a romantic trip to Paris. As you enter the hotel, with it's warm lobby with deep burgundy tones, catching a glimpse of the cozy bar with warm autumn colors, rich fabrics, plush chairs, and filled bookcases, you feel like you have stepped back into the romantic Paris of the 1920s. The front desk staff is cheerful and professional and speaks some English. We chose the club room, which was newly renovated and opened out onto a quiet courtyard. While the room was quite cramped (as I always expect in Paris), the bathroom was particularly spacious and bright with fancy shabby chic fixtures and toiletries from Provence. It even had a bathtub. Perhaps it was due to the low season, but we got a fantastic deal of 150 euros a night, which included the hotel's generous breakfast buffet for two and a half bottle of excellent champagne (the real deal--not sparkling wine). Wifi is free throughout the hotel (just get a code at the front desk) and non-alocholic beverages in the mini bar are all-you-can-drink for 6 euros. Another perk is free pay-per-view movies in the room (though who is going to stay in and watch movies in Paris?) The Lenox is the perfect hotel for a romantic getaway. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay - would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Wish-I-had-more-hols
Reviews.Content: My partner and I made use of the eurostar package & chose this hotel, which is near a metro station, great for getting around. The street itself is quiet - we were in a room on the fifth floor facing the back courtyard. Room itself small, but had everything we needed, and very quiet. Receptionists very friendly, and helpful. We made use of the honesty bar. Overall no complaints. One small negative though - stick to the continental breakfast (â‚¬10) - the cooked breakfast option is â‚¬17 and you get tiny sausages (very strong tasting!), soggy scrambled egg and tiny, fatty bacon - not really worth the money when I expect there are restaurants not far away doing the same food (but nicer!) for less.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: NetherlandsSabine
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, and excellent value for money. The location is excellent with 2 metro stations very close by, and plenty of restaurants. The staff are great, they really make you feel welcome and give excellent information. There is free wifi (which actually works for a change), free video on demand, free coffee and tea in the afternoon, etc. All this attributes to the welcoming atmosphere. I love the big city, but it is nice to be able to relax in a hotel that doesn't feel as if it is in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: amy m
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, as metro stations are close by. Excellent service with receptionists being very helpful and welcoming (speaking good English too). Upgraded upon arrival, rooms perfect for stay - has everything you need and exceptionally clean. Free Wi-fi service which was very helpful. If you arrive too early to check in, they hold your baggage safely (which we found very helpful). We would definitely recommend this hotel, and will be returning if we go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JonFromyr
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in this hotel to celebrate an anniversary with my partner. The rooms are well decorated with neat and clean bathrooms. The staff is very friendly and helpful speaking fluent English and the neighborhood is filled with great restaurants and food shops. It is also conveniently located two minute walk from Vavin metro station that is connected to line 4 which takes you straight to Gare Du Nord for the Eurostar. Loved it and will come back in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Paris hotel, good location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Bibliophiles
Reviews.Content: I'd like to give this hotel 4.5 stars, down from 5 because of a few quibbles, but will have to give 4.. It is very easy to find, a couple of hundred yards around the corner from Vavin metro on the number 4 line direct from Gare Du Nord, on the Rue Delambre which - with neighouring streets - is full of useful shops, small supermarkets, cafes, bars and restaurants. We had booked a Classic room but were instantly upgraded to a Club room - a slightly larger room, with a larger bathroom including bath as well as shower, and situated at the back overlooking a quiet courtyard. The room was quiet - even though it was right next to the lift - although the plumbing was noisy at times. Reception staff were excellent, and the honesty bar is a nice idea The downsides: breakfast was comparatively expensive so we didn't take it; while the TV was fine in all other respects, the advertised free video-on-demand service was faulty - with the TV on full volume the video was too quiet to listen to comfortably (reception staff said that this had been reported, but that 'the technician' said it couldn't be fixed); the bath was a nice idea, but being shaped (to conserve water I presume) it was uncomfortably small for a fairly tall and overweight Anglo-Saxon. But these are comparatively small quibbles: we'd happily stay here again if we wanted to be in the Montparnasse area again, which is full of life, convenient for trains south, and not too far from the tourist centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Helen D
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel. Stayed in January 2012 and booked as a package deal train/hotel through Eurostar. Fantastic location and within a 2/3 minute walk to two metro stations. Very clean room, cleaned daily and very comfy bed! Staff on reception very helpful and allowed us to leave our bags with them as we arrived before our check in time and again when we checked out, also left our bags with them so we didn't have to carry them around all day. Lots of bars/resurants located nearby. Wonderful "Honesty Bar" to relax in...and also made use of the free coffee in the afternoons. In all a great place to stay and would highly recommend and look forward to returning again to Lennox and the wonderful city of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!! HAVE STAYED THERE TWICE & WOULD LOVE TO GO BACK AGAIN SOON!!”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this little gem of a hotel via Lonely Planet reviewers back in 2006. We were so happy with our stay that we came back with three rooms full of family members in Dec 2011! I had my wife and one year old daughter (she turned one at the Hotel Lenox!), my brother with his wife and 3 yr old daughter, and my parents on their first visit to Paris. Everyone loved the Lenox. As an avid traveler and a former Television Producer for the Discovery Networks/ Travel Channel, I like to think I am a good judge of hotels. That said, I cannot think of one negative to say about the Hotel Lenox. The hotel's location is AMAZING - less than one minute's walk to two different Metro stops, centrally located in the lovely and artistic Montparnasse arrondisement (aka the bistro district), and a very short walk to the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. The staff was outstanding - just as I had remembered - and they made us feel like we were at a home away from home. This tiny, clean, gem of a hotel provides the charm of Paris without all the hype or crazy prices. I would not want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from a 3* and more”
Reviews.Author: MadameDoise
Reviews.Content: This 3 star little hotel was a pleasant surprise. Small, cozy and comfortable, with lots of bistros, fruit markets and cinemas within walking distance. You can even find the Saturday marchÃ© and the Metro just around the corner. Could benefit from better pillows though, but the magnifier mirror in the bathroom was a big bonus to have your best make up finishing touches. Breakfast is a bit pricey (17 EUR), but the service was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Happy we stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: geminimonkey
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on friend's recommendation. Stayed 5 nights. After reserving online, we emailed the hotel with a few questions about the area and got a very nice reply. Such convenient location! 2 minutes on foot from Vavin Metro station (exit to the rue Delambre) on the #4 Line that connects directly to Gare du Nord. Perfect for us as we arrived via Eurostar. Didn't have to transfer. When I made the reservation I had requested a quiet room away from the lift. The front desk clerk noted this when we checked in and we were pleased with our 5th floor room with a little 'balcony'. The room itself was small, but nicely appointed with a good sized bathroom. When we asked about restaurant recommendations we were given a couple of suggestions. We had a very nice meal at one of them. There are 2 supermarkets on the same block, as well as restaurants and bakeries all within a few minutes walk. We even walked to the Latin Quarter and Musee d'Orsay. It was our first visit to Paris and we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would give it 6 stars....”
Reviews.Author: iamcalber
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for a long weekend 2 weeks ago and stayed at this here.... we absolutely can't fault it. the staff were really helpful, the rooms was a nice size, with a balcony overlooking rue delambre....very close to 2 tube stops.... basically if you are looking for a nice, quiet, clean, authentic Parisian boutique hotel, without spending too much - go here! oh and its got an honesty bar where you can pour your own drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, outdated. Rude clerk. Gay guests beware.”
Reviews.Author: TheZenGuy
Reviews.Content: The lobby is like a beautiful antique living room. The room was standard duty for Paris. Clean but a bit dowdy, old-fashioned. When I came to the lobby in the morning the front desk clerk asked if was going into the adjoining room for breakfast. Sure, why not? After eating the cereal, mixed fruit salad, pain au chocolat and scrambled eggs. I went to check out. The clerk asked why I was checking out without my luggage in hand. I told her I am renting an apartment in Paris for 2 months but the lock is frozen and the repairman can't come until Monday morning; the day of my Lenox hotel departure. Perhaps she didn't like that I didn't have luggage and was with my male friend. Fellow gay travelers beware. Next she indicated that the breakfast we just enjoyed would be an additional 17 Euros ($21) per person. Surprise! I suggested she tell people that instead of just inviting them for breakfast and then asking for that kind of money. She offered no apology, pointed to a small sign on the front desk that I couldn't read without putting my glasses on and asked which credit card I'd be using to pay for breakfast. Rude! The man who checked us in the night before was very accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel once before and this second visit reinforced it as a great hotel. Our group were given an upgrade to club rooms free of charge. Always a good start. Hotel is in a great position and is a top end three star standard for Paris. Good system with honesty bar and also compimentary tea and coffee during the afternoon. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: ThaisOReilly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good, but a bit far from the best of Paris. I missed better places to go out in the neighboorhood. Service, room size and cleanness and charm are all good. I liked a lot, and stayed there twive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: tgarden34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 3 night break at the end of January and found the hotel ideal for getting around and eating out in the evenings. The Hotel was only 100 m from the Vivan metro station which made it very easy to get to from the Gare Du Nord (25mins with trains every 4 mins). We booked a basic room but were upgraded on arrival which was a nice touch. The room was clean and well appointed but it did face the road which brought some noise at about 6am when deliveries were being made to the local restaurants - having said that it didn't spoil the break. The honesty bar provided a good selection and we made use of it every night before going out to eat. Had breakfast once which was fine but quite expensive at â‚¬17 each. Good restaurants within 100m of hotel. Ate at the Parnasse 138 and La Rotonde twice - the latter not cheap but we were pushing the boat out. Will return hopefully in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JoleneChew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the Christmas weekend in Paris and were really happy with the hotel, which was situated in the theatre district. Even though we had been told before our arrival that we couldn't have a room facing the courtyard (supposedly quieter) due to the unavailability of such rooms, the hotel staff had remembered our request and we were promptly given a courtyard-facing room on arrival, which was fantastic! The room was very small but everything was clean and comfortable and this was good enough for us since we spent way more time outside than in the hotel. The hotel is situated slightly further from the main tourist spots but this suited us fine due to the proximity to 2 metro stations (Edgar Quinet and Vavin) and the more local flavour of the area. There is also a direct connection to Gare du Nord from Vavin which took only 20 minutes door to door. We found travelling to all tourist areas extremely easy as everywhere was just a short hop away. We were also able to get our breakfast from the patisserie just 10 steps from the hotel entrance. All-in-all a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Lenox Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: fforbes212
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Lenox Montparnasse. I had a room that was facing Rue Delambre .The room had a princess balcony, and the doors were able to open.Which was nice to open on a nice Parisian spring day to get some fresh air.The room had a full bathtub with a shower,and a heated towel rack.It also has heat ,and full AC which in my opinion is essential in Paris on a hot July day, or cold January mornng.A block away from Boulevard de Montparnasse,and the Vavin Metro stop.On Rue Delambre you can find a really good boulangerie (bakery for my English speaking friends).From the Vavin Metro stop you have quick access to the rest of Paris.The Montparnasse section of Paris is not always the first for tourist but a definite must. I have some pictures of my stay here: http://atravelbugg.com/2011/12/28/hotel-lenox-montparnasse/

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable room in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: theseatsaretooclose
Reviews.Content: If only for fleeting moments, I felt like a local wandering down a quiet side street, past the local butcher, the grocery store, and bakery amongst other delights that are just outside the front steps of this charming hotel. The public rooms are lovely and modern with free internet access and a lounge area to relax and take in breakfast in the morning or take an afternoon break, collect your thoughts, and devise a plan of attack for your evening adventures. The staff are very helpful at this and anything else you might need. Such are the benefits of a smaller facility. The standard 'club' rooms are, "surprise", small. Real small. Hey, if you want extra room you can get it elsewhere, but this is Paris and you will pay for that extra space, and frankly I didn't miss it. But who notices such things in the dark of night. The bed was comfortable, and the room nice and quiet without any street noise. Showering requires that you leave the bathroom window ajar unless you want a wet steamy mess everywhere, but again, if you take it in stride and accept that you are living as a great many of the locals do, it's more amusing than annoying. Sure, I prefer the more expensive hotels of Paris, but the Lenox is a solid choice made even better if you take advantage of the local area and upgrade to a bigger room, I think it's a better choice than many of the 'fancier' accommodations. Grab a nice variety of foods from the local shops and head off for a picnic under the Eiffel Tower at sunset - always a winning idea. FYI - Take the RER B train from Port Royal station just down the street to and from Charles De Gaulle airport (fast and cheap) or Gare du Nord to catch the Eurostar, Thalys, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Average Value”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us during an extended trip thru Europe. Spent a couple of nights at the Lenox in October. The hotel was clean, front staff friendly and efficient. The rooms are small, bathrooms modern. Lots of amenities close by, including fruit, cheese & fish market as well as grocery store and restaurants. As we turned in our rental car upon arrival in Paris we relied on public transit and walking to get around. The Lenox is 30-45 minutes on foot from most attractions, 20 mins to reach the Seine and the Bato Bus which we used one day. Close to the Metro lines as well. Wifi & movies were free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good”
Reviews.Author: rjw85
Reviews.Content: This is a good value (for Paris) hotel that is very well situated for St Germain and it's pretty easy to walk anywhere on the left bank. It doesn't feel just like a tourist spot - there are plenty of shops that are clearly used by Parisians and we found a couple of very good value bars. The hotel staff were very friendly. The rooms are extremely small - room for a double bed and nothing else - but we didn't find that a big problem. There's nothing remarkable about the hotel but nothing to complain about either. They have an 'honesty bar' - you serve your own drinks and tell reception what you've had - which we liked. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: jay sern w
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, great French breakfast, friendly staff, clean rooms, just awesome!

Reviews.Title: “an absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: toddha
Reviews.Content: after all the horror stories about small rooms in Paris hotels this was a great find. although the room was not huge it was perfectly adequate with a great bathroom area. location too was great with a choice of metro stations nearby and even the walk to the river was not too onerous. an added bonus was the great selection of restaurants close by with seafood lover adjmg especially well catered for. will be high on the list for any future visits to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jamesm2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a quick stopover in Paris and thought it was excellent. Although the room was a little on the small side, it was comfortable and well equipped. The staff were really friendly and helpful, and the honesty bar is a really nice idea. The hotel is really well located near the metro and Gare Montparnasse. Added to the fact it's in the heart of Montparnasse itself and this was a top place all round. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and Excellent Serivce”
Reviews.Author: Adam N
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am hoping to drop our bags off before checking in but were pleasantly surprised to have our room upgraded and were allowed to check in on the spot. The room was a lot bigger than we expected and the hotel was immaculate throughout. All staff were very helpful whenever we needed assistance. We were just booked for one night but it proved a great base for a weekend in Paris and we would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must stay hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kylienigel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights for our honeymoon a week ago. The staff were all so friendly and helpful. Unfortunatly our knowledge of the French language is almost non existent however that was no problem as all the reception staff were very fluent in English and very kind in tolerating my attempts at speaking French. The room where we stayed was small as we expected it would be for Paris however everything was comfortable attractive and very clean. Our bathroom was surprisingly large and contained very good quality toiletries. The hot water pressure was fantastic in the shower. There was a heated towel rail. Hair dryer and magnifying makeup mirror. The mirror behind the bathroom door also allowed for checking the back of my hair. Something that was just a nice thoughtful touch. The room was tidied and cleaned every day to a very high standard. The bed was very comfortable too. If there is anything less than positive to say about the room it is only that the sound proofing could have been better. (there was a rather amorous couple next door and I was woken a few times by some rather interesting noises!) We enjoyed a lovely breakfast each morning downstairs in the dining room. The food was delicious and the dining room lovely and inviting. The location of the Hotel could not have been better with everything you need right on the doorstep. The metro train station was so so close and enabled us to be at all the tourist destinations within minutes. We loved staying at the Lenox Montparnasse and hope we get the opportunity to visit Paris again soon and with out any doubt we would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “little big hotel”
Reviews.Author: roniem
Reviews.Content: We stayed, my husband and I at LENOX MONTPARNASSE hotel during our stay in Paris recently. We chose Lenox , after the hotel we wanted was full and a long search various sites, including a review of recommendations in tripadviser. From the beginning of the booking proces , the wealcoming at the arrival day ( nice Fouzia) And all our stay at the hotel the reception was nice, welcoming and very helpfull. The room was small with a tiny bathroom ( we knew it from previous visits in Paris) , but very very clean. Breackfast buffet was excellent . The street outside is a little noisy so if you want to sleep with open windows - use a earplugs. There are lots of shops, restaurants, bars and delis, shopping centers near the hotel and the nearby streets. Transportation - few metro stops from which you can get anywhere in town near the hotel ,nearest- Edgar quinet. From / to CDG airport we used the Air France buses, line 4 to Gar montparnasse. We had a great vacation. The hotel met all our expectations and more and we have no doubt of our next holiday in Paris we'll elect the Lenox Montparnasse again! Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Cichardrox
Reviews.Content: Easy direct access on route 4 from Gare du Nord to Vivan by metro then 150 yards and you're there. Warm welcome and lovely room. Lots of cafes and restaurants to choose from within easy walking distance. Short metro hop to all major attractions though we opted to walk. Louvre to arc de triomph was lined with Christmas booths. Street noise late at night and early in the morning was the only issue for us (room 205) but that was only noticeable when we left the windows open. Maybe get room on higher level next time.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Paris destination hotel”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: A great surprise. Ideally placed, for walking Paris, and surrounded by superb shops, especially for cheeses and fish. The hotel is inviting, the rooms comfortable and the breakfast quality outstanding if a little pricey. Look out to for La Cerisaie, a wonderful small restaurant nearby. David N

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: william21Cheltenham
Reviews.Content: Plus points. Great location.Good restaurants nearby. Easy access to Metro. Polite,pleasant staff. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds, Minus points. I'd read the reviews so decided to e-mail the hotel & requested a quiet room, Our room was so noisy we hardly slept during our two day stay. The walls were paper thin & we could here every sound from adjoining rooms. The street outside was noisy early in the morning even though the windows were shut.. The lift was out of order.(some rooms were on the 5th floor) The TV didn't work. The room was too hot & it seemed impossible to regulate.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_Simon
Reviews.Content: We were on a couples weekend and I booked a Eurostar package. To be honest, we didn't expect too much. But was pleasantly surprised when we were greeted with a smiling face at the reception (I think it was Marjorie). After a long trudging trip through the Metro etc, the reception made it quick and simple to check in. Our room was on the first floor facing the courtyard. Peaceful. We were kindly upgraded in to a Club Room. The room itself was a little tight but it was clean and lovely. The bathroom was nice and clean. But the main feature of the area (for first timers) are the seafood restaurants flanking every corner! If you love clams, oysters, fish etc - you'll adore Montparnasse.A great place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel! My daughter (18) and I had a Jr Suite for our stay. The location of this hotel is perfect; it has easy access to the metro, great restaurants close by and a bakery just down the rue! It was very clean and we felt very safe. The staff was helpful and friendly (Sebastian!).

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel- cannot wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: NandKwhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lenox for our 5 day honeymoon in the romance capital of the world! We chose it due to previous trip advisor reviews and it was a fabulous choice! The hotel is situated near wonderful, well renowned resturaunts and cafes and a stones throw from the metro station. The rooms are impeccably clean and in good, clean order. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the shower was amazing!!! The staff were friendly and helpful, and they spoke perfect English. We did not have breakfast in the hotel (although the pastries did look delicious), instead we chose pastries from the bakery at the end of the road to eat on the go! Our room was at the back of the hotel, overlooking the courtyard and was very quiet (room 54). I would wholeheartedly Reccommend this fabulous little hotel to anyone visiting Paris! Thank you for making our stay so perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: molly1201
Reviews.Content: Would have liked to give this hotel 3 and a half points if this had been possible. The best things about it are the fantastic location and the friendly staff. I was a little disappointed with our room. I booked a Club room directly with the hotel and asked for a room overlooking the courtyard at the back, which we were not given. The room also looked a bit tired with scuffed woodwork and wallpaper etc and the walls extremely thin. A large bathroom made up for this a bit but I did begin to wonder if it had been worth paying extra for a Club room if this was the standard. We had breakfast on the first morning and decided that it was not worth the money so went elsewhere after that. I would definitely stay in this area again though as the cafes, restaurants and shops are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Paris 2011”
Reviews.Content: feature much better on line than reality,small rooms.poor internet conections

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: tsmithNM
Reviews.Content: We just spent an entire week here, and we were very pleased with our choice of hotel. Rooms The rooms are small, but that's common in Europe.The bathroom was a pretty good size though. The bed was comfortable. The TV offered free movies...a nice perk when taking a rest from all your walking around Paris. The walls seem to be pretty thin, as we could hear conversations from neighboring rooms. We never struggled sleeping though. Despite being on a street, the street noise is minimal. The only time we noticed it was early in the morning a couple days when some louder trucks would make some deliveries nearby. If we were spending a lot of time in the room, we would probably start to feel cramped. But, when you are in Paris, you shouldn't be hanging out in the room that much. The room was just what it needed to be. Staff Every staff member spoke English and was incredibly helpful. We asked for a restaurant recommendation, they gave us a business card of a restaurant very close to the hotel-and it was the best meal we had on our vacation! They ask for you to leave the room key at the front desk every time you leave the hotel. This wasn't a problem and probably prevented us from losing the key somewhere in Paris. Breakfast At first, the breakfast seems expensive. They charge 9 euros for coffee, orange juice, and a croissant. You would think you could find something cheaper in the area, but we struggled to find anything comparable. The full buffet breakfast is twice as much and probably not worth it. But this smaller, Parisian breakfast is convenient. Honesty Bar In the afternoon and evening, they put out a variety of drinks (wine, beer, liquor, etc.). It's up to you to serve yourself, write down what you had, and then leave the paper with the front desk. There are definitely cheaper bar options nearby; however, this was another nice convenience that we used once or twice. Internet The wifi service is very spotty. When it does work, it is slow. But it's enough to allow you to check your email, etc. There is a computer hooked up to a printer in the lobby that was also convenient. The Look Every area of the hotel was clean and pleasing to look at. From the seating area in the lobby to the hallways and rooms, it is a nice looking place. The elevator is tiny (3 person max). To get our luggage upstairs, we had to make a couple trips on the elevator. Location This is probably the biggest selling point of the hotel. Montparnasse is a great area to be in. It has a lot going on without the seediness of other areas. Two metro stops on two different lines were less than 5 minutes away from the hotel. This made for easy access to all the sights of Paris, the RER trains, etc. There are a ton of great restaurants in the area- La Coupole, Le Parc Aux Cerfs are both must haves. The fromagerie across the street had great cheeses, prices, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, friendly, small hotel in lively area”
Reviews.Author: Neil S
Reviews.Content: Rooms while small were very clean and ours had a large window that opened out over a nice side street. The staff were all excellent. Their English was impeccable and they all answered our questions with smiles on their faces making us feel welcome. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: oehjr
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean rooms, good breakfast, good location. It's also about 100 yards from La Coupole, a reastaurant with a rich history; Take the passageway with the movie theaters across the street from the hotel entrance. Great location near metro stops and a nice walk to the Luxembourg gardens and the Latin Quarter. Very quiet at night. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great left-bank location, charming”
Reviews.Author: gusgman
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lenox because we arrived at Gare Montparnasse from Bordeaux. Within easy walk to lively boulevards, Luxembourg gardens, and Latin Quarter and to RER and Metro. The room was clean, cheerful and comfortable, with large, clean bathroom. Excellent generous full breakfast was included in our special rate. Although we didn't use the "honesty bar," it's a nice feature if you desperately need a late night drink. Very pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Sarahsmiley
Reviews.Content: Last stayed at this hotel in 2004. Then it was smart, reasonably priced and newly refurbished. This time around it was dated, expensive, tatty and not very clean. The room was quiet apart from the usual plumbing noises. It looks as if is it hasn't been decorated since 2004.- Seriously. The sink was cracked. I found someone's hair in the shower which was stained. The room cost 220 Euros a night. Breakfast was an additional 16 Euros a head. The area is good and it is near the Metro. La Coupole is nearby and does a very good breakfast in beautiful surroundings for 8 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Lauren_Barr
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Lenox Montparnasse. The room was clean, sheets crisp and white, big bathroom. The size of the room was a bit small, but we managed by stacking our suitcases at the entrance. There is minibar in the room and an honesty bar in the lobby. (An honesty bar is a bar where you serve yourself and write down what you drank.) The people at the desk were very helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a pleasant stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Hoomi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 3 days and we chose this Hotel for our stay and it turned out to be a great choice, I really loved it. It's so close to two important lines of metro so you can go everywhere in Paris within minutes, there are lots of great cafes and restaurants around Hotel and there is a good shopping mall near it. the other positive points of this Hotel is its friendly staff and also cleanness. the staff was so friendly and professional, I even became friend with one of them whose name was Olivier. this guy was full of energy. every time I saw him we started to talk for about 5 minutes, of course in french! but you'll have no problem with language as all staff can speak English fluently. the only negative points I can say is it was a small hotel overall, and room was small too but it was OK. free WiFi was great, TV was fun also as you can use Internet and watch movies and lots of channels. another positive point the rooms had safe box which is vital for safety! at the end, again I have to say that the location was superb. three metro stations nearby, and it was safe even late night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for travelers!”
Reviews.Author: Shinobi91
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with this hotel in October and really enjoyed our time here! I was warned ahead of time that rooms can be quite small in Paris, and it was true as there werenâ€™t a lot of room to place a luggage, let alone two! However, everything you need is available in the room and it was clean and tidy. The hotel is conveniently located between three different subway lines, giving us a lot of route options when we planned out our visit. Breakfast is available for a price, but there are bakeries next to the hotels if you want a fresh croissant. Two convenience stores are available on the same street and are open till late. Staffs were friendly and they have a luggage room in case you arrived earlier or wanted to leave your luggage at the hotel after checkout. Free wifi and movies are available in each room. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel as it is very convenient for travelers and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: If you want a decent hotel in a really good location, you will be pushed to beat this one. There are 3 Metro station within very short distance which will take you to just about anywhere in the rest of Paris you want. The staff on the front desk were really helpful and polite, the room was clean and the honesty bar was a nice concept too. If you want a good evening meal try the Cafe Noisette just down the road from the hotel. We stayed 4 nights and ate in a number of different places, in terms of quality and value this was the best. If I go back to Paris I would certainl stay at the Lenox again. A couple of words of warning if you are sightseeing. Check out the places are open before you go, you can do this on the free internet at the hotel. We did not realise the Louvre closed Tuesdays and were disappointed to find on the Wednesday when visiting the Musee D'Orsay that it was shut because of a staff strike. Also watch out for the con trick with people pretending to find a ring, we were approached 3 times by these people all around the Place de la Concorde area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic short break for our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: MissingParis1957
Reviews.Content: First time at the Lenox for our wedding anniversary. Delightful quiet side street off the bustling and typically french rue de montparnasse literally a couple of minutes walk from Vavin metro so no problems with luggage. Hotel quiet and tranquil. Very helpful and courteous bi-lingual staff at reception, happy to assist with information and offers to book restaurants/shows etc..Lovely mini-suite on sixth floor - efficient and quiet lift - very spacious and well equipped for central Paris. Robes and slippers provided! Free wi-fi in room and free internet adjacent to reception. Fantastic patisseries and specialist food shops of every type imaginable on rue Delambre. Beautiful square at the top of the road with pavement cafes,impromptu live jazz in the square on Saturday plus great fresh food market and also within walking distance of theatres and cinemas. Paris encapsulated along rue Delambre with the Lenox right in the middle! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: JRose123
Reviews.Content: Similar to the other great reviews, this hotel lived up to them and more. I was most surprised by the pleasant, very friendly staff, cleanliness, ease of getting there and the size of the BATHROOM! I took my mother here (in general Paris) for the first time and she was very pleased and came back raving about the whole trip--including the great hotel. The hotel is in the perfect spot for taking Metros but even more so perfect for walking around Paris. There are great resto's nearby, gardens, shopping and even a salsa club close! I would recommend anyone staying here and I will definitely book this hotel again. OH! There are only two things to keep in mind: The elevator is tiny and like any big city, there is street noise so book a room at least 3rd floor or higher :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: KfordRedSox
Reviews.Content: I don't want to appear too negative but the idea of this site is to make people aware of what to expect. This is a warm, friendly hotel in a great location with very good staff which goes a long way to making the stay enjoyable. We had the inclusive breakfast deal and a standard room, breakfast was just adequate but at 16 euros a head it should be. The downside was the size of the bathroom and the noise both inside and outside the hotel. The room itself was small as we expected but we are literally just sleeping in it on a very comfortable bed, The bathroom was a challenge, you are unable to sit on the toilet as Mr Crapper intended due to its position and the shower area is cramped. I'm not a large person but with a lever shower control (a turn knob would have been so much better) I found as I tried to move I either turned the shower down or knocked it so the water was very hot or very cold. Thin walls lead to plumbing noise, both water plumbing and guest plumbing without wishing to be too specific! Not what you want to hear. The hotel is on a working street, bars, restaurants and shops so there is bound to be noise but even the double galzing couldn't stop the early morning noise of the glass bottle recycling and the drain cleaners (not a fault of the hotel but be aware if peace is what you require). All in all we enjoyed our stay due to the staff and location but it's not that peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wisc1
Reviews.Content: Could not have been more pleased with the hotel and staff! Great location, with bonuses such as very near train station, subway, banking, great restaurants, wine shops, deli, and grocery. Had many restaurants within walking distance. We had a club room and was far above the standard in europe and bathrooms were great! TV was limited, but hey, you're in Paris-you should be tired and ready for bed after taking in the sites and eating fab. food! Will definately recommend to friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: fixitmjc
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a deal for a club room (no breakfast) with Hotels.com, costing â‚¬400 for three nights. I think this was good value considering the location and that Paris is generally quite expensive. We had nice breakfasts in nearby cafes for just a few euro each day. It's quite central, with good metro and rail links. The staff were polite and friendly and we would recommend it on this basis.

Reviews.Title: “POOR VALUE, BEWARE OF HOTEL PHOTOS”
Reviews.Author: JMS84
Reviews.Content: At 190 Euros per day with a poor breakfast included the room was poor value considering that it, the Club room, was a step above what is called the Classic room. The room was really tiny and you have to be clever to navigate within the limited space. Not a very pleasant experience. I have been to Paris many, many times, and this time I chose this hotel based upon the recommendations in this site. The room and bathroom are clean, not very inspiring from a decorative point of room. The breakfast costs 16 Euros if it is not included and it certainly is not worth 16 Euros. Next time , I will return to other known hotels or rent an apartment. To enjoy Paris one has to stay at least one week which merits a longer stay option where price can be negotiated at times.If one is from a country based upon the US dollar costs, this hotel is very expensive considering what you can get in New York off season, or in Tokyo (which is considered to be a very expensive city).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ELHawkes
Reviews.Content: We took the train from the airport straight to Port Royal stop and the hotel was a 8 minute walk from there. Great situation, staff always happy to help, clean bright front bar/lounge. Room facing the road moderate size(v good for Paris) very clean and good size comfotable bed. Good size bathroom,clean towels each day. Tv etc. English speaking receptionists. A wide range of restaurants very nearby, various price ranges, but nothing really cheap, its P Paris !! The Discover Walks were brilliant ? only in summer? Eiffel Tower about 30 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on October 2011. The staff was terrific and helpful. Rooms are very small but clean. Bathroom was of good size, and toiletries were of good quality. The location is very good, with subway stops right around the corner. Plenty of restaurants nearby, and a grocery store a few doors down. The only problem is the hotel's walls are thin, and you can hear noise from other rooms, as well as doors closing. This will be a very big problem for people who need a quiet room to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming and friendly. Bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: almosr
Reviews.Content: As a frequent vistor to Paris, I stayed for two nights at this hotel last week, having had it booked for me by a company I do some work with. Very characterful, with an "honesty" bar, free wifi (once I had got the code accepted), room a bit tiny with hardly any space around the bed, decent-size flat screen TV, but with only French channels. Not a problem for me, but could be for others? Price at â‚¬180 per night seemed over the top for Montparnasse, or am I simply getting out of touch?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and small”
Reviews.Author: TheBumbleBee
Reviews.Content: Clean and cosy hotel. You have everything on your hand - the shops, the restaurants, the grocery, boulagerie, charcuterie and Le Tour de Montparnasse - Eiffel Tower, eat your heart out! This was a good stay - very close up to Vavin mÃ©tro station - "pink" line 4 between Porte dÂ´OrlÃ©ans and Porte de Clignancourt. We had a very small room - but we travelled to Paris to be in Paris - not stay in the room. We slept long, skipped breakfast and bought a baguette on the corner. You can hear all the neighbours. But that is how it is meant to be. Living for real. Je reviens.

Reviews.Title: “Very good small Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah S
Reviews.Content: THis was the second time this year that we have stayed in this lovely, friendly and well-appointed hotel in Paris. The location is central and is close to metro stations whilst not being on a busy road. The staff are endlessly helpful. The rooms are not huge but Parisian hotel rooms tend not to be. I would recommend the Club rooms over the regular. The hotel accommodated our request to have interconnecting rooms for the nights we were staying with our children. It is an easy hotel to stay with children and this cannot be said of all! The children appreciated the free movies available in the rooms. I like this hotel very much and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 4canoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in September, 2011. The service was excellent, the staff friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. This is a compact hotel in the heart of old and very busy Paris. Its room furnishings are up to date and its lobby/bar room nicely decorated. We found the TV can also be used to access the internet which is useful. When we return to Paris, we'll book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing and chilly reception”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorMom11
Reviews.Content: That's the best description of our experience at the front desk of this otherwise very good hotel. At check-in, my husband and I were met by a very kind and accommodating desk clerk, then spent the rest of the week wondering where she went. Out of the four clerks we encountered at the Lenox, she seemed to be the only one who wasn't merely tolerating us. Our experiences with the other three included rolling eyes when we reported a blown circuit in our room (it was my fault, to be fair - but I tried contritely to explain what happened); a complete inability by one clerk to give any comment at all on the food at the Italian restaurant directly across the street from the hotel (it is excellent, by the way); a harumph when we accidentally left our key in the room at checkout (this hotel requires you to give your key to the front desk every time you leave the hotel), even though the same desk clerk was absent when we returned the night before and we had to wait for approximately 10 minutes to get into our room, and the same guy failed to call a cab for our early morning departure, even though we asked him to do so the night before. We are not high-maintenance travelers and always try to be polite (we both have imperfect but improving French), so were disappointed by the attitude, particularly given that we have never run into it during our stays at other hotels in Paris. All other amenities at this hotel are commendable. Rooms are not that small in comparison to others we have stayed in in the city, french doors open to street with noise that was not enough to keep us up at night (when doors closed), the room and bathroom were impeccably clean, and the bed comfortable. Internet was sketchy and cable TV reception was intermittent (but really who cares - we were in Paris). The hotel location is outstanding. It sits within a block in each direction between two metro stops, is walkable to most Left Bank attractions including stores and Luxembourg gardens, sports a grocery store, bakeries and wine and cheese shops on the same street, and is surrounded by excellent cafes and restaurants. All in all, the Lenox is a good hotel and we had a wonderful stay in Paris, but sadly it was not enhanced by 3/4 of the front desk staff. If indifference by staff doesn't bother you, this is a good pick. Since it does bother me, next time we will look for another hotel in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: anonrockville
Reviews.Content: Was there for 8 nights during unusually hot weather (86 deg) so appreciated the hotel's A/C. Very helpful staff. Our Club Room was small; regular rooms must be tiny. Decent size bathroom. (A bit of mildew in the corners.) Great location and neighborhood. The Italian restaurant across from the hotel is very good. Didn't try the breakfast--cheaper and more fun to go to one of the many nearby cafes/bistros.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: malkochoglu
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good betwwen 3 diffrenet metro lines in a short walk. There are supermarkets, many good restaurants with many different options and tastes. Indeed this district is a very nice one for tourists compared to other locations saying as a 7th times visitor to Paris. Rooms are small but clean. Reception and personnel is ver kind and helpful which it is a real value for Paris:). I did not evaluate other services because we did not get one. I advise this hotel to everybody whose budget is suitable for the price. No need to look for another one. It is old like other many hotels in Paris so do not consider this critics.One bad point about hotel is there are restaurants round and there is noise in the very early hours morning during garbage collection.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great service, trendy location”
Reviews.Author: gooshoo
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic four-night stay at the Lenox Montparnasse and were really impressed with everything. The hotel is in a great location, on a postcard-esque street within an easy walk to three metro stations. The neighbourhood itself seemed very trendy, with lots of restaurants, patisseries and grocers filled with locals. The staff at the hotel were all incredibly friendly and we very tolerant with my murdering of the French language. They were also really thoughtful about all the details we'd need for our stay. The room was very generously sized for Paris and I was delighted to find we had a massive bathroom with a bath. The room was also very clean, bright and elegantly decorated. I thought the price was reasonable for the standard. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the hotel for any length of stay- can't praise it highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ayhugel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located, has comfortable rooms and fantastic staff. Everyone was most helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great little street”
Reviews.Author: Exetergourmets
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay here was a gift from friends and what a lovely gift it was. We knew it was close to Montparnasse Station and that for some reason slightly lowered our expectations. Its just off the Boulevard Montparnasse and the road itself is home to some excellent food shops, a couple of nice bars and restaurants. Just around the corner on B Montparnasse are some famous and great looking brasseries. The staff at the hotel made us feel welcome and the hotel goes out of its way to make you feel at home - the wifi is free, the TV films were free, the mini-bar isn't a rip off and there's a trust bar where you tell the hotel how much you have drunk. Our room was newly decorated with a large comfortable bed and a nice balcony. The bathroom was large and very clean. The buffet breakfast is excellent. Delicious breads and croissants and a Nespresso machine for coffee, not the usual hotel stuff. Good choice of other foods too. We'll definitely think of staying here again - even if we ae paying ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Robert Q
Reviews.Content: This well located hotel has well appointed rooms, a very good breakfast, and good amenities. Most of all, the hotel has a very courteous and professional staff who helped us negotiate several questions and challenges. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean, beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Cricket31
Reviews.Content: Very fond memories of this hotel - beautiful room, friendly staff, lovely included breakfast, the good location. One of the more expensive places I stayed, nice if you want to spoil yourself

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant clean room”
Reviews.Author: ontheincline
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the bathroom was relatively large, and the desk staff was nice. I would stay here again as it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, easy to get to and efficient check-in”
Reviews.Author: dustyruin
Reviews.Content: It was easy to get to after arriving at Gare du Nord - just got the M4 metro directly there to Vavin station and the hotel was about 100 metres away around the corner. The check-in was very efficient and we were checked in very quickly. The room was overlooking the street but wasn't noisy. Everything was crisp and clean. As we were out late I didn't get a chance to use the honesty bar, I did have a quick look and the Leffe beer on tap looked quite inviting. We had to be out early to catch another train, so we didn't have time for breakfast. I would definitely come here again

Reviews.Title: “Bit pricey but a great location...”
Reviews.Author: LondonTealady
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give 3 and a half stars but Tripadvisor won't let me. Four seems too much, three a little mean. Given the rave reviews, we were a little disappointed with this place. Admittedly, our expectations were coloured by the fact we paid 200 euros, (run up to Fashion Week...) I don't have much to add - the other reviews have it right: the rooms are a little small but very clean, the service good, and the location great. For 200 euros, it is, however, disappointing: it's a little on the shabby side and the bed a bit hard. If I could get the room for 110 euros, I'd happily stay again. For 200 euros, I'd look elsewhere. Top tip: round the corner in Rue du Montparnasse, Cafe Josselin does the best crepes! Be prepared to queue at busy times!

Reviews.Title: “left the kids with grandma, and stayed in Paris for 5 days”
Reviews.Author: popelkaa
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in great locations, and that's what it's all about. Helpful staff, small rooms, very quaint, but well worth the $. VERY easy to get to from the Metro, and thus from the airport as well, with NO need for any taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingNoonans
Reviews.Content: Great location in Paris. Metro is a 2 min walk from hotel and the street the hotel is on has fantastic fresh produce, fromage shops, patisseries, and great places to eat. Well worth using as a base to explore paris. The room we stayed in surprisingly spaceous for Paris and had a lovely view of the inner courtyard and rooftops of paris. Beautiful atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value...”
Reviews.Author: jk2143
Reviews.Content: As I don't have any other experience with hotels in Paris, I don't have a frame of reference. However, I have heard numerous horror stories about the typical Parisan hotel rooms, and based on that... The Hotel Lenox Montparnasse was amazing! The junior suite was larger than most US hotel rooms that we have stayed, and was perfect for my wife and I. I'm a large man, 74" 310lbs, and was more than comfortable in this hotel room. I saw some of the regular rooms and feel they may have been too small for me, but the junior suite was well worth the extra cost to us. We also had an obstructed view of the Eiffel Tower from our suite (#62). While the location wasn't perfect, it was convenient to two metro stations (one block away), and numerous cafes who catered to us as English speaking only. The hotel staff was amazing, and highly professional. Free WIFI for all of our devices, english news and movies. We aren't the biggest fans of Paris after our vacation, but if we ever were to revisit, the Hotel Lenox Montparnasse would definitely be our choice to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Furrgy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lenox Montparnassefor 4 nights....and we loved this hotel. The location was amazing, close to a few metro stops and an endless amount of restaurants and cafes. The staff were warm and friendly. The room was small, but it was clean and we were very comfortable. There was also free movies available in the room which was nice. The only drawback of the hotel would be that the bathroom was a bit small and the bed was a bit on the lumpy side. We would definately stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful recommendation from several friends who have stayed here...”
Reviews.Author: Felicia P
Reviews.Content: I was very weary about booking our hotel in Paris having heard a lot of horror stories about being overcharged for terrible dirty rooms in bad locations. But I also didn't want to overspend just to guarantee a great stay. Two of my couple friends recommended Lenox Montparnasse and I was very pleased with their recommendation. It was a a great quaint boutique hotel in a great area. I did not want to stay in an extremely touristy part of town but did want to be in walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc. There were wonderful cafes and restaurants within 1-2 blocks of the hotel and also central to the metro and busses. Even before we got there, I was treated to amazing service from the staff. I had emailed ahead of time concerned about booking excursions and they were very helpful with getting me all the information and booking those ahead of time. I had also wanted to book reservations to a restaurant that was rather difficult to reach. I am in no way fluent in French so I was intimidated but Maxime at the front desk helped me with this and called the restaurant several times to get our reservations and was in constant email contact with me. This was a big relief and allowed me to look forward to our trip. Once there, everyone was of great help and really went out of their way to ensure we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: GwenOswestry
Reviews.Content: Staff were very professional and welcoming. The room was clean and free use of safe was an added bonus. Fridge was well stocked with crisps, peanuts and chocolate treats as additional extras. Close to metro (end of road). Exceptionally good and varied breakfast. Free coffee, tea and biscuits between 2 & 6pm. Honesty bar during day. Lift available.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, lovely staff and very clean nicely decorated hotel”
Reviews.Author: 64Cheryl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews from Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a very good location near to three metro stops (Vavin, Edgar Quinet and Montparnasse Bienvenue) and many bars, restaurants, bakeries and two supermarkets. You can see the Montparnasse tower if you have a street view - it's that close! The hotel is in a lovely old building and is decorated in a contemporary style, we booked a club room and it was not the largest room in the world but it was fine, a queen bed, desk, colour tv, safe, fridge/mini bar (they didn't mind you putting your own food and drink in it), chair, stool and wardrobe. Other guests have commented on how small the rooms are and I would imagine that a standard size room would be small, my advice would be to book either a club or junior suite (if you can stretch to it). The bathroom was quite small but had a shower, bath tub and loo. One thing I would say is that the room was cleaned to a very high standard every day and was spotless. French windows opened onto a balcony, lovely on a warm evening with a glass of wine watching the world go by. Free WiFi and also when we were there, free films in your room. We had a street view room and it was quite noisy early morning when the bin men arrived, the double glazing shut a lot of noise out but if you are a light sleeper than ask for a courtyard room. The maids also began work quite early and it wasn't too easy to have a lie in - but hey you are in Paris so get up! The staff on the front desk were without exception wonderful, all spoke good English - but give French a try as it is really appreciated. On our next to last day, they organised an early morning wake up call (4.15am), a private taxi to the airport and printed out my boarding passes for me. If you want a boutique hotel experience then give this hotel a try, for the price, location and experience it is really worth the money. Bear in mind that it is listed as a three star and I think that this is only because of the size of the rooms and possibly because they do not offer dinner or room service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peggy H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days in Paris at the Lenox and the hotel was excellent. The staff were super friendly an helpful. We had a room with a double bed facing the street. The room was small but that is what we expected in Paris. The bathroom was more than we expected. It was huge and even had a nice tub to soak after all the long Paris walks. Even though we faced the street it was a nice quiet street at night. Mornings were busy but we were up early anyways. The location is perfect for getting to everything and the Metro and RER are very close. Strongly recommend this hotel and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that is all”
Reviews.Author: Maura717
Reviews.Content: First, the photos are not really accurate. Not one bit of toile was in my room! The room was very small even by european standards and the bed was rock hard. The bed was an american full size and very small for 2 adults. It might be better to get a room with 2 twin beds. The location of the hotel was excellent though. The neighborhood was superb with fabulous restaurants and 2 metro stops that were on lines that took you to most of the toursit spots. I would stay there again but only because of the location. I had a room on the first floor up facing the street and that was quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ashuppe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse with my aunt in July. The only trouble we had with the hotel was of no fault of theirs. We took the Air France shuttle from the airport to the train station and had a hard time finding the hotel after we got off, but once we did find it we were very pleased. Our favorite part was the neighborhood. It was removed from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas and made us feel like we got a true Parisian experience. The hotel is located between two different metro lines. We were able to use these to get anywhere we wanted to go in Paris. We had a room on the second floor that was in the front of the hotel. Although the room was small, it was normal in European standards and the bathroom was HUGE. We did not have any problem with noise coming in from the street and we were there on a weekend. The rooms were always clean and the beds were extremely comfortable at the end of a long day of touring. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, as we felt it was expensive when we could stop at the bakery down the street and get a pastry for 2 Euro. There is also a grocery and fruit stand right down the street that are good for purchasing breakfast foods. There are many restaurants nearby and on the next street over it is crepe heaven. The staff was wonderful in their English and extremely helpful in all the questions we had for them. If we are ever back in Paris it will be the Lenox Montparnasse for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: thermaljean
Reviews.Content: Good area, close to Metro, walking distance restaurants, helpful friendly staff, clean room though shower was TINY, modest price for Paris. Would happily recommend to other couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sapinaria
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, friendly and welcoming, and the hotel is close to attractions and restaurants. The room was small, but the balcony helped to make it seem bigger.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are the stars here”
Reviews.Author: Kerchner
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of good things going for it: It is a beautiful building located in a great neighborhood away from the tourist noise of the 1er arr; two Metro stops are steps away; it has good, reliable, free wifi; its rooms are above average in size for Paris standards, and the bathrooms are especially nice; and the honesty bar is a very nice feature, making you feel like you're enjoying a drink in your own living room. But the front desk staff are the real stars, and they are the main reason that I will return. They are attentive, personal, and genuinely committed to making my stay comfortable. They were all fluent in English. By my second or third day, they recognized me and remembered my room number.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and moderately quiet; horribly spotty internet.”
Reviews.Author: antiquitas
Reviews.Content: Decent price for the area. My boyfriend was looking for a good location for a low price, so without squatting in some youth hostel (and we are certainly not youths) we went for a moderately priced niceish hotel. Of course, this is Paris, so moderately priced is still pricey. Our room was tiny. Full sized (not quite Queen) bed took up most of it with a tv and small desk near the window. Bathroom is small with a tiny shower as well (not as small as some I've used in the UK). Comfort-wise, I am very pleased. The bed, though a bit on the soft side, was very cozy. We had four pillows all of different type (hard, soft, but all synthetic) to choose from. The room has an electric forced-air heat and cooling system which made for nice overall room comfort. We were right in front of the elevator but I never really had much complaints about noise. The most noise came from outside late at night but died down around midnight, thankfully. Noise in the morning started around 7 but Sunday was very quiet. Apparently there is a noise ordinance in Paris, which makes me happy. No loud thumping music from nearby clubs to worry about. There is a bar-restaurant downstairs if you are desparate, but at 9eur for 1 croissant, coffee and juice, don't bother. We just went to the plethora of surrounding cafes and got breakfast there. They also have sort of an honor system for what you take from the bar (drink wise), write a note on what you took, to be added to your bill. Didn't indulge but I'm not sure this is the wisest thing for a business. Anyway, about the internet. If you are here on business and need constantly good wireless, DO NOT stay here. I don't know what it is about hotels but I've rarely had a consistent connection and this was one of the worst. If you plan at all to visit non-French sites, be prepared for the connection time to be so long that it is timed-out. French sites, not at all kidding, are usually fine.
