The wireless connection at times would drop without warning or would be supposedly connected with no actual internet access. Otherwise, when it worked it was fast. For instance while I was writing this review, the internet decided it was too tired to connect again to this website, despite Google for instance working fine. The bathroom could have used a bleaching and lime de-scaling. Would maybe stay here again if it remained a better option, but the internet thing really bothered us, so it's not likely.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: JMMScotland
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this area several times before but not in this hotel. Montparnasse is a great base for exploring Paris. Within walking distance of Jardin du Luxembourg and of course the Tour Montparnasse. It also has a nice "village" feel about it - with a street market and an excellent range of cafes, restaurants etc. The Lenox Montparnasse hotel is centrally located within a short distance of two Metro stations. Very clean, comfortable and well-equipped with a very friendly atmosphere. Reception staff were all very pleasant and helpful and small details like the "honesty bar" help to give the feeling of being a welcome guest. Room was small but had everything you could ask for. Would definitely go back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly and helpful Service. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bayarea74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. The location was great - not only is it very close to 2 metro stops (Vavin and Edgar Quinet), but these two stops are on different lines, meaning you can very easily get to different parts of the city. It's also close enough to the heart of the city that you can walk if you choose. On our first night we walked to the Eiffel Tower and another day we walked to the Louvre - both walks took somewhere between 30 and 40 minutes. The staff was very friendly and helpful - this was key, as we were there in August when a lot of things are closed, so a bit of local knowledge was much appreciated. The size of room was just as we'd expected - nothing huge, of course, but it was very comfortable. Considering the price we paid ($125/night), we were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: sl_clifford
Reviews.Content: This was our base for a wonderful trip to Paris! We stayed seven nights, then another night at the end of our trip, and absolutely loved it. Montparnasse is a great neighborhood -- lots to see, but not too touristy, Also a nice walk to the Jardin du Luxembourg. The hotel is on a street with two different Metro lines (one at either end of the street), so it was easy to hop on the Metro and be anywhere in the city in 10-15 minutes. As for the hotel itself, we were very impressed. The room was small, but that's the nature of a Paris hotel room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was good-sized. Climate control worked well, and double-paned windows kept any street or courtyard noise out. We also didn't hear any noise through the walls -- a very quiet, comfortable room. Housekeeping did a good job of cleaning up and refreshing supplies every day. Also, the free Wi-fi worked well in the rooms, and there was a computer easily available for guest use in the lobby. The staff was also fabulous at Lenox Montparnasse! They were unfailingly polite and extremely helpful. They happily gave directions and answered typical tourist questions. Also booked our shuttle to the airport for us, and even stored one of our suitcases for the 5 days we were in Provence (we returned to the hotel for one night at the end of our trip). We will definitely stay here the next time we're in Paris! Also, check out the bar Rosebud a couple of doors down -- best old-fashioneds around!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: michalmm
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 9 nights at this hotel. We had a 5th floor room facing the courtyard which was very nice. I thought the room was a good size, we weren't there too much so we didn't need any more space. The bathroom was huge. We didn't have the breakfast at the hotel, but did go to the honesty bar one night. I would highly advise against that as it was outrageously overpriced. The staff at the front desk was fantastic, and the location of the hotel was great. It was about a half hour walk to most sites.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, but overly small room and bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: sawhitney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and very close to three different train stations. When we checked into the hotel our room wasn't ready, so we had to wait an extra hour, but we were told we were "upgraded" to a 5th floor room that faced the courtyard. The positive of this was that it was much quieter than a room that would face the street (a bar across the street stays open until 5am), but the negative was that we got the room that had the elevator right next to it, which meant that our room was smaller than the average room in the hotel. You could see this by the map of the floor plan that they put next to the elevator. Our bathroom was very small, but did have a window that opened to the courtyard. We tried the buffet breakfast one morning because we had woken up so early because of the time change and we were starving! All of the food was very fresh and tasty, but it is overpriced. Having it one time was worth it, but not more than once. We also did not use the Honesty Bar because it was also overpriced. We were told that the coffee was "complimentary," but what they actually mean is that they make the coffee for you, but you have to pay for it. Overall, we really did enjoy our stay because the staff were friendly and helpful. One day we had booked a day-trip to the Champagne region and the travel company went on strike. The woman at the front desk helped us to plan our own trip to the Champagne region instead and was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to all of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MA_Fuchs
Reviews.Content: Location defined this hotel for us. Easy access to three different metro lines made traveling the city great. Easy walk to Luxembourg Gardens, a nice grocery store, restaurants, crepe stands, and great kebabs. The room was clean and the interior of the hotel had a very French feel. Book in advance and you can get great deals. Paid well below what most hotels cost and got great quality in an almost perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: doc_joe_NY
Reviews.Content: Agree with rest of reviewers in good value for money. Bed filled most of room but had a decent size bathroom stocked with good quality toileteries. Faced street but not bothered by any noise. Free wi-fi a plus. Honesty bar great feature - end day with nightcap in quiet surroundings. No fitness center but streets and neighboring Jardin du Luxembourg provide jogging trail. Metro at either end of Rue Delalmbre makes local travel a cinch. Front desk friendly and extremely helpful in booking restaurant reservations and cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rincewind05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July and found it an excellent base for visiting Paris. Very convenient to two Metro stations and a short walk to Montparnasse Bienvenue. Boulangeries and Supermarkets on the Rue Delambre are very convenient as are restaurants, bars and especially creperies. The hotel was clean and comfortable. We really had no problems with noise. The rooms were small but very clean and well furnished. The breakfast as 16 euros is a little steep but the nearby shops mentioned above provide excellend croissants. The Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. I would happily return here for any further trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great!”
Reviews.Author: JonJonMontreal
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel on a quiet street in the middle of Montparnasse. You are close to everything; markets, boulangeries, metro, bistros, etc. I had prepard the room so i paid about 125 euros a night instead of 300. I also took the club-room which is quite big for Paris. The room was very clean. The staff at the hotel was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to a metro station!”
Reviews.Author: acmorris
Reviews.Content: This was an interesting (in a good way!) hotel. The staff was excellent, the spoke excellent English, and the location was *very* convenient to both the metro and numerous restaurants. In addition, the beds were comfortable and the rooms were quite clean! :) There are only two small issues: 1. The hotel has a very strange room-key situation. You turn in your key at the front desk when you enter / exit the hotel. As I mentioned the staff was very nice and trustworthy, but some may not feel comfortable with this situation. 2. The walls were a little thin. We heard a drunk couple next to us for two nights in a row. Otherwise, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: HelenD6080
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location close to lovely cafes, shops and the Metro. The room we had was small but very clean with a good size ensuite bathroom and overlooked a charming courtyard. Because we were staying for 6 days one of their larger rooms would have been a better choice. But what stands out about this hotel is the staff. Each and every person we interacted with during our stay were amazing - friendly, helpful and very polite. I required some medical care mid way through our stay and the staff went over and above to assist me in finding a clinic, making numerous calls on my behalf and even taking care of some paperwork for us after we had flown home. When we return to Paris we will be staying again at the Lenox - a hidden gem!!

Reviews.Title: “We got our room for half price, and thought was a good value hotel. Maybe not so if you paid full price?”
Reviews.Author: LittleAndMegsy
Reviews.Content: The staff here were very helpful and spoke great English. Room was small but all we needed. Air con in the room was great for the hotter weather and window to street was nice also (although it was noisy at night with the window open). Two metro lines are located at either end of the street which was handy for getting around, but it was only a 20min walk to the Effiel Tower. Lovely restaurants and bistros in the neighbourhood, and lots of crepe bars! Loved the bar in the hotel lobby too. Only not so great thing about this hotel was the price for breakfast and laundry.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Lenox Montparnasse and we enjoyed it as much as the first time. Staff friendly, cordial and helpful. Location great...two metro lines at either end of the block, patisseries, boulangers, markets and restaurants on Rue Delambre and many others close by. We will certainly stay at this hotel when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautfiul hotel in Montparnasse area close to transit and walking trips to many sights.Well appointed .”
Reviews.Author: gqb
Reviews.Content: The staff were gracious and very helpful. The hotel is in a central area with many small grocery stores and lovely bakeries nearby. The room was large and very well appointed with a view over the back courtyard. We would definitely recommend this hotel. We were close enough to walk to many sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , well located , value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinglj
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel , immaculate and clean , very friendly, helpful staff .Great breakfast and bar .By Paris standards my room was large and the bathroom was really large. The Lenox is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEB1961
Reviews.Content: This hotel we booked on Expedia and read many reviews. The hotel was very CLEAN throughout, and the staff was more than accommodating and pleasant. The room had many conveniences with a safe, coffee pot & mini bar refrigerator and air conditioning! (We had a couple of 90 degree days so this was Great!) The hotel was also located between 2 train lines which was also convenient. Our room was in the front of the hotel, so there was some street noise, BUT the airtight windows buffered the sound out. If we left the windows open it could have been a problem. But we left the air on and the windows closed, and it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DebbietheTraveler
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of TripAdvisor reviews and its location near the Montparnasse Train station-an easy 3 or 4 block walk. The staff was friendly and helpful (upgraded us to a suite due to some reservation hassles), room was very nice, in-room coffee maker was much appreciated, as was the afternoon coffee/honor bar near the front desk. All great touches. Loved the neighborhood, and especially the Brasserie scene at the intersection near the Edgar Quinet Metro. There is another street filled with creperies and a lovely pastry shop and a grocery store just a few doors down from the hotel. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shivknair
Reviews.Content: from the helpful and friendly staff at the front desk to the well maintained , clean and quite spacious bathroom...this is paris where space is at a premium... every thing about this hotel met my expectations. you couldn't have asked for a better location in a very parisian neighborhood with famous cafes all a short walk away and...a minutes walk to 2 metro lines ...highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: peteTimaru
Reviews.Content: we were delighted with the hotel from the time we arrived until the time we left,friendly staff,good central location,nice clean room,quite a novelty having an honesty bar.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: PTDaisy
Reviews.Content: My room was not as pretty as they are portrayed on line, but that really didn't matter all that much, as it was nice and quiet...an excellent retreat at the end of a busy day. (note, I had a room on the back side of the hotel overlooking the courtyard). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. The front desk staff was super friendly, and really helped me in figuring out my way around Paris, and how to get out to Disneyland Paris (very cool btw). The location is excellent. I felt safe walking alone at midnight, after leaving my group who were staying several blocks away. There are darling restaurants and shops and a metro stop just at the end of the street. It was more expensive than the hotel where my friends stayed, but it was also nicer in my opinion, so worth the price difference ~pretty spendy though, that's why I only gave it 3 for value. GREAT GREAT GREAT! I plan on staying there when I return with my husband and son. Cheers and have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Clean - Lovely Area”
Reviews.Author: SeCR25879Q
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, spotlessly clean, charming. On a small street lined with many restaurants, a grocery, ATM, patisserie, and a block from VAVIN Metro stop, few blocks' walk to Luxembourg Garden. Receptionists speak English and are helpful. There's a shared computer in small lobby. Free coffee/tea and "honesty" bar (not free) in hotel lounge in afternoon are pleasant to come back to after a day out sightseeing. Rooms are small like in all Parisian hotels, but bath is surprisingly good size and everything is spotlessly clean. We have stayed at Lenox Montparnasse 2 times and will return again. Compared to other Paris hotels we've stayed in, the Lenox Montparnasse also is a BARGAIN, especially if you book through Expedia.com. TIP: At the time you make your reservation, ask for a quiet room at the back of the hotel. There's a small upcharge for these rooms, but it's worth it not to be awakened by noisy garbage trucks at dawn at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location & suberb value”
Reviews.Author: BendPhilisha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montparnasse in May 2011. We were so impressed with the staff who were so helpful and courteous. We loved our courtyard room, though small as all rooms in Paris, it was clean & new bathroom. Provided tea & coffee. They had a great bar with self-service in the lobby with nice couches. The area was quiet and well situated to see all the sites. Great restaurants in the area...it's a 10!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AMAZING, EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TorontoStephen
Reviews.Content: Where do I start..... from the moment we stepped into the lobby, all the way until we checked out, our week stay at the Lenox was superb. At first we were not happy with the room which was facing the courtyard, way too small, even though I was prepared for that, so we upgraded to a bigger room, but not that much bigger. All the staff at the Lenox were more than happy to accomodate us, to help us with our plans, recommend restaurants, daily trips etc. I found them all to be very very curtious and helpfull. If you love night life, fine restaurants, easy access to transportation, then this is your best stay. It was our fourth time to Paris, and we have stayed from a three star to a five. Yes this is rated as a three star, but the service you get is better than a five. After a long day we would go to the lounge for a few drinks, then right to bed for a relaxing night, well rested for our daily trip, wherever it took us. Would I stay here again, most certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ShellyD2323
Reviews.Content: I certainly would stay here again. The hotel had a convenient location to several Metro stops. We got there way before our check-in time and they offered to take our bags while we explored Paris. Our room was very clean and cozy. The staff answered all of our questions and even made a dinner reservation for us at a local spot which was superb. I also suggest trying out the bakery down the block for croissants. It made a perfect breakfast-on- the-go for a packed day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Bill1606
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this booking in every respect. For Paris the rate was acceptable. The staff was courteous and accommodating. The room was well presented, clean and comfortable. It was not a large room but we didn't intend to stay in it during the day anyway. Breakfast is not included in the room rate. The cost is probably in line generally though we found a less expensive and as suitable an alternative at a small bistro in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahB41166
Reviews.Content: In a good spot near Luxembourg Gardens and a 20min walk to Notee Dame. 3 metro stations really close and very close to the hop OMB - hop off L'open bus route. Obliging staff. Rooms lovely with windows opening to a tiny 'balcony' overlooking the street. Good Internet in rooms. Close to several cafes and boulangeries for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Greg0005
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the LOCATION, we wanted the true Parisian feel and that's what we got. The street is filled with bakeries, vegetable stands, butcher shop, deli and so on. Yes the rooms are not the biggest I've stayed in around Europe but this location could not be beat. Every morning we felt as if we were locals going about our business. My main suggestion is to SKIP the hotel breakfast, it is OVER PRICED and the same can be said of the honesty bar. Make a right upon exiting the hotel and than a left on the Blvd Montparnasse, just walk down a block or two and the choices for breakfast are endless for A LOT less. As for the bar simply hang a left out of the hotel and on the very next block the market carries alcohol and mixers (8euros got me a bottle of gin and some tonic) One thing we did notice is that when you ask for directions its always straight ahead so take them with a grain of salt. But as previously stated you have 2 different lines at either ends of the street and also the Gare Montparnasse a few blocks away which is a 30min ride to Versailles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms and great service; convenient location”
Reviews.Author: newyork123321
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Lenox Montparnasse for 4 nights in May 2011. We had a junior suite as well as a double room. The rooms were very clean and nicely kept. We asked for a baby cot and it was there when we arrived (and in excellent condition). We also had a daily complimentary bottle of water and coffee in the junior suite. Free wireless internet is available in the room. There is also one computer in the lobby where you can use. All the staff spoke very fluent English and were extremely helpful (helped us make dinner reservations; answered all our questions; etc). The hotel is located on a quiet side street and by walking half a block in either direction will you will get to two differnet metro stops (on two separate lines) so it is very convenient. For about EUR16 you can get a hot buffett breakfast which was very good. For about EUR9 you get a coffee, a fruit juice and a croissant. The breakfast area turns into an honesty bar at night where you can pour your own drink; you just write down what you had and the hotel will charge you accordingly. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benjamincopenhagen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Lenox Montparnasse in May 2011. Having read all the positive reviews we had high expectations - and we were not dissapointed. This little charming hotel was perfect in every way. We were warmly welcomed by a very informative and helpful receptionist. And the service from the hotel staff was impecable from the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out. The honesty bar next to the reception was very cozy and gave a very relaxed and "home-like" atmosphere which made it really nice to return to the hotel after hard days of sightseeing and shopping. Our room was really nice. Everything was clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was big and nice. We had one of the rooms that are a bit larger than their standard rooms and we were very happy with the size. We had a small balcony from where we had a really nice view to the charming street Rue Delambre. We had absolutely no problems with noise from the street even though our room was on the second floor and facing the street - the balcony-doors shut out all noise very effeciently when they were closed. We loved the location in Montparnasse which is a very true Parisian neighborhood without to many tourists. We were within short walking distance to the Luxembourg Garden and Saint Sulpice, and with two metro stops very close to the hotel the rest of the city was easyly accessible. Rue Delambre in particular we found very charming with several beautiful small food shops selling bread, meat, fish and cheese. There are also several great restaurants in Rue Delambre and the connecting streets. We loved Le Dome at the corner of rue Delambre and Boulevard du Montparnasse just a few hundred meters from the hotel - it's a classic and classy Parisian restaurant with great seafood. We can also recommend to try one of the several authentique small Breton Galette restaurants that are situated around the charming square at the opposite end of Rue Delambre (especially in Rue d'Odessa and Rue du Montparnasse there are many of them).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: pnd1991
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for ten nights. We based our selection on the many excellent reviews from TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. Our room was clean and quiet, and the entire staff was exceptional. The rooms have plenty of storage, and the bathroom was spacious. We both always overpack, and we still had plenty of room. We had a courtyard facing room, and we were never bothered by any noise. Take the time to explore the neighborhood. Rue Delambre is a perfect little Parisian street with everything from patisseries to pizza! Cafe Josselin was recommended by Monsieur Sebastian at the front desk, and it was one of our favorite meals during our stay. Don't miss the street market just one street over on Saturdays and Wednesdays. It offers another glimpse of daily French living. We've only been back for two weeks, and we already miss Paris. We can't wait to return, and we highly recommend the Lenox Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fonzy2000
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for 10 nights. The rooms are small but apparently that 's the norm in Paris and anyways, after the initial surprise you get used to it very fast. The room was spotless and so was the bathroom.The service was great and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located a couple of minutes walk from 2 metro lines giving you easy access to all the sights in Paris.There are many good restaurants and creperies in the area as well as 2 bakeries. We took walks in the area after supper and always felt safe. The only negative point is the walls are paper thin and if you get a noisy neighbor it could affect your sleep quality especially when closing closet doors, it sounds as if someone is in your room. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel - Exceptional staff - Multilanguage speakers! - I love Fouzia!”
Reviews.Author: princzz
Reviews.Content: My name is Dr. Julian Ricks and I stayed there May 18-23, 2011. The staff was helpful and the hotel is in an excellent location. I was always treated with respect and courtesy! The staff and the management continued to maintain high standards of excellence throughout the stay! Further, Fouzia (front desk) is very professional and goes the extra mile to help you. Additionally, she has numerous suggestions off the beaten path that has you learning about Paris in a new light! The rooms are neat, clean and accommodating though it is a typical French size. I got a bigger room (club) but it still has a French flair! The breakfast buffef is HIGHLY recommended!!! It is in a beautiful room with very nice furniture that is comfortable. The buffet has everything would would want and it is expertly prepared. It is only 16 Euros, and you get everything, however, if you go to a restaurant for breakfast, you will pay 14 Euros and only get one cup of coffee, one, baguette, one croissant and a small glass of juice! No brainer! The hotel is next to the Gare Montparnasse which has several Metro and train lines that go through it so you don't have to do a lot of transferring. For example if you want to go to the louvre, take M4 with no transferring and if you want to go to the Eiffel Tower or Arc du Triomphe take M6 no transferring. You will love it there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erica907
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 7-night stay at the Lenox Montparnasse and had a fabulous experience with the hotel and the staff. All of the desk staff were helpful and spoke English well. We stayed in a club room and had a nice little balcony facing out onto the street. I am a very light sleeper yet I had no problems with the street noise and we were on the 2nd floor facing the cinemas. There are so many wonderful cafes nearby and we particularly enjoyed La Rotonde on Boulevard Montparnasse. The two local metro lines made access to all attractions very easy. I recommend the Lenox Montparnasse without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good simple accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Girl_on_the_GoiNBaku
Reviews.Content: A last minute short break - we arrived Saturday evening late having booked that day on laterooms and having just come over from London on Eurostar. Reception was expecting us - you're last in so you must be the Maclachlans - and check in was quick and efficient. Our room was at the front (3rd floor) but wasn't noisy. Aircon worked or we could've had the window open - being May either was fine. The bed was a large double (which to be fair I only discovered after the 2nd night was 2 singles joined - usually it's so obvious!) and overall the room and bathroom was perfectly adequate for our needs. We popped out for breakfast to one of the many nearby street cafes, just to 'be' in Paris. Went for a lovely evening meal at the nearby Bistrot du Dome - turn right out of the hotel and it's just there, the one with the yellow sunshade. We booked half an hour in advance - just enough time for a quick wash - and we knew we had a good table to go to. See my review for the restaurant. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely recommend eating local to the hotel and then it's an easy walk back after a day of walking and walking...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: tdmck573
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Lenox Montparnasse in April, 2011 for the Paris part of our France vacation and could not have been happier. Unless you have to be right in the heart of the sights, you cannot beat the location. Two metro lines are within a 5 minute walk to the hotel. One stop, Vavin, on line number 4, will take you to Notre Dame and get you close to SacrÃ©- CÅ“ur; the other stop, Edgar Quinet on line number 6, will take you to the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. It's ideal for exploring Paris. To get to the hotel, we took the RER from Charles de Gaulle airport to the Denfert Rochereau stop and then hopped on the metro; the hotel is only two stops on either line - this is the most affordable option. As everyone else has said, the hotel is spotless. We found the staff to be wonderfully friendly and very helpful. Yes, the rooms are small compared to US hotels. That's Paris, and most of Europe for that fact. But we were never in our room except to sleep, so it didn't matter. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. There were boulangeries on the way to either metro station, so we would stop and get pastries and juice at one of those every morning (we thought the one on the way to the Vavin stop was better). There were numerous restaurants around the hotel and a couple of small grocery stores. We didn't have any issue with noise, but we were on the back of the hotel over looking the courtyard. The only issue we had was the wi-fi was spotty at times, but we found that to be the case at all the hotels we stayed at in France and it was by no meas a deal breaker. Overall, we were very pleased with out stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. Paris is our favorite destination and we try to get back there every few years. We will certainly stay at the Lenox Montparnasse again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ver nice stay in the city of lights...”
Reviews.Author: Tisch101
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time in Paris, very much so due to the nice hotel at an affordable price we stayed in. We thought the area in which it was situated was very nice (Montparnasse) and a convenient starting point for all the sight-seeings... We walked a bit around and for those longer streches we bought a 3-day card at the Metro in order not to bother about tickets all the time. Very nice and welcoming staff at the hotel. Very accommodating and even offered an upgrade of the room. Some noice from the street during the weekend, but would like to know where you don't get that in Paris... Clean rooms, and very good standard! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel with very helpful front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lytle1477
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small, but immaculate. Several front desk staff were very helpful. Location is highly desirable. All facilities handy, but not in main tourist zone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: imras47
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews we chose the Lenox Montparnasse and were pleased with the choice. The location is excellent on a relatively quiet street and with soundproofing windows. There are many restaurants within 2 city blocks - creperies and seafood are predominant. There are several Metro stations close by - we walked to Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, the Louvre and Arc de Triomphe. Breakfast in the hotel is expensive (($12 for coffee and croissant) - there are several better choices among the numerous sidewalk cafe's in the neighbourhood - the further you get from a major intersection (such as Place Pablo Picasso) the better the food and beverage prices. The hotel has a well stocked "honesty bar" where you can relax after a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with brilliant staff.”
Reviews.Author: themccs90
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay. This was my first stay in Paris and I was nervous as I had booked this just based on info on the internet. It was extra important as it was a treat for my wife for her 40th birthday. I shouldn't have worried though, as it was a real pleasure to stay at this hotel. While we didn't use some of the facilities, like breakfast or honesty bar (mostly due to being out and about in Paris), I found the room had everything we needed, very clean and well laid out, and the staff were exceptional. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome by the front desk and got a real feeling that they were keen to help us any way they could. They answered any query we had and helped us solve a number of issues we had including transport to the airport. The only issue I had with our stay was that the noise from the street was loud at times and a room to the rear of the hotel probably would have been better. Apart from that the Hotel was well situated with Metro stops at either end of the street. The local area had plenty of places to eat etc and ten minutes had you in the centre of Paris on the Metro. I would recomend the Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, but overall good experience.”
Reviews.Author: tripuser1
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are wonderful, helpful, and accomodating. The rooms, like most in Paris as I understand, are small but the bathrooms are decently sized. The carpets, linen, and drapery were all clean, rustic, and of good quality. The hotel has a charming, quiet ambience. The honesty bar concept is fun and relaxed. The location is fantastic, Montparnasse being a lively and diverse neighborhood, close to three metro stations, numerous restaurants, cafes, bars, a farmer's market on weekends, convenience stores and other retailers. The downsides to this hotel are the lack of air conditioning in off season periods, (we stayed the first week of April and the AC was not yet turned on, and unfortunately it was a bit warm), and noise level on the street as there is a bar across the way that seems to never close. I don't mind a bit of noise, (being originally from New York City), but screaming drunks and garbage trucks in the AM have an unfortunate way of inducing insomnia... I would stay again, but next time bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, decent value in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: hajile99
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for four nights in March. The room was definitely small, but comparable to most standard Paris hotel rooms. It proved to be more than adequate since we didn't spend all that much time in the room anyways. The bathroom was tiny, and the shower very, very tight, but we made it work. The hotel offered free Wi-Fi which was reliable and very useful for researching our destinations while we were in Paris. The service from the staff was adequate. They were able to refer us to a nearby store where we could buy a power convertor and also suggested a few restaurants for us to try. My main concern with the hotel is their policy on returning the room key each time you leave. I understand the policy, however, when picking the key up, they should require ID, otherwise anyone could come in and pick a key up for any room. I never had an issue, however, it was always in the back of my mind every time I left the hotel. In addition, I would not recommend the buffet breakfast offered by the hotel. We opted to eat it on the day we were leaving because it was convenient, however, it was expensive and the selection was poor. I just was not impressed by the meal. The location is superb, just a few steps from the Vavin metro stop. The street has a couple of boulangeries (bakeries), as well as a charcuterie (butcher), a poissonerie (fish) and a small grocery store, which made it very easy to pick something up to eat quickly. At the intersection where the Vavin metro stop is located, there are numerous restaurants. I highly recommend Les Fondus de la Raclette down Boulevard Raspail just a little bit. If you've never had Raclette before, it is absolutely delicious. We were given a room on the street side and while there were some noise issues, it was not nearly as bad to me as some reviewers say it is. Especially with the window closed, you could rarely hear any of the street noise, and we were only 3 floors up. Overall, the hotel was fabulous and I would definitely stay there again. The location was very convenient to the Metro, which is all you need in Paris to get around. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing much to say, just very good!!”
Reviews.Author: basvince
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say about hotel lenox montparnasse? Nothing in particular, its just a very good hotel! We stayed at the hotel for a short honeymoon trip to paris. First of all, the receptionists are all very kind and very helpfull. We asked if it was possible to get a room at the back of the hotel. It wasn't a problem and we got an upgrade automatically. Dont expect large rooms in paris! Ours was spacious enough and a complete and very clean bathroom with even a bidet! The bed was small but very comfortable and enough pillows available. The room was equipped with a very silent airconditioning, but we didn't use it because it was possible to leave the window open (it was that quiet!). Wifi and pay TV was included and worked very good! One of the very strong points of the hotel is its location. In a quiet street just between 2 metrolines with a station at every end of the street. Around the corners you find the area of montparnasse which is a very nice and safe area with lots of good restaurants. Within 5 minutes walking distance you'll find montparnasse graveyard, the catacombes, tour montparnasse and jardin the luxembourg. There is a breakfast buffet offered at the hotel. I can't review the quality of it, but it looked very nice. There are 2 very good pastrie bakeries in the street so we had breakfast there. The hotelbar has a unique formula. You can get your own drink from the bar and write down every consumption. You can use the hotelbar till 2 am! For the price it is the best quality you can get! we definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluenose1076
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is in a great location in the heart of Montparnasse. After reading all the reviews before going we were very happy to be upgraded to a cabin class room because our booked room was not ready when we arrived. This was perfect as it was at the back of the hotel (room 51) so we had no issues with the potential street noise from the front. However because I think I messed up the air con setting we had to open the windows during the night and the sound of the fountain in the courtyard coupled with the various services working so early in the morning was a bit of a pain. Dont go for the breakfast option as this was not cheap - but nowhere is in Paris. All in all decent value for money and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “THE most wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: The_stone_traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just 5 minutes walk from le jardin du Luxembourg, a spectacular place to lounge around in, soak up the sun (if you're lucky like we were, and simply watch the world go by. It is also located close to two metro lines and enough decent restaurants to satisfy all appetites and purses. La Tour Montparnasse is ten minutes away, and a great place to watch dusk fall one evening. When we checked in, our room wasn't ready, but tired and potentially grumpy, the front desk offered us a free upgrade- excellent customer service. Our room was on the second floor on the courtyard side, and was quiet with the most comfortable bed. Free internet access meant we could check in for our flight home, and all the staff were incredibly helpful. The only slight negative was the size of the room- just a weeny bit too small. But hey, this is Paris, and with this great location you're not going to spend much time in the room! In summary, if you can get a good price here, then go. It's as simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Bright Lights, OVERRATED AND Not a Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: NhLulu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in France for 10 days. I slept at numerous hotels in and outside the City. For this Hotel the story is about what they DON'T tell you. First, this appears to be a good location on a side street. However, this street was my MOST NOISY street during my entire stay. The Cinema is across from this hotel with noise well into the night. There are numerous businesses that have trucks unload beginning very early in the morning with the CINEMA lights turning BRIGHTLY on at 6 am after having been off only a few hours.. In addition there appears to be a TRASH CAN Processing Plant next to the CINEMA. SO, on trash days, the receptacles were NOISILY emptied in and out of the doors which NOISILY opened pre-dawn hours across the street. Trucks servicing the businesses were backed up on the street prior to 7 am. I counted 5 Police cars with Sirens that used this Street as a cross through to their destination. My room, was on the second floor. When I arrived, the central air conditioning that they advertised as a feature was not working. The room smelled musty and I ended up buying flowers as the front desk said the air conditioning wasn't working. The carpet in my bedroom, seemed vacuumed, but not cleaned. There were two towels which were stained or dirty and appeared to be left over from the previous occupants of the room. The towels were not replaced everyday and the tile in the bathroom floor was cracked...If I paid $40 per night, this is what I could have expected and lived with. But the price of this hotel was NOT a value and I found that I could not get a peaceful night's sleep. I WOULD NOT GO HERE EVER AGAIN, IT WAS OVERPRICED, AND VERY, VERY NOISY...AND NOT A GOOD VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: lallarebecca
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother had a great stay at Lenox Montparnasse, definately one of the best places IÂ´ve been staying in while in Paris! Everything was perfect, could not wish for anything more. Lenox Montparnasse is a real gem, and IÂ´ll be happy to come back and recommend it to family and friends, both for business and leisure-stays!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Eurover
Reviews.Content: A very nice, little hotel in the lovely Montparnasse area. Great staff. Rooms are a little small with not too modern furniture. Inner side room was very quiet. Wireless internet connection not only in the lobby but also in the room. Liked it very much and may surely come back if on vacation Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfectly situated.”
Reviews.Author: MoriF
Reviews.Content: Been there for a week with my daughter. Had a very good time there. A clean hotel, good facilities, good and helpful staff. Would certainly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aubrint
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, nice area (Montparnesse). I arrived early in the morning but they had a room available so they let me check in early. Great way to start. Lenox Monparnasse is a comfortable hotel with complementary afternoon tea and coffee and honesty bar which is a nice low-key way to wind down the evening. The rooms were clean though small (European typical). The location is very good with access to 3 train stations within a couple of blocks of the hotel. Free Wifi in the room worked very well, even able to Skype back to the US with the connection. I would stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great value”
Reviews.Author: lw105
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be in the heart of all the tourist attractions, but that was actually one of the reasons I chose it. It is in a very nice area just a couple blocks from Luxembourg Garden (very large and pretty park to stroll or chill on a bench). Hotel offers a breakfast but there is also a Boulangerie on the street. For an inexpensive breakfast, grab a pastry and take it to the coffee shop on the other side of the street. Musee D'Orsay is about a 20 min walk. If you stay here, Tour Montparnasse is about a block away - go up to the top of the building (small fee) for a great 360 view of the city. Also 1 block away is Montparnasse Cemetery for a very quiet stroll. And, the catacombs are very close by as well. If you dont like street noise, ask for a room away from the street - I woke every morning around 6am to the sound of garbage trucks and street cleaners (which lasted about an hour). Great Restaurant: Le Timbre

Reviews.Title: “Only 1 issue”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_EnterpriseUT
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was very conveniently located - close to several metro stations. It was very clean & the staff were excellent. Our only complaint to this hotel was that the walls are very thin - so I woke up in the morning thinking it was raining outside, only to realize the neighbors were flushing their toilet. Other than that we thought the hotel was great. We would probably stay again if we ever went back to Paris (which I doubt we would!).

Reviews.Title: “Worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: thehowes84
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Rooms quite small, but immaculate and well-equipped. Super-helpful and friendly staff. Is now our hotel of choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “For Americans in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GloryPoint
Reviews.Content: The Lenox on Rue DeLambre is such a gem. The price is right and the location is perfect for getting around this very user-friendly area. Close to excellent food and shops, The Lenox puts you right at home in a very short period of time. The hotel is elegant and friendly, the desk staff is multi-lingual, very helpful and patient. They will set you up for tours and recommend places and events that will enhance your stay. Recently renovated, the bathrooms are spacious and boast great water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl1981
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip to Paris and enjoyed our stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. We really enjoyed the location of the hotel, with its quick access to anything we could need. The front desk was very helpful in setting up an airport shuttle and giving directions. The hotel had a very casual feel, but we felt welcome when returning at night. One minor setback was the street noise one Friday evening. We packed earplugs, as we had read that the noise could be bothersome while sleeping. Overall, we found the hotel to be exceptionally clean and met our needs well. If we ever make it back to Paris, we will surely check out the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overrated on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: kokimole
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in room 43 (?) and although the room was basically clean and the bathroom was spacious- I think this hotel is a bit overrated. The room's decor was consistented of depressing dark, scuffed maroon colored wallpaper and dark cutains. The "balcony" was not big enough to do anything except step out on. The bathroom was light and large- very nice. The hotel staff was very friendly - unlike many of the other Parisians we encountered. The hotel was conveniently located to two Metros and had anything you could ask for (supermarket, restaurants, creperies, shops) all within a block or two. Much more of a local feel to the hotel than other parts of Paris. One major problem was the thin walls. We could hear our upstairs neighbor and their very noisy child well past midnight. Again, the best features of this hotel were the extremely friendly staff, the local feel, and the convenience of transportaion options. If you can afford a bit more per room, keep searching- I think there may be better options for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Well liked and felt like a local”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBlighty33
Reviews.Content: A conveniently located and priced hotel which is around 20mins from 'Gare du Nord' metro (Eurostar and SNCF rail links) to 'Vavin' Metro Station then a 3 to 4 minutes walk to the Lenox. On arrival the staff were very courteous, pleasant and everything explained clearly. Although the room was a tad small but still good . The area of Montparnasse had lots of nice restaurants and bars to choose from, especially along 'Boulevard Raspail' and side streets. Also there's a supermarket and a 'Nicolas' wine shop yards away. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I'd definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “This quaint hotel is tucked into a quiet street with many amenities”
Reviews.Author: brianm37209
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the hotel we were greeted warmly. The staff spoke English which was a big help. The hotel was charming, we were upgraded to a balcony room. The room had everything we've grown to expect and overlooked a nice courtyard. The hotel was so close to the metro, terrific bakeries, restaurants and a cute little school. We loved our stay in this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: eoflynn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse and had a wonderul time. The hotel location and facilities were great. Instead of staying in a traditional North American type of hotel we thought we would try a Parisian style of hotel. The location was amazing. It is 1 minute away from the Vavin subway and 2 minutes from the Edgar Quinet stop. It was also a very short walk to the Jardins de Luxembourg, the catacombs and wasn't far from the Left Bank, Germain des Pres and Notre Dame if you are up for a walk. The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. The rooms were more than adequate even though we didn't spend a lot of time in it at all. The restaurants and shops in the area were also superb.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Joy with Lenox in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wffolkes
Reviews.Content: I fished around looking at lots of hotels and after checking reviews here I decided to take the plunge and book with Lenox Mantraparnasse for 4th March 2011. Ok lets get to it the service is extremely high, the staff at the front desk are willing to help as much as they can to make you enjoy your stay. (My girlfriend needed to dry clean her dress and they pointed us to the two shops availiable within walking distance) The rooms are quite small but they are clean and have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable. Free TV Internet and movies was bouns as well as the super comfy beds. (I had a great nights sleep) In regards to the location its also great, lots of shops, bars, restaurants, grocery stores all within walking distance as well as two metro station within walking distance. The best thing about this hotel is the Honesty bar but you need to book and stay here to find out more. My girlfriend is quite fussy when it comes to staying in other places and she loved it and loved her Birthday in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a very nice part of Paris with a very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: HugodelaR
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, price and quality match! Self service bar is nice and the reception is very helpful. Lots of good and trendy restaurants and bars in nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lenox Montparnasse - will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: hannah201
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for 3 nights in February with my boyfriend over my birthday. The hotel was really easy to find, very near two metro stations (Edgar Quinet and Vavin) - really close to lots of restaurants, so easy to find somewhere to eat nearby. Rooms were lovely, although a bit small. Had a Juliet balcony which was nice too. The hotel itself is small, in a really pretty building. We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't comment on the food, but we did use the honesty bar. You help yourself, and then fill in a form to say what you have, give it in to the reception, and then you get billed at the end of your stay. The wine was lovely! Easy to get to all the different places in Paris you want to see, and the metro runs late into the night, so you can always get home easily if you've been out for dinner and some drinks. We ate a restaurant at the top of the Champs Elysees one night, right by the Arc de Triomphe, which we would definitely recommend. It wasn't too expensive either. Also went for a drink near Notre Dame one night, really pretty there. Hotel staff were all really polite and friendly. I speak French, but for those who don't, their English is really good so you won't have any problems. They also go out of their way to help you. I actually left my passport in the room when we left (!) and had to phone to get it back, and they immediately got it from my room. I still had enough time to go back to the hotel and get it before my flight, but they seemed concerned and willing to help if there had been more of an issue. We loved our stay in Paris, and are planning to come back within the next year. We will almost definitely stay at the Lenox Montparnasse, unless we can find somewhere for a good price near the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal oasis in paris”
Reviews.Author: Tfix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lenox montparnasse for ten days in late December '10. I had researched many hotels all over Paris and chose the Lenox due to value, location and positive reviews. In short, the Lenox exceeded our expectations in all of those areas and then some. I will acknowledge that the rooms are small but you won't find bigger rooms without making a bigger sacrifice in some other area. Aside from that, there is nothing I would have changed. The staff was extremely professional, courteous, jovial and accommodating. Next, the location was fantastic. Tucked away on a quaint, quiet street but near many metros and one of the main boulevards in Paris, it was very easy to get whereever we needed quickly. Plus, two days a week they had a great little market a half a block away. Finally, the value. There really is no getting around the price of this clean, delightful, safe, reliable hotel. They could charge much more and I would still come back. My wife and I agree that not only would we return to the Lenox if we get back to Paris, but will recommend it to anybody else going to Paris. Thank you hotel Lenox montparnasse!! You made our trip to Paris even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler0910
Reviews.Content: Our 10 day stay was perfect. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was a good size and our bathroom was quite large - both were very clean and had everything we would need. The staff was very happy to help us with additional needs as well (such as ice buckets and calling for taxis for us). And the location was perfect: close to great restaurants and 3 metro lines, but tucked away on a side street that it was very quiet for sleeping. We both were very happy with every aspect of the hotel and will definitely stay there again the next time we visit Paris. Which hopefully will be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PSMpls
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was excellent. I had a minor issue (computer locked to desk and lost key) and the hotel staff was able to help me. The rooms are small compared to US rooms but very comfortable. I had a queen bed that took pretty much the entire room. Very little room to walk around but the bathroom was very nice and large. I had a heated towel rack which was very nice. The hotel provides a hair dryer and provides soap and shampoo. Note: If you are bring american electronics, you will need a adaptor/converter. Also, make sure you have an International or French Phone (if you want to talk to others). French phone (Virgin Moblie for about 30E which will let you send unlimited Text messages to anyone). Skype works great also but not when you are out and about. There are two metro's very close. The Edgar Quient and Vavin. Both are one block from hotel. Easy to access. Great Location for traveling about Paris. There is a supermarket and fruit stand on the same block as the hotel. The Montparnasse is a truely typical quaint paris area. You will expereince the true parisian life staying here. I also stayed at a Hilton which is a typical American Hotel. I am glad I had the oppurtinity to stay at the Lenox. There were more food choices around the Lenox. I felt safe at the Lenox and was able to come and go as I pleased. Note: In most cases, I was in by 8:00pm as there is so much sightseeing to do and I was tired. The restaurant accross the street (Italian) was very good and reasonably priced. Note: Food is very expensive in Paris and be prepared to spend about 15 to 30 E per meal except if you go to bakeries. I bought the Paris, Paris pass - I personally would not buy this again as it would have been cheaper to just pay the entrance fee's. Do's - Buy a metro pass for the length of stay. You can purchase at any metro stop, Take a hop on and hop off bus (24 E for two days) the next day when you first arrive. You will see all of the main sights in Paris expect to be tired after this if you get on and off. Note: if you take the bus, you do not need to take the boat ride on the seine. I did both. Best sights - Place Versailles, Opera Tour (Wed and Sat in English), Effiel Tower (get their early). Best Shopping - Galeria Lafayette, Best View - Sacre Coeur, and Effiel Tower. Disappoinment - Catcombs. Lots of walking and not much to see.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: brendamariet
Reviews.Content: If we hadn't been referred to this hotel, we probably wouldn't have found it. The rooms were small but very nice and the staff were wonderful to us during our stay. The morning breakfast buffet was great and the afternoon and evening honesty bar was a relaxing way to end a busy and fun day. The location was perfect for sightseeing, dining out and shopping. Grabbing a cab was quick and easy to get to sites further away. We loved our stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice rooms, free Wifi and Movies”
Reviews.Author: latbonchimsi
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and the free Wifi and even free pay per view movies are great! Would def. stay here again. The rooms are small but cosy, the breakfast nothing special though so I skipped it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lraphael
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at Lenox Montparnasse with my teenager. It was an excellent base for sightseeing, near the 4, 6 and 12 metro lines. We had a number of excellent meals right in the neighborhood. The area was also busy with cafes and movie theatres open well into the evening and we felt safe coming back at any hour. The hotel is typical for a three star in the neighborhood and seemed on par with the other three hotels on the block. Our room was very clean, but small, as expected. Our bathroom, while large, was dated and just okay- not as nice as those on the web site. Also, there were no dresser drawers- just a closet with some shelves. The beds were comfortable and while there was some street noise, as New Yorkers, it was not a problem for us. The staff were pleasant and accommodating. I would recommend for the price and would consider staying again or might try another in Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Beich18
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a nice neighbourhood. We stayed in a club-room, which was not very big, but we didn't need more space - we didn't come to Paris to stay in our room:) Bathroom on the other hand rather big. Cleaning was perfect - there was a nice scent of 'clean' in the room and everywhere else in the hotel. Very accommodating and helpful staff. Nice breakfast buffet at â‚¬ 15,50. If you take the Air France shuttle bus 'les cars' from the airport (both Orly and Charles de Gaulle) to Gare Montparnasse, you only have to walk 500 m. to the hotel. Several nice restaurants nearby; would especially recommend La Rotonde at the end of Rue Delambre/Blvd. du Montparnasse. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming room and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: pianogal1018
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay - we were automatically upgraded to a larger room which was beautifully decorated. the bathroom was a decent size and spotless. the honesty bar was beautifully set up and the location was perfect - removed away from touristy areas to feel truly local yet right on two train lines. we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: cindy1360
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and myself) stayed in Lennox Montparnasse for 4 night on June 2010, in the occasion of our 20th anniversary of marriage. We did the booking very early, at the beginning of February, to take advantage of the special offers available in that moment: our target was a medium class hotel, near to the city center and to a metro station, to be able to reach easily the airport and all the lines. Our experience was very good: the girl at the reception was very kind and professional, the room was small (as in almost all the hotel in Paris), but designed in such a way that the space is used at the best; the furniture style is modern and comfortable; the cleanliness is very good and the lack of the moquette allows a better hygiene; the bathroom is new and clean, with all the main accessories. We appreciated very much the hotel bar, where you can enjoy a very good breakfast: it's well-appointed, with a small lounge, where you can relax after a day of work, or, like us, after a day spent walking to see the city; a soft music helps to create a relaxing atmosphere. The offer for the breakfast is wide and diversified, but we appreciated the possibility to have a light breakfast, composed by a hot drink (cappuccino, tea, ...) and a croissant, like we are used to have and with a lower cost. Taking in account the overall scenario of the hotels in Paris, this is a very good solution with a high quality/cost ratio; by sure, we recommend it and will be our choice for the next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Inquizz8tor
Reviews.Content: Just spent two weeks at the Lenox Montparnasse exploring Paris in-depth with my partner, and couldn't be happier with the experience. Though the hotel rooms are quite small by North American standards, the site is a tranquil safe harbour, extremely clean and with all the amenities you might need. Plus the staff speak great English and are only too happy to help you with directions, restaurant reservations, taxis, you name it. I'm definitely returning when I come back to Paris. Here are some more specific thoughts: - very small hotel, only 50 or so rooms, nestled in a narrow street - fantastic location -- there are boulangeries on either side, a supermarket (Franprix), tons of restaurants at either end of the street, nearby metro and a train station (Gare Montparnasse, which you can use to get to Versailles in 25 mins). In fact, each day we made a point to just set out walking from the hotel into Paris, e.g. the Louvre or the Eiffel Tower. Everything is easy to get to. - rooms are quite small, but very clean, with flat-screen TV (they even included free movies for us), free Wi-Fi, and an excellent bathroom. We were in a room that had a kind of balcony fire escape, but it was perfect because we used it to store flats of soda and beer (we were there in January). - the vibe of the hotel is like a city mansion -- it has a big central carpeted staircase and a teeny elevator, and you never hear any noise from outside. Sometimes the odd ambient noise from other guests, but nothing too distressing. - they offer a breakfast each day, served in a very nice, cute restaurant-bar, about 15 euros for a full spread (you can get a cheaper one, just juice and pastry, but we preferred the bigger breakfast). Didn't get breakfast every day, but when we did it was great (and the lady who manages the area is lovely). As I said, there are pastry shops a stone's throw away, so you can always get a pain au chocolat there and walk it off LOL. We also occasionally bought baguettes and ham/cheese in the market for a nice impromptu and hugely satisfying lunch. - if you're a drinker, the bar is an honor bar ... you just mark down what you drink, as though it were a mini-bar. - Montparnasse Cemetary is right around the corner if you want a quick tourist fix (e.g. the graves of Samuel Beckett, Jean Seberg, Jean-Paul Sartre and Simone de Beauvoir etc.) When going to a big city, I'm used to getting scammed by "value" hotels. This place was a refreshing reminder that there are decent establishments still out there. I wouldn't recommend it for people who want to spend all day in their hotel room, but this is Paris after all -- get out there and enjoy the city!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: suntraveller123_11
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse is ideally situated in an interesting quarter of Paris. It is about 100 meters from two Metro lines and is close to many very good restaurants. Sebastian and the staff at the hotel are exceptionally helpful and friendly. The 'honesty' bar and the free coffee and tea that are available in the lounge make you feel at home. The buffet breakfast is very good with a wide choice, The rooms are spotless and comfortable. We have visited Paris 14 times and this was the best visit ever!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel- I couldn't recommend it more highly.”
Reviews.Author: fluteemj
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about booking a hotel in Paris because it was the first time I had ever been, so I used the tripadvisor website and came across this little gem of a hotel. We really weren't disappointed when we stayed at the hotel for a few days in January 2011. Our hotel room was situated on the third floor- it wasn't a particularly big room but it was certainly a comfortable size and had a pretty balcony; the room was was nicely decorated, had a large (and ridiculously comfortable) bed, and was impeccably clean. There was also a welcome folder in the room which gave you lots of information about the hotel etc., as well as things like a map of the metro and train lines which we found very useful! The room also had a safe, a mini bar, tea and coffee making facilities, and a TV which also incorporated free internet. I loved the area where the hotel is situated- it is on a fairly quiet street in Montparnasse. It's a nice area with lots of little cafes and bistros which really come to life in the evenings, as well as a range of boutique styled shops. The metro stations are really close to the hotel as well- the most convenient we found to be the Edgar Quinet station at the top of the road. We never had breakfast at the hotel because it's quite expensive- we preferred to go and try different places nearby. There is a lot of choice nearby if you want to try something different. I think that it is the staff that really makes this hotel stand out as fantastic because they are all so helpful and friendly. Every single member of staff at the hotel really strives to go the extra mile to help you- one even helped us to find a vegetarian restaurant nearby the hotel. Their standard of English is very good and they really make you feel welcome. I honestly couldn't recommend this hotel more and will definitely be using it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: jmohide
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, 2 minutes walk from 2 different metro lines yet on quite a quiet little street so no noise! Staff were really friendly, even got a free glass of champagne on new years eve!! Room was a reasonable size, very clean and modern. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the place at all”
Reviews.Author: eddiesolman
Reviews.Content: I seriously enjoyed my stay at the Lenox and was very impressed with the place. It's not a massive hotel and the street it's on is not particularly beautiful by Parisien standards. However, it's in a vibrant-enough spot with lots of bars, restaurants, cafe's, creperies etc. nearby and a supermarket three doors down. It's within a couple of minutes walk of three Metro stations for easy access to most of the city and the Paris metro is a doddle, so definitely use it!! It's also only about 10 mins walk to both the entrance to the Catacombs and the Montparnasse Tower (stunning views over Paris). So overall, a pretty decent location. The room we had was small-ish, but absolutely comfortable for me and my partner and I wasn't exactly expecting anything massive considering it's Paris! The room was extremely tidy, clean and well maintained with a nice bathroom. The bed was very comfy and we both slept really well during our stay. There was a bit of occasional noise from the road outside, but really nothing significant at all. The staff were extremely nice and friendly throughout and all spoke good English (although we were trying our best to speak to them in French as much as possible!). There was free WIFI which seemed to work OK and all TV (including the pay-per-view movies) was free throughout our stay (I'm not sure if that's normal or something they did especially over the new year period). The honesty bar was great and it was really nice to help ourselves to a drink or two in the evening or just before going out somewhere. Breakfast was not included and a full breakfast was a little pricey at 15 euros, but these prices were pretty common for food throughout Paris to be honest and at least you could eat as much as you wanted and set yourself up for the day. You could easily go to one of the local cafe's and find a cheaper breakfast option anyway if you wanted. I spoke to another couple who were staying in a hotel around the corner and they had been very disappointed with their cramped rooms and been forced to upgrade to a suite. They'd also paid more than at the Lenox, so I felt pretty chuffed with my hotel choice! In summary, the Lenox Montparnasse is good value, very clean, staff are friendly and the location is pretty decent too. I'd definitely recommend it and would stay there again there for sure. A HIDDEN GEM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox is the place to be.”
Reviews.Author: Kingpin05
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Lenox on purely economical grounds. We were offered a book early rate. We we HAPPY! We had two rooms on the third floor that were clean and while not large, with the high ceilings we didn't feel cramped. The beds were excelent and the rooms were quiet. The decor was very well done. The facilities were up to date. We loved the Honor Bar area as we really brought down some of our own supplies and made do. The staff was helpful. The service was timely. I would absolutely stay at Hotel Lenox when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eddragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nites in Dec. This was our 1st trip to Paris. The location was excellent. There are two bakeries to the left and right of the hotel. There is another one just around the corner. As other reviewers wrote, there is a grocery store close by and another larger one just 2 blocks away. A laundromat is to the left of the hotel as you exit. There are numerous creperie restaurants just a block away. Many other restaurants and a Starbucks is also nearby. A deli and produce store is also a few steps away. 3 subway stations are close by. We faced the street and heard the daily garbage truck and activiities at 6am, sigh. We also heard plumbing from the room above us as well as voices from other rooms, which wasn't all that bad. The weather was cold, er, make that freezing 30 - 32F and I placed my bottles of water and cartons of orange juice on the outside balcony and had cold beverages as needed. Free wifi, all movies are also at no charge. the room was small (we chose the least expensive option), but was very clean. The front staff was very friendly, spoke English and provided advice as required. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: andrewbo
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is handily placed on the borders of the 14th and 6th arrondissements. There are a huge range of bars cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Whilst the room was quite small, it was comfortable and spotlessly clean. We liked everything about this place and will return on a future visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, definately come back again”
Reviews.Author: Babuci
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Lenox Montparnasse in 2010.december. It was my first stay in this Hotel, and I definately come back again on my next Parisian stay. The staff was really helpful, the room was clean, although it was small a little bit. We were there for leasure, so for sleeping it was comfortable and enough space for us. For me the most important fact in a hotel is the cleanless. I found it in Hotel Lenox Montparnasse. The location is quite good three Metro station is close to the Hotel. I highly recommend it to everybody, who wants to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Retyred
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days beginning October 8, 2010. The staff couldn't been more helpful and all spoke English which was helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable although small. But this is Paris after all. Small can be beautiful especially when you spend most of your time out in the city. The hotel is in the 14th but just on the border of the 6th so the location is great for the price. The rates were very good and we would definitely stay here if we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Treasure”
Reviews.Author: BradSF
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay the Lenox Montparnasse and it will be the first hotel I look into whenever we return. The hotel boasts a great location- near restaurants, shops and movie theatres, and a short walk to the Vavin Metro stop. The hotel offered free wi-fi and in-room movies. The breakfast was good, though at 15 Euros per person a little pricey. Our room #45 was small as was the postage-stamp size bathroom, particularly the shower. Rooms facing the front as did ours, can be noisy at night- loud people on the street and early in the morning - garbage and recycling truck. However, the double paned windows significantly reduces the noise. All-in-all this is a WONDERFUL hotel which I look forward to returning to many times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenShi
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel. Friendly staff. Not cheap (â‚¬ 15.50) breakfast but good and fresh. Cozy honesty bar. Close to Metro - shops and restaurants. Some noise from street (room 16). We come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a super-convenient location”
Reviews.Author: PhilKParker_CO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent four nights at the Lenox. We had a great time! Thanks to earlier reviews, we were prepared for the small size of the room. But, it was very clean and well-kept, with enough room in the mini-fridge to keep a few small items cold. The location of the hotel was excellent, with a street full of creperies nearby. Also, there were many bakeries and a grocery store within walking distance. Finally, the hotel is located very close to the Montparnasse bus station and several metro lines. The staff was excellent... very friendly and fluent in English. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb hotel in our favourite city - Really made our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Cullybackey1notyin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our autumn break in Paris. We travelled with our two teenagers and our one and a half year old and have had a wonderful time. We travelled to the hotel from Charles de Galles via the RER which worked out quite well the Vavin stop on the metro is just round the corner from the hotel and our only problem was changing from the train to the metro with cases and a child's buggy but we managed okay. On arrival at Lenox we were greeted with a smile and made feel very welcome . The staff spoke perfect English although we did attempt our Franglais and our rooms were spotless and for Paris we found them spacious enough after all we were here to discover Paris not a hotel room. The reception staff were also able to give us some recommendations for restaurants which we found helpful because travelling with children not all restaurants seem to cater for small children and this was probably our only negative point on our Paris break. The ones we found most helpful and child friendly were Hippopotamus and Chez Clements but elsewhere although the staff were very friendly there just aren't very many high chairs in the eateries.Back to the hotel they do provide breakfast but we were on a bit of a budget so we went to Pomme du pans on Montparnasse Boulevard beside the hotel's street and this was very reasonable . Overall the hotel was very central and well serviced by nearby metro stations so the whole of Paris is on your doorstep also plenty of shops with Gallery Lafayette at the top of the street and plenty of restaurants all about also the nearby Jardin du Luxemburg is a very relaxing stroll in picturesque surroundings. Thanks again Hotel Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: happytrails2uall
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel for the money. We booked through Orbitz and paid $140 a night which I think is a real bargain in Paris. We spent very little time in our cozy room so we thought it was a great deal. Pros: The bed was super comfortable, the location was fabulous with wonderful creperies, bars and restaurants. The staff were very helpful, the hotel bar is nice and cozy. Cons: The bathroom and shower were a little cramped and water was slow to drain. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like my home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AloVera_9
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to get one of hotel's Junior Suites, you will never want to stay anywhere else. If you stay in one of their smaller rooms, prepare to sacrifice space for caring and professional service from a friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a chilled out area”
Reviews.Author: Don-Rinser
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with really friendly and helpful staff who all speak English, in a nice chilled area with a supermarket, 2 patisseries, a pharmacie and other shops, cafes and restaurants all really close by. The maids can sometimes make noise early in the morning - around 9am-ish but generally the rooms are quite quiet at the rest of times.
