Our room was a tiny bit cramped but that's Parisian hotels for you but it wasn't a problem for us both - plus you're not gonna be couped up in your room much when you're on holiday anyway. Our room was also very clean. Quite close (on the metro) to alot of the main sights but distanced enough so you're not swamped by the other tourists - I highly recommend this hotel! P.s - They upgraded our room for free and we were also given free pay TV (movies etc) and when we checked out they gave us a free shower radio, 2 t-shirts and a bag - there's service for you =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, top quality service”
Reviews.Author: Da_Globalist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse over a weekend for my wife's Birthday. Lovely room on the top floor, beautifully designed, clean. Very helpful and courteous staff as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good proximity to Metros and creperies”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl93
Reviews.Content: I'm torn on this review - I'd go 3 1/2 stars here if I could. We had a small room on the 5th floor - room for the bed and not a lot more. The bathroom was decent sized, though with the odd French high-sided bathtub that I stubbed my toe on twice. ;) We didn't buy breakfast here - it was very expensive. The hotel does have an elevator, which is tiny but we were able to (barely) get ourselves and our luggage in it at the same time. Free wifi. Some of the downsides: - they require that you leave the room key with the front desk when you leave the hotel every time. And of course, when you return, you just tell them the room number and they hand you the key. This made us nervous - they never once confirmed our name or anything else when giving us a room key. I would've been less worried if they had at least asked our last name... - housekeeping was late each day. We came back in the late afternoon to find our room's window open all the way (?!) and about 10 minutes later, the housekeeper came in to make up our room. It had been raining the day before and the unattended open window made us uneasy. Overall, an average hotel - good proximity to the Metro and also a ton of creperies within a five minute walk!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful - uncomplicated.”
Reviews.Author: MargaretWillow
Reviews.Content: liked the intimacy of the rooms, the location - convenient to many attractive places, and no nattering snow birds or Floridians trying too hard. The staff was very helpful with a silly light bulb burnout, and sent up wine later. Really sweet of them. Immaculate, clean, charming place. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, prefect stuff!”
Reviews.Author: kphgnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the maybe the best hotel we ever stayed in, but without any hesitation I can say that it was the best hotel stuff we ever saw. Our room was clean, not luxury, but in the same time cozy and warm. The only problem maybe sometimes can be the size, but thats Paris. I ve seen some of the reviews saying that everything is very small- yes it is!!! But in Paris everything is small. I guess if you want to have something big, you should go in Las Vegas. We felt great here and everybody were so friendly to us! Location was great, so we were very close to the most of things to see in Paris. When we talk about food, we can say that the breakfast was great, way bigger then we expected it to be. For sure, when we get back to Paris, we will stay here again. Thank you all for making our stay in Paris unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: christine8270
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay at this hotel in Oct and it was very good. The staff at the front desk speak good English and are really great and were able to help us with everything we needed. The rooms were quite small and the shower is a bit difficult to navigate without banging into something. The internet was included in the room and it was excellent, and even included use through the T.V. with a keyboard. Given that having internet alone is a luxury in Europe I was very happy with this extra! Good location - right next to tons of cafes, shopping and a metro station. Out of the central area so transit will be required when going to various attractions, but it is only a short ride to everything. There is also a grocery store just a few doors down from the hotel that will offer lots of options for snacks and such. Beware of the elderly lady roaming the store heckling everyone! Breakfast seemed expensive at 15 euros per person, with so many cafes in the area there is for sure a better deal outside of the hotel. Good stay at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rc476
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice location, easy to find and great to explore Paris. Stayed for 4 nights and would happily stay here again!! Some excellent bars and places to eat just round the corner, easy for the metro and nice rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Harryb23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. This hotel has absolutely everything going for it. Located in the heart of Montparnasse it is only a couple of minutes walk from Vavin Metro Station (line 4) which has a connections to the RER B line to the airport just two stops away. The hotel is located down a quiet side road and is surrounted by restaurants, bars, supermarket, patisserie, wine shop and cinema. The area was peaceful at night with nothing to disturb a nights sleep. Check in was quick and efficient with English spoken if necessary. Rooms were a decent size for a major city and were clean and well appointed. The bed was large and very comfortable. Our room was serviced daily and gave no reason to complain. Indeed everything was done quietly and discreetly. I dont think I saw any staff apart from on the desk during our stay. The hotel operates an honesty bar in the main lounge which also serves as the breakfast area. I thought breakfast expensive considering the numerous options available within a short walk of the hotel. However this is a minor point considering everything else that this hotel has going for it. We will certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Penev
Reviews.Content: 10 out of 10 points for the location of this excellent hotel.Plenty of little shops, supermarkets, patisseries, even a laundry in walking distance.Furthermore a multitude of restaurants, bars and cafÃ©s iall price categories within several metres of the hotel. Tour Montparnasse in 5 minutes on foot, Jardin du Luxembourg in 10 minutes on foot, Concorde to be reached in 15 minutes by metro. The district itself is great and still bearing a typical non-touristci parisian atmosphere. The hotel itself was perfectly clean, cozy and comfortable altthough the rooms were a bit on the small side.Perfectly courteous and helpful staff, speaking excellent English. Singular drawback was the bad quality of the WLAN Internet, but it didn't matter much for us. I can't comment on the breakfast, because we ate always in different patisseries and cafes (it was cheaper this way). We would definitely come again here the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox MOntparnasse is in a good location, very safe,clean and staff friendly”
Reviews.Author: lucidickens
Reviews.Content: Good location for visiting Paris, close to metros etc. HOtel nice, staff very nice and helpful but room was so small, hard to put all our luggage in it(we had been traveling two weeks) we stayed in front of the hotel with little balcony with street view, very nice. This is not a luxury stay but then in Paris we were hardly in our room. You can feel safe here and breakfasts were not free but were very good. Nice coffee, tea wine hour in afternoon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: goonerjon2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wife's 30th birthday and I have to say that the service was excellent, hotel very clean and tidy, excellent location being close to 2 Metro stations, a supermarket and numerous bars and restaurants. Overall very pleased and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June 09 and loved our time in Paris. Our room 42, was good. Bathroom was a good size with a nice hot shower. There was some noise from doors slamming and street noise early in the morning. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but it looked like there was a good choice. Had a drink at the bar, drinks expensive, but you must expect this from any hotels you stay at. Staff are friendly and had no probelms with giving you advice where to eat. the hotel is surrounded by restaurants and cafes, so you won't go hungry. If we ever go back to Paris, we would stay in Montparnasse again, but woyld choose another hotel, only due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nola001
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Friendly and courteous staff, clean rooms, good neighborhood. would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “an outstanding hotel with friendly staff and excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl8050
Reviews.Content: Situated within walking distance of the Luxembourg Gardens and the Seine, this is an outstanding hotel. The staff were very welcoming and our room was excellent, being situated at the rear of the building and looking onto a courtyard with a fountain.The breakfast was very good value with lots of choice. There are plenty of restaurants and wine bars in this street alone and it is a short walk ( one block ) to the metro and to an extensive choice of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as nice as I had expected”
Reviews.Author: natmer13
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Paris less than a week ago. Hotel Lenox Montparnasse was our first hotel and I was super excited about it after reading the reviews on TA, as well as looking at pictures of the hotel. When we arrived, the staff were very helpful and gave us our room right away. Our room was beautiful and full of character, small but very clean. We had room 34 facing the street w/ a beautiful window w/ Romeo & Juliet balcony. The one BIG negative, in my opinion, was that the bathroom was TINY. If you weigh more than 150lbs, I don't think that you will fit in the shower. That wouldn't have mattered that much, but then I noticed disgusting mold all over the shower. I was completely grossed out as we paid $200/night to stay here and I would expect a little more for that kind of money. However, this was my first trip to Paris, so maybe I had unrealistic expectations. The shower curtain is stingy and there is no way to stop the floor from getting wet. Maybe we just got the short end of the stick. We didn't bother complaining b/c we were worried that we would get something worse &, overall, how much time do you spend in the shower on vacation anyway? If you are a light sleeper, be aware that the walls are pretty thin so hopefully you won't get a noisy neighbor. Also, the staff were very friendly but I asked about where to exchange currency and the lady at the front desk had no idea. I thought that that would be a fairly common question that tourists might ask, but I guess not. However, the location is great w/ 2 train stations very close by, Vavin to the right and Edgar Quinet to the Left. There were tons of places to eat right next to the hotel. Breakfast was $12euro per person @ the hotel, but we never had it as there are 2 bakeries on the same block where you can buy a croissant for $1Eu. In general, the hotel was a fairly good deal but I'm not sure if I would stay here again as I stayed somewhere nicer (Grand Hotel Francais) towards the end of my trip for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but the staff made it UNFORGETABLE”
Reviews.Author: SABurgess
Reviews.Content: Although travelling on a slight budget we decided to go the extra 50Euro a night for the Lenox over other 2/3 star hotels. My partner's mother had recommended it from a previous trip and I'm so glad that she did. We came to Paris for Nuit Blanche - an all night cultural/art festival in Paris and decided not to book a hotel that night. Although the festival was fantastic, by 6am we were freezing and tired and decided to go to the Lenox (where we'd stored our bags the previous day) to see if we could get a room! When we arrived there wasn't any rooms left however the guy at reception couldn't be more helpful and said we could have a coffee and rest in breakfast room and he'd try to get us into our room early. After a couple hours sleep in the breakfast room we were ready to go again and even though we couldn't get into the room early it didn't matter because by 9am we were warm and rested so spent the morning walking around the markets until we checked in at 1pm (still an hour early). The room (room 56) was very spacious with private balcony, large bathroom (with bath) and huge double bed. The receptionist explained that all movies on the tv were free - even though we didn't come to Paris to watch movies, when sightseeing from 9am-5pm it was nice to sleep or watch a movie for a couple hours before going out in the evenings. We had breakfast included in our room so took full advantage of the eggs,sausages, bacon, bread, croissants, cereals and fruit salad which filled us up until well into the afternoon. Also coffee is served every afternoon in the breakfast room which is nice after a full day of walking. Rue Delambre has a supermarket, cheese shop, bakery, butchers and several restaurants. At either end is Vavin metro and Edgar Quinet metro as well as Gare Montparnasse a couple minutes walk. Montparnasse is a busy area with plenty of restaurants (a couple top fish restaurants in Paris) and lots of bars. The Lenox is a fantastic hotel and the location, service and value for money make it unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best 3 star hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Boleon
Reviews.Content: I loved celebrating my birthday in Paris (9/29-10/03/2010) with my daugther. The Lenox Montparnasse (room 62) was an excellent choice of the many hotels to choose from. The room was medium size and clean with a view to the street. The bathroom was the best; 2 doubled sinks, marble vanity tops and marble foor, plenty of hot water with good water pressure, heated towels, bathrobes and slippers, double bed, sitting area with sofa and chairs and many more amenities. The Staff spoke english and was helpful and friendly. Discover Walks offer a free guided tour in English. Thomas was an excellent guide. Transportation to/from airport, hotel used Airport Van/Pari Shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: njtraveller48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and was very happy with everything. Our room was kept spotless, the bathroom was quite large. The breakfast buffet was very good; the honor bar is also nice. The location is great being between 2 metro lines, both easy walks from the hotel. Also easy to get here from CDG; we took the Air France bus and walked from the Montparnasse train station. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSandra55
Reviews.Content: This year's annual girls' trip went international-Paris, France. My best friend and I stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for 5 nights. Both of us have traveled internationally several times. This was a return trip to Paris for both of us. We could not have been more satisfied with this hotel. The room size is normal for Paris. The bathroom was plenty big enough. It is clean. The staff was very helpful. The "honesty bar" shows such respect for the guest. The wine I drank there was very enjoyable. I was thrilled that there was an electric tea kettle and instant coffee in the room. That held me over until I could get coffee and creme at one of the local cafes. And there are many delightful cafes right by the hotel. Ti-Jos creperie has excellent crepes. It is just down the street from the hotel. There was some street noise but that is to be expected. There were no other negatives for us. Enjoy your stay. I know we did!

Reviews.Title: “Best 'city' hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RobTrina
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location. Two metro stops within a 30 second walk - metro costs 6euro for a day pass and will get you anywhere in paris in 15-20 mins (all major attractions within 5 mins). Loads of bars and restaurants within 2 min walk. Hotel room was spotless, free internet through the tv in the room(all movies free), bathroom was spacious, clean and modern. Reception were very pleasant and exteremly helpful - nothing is too much trouble. How this hotel is only 3* is beyond me, not sure what they have to do to get a fourth star??? For those travelling from England who have never been to Paris, be prepared, as it is one of the most expensive cities in the world, specifically for drinks. You won't get any change from Â£20 for a beer and a glass of wine. Having said that it's a wonderful city and we thought the trip was worth every penny. The hotel is utterly faultless!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in the good location”
Reviews.Author: KarenM65
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly, even prior to me getting to Paris when i requested directions via email...which were extremely easy to follow. A lift available to the upper floors made lugging heavy bags a breeze...staff accommodated all requests...my room was small however more than adequate. Located near two metro stops, the luxembourg gardens a short walk away, a great market at the end of the street on a saturday, supermarket approx 500 - 700m away to purchase any essentials. Internet available in the lobby (watch the keyboard, some letters in different places!!) Would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “TA's Reviewers Got this One Spot On”
Reviews.Author: EtoileBrilliant
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in charming Montparnesse district (near the University). Good points: - price about â‚¬140 per night (included free wifi and "all you can eat" from the movie channel) - honesty bar was cheap, well stocked and good atmosphere. - bathroom was big by french standards with bath and shower. - great staff (particularly Sebastien). - supermarket two doors down Not so good points: - bedroom was a little small but very nicely decorated. - some might call it a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, good amenities but room and bathroom very small!”
Reviews.Author: DashTravels
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel - although I think the price is a bit high. The location is absolutely great, and so is the service. Folks at the front desk are very sweet and helpful. From 2pm they have free tea, coffee and biscuits. They have a bar too which is very convenient - you can help yourself and just leave a note with the front desk. It is very nice and private. Perfect for when you come back in the night, but don't want the night to end. The only issue I had was the size of the room and bathroom. I know in Europe the room size is smaller than the US, but this was really small - especially the bathroom. So in all I would recommend the hotel, but be prepared mentally for a really tiny bathroom. Everything else is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantSherpa
Reviews.Content: I've read the other reviews and concur--This was a lovely place to stay, with wonderful, helpful staff. The hotel was on a quiet side street, but had a metro station at each end of the street! It was in a great part of Paris, really close to La Rotonde--where Jean Paul Sartre and his significant other, Simone, used to hang out (actually they hung out in a few restaurants in the area--all good); and close to Le Parc au Cerf where we had an amazing meal. We stayed in a suite on the 6th floor because we had our 15 year old daughter with us. It was wonderful--a view of the rooftops of Paris, windows we could open for a nice breeze, and a lovely, roomy bathroom. I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends. It's also walking distance from Montparnasse Cemetary where you can visit Jean Paul Sartre and Simone, among other's.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: rafried
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for three nights prior to joining a tour for a River Cruise to th south of France. I had booked a total of six rooms based on other review of this hotel. Everyone in the group loved this hotel. The rooms, although not large, were very comfortable and adequate. The bathrooms were quite large Location is great. Three metro stations are very close by and there are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. They offer breakfast for about 15 euro each and it was quite good. Some of the couples in our group chose to buy food and eat in their room. There was a supermarket two doors from the hotel. During the day, the breakfast area is available for the use of the guests and it was great place to meet at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - we will come back again”
Reviews.Author: MfromFinland
Reviews.Content: Just perfect hotel! The location was great, small street so not too much noise, still near 3 different underground stations. We walked to Eiffel tower and in the evenings from Latin Quarter to the hotel, so the location was excellent. Many restaurants near the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived in the morning and they suggested that we leave our baggage to the hotel. They also gave us tips where to go and what to see. The "home bar" / "help yourself bar" was nice and hotel breakfast was just perfect. Our room was beautiful and clean. We are definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise - delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwiseAubreyTx
Reviews.Content: The reviews didn't lie on this one. I was extremely surprised with the hotel. The check-in with Sebastin was wonderful. He gave you all the information that you needed, helped answer all questions and quickly and efficiently checked us in and arranged for a an early morning shuttle to the airport upon our departure. Lenox Monparnasse was a well decorated hotel with complementary afternoon tea and movies. The rooms were super clean and very well decorated - the 4 star rating on this one definately equates to a 4 star in the USA. The location was very good with access to 2 train stations within one block of the hotel. Also the air conditioning works wonderful!!!! - We arrived in Paris and the weather was pleasant - but were a little concerned upon arrival at the hotel as the room on the 5th floor was a little stuffy. I turned on the airconditioner and in about 30 minutes the room was very pleasant. They have a very nice business area where you can get on the internet, again complimentary. I got on and performed airline check ins as well as printing out our boarding passes - again all complementary. The only complaints - albeit minimal is that the TV and cable had issues both nights we were there - the 1st night the movie was almost unviewable - the second the service kept going out and then locking up the TV - Sebastin had to reset it and I had to reset twice after that. Also one strange requirement that I had never encountered before is that you were required to leave your key at the front desk upon leaving. I was told that it was so the chamber service would know if they could clean your room - I was uncomfortable with this as all your possessions are in the room and your only real proof that you are a guest is the possession of the room key - but alas nothing to worry about and it turned out to be a delightful hotel stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eneumeyer
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for two weeks for our honeymoon in August. We picked this hotel because of the high recommendations on this site. We weren't let down at all! Cleanliness - Pretty standard, housekeeping did a very good job, the place was always immaculate. Location - Probably one of the best points. It is right near Montparnasse tower, numerous restaurants, and the Vavin metro station. The Montparnasse train station is also a 10-15min walk away which is where the Air France coach bus stops from CDG Airport, and Orly. The bus was more expensive to take than the RER line from the airport, but much more relaxing than the busy train with a connection. Rooms - I would give this place five stars if they were just a bit bigger. I understand that hotels in Paris and Europe are smaller than North America, and I've traveled all over Europe. When we first came to Paris for our first week, the room was perfect. It was a queen bed, with a fairly large bathroom. No complaints at all. We then went to the Czech Republic for a few days to visit family. When we returned, we had a much smaller room with a double bed. I must have accidentally booked the smaller room on expedia. The room was tiny which was ok, but the bathroom was much too small. In the shower if I really had to make sure that I didn't swing around and hit the shower handle to burn or freeze myself! I'm also a very slim guy, so I can't imagine how it would be for bigger people. This is no fault to the hotel at all, it's as advertised, but if I were you, I would spend a bit more Euros and book the larger room with the queen bed. It's way better! Service - The service was so good! The staff was always smiling and friendly. Our flight from Vancouver came in early in the morning, and we arrived at the hotel at around 10am, looking like zombies! We really wanted a quick nap before we headed out to see the sights. I wasn't sure if this would work since normally you have to check in to hotels in the afternoon. The front desk clerk, Sebastian, saw that we were tired and had the room made up right away, within the hour. We were so thankful! The service here was so much better than the "stereotypical" French service we had at the CDG airport hotel later in our trip. Value - Everything seemed fair, the honesty bar in the room was expensive, but that's to be expected at a hotel. I'm not sure why so many people rave about the bar at the hotel, it's nice but I find it expensive. Go out to the numerous bars and cafes that are right down the street for better prices and ambiance! Overall though, I felt I got my money's worth with this hotel. Sleep Quality - Good, much better in the queen bed than the double bed, make sure to book it if you are going with a spouse / partner! Overall this hotel was great. You can tell it's quality as soon as you walk in. If I came back to Paris, I'd like to try a different hotel only because I'd like to try to stay in a different district since there are so many great places in Paris. Other than that, I would have no problem booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay; glad we found it!”
Reviews.Author: alexb78
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay in this hotel - staff were wonderful. Service was flawless. I'd recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in a great spot in Paris. Looking forward to staying at this hotel again on subsequent trips to Paris also. Nearest Metro Station : Vavin (Line 4)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LolaK
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 3 other couples twice this summer at the beginning and end of a France trip. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to the Montparnasse Train Station and ideally positioned between two Metro lines. The rooms are small but well appointed and the bathrooms are huge. The honor bar in the downstairs lobby is a wonderful, comfortable meeting place. The staff speak excellent English and helped us many times with restaurant suggestions, routing information and reservation confirmations. The hotel has great air conditioning and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. You don't need to be right in the heart of Paris to see the heart of Paris. The metro brings it all to you!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, cosy boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LAZMilperra
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lenox for 7 nights was vey good overall. The room for us was too small, we had to climb over the bed to get around if we were using the small desk at the time however the bathroom was fine, more than adequate and a great shower. The double bed was very comfortable that provided a great night's sleep and the air con worked fine if it was needed, nice and quiet. You will love the elevator, it's the best. The free internet access was nothing short of terrible, almost non existent. Breakfast is set up in a cosy room and bar with plenty of variety to satisfy everyone, we ate there every morning and enjoyed it, nice quiet atmosphere. The staff were excellent, very helpful and welcoming, couldn't fault them if we tried. The location of the Lenox is perfect with Metro stations at each end of the street, you can go anywhere in Paris from there. The availability of good pubs, cafes and restaurants are endless. Everyone's taste and expectations are different, but I know we'll go back to the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: bikerbird772
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for 5 nights and have no complaints - would highly recommend. After reading reviews for various hotels everyone seemed to think hotel rooms were small in Paris - not at the Lenox, my room was plenty big and had all i needed. Montparnasse is a great area to be based - there are 3 metro stops within 5 min walk of the hotel and there are lots of lovely cafes and restaurants. In my opinion, turn left out of the hotel and head for La Vache au Comptoir on rue d'Odessa - gorgeous steak and chips, very reasonably priced too. There are so many places to eat in this area thou you are spoilt for choice. If you need anything or have any queries, the reception staff are more than willing to help. I would definitely stay at the Lenox again :)

Reviews.Title: “convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: chocbisc
Reviews.Content: Location was brilliant as the two metro stations were so near. Good suggestions from helpful staff at reception. Room was not large but was clean and pretty. Powerful shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: amatoje
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect - can't rave enough about this hotel, especially considering the value for the price you pay. It's a lovely (modern decor with french-touch) boutique hotel - and perfect for seeing the sights of Paris. It was very convenient for what we wanted to accomplish in 4 days (near subways), and the staff was helpful, friendly, but not too intrusive. An extra bonus? The room even had a very small little balcony. Wireless was also very simple/inexpensive if you bring a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Doll01
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, Metro stations both ends of the street. We arrived on Eurostar and couldn't believe how quickly and easily we reached the hotel.This was our first trip to Paris and the staff at this hotel made us feel really welcome.The room was very clean and comfortable,the bathroom was a good size with a good powerful shower.The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly The area has a lively atmosphere with lots of great places to eat. We will definitely be coming back. This hotel is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: moneypenny78
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing. Metro stations at the end of the street in both directions, and the Montparnasse-Bienvenue station in close proximity. There is a grocery store, a bakery, and tons of restaurants just a few steps away. The room was small, and the shower was teeny. The coffee/tea service in the room was a bonus. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We highly recommend the Pizza Delambre take-out place down the street! The free wifi was also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great location, amazing hotel..”
Reviews.Author: bgmk_10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Paris by Eurostar with my girlfriend for a wedding. This place is 20 min door-to-door from the station. Perfect location in the middle of Paris. The staff were fantastic. Very polite and helpful. We had a great time. This is probably one of the best hotels we have stayed in. I never write reviews of holidays or hotels.. but felt that this place really deserved it The honesty bar is very cool as well!

Reviews.Title: “What a find- a lovely hotel in a great location with helpful staff and all at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: sarahstevemiller
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on Expedia where it received excellent reviews and we can only echo them. It is a lovely hotel tucked away in a back street but in a busy area with lots of restaurants, shops, bars and life (but not noisy). It is close to Gare Montparnesse so easy access from the airport. There are two Metro stations within a street of the hotel and the closest is on the line to the Eiffel Tower and the Trocedro. The hotel is really clean and is very well decorated. The rooms were well kept and there was tea/coffee making facilities which was a bonus. The staff were really polite and helpful. The breakfast was extra but was very good value (once we realised how expensive it was to have breakfast in a cafe!). The hotel had a honesty bar which had a great choice of drinks. We did not use it as we went out rather than stayed in at the hotel but it was nice to have the choice. An excellent hotel and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jasonholicky
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Everything was great. The staff were very friendly. Close to restaurants, grocery, two metro stops, shopping. Room was clean. Had no noise issues. Free Wireless Internet worked perfect. We stayed about a week, so received a discount for multiple nights. The only thing bad was the small shower. The shower was about 3" x 3". I didn't have that much of a problem with it, but just be warned, it is small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great service...don't hesitate book it, if stopping in Paris”
Reviews.Author: niblets
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, based in a fantastic thriving vibrant area of Paris. During our stay we traveled around Paris & I would suggest that Montparnasse is one of the better areas. All the other reviewers have identified so many positives about this place which I would whole heartedly support, it is difficult to identify any faults with it. The reception service was great, Julia was our favourite on reception always happy and very courteous, her English was very good, but also she was very understanding, but encouraging when I was making a poor attempt at French! We were in room 59, the bathroom was large and had a lovely big window to the courtyard. The rooms are not huge, but we were there for 7 nights and did not at any point feel claustrophobic in any way. Any issues were dealt with immediately, the shower head was not working well the first morning, I advised Julia on reception and it was sorted by the lunch time. We forgot a converter plug and ask at reception where we could get one from and Julia once again came up with the goods by providing one for a returnable deposit of 10 euros. There were about 8 or 9 english very recent blockbuster films that were free on the televisions and could be paused at any time, also internet was available on the TV and we were also able to log on to the wireless network with my husbands IPad after receiving a code from the reception. There are tea and coffee making facilities and a safe in the room. The breakfast was great and although appear very expensive, are on a par to much of Paris. There is also free tea and coffee in the afternoon in the bar, with biscuits. Paris of course is very expensive, be aware that you could be looking at 4 or 5 euros for half a pint of lager, although some of the bars do happy hours, so worth looking out for. We were prepared for the expense and therefore it was not actually too much of a shock. Some the highlights and must do's of the area are * Montparnasse tour- view of whole of paris from roof top of 56 floor building. * Catacombs, by Montparnasse cemetery. Tunnels with 6 million Parisian bones in from 18th Century! Jardin du Luxembourg- 10 min walk max from hotel, lovely gardens, palace, band stand with live bands in the band stand, lots of chairs around to sit down on, lots of birds, lots of opportunity for people watching! We spent nearly every afternoon down there, eating a baguette and reading a book! Metro links excellent, Vavin and Edgar Quinet at either ends of Rue Delambre the street the hotel is on. FYI We bought a five day pass for the metro, these can be found on the net etc, but if you are buying a ticket to travel on the metro on daily basis, you only need to buy one ticket which costs about 1Euro 70cents for the whole of the journey even if you swap metro lines, the ticket is used in effect to get into the station from the outside, if that makes sense and once you leave the metro, it is obsolete. You can also purchase a book of 10 on these tickets. One downside of Paris, although I think it is common of many capital cities, there were lots of beggars....it was quite sad, but weirdly, you kind of get use to it after a while! Final thing, we went from 25th July to 1st August, a few shops and restaurants were closed when we arrived due to holidays and were not reopening until Sept, there were not that many so it did not affect us too much, but the day we left a lot more closed and I think that probably would have had an impact, so I would suggest if possible you avoid the month of August. All in all a fabulous hotel, which we will return to in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabiex
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in an interesting area of Paris. The staff, rooms and facilities are superb. Easy to get to from Orly airport by Air France bus. Good local cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a wonderful area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: smillsfam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights. The rooms are cosy but very clean. Our room overlooked the interior courtyard and was very quiet. The staff were friendly and very helpful---definitely a major plus for the hotel. The air conditioning worked great. Other reviewers had commented how expensive the breakfasts were but we found it to be very good value with an excellent selection of food to choose from. A great way to start the day. The location is central to the Metro and many many cafes and bistros. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy, warm hotel with the great staff!”
Reviews.Author: MashaFurman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the middle of July. I picked it based on Tripadvisor reviews and I din't regret. I wanted a small Parisian hotel with nice English speaking staff, and that is exactly what I got. My Clubroom was perfect, small but enough for me as I stayed alone. The bathroom was a good size, not fancy, but nice and clean with lots of clean towels every day. Free Internet was great; I had trouble connecting to WiFi, but got helped and didn't have any problem then. Free movies in English, kettle in the room and free coffee and tea bags, small safe in the closet were great too. I used soft drinks bar and it was a very good deal, I had 3 cans of soda, 2 bottles of water, and orange juice just for 6 euros a day! Special thanks to Julia for helping me from the first hour of my arrival at the airport with calls to hotel shuttle and with all my questions every day! My advise: don't go on ParisVision tours. They will rip you off and you won't get any service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, I'll be back next time I'm in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: erg1929
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at the Lenox in late May, and it was a very, very pleasant experience. I was traveling with my teenage son, and we spent 8 nights. The folks at the front desk were always helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. I'd visited Paris several years ago, and also had been to London and Athens, so had an idea what to expect when it comes to European hotels -- smaller rooms, limited amenities. But the Lenox was top notch. The room was neat, clean, and met our needs. When in Paris, you're not going to spend hours hanging around the hotel. But when we were there, we were comfortable and taken care of. The TV was the computer monitor, and that worked just fine. You also could connect to the internet thru the computer, but that was a bit sketchy at times. It's always a great perk now to have free wireless in the room. We were given a code when we checked in, and it ran out after 7 days. There was no problem in getting a new code for the extra day and a half. They also had a public computer in the lobby that was helpful. The location was perfect -- right between a pair of Metro stops (Edgar Quinet and Vavin) within steps. Montparnasse is a bustling neighborhood, and we never lacked finding anything. There was a grocery store steps down the block, and a couple of pastry shops to choose from. We mostly ate in the neighborhood -- Italian, Chinese, and a couple of cafes. No complaints on any front. And altho the area was bustling, it was quiet at night despite having a theater right across the street. We made trips to the French Open, Versailles, and also to the beaches of Normandy. Again, having the two Metro lines so close made trips to those various different direction very convenient. I'm trying to think of some complaints ... but would be hard-pressed. Again, you don't spend much time in the room, but at night we clicked on the TV, and I have to say that the channel selections for Americans is VERY limited. CNN Intl., and BBC was about it. Would be nice to have some sort of ESPN or something off the satellite that shows any kind of American programming. As for food ... perhaps if they offered some sort of Continental breakfast? Few hotels do, it would seem. They did offer something for several Euros, but we hit the pastry shops instead. Also, there was an honor bar fridge, so we cleared out some of the stuff in there and filled it with our purchases from the grocery store down the block -- juice, water, snacks. If you're an American and want the taste of America, there was a Starbucks and a McDonald's in the neighborhood. I booked the trip back in Jan., and selected the hotel mainly through a general location and the TripAdvisor reviews -- which were almost all positive. And I can't disagree. I'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value and a Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: Dutch096
Reviews.Content: This small hotel exceeded our expectations. The staf was incredibly friendly and helpful, the location, with two metro stops nearby, is excellent, and the room was very comfortable. At the end of the day, we enjoyed the pleasant lobby and honor bar and breakfast in the same location each morning.

Reviews.Title: “great room, free coffee to boot!”
Reviews.Author: RaleighTraveller1234
Reviews.Content: Not much more can be said about this hotel. Very comfortable, well decorated, reasonably spacious rooms, with expresso coffee maker. Upgrade to junior site well worth it. Staff made every effort to be helpful, including early check in. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel with fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: ricktrebing
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse while on vacation in France and had a truly great experience. Although the room was a bit small, it had everything we needed - the bed was very comfortable, the airconditioning was a godsend (with the temperatures around 30 C each day) and the bath was quite large. The rooms and the entire hotel were well organized and very clean. What really makes this hotel however, is the outstanding service and especially the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful - from the front desk personnel greeting us each time we entered/exited the hotel to the smiling waitress serving us a 'cafe complet' in the late morning (technically after the breakfast hours had ended) to the friendly housekeeping staff in the halls wishing us good morning. We were very impressed that they cared so much about their guests. The 'honesty (honor) bar' was a really nice touch - you can mix your own drinks and just write down what you had and drop off at the front desk, to be biled to your room. Also the wireless internet worked great and was free. It ended up being a great match for our trip and our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A great Parisian boutique hotel in a great area!”
Reviews.Author: lovedparis2010
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Lenox Montparnasse Hotel. We had a junior suite which offered a nice room with a sitting area, desk, minibar and a fireplace. We also had a balcony to enjoy the beautiful evenings we had while we were there. The room was not large, but the space was well utilized and made the room seem bigger than it was. The bathrooms were nice and everything was very clean and smelled fresh. The linens and bed were comfortable and nice as well. The best feature is the wonderful staff at the hotel. Julia and Sebastian are fluent in English and always willing to help book a reservation or answer a question. I think it is a great value for a hotel in the city and for the money I don't think we could have found a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and great location!”
Reviews.Author: ontariofun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a very nice stay. It was very close to two subway lines. The staff were very polite and helpful. Our room was very nice and cozy. We had a nice view of the courtyard below. There was no breakfast but there's a grocery store, bakery, wine and cheese store just a few buildings down. There's also a number of restaurants around the area too. We took the train from the airport and arrived in about 30 min. with no problems at all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: sewhat83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in July, 2010. We were in Room 11, a slightly upgraded room. It had a double bed, two closets, a small desk, a flat screen TV on a stand which held a refrigerated mini bar. It also had a very adequate bathroom with a nice tub and a rolling cart with shelves on which to put all your toiletries. It looked exactly like the picture on their website so no surprises. The room had a view of a rooftop and a courtyard which was behind the hotel. I found it to be quiet but I always sleep with earplugs and my husband could sleep through anything! The air conditioning worked great which was a real plus since it was very hot while we were there. What was very nice about the hotel was the lounge downstairs. Since the rooms are pretty small it was nice to be able to go there and relax with a book or just a cup of coffee or glass of wine with nice jazz music in the background. They have an honesty bar now, no bartender, and you can just make your own drink and let them know what you drank. Easy and no waiting! Tea and coffee are free. As far as the breakfasts go - we thought they were a bit expensive,(15.5 euros for the full breakfast) but soon learned the real advantage was a very big breakfast (eggs, cheeses, meats, yogurt, fresh juices, several bread choices etc.) was not over priced and also since it was all ready to go you could really save some time if you wanted to get to the Louvre when it opened! If you go to the cafes for breakfast it can sometimes take over an hour to get coffee and a croissant and cost almost as much in the end. We loved the cafes, but saved them for the afternoon when our feet were tired and we really needed a rest. A few other niceties were the free internet, the friendly, helpful staff, and the great location if you're looking for a fun vibrant area close to LOTS of cafes and little restaurants. Be aware though that those little restaurants often don't even open until 8 pm. It was also located close to all the modes of transportation, metro, train, and buses. One last item - it was my husband's birthday while we were there and our friends called the hotel and arranged for them to buy us a very nice bottle of wine for our room and when we returned from sight seeing for the day it was waiting in our room with two wine glasses on a nice silver tray with a corkscrew and nice note. That was a very nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cheri219
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montparnasse on the recommendation of a relative. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is "authentic" Parisian. The lounge and courtyard is great for winding up a busy day in the city.,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our way south. Very nice hotel in a good location, lots of bars and restaurants nearby and easy walk to gardens and river. Staff very helpful and the room was very tasteful and a good size (we were upgraded), AC very handy in the hot weather, I've stayed in plenty hotels in Paris without AC. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisienne hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PhillyG69
Reviews.Content: Small but extremely friendly hotel - the staff speak excellent English and are so helpful. I would really recommend the suite at Room 62 - lovely rooftop view and very spacious room - some of the double rooms are pretty small and they don't have much room around the sides of the bed. The room was very clean, the bed a little on the 'firm' side, the bathroom spacious and well laid out and the sitting area in the bedroom was very charming. Rue Delambre can be quite noisy and busy at night but there is a good air conditioning system for the room if you find sleeping with the windows open too noisy. The little bar on the ground floor is a nice place to meet people for a drink - it's very low key and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CanberraHols2010
Reviews.Content: Lenox is in a great location in the heart of Montparnasse - convenient Metro stattions at either end of the street and plenty of restaurants and supermarkets close by. Staff were very helpful and friendly and rooms (although a bit on the small side) were comfortable and well appointed. Breakfasts were very good and a great way to start the day. Would definitely stay there again and would happily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right - this is a wonderful, comfortable hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: traveller154945
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travelled to Paris in June to stay for four nights prior to a cycling tour of the Dordogne and two nights after cycling. After checking out reviews of hotels in Paris on various travel web sites, this one kept coming up with fantastic reviews. The reviews were right - the hotel is located in a great location that has everything you need, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms are really clean, bedding is gorgeous and the beds really comfortable. My favourite part is the buffet breakfast - I looked forward to it every morning! I look forward to my next trip to Paris and I will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hondrigata
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse upon first arriving in Paris for the first night and also at the end of the trip. Originally, we were supposed to rent an apartment for the week in Paris for our second week, but the volcano postponed our trip in April. We were only able to rent the apartment for 4 days and therefore finished up the last week at the Lenox Montparnasse. The staff is very helpful. The rooms and bed were very comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. When we returned for the 3 days were were upgraded at no cost to a club room. Montparnasse is a good area to be in, with the train station right there. Actually, the apartment was not what we were expecting, so everytime we would come back to our room at Lenox, we would say to each other. " This is a nice hotel'! Room was clean, nice TV, an honesty bar that we put a few things in and a great hot water pot that we used for our coffee and breakfast. They do offer a breakfast at 15 eu, but we chose to do our own thing. There is a nice grocery next to the hotel and a bakery. We would definitely come back, but may choose any different location just sample another area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ArdaD
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and helpful staff and great location, very comfortable room with street view. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than we expected of an affordable Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: drlindahill
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lenox based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were in Paris for two of the hottest days in memory. Thank you for the great air conditioning system -- we were expecting much less and got much more than we expected. A good size room (they call it a club) and a huge bathroom. Exceedingly clean and well-decorated. Lovely staff who were always helpful, even with small things. Terrific neighborhood, a ten minute walk from the Luxembourg gardens, twenty minutes to Notre Dame and la Sorbonne. We recommend La Coupole, around the corner, for breakfast. Our waiter remembered our orders from the previous morning -- unlike most uninterested waiters we encountered. L'Aubergine Venise was outstanding for dinner, and just across the street, wonderful after long days of sightseeing. We picked up the Red Bus at Notre Dame with their two day pass -- perfect for getting around town and cheaper than the same pass in London. A little cafe at the Vavin end of the street offered Boeuf Bourgoignon (spelling?), a classic dish. Enjoy just sitting and people-watching -- as the women are slim and well-dressed in Paris. Just a great two days, busy from morning until late at night, which all the restaurants accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, comfy bed and great shower.”
Reviews.Author: spangly_mangly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days for an anniversary holiday June/July 2010. The room was very clean and nicely decorated, with a very comfortable bed and great shower. There was free wi-fi available in the room, even a good internet connection through the T.V. if you didn't bring your own laptop! The hotel is in a excellent location - on a street with a fromagerie, a number of bakers, bars and restaurants. At one end of the street is a metro line to the Eiffel Tower/Arc de Triomphe (10-15mins), and at the other end of the street a metro line to Gare du Nord (handy if you're arriving by Eurostar!). The staff were VERY helpful, speaking very good English, but also replied more slowly when we tried our broken French (which was appreciated).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Adde79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel with my boyfriend in june 2010. We had a great room with a small balcony overlooking the street. The staff was very helpful and freiendly, and assisted us with maps and directions, restaurants, and even sorted out our train journey from Paris. We also had free internet in our room and could get information that way, too. The location is good, with several metro stations nearby. It took about 30 minutes to walk to Louvre, and there is a lot of great neighbourhoods on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatieH777
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a package through Expedia. It was a wonderful choice. The people at the front desk were so helpful and nice. My french is passable but they were more than happy to speak english if I did not understand something. I loved my room. I know that Parisian hotel rooms are small by American standards, but I never felt cramped. The free Wi-Fi was a bit temperamental but it's free so who am I to complain. The free movies in the room were very nice. I could not have asked for a better location! You are near so many places to eat and shopping. For a quick bite or drink, I would recommend the little pub directly across the street. Great atmosphere and friendly people! Multiple metro lines nearby which is perfect. I ate the breakfast at the hotel once. It was good but much to expensive for my tastes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will most likely return myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: danaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: The staff was EXTREMELY helpful and the room was what we expected, clean and quiet. This is not a Holiday Inn, where the rooms are bland and well, North American style, XL for everything. However, it is what a Parisian hotel should be, unique, cozy, and European. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay there for 4 days. We had the courtyard facing room and it was quiet at night. Wifi is free, but the connection is not that great. Then again, it's free, so can't really complain. A more secure internet connection is available in the lobby. The location of the hotel was excellent, with MANY excellent restaurants around and VERY easily accessible to several Metro lines. There are great bakeries around as well for morning fresh, french baguettes. It was easy to get to from CDG airport as well, with the Air France bus. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel ... Great location... Lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: jgoodjello
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated between two metro stations on different lines. The room was small but thats to be expected anywhere in europe. The space was used very efficiently. Wifi was free... Movies were free too. Excellent for english travellers. I stayed down the street at a different hotel and the Lenox was less expensive, cleaner and had better ammenities. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a nice neighborhood, with very helpful staff and reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: Hinsdale_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I won't duplicate all the other positve reviews on the Lenox. It's a fine little hotel that provided everything we wanted and needed at a reasonable price. The staff is incredibly helpful (Sebastian especially) and the Lenox is located in a charming neighborhood with many cafes and restaurants and excellent access to several Metro lines as well as the RER trains. The hotel is nicely appointed and well managed, although by no means palatial. We toured the City all day and our room provided a clean and quiet respite when we returned in the evenings. We only slept and showered in our room -- didn't spend much time there since we came to see Paris. Of course, the rooms are smaller than what Americans are accustomed to, but when you go to Europe you need to leave your New World assumptions behind. (Cities, streets are buildings that are 300 to 400 years old tend to be smaller than our suburban sprawls that were built for the automobile.) We did not experience any problems with noise from other rooms or from the outside. A few tips that I wish I had known before going. 1.) A grocery store (FranPrix) is located 40 paces to your right as you walk out the hotel. You can buy a six pack of Heineken in bottles for less than the cost of one beer at a cafe; they also carry a nice selection of wine, cheese, fresh-baked bread and fresh fruit. So buy a picnic lunch and enjoy it in the nearby Luxembourg gardens. 2.) Buy a packet of ten Metro tickets at the window (About $14 US). The ticket machines didn't always work for us. (There is a setting for English instructions, but it's hard to find; plus not all the machines appear to work with a US credit card) Metro is cheap and easy way to get around, and there are three different lines within a few blocks of the Lenox Hotel. Learn the system on your first day; then go where you want to go. (Skip the tourista buses, particularly if you only have a few days in Paris.) 3.) Spend some time strolling around the Montparnasse neighborhood. There are many excellent cafes and restaurants. Sushi (there are a few places nearby) was about the only meal we found that was less expensive in Paris than in the US. Around the corner on Montparnasse Blvd. is Le Relais de l'EntrecÃ´te which serves a delicious steak with an excellent "secret sauce" and the best french fries you have ever tasted. (Also a good value because a second helping is included.) 4.) It is said that the Montparnasse Tower offers the best views of Paris because you don't have to look at the Monparnasse Tower. It's very expensive to go to the observation floor, but a waiter told us you can go the bar (a floor or two below) and order a drink and still get the same views. All things considered, I would highly recommend the Hotel Lenox if you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel in a nice Parisian neighborhood at a reasonable price. (Yes, there are a few negative reviews on TripAdvisor, but they strike me as rather whiny.) Hinsdale, Illinois Traveller

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mmgonzo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for 6 nights in June. I booked it after reading the many positive reviews on TA. It did not disappoint one bit. It's in a perfect location with a market, ATM, and bakery on the same street; with delicious restaurants and the metro literally around the corner. It was nice to be a few metro stops away from the heavily touristy areas. I highly recommend relaxing after a long day at their Honesty Bar, it was a nice way to wind down. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating; like others have posted, they do speak English and are more than happy to assist you with any questions. The rooms are on the small side, but I thought that added to the charm, and we had no problem fitting our luggage in. All in all, it was a wonderful stay, and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel welcome in Paris - stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Sunlounger99
Reviews.Content: Within 30 minutes of the Eurostar gliding into Gare Du Nord you can emerge from Vavin Metro station (line #4) and the Lenox Montparnasse is two minutes walk around the corner (take the Rue Delambre exit from the Metro). We found the hotel to offer a gracious welcome and a very comfortable room. Alas we did not have time to sample any of the drinks available at the well stocked honesty bar (yes, such things do still exist) but the same room in the hotel was superbly presented the following morning for breakfast. The 15 Euro breakfast option included eggs, bacon and sausage along with a variety of cold meats, cheese, fruits and exquisite croissants and breads. Fresh orange or grapefruit juice and the usual tea, coffee or chocolate added the finishing touches. Again, the staff were charming and helpful. Complimentary afternoon tea and cookies might be a temptation if you want to relax for a while. The location is ideal for heading off to see the big sights of Paris but is also better than most if you want to mingle with the Parisiennes and enjoy some cafÃ© culture. The CafÃ© de la Place at the end of the road was one our favourites and came as a recommendation from the hotel. The Wednesday morning also saw a good market selling fresh fruits and vegetables, trinkets, clothes and bags. Turn left out of the hotel and head towards the Edgar Quinet Metro, just two minutes walk along Rue Delambre. Other reviews extol the vast range of cafes, bistros and other shops all within a short walk and you will surely find whatever you are looking for. Inclusive extras include free Internet access (from the room and via the TV or lobby) and movies if you really need to rest up for a while. A great hotel, excellent in so many ways and thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Nisheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 1st time. Good experience as the hotel is located in a quiet street close to 2 metro lines(Edgar Quinet & Vavin). Amd the big train station as well for intercity trains. Rooms are small yet comfortable but the service and staff are great. Lots to see and do in the neighborhood which is safe with many restaurants cafes and big shops like Monoprix and Gallerie Lafayette close by.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CathyHV
Reviews.Content: We were here for two nights and had a very pleasant experience. Assuming you don't have a lot of luggage, it is a snap to take a train from Charles de Gaulle Airport (8 euros each) and then walk a short ways to this hotel. The neighborhood affords many cafes and everything else you could need for your stay. The Metro stations make this a convenient place from which to get to the rest of Paris. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful and gave us good advice on local restaurants and shopping. We had a courtyard room which was very quiet and peaceful with a very comfy bed. My only complaint was the poor internet reception in our room but other reviews don't indicate this to be a common problem. We were able to use the hotel's computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Constantly contented”
Reviews.Author: Anita7702
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Lenox Montparnasse and we were very satisfied with everything in this hotel - again. I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay. Pros: wonderful staff (especially Julia at front desk!!!), great location with many cafÃ©s and little shops nearby, friendly and stylish furniture, free internet (wifi-code or via TV), free movies, water heater for tea/coffee in the room, comfy bed and pillows, Honesty-bar, free tea and coffee in the afternoon, good value for your money Attention: be thoughtful when booking. In case you are alone or just two and have little luggage and stay just for few days â€“ â€œclassicâ€� rooms will be fine for you. But if you want stay longer or have more bags than youâ€™d better choose â€œclubâ€� room. Cons: nothing. Some people in previous reviews were complaining about thin walls â€“ yes, they are really thin, but really not disturbing. There is a pub in the front of the hotel and people can be loud (nowadays sure because of the soccer world cup), but if you are a heavy sleeper you wonâ€™t mind. Nevertheless it is a big city with its benefits and handicaps. If somebody wants to have a relaxing experience he/she should visit the country.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, plenty bad”
Reviews.Author: mew20
Reviews.Content: Good points: very close to the metro. Restaurants and bars nearby. Friendly staff who speak English. Honesty bar. Free WIFI. Air conditioning. Bad points: very small, though comfortable rooms. Bathroom dated with broken hairdryer. Poor sound proofing with lots of noise from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, staff, situation!”
Reviews.Author: misspixels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice! Near 2 metro station, groceries, wine store, shopping, restaurant, cafÃ©... All you need within 5 minutes walk! The hotel is very clean, confortable and the concierge is amazing and very friendly! I will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for my granddaughter to see Paris for the first time”
Reviews.Author: LugersMom
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I just spent 8 days in Paris at the Lenox Montparnasse and after reading other tripadvisor reviews, we were not disappointed. The hotel is situated in a nice location within half a block from 2 metro stations, near a 24 hour ATM, a grocery store, resturants and a wonderful bakery! The staff - especially Sebastian and Julia - were wonderful in helping make travel arrangements and recommending resturants. The rooms are small by American hotel standards, but we loved our room, the bath was large and we had a small balcony which was very nice. We did not spend much time in the room as we were touring Paris, but it was a perfect, safe, relatively quiet place for our stay and I would recommend the hotel and the staff! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Good option but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: gianjoan
Reviews.Content: My wife, our daughters (22 and 19) and I stayed at Lenox Montparnasse (***) for a week in May 2010. We booked two rooms, one classic and one upgrade (club room). Our early booking let us saved 25% of the standard room rate. In fact I expected a little bit more. The hotel is fine, well located, fair rates (in comparison to other similar hotels in Paris), and clean. All staff members speak English and some of them speak also Spanish. They all were very kind. There is a bar in which you can have a breakfast from 7 to 11 am (15 euro per person per day is expensive but similar to other hotels), and a small business center. There are no more facilities in the hotel. Rooms are small but comfortable: a table with a chair, a coffee maker, a small fridge and safe. Housekeeping is very good indeed. Check-in and check-out processes were quick and easy. There are lot of cafÃ©s, a Franprix supermarket, several restaurants, patisseries and boulangeries very close to the hotel. You will find three metro stations only 2-3 minute walking and the Gare de Montparnasse to take the train to Versailles is located only 5 minutes from the hotel. Some of the main Paris attractions are also close: Jardin du Luxembourg (4 minutes walking), Saint Germain des Pres church and the CafÃ© de Flore (15 minutes walking) and Montparnasse Tower (in which you probably find the best view of Paris) is located only at 5 minute walking distance. For most of the attractions you will need the Metro, but taking a train at Vavin (1 minute) or Edgar Quinet (3 minutes) metro stations you will go wherever you want. The TV system includes Internet and offer new movies (free!) but it really did not work properly and nobody fixed the problem during the whole week. Room free wi-fi is offered although we had a lot of problems to link most of the main web pages. Summarizing, I think this hotel is a recommendable option to stay in Paris, but I am not sure if it is as good as the current ranking shows. With more than 1,800 hotels ranked worse than Lenox (#33 among 1,845 hotels in Paris), I expected something better.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: PA40Love
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "club room" for 3 nights and had a very nice room with a small sitting area and a large marble tiled bathroom. with a heated towel bar, ( good for drying your undies or socks if you rinse them at night). The hotel provided terry robes, slippers, oversized bath towels and good bath amenities. We had free internet access, a mini-bar, lots of free movies (in English) and Julia at the front desk who was very helpful in giving directions. The hotel is convenient to 2 metro stops and there are plenty of good restaurants right in the neighborhood. Try the Italian Restaurant across the street. Very good. There is also a grocery store and a patisserie right in the same block. All in all a great little hotel in a good location. We would definetly stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_Kernoghan
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse has all the important things you look for in a 3 or 4 star hotel. Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms etc. The air con was one of the best in any hotel iv stayed and we really needed it. I was in Paris for the Tennis Open and the hotel was a perfect location for the metro to and from rolland garros. Theres also plenty of eating places close by the hotel that are open late into the night. If your looking somewhere clean and friendly in a great location then Id recomend the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Susan060
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We were very happy with our room (no 36). it had a little balcony, and being able to open the window onto the balcony was great. (we did pay for upgrade to the 'club room' ). Location was great, lots of resturants and bars nearby. Metro on your doorstep. Recommend the Montparnasse Tour, great views of the city. A picnic in nearby luxembourg gardens is a must.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel. Superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: indeau
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, that we got as part of a recommended airline package. The "classic" room is a bit small (similar to NYC standard room) but comfortable with mini-bar, cable TV, bath with shower, phone, WIFI and desk space. If you want a larger room stay away from rooms numbers ending in 4 or 5 (ie., #44, #45, #24.......). Great well stacked honesty bar in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in wonderful Montparnassee but be careful what you pay”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several places in Paris over the years and this was my favorite. It wasn't entirely convenient to Roland Garros (why I was in town this trip) but there are 3 metro stops within 2 blocks. If this is your first trip to Paris, you might want to stay closer to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter to be closer to the tourist sites. For me, I wanted to stay in more of the 'real' Paris -- and I enjoyed Montparnasse very much. There are at least a dozen very nice restaurants within a 2 block radius around the hotel, none too touristy. I paid about 125 USD/night -- I booked probably 4 months in advance. I tried to add 1 night to my stay the day before I arrived -- and found that the rate had gone up to almost 200 USD/night. For that rate, I might try to stay somewhere else. But, then again, Paris is not expensive in May and when I booked I might have gotten the Winter rate. The hotel very nicely added my extra night at the lower rate! (I booked through expedia) The wireless internet connection in my room on the 5th floor was outstanding. If you are looking for a big hotel room, you might want to stay elsewhere. In Paris, that means either paying a LOT of money or staying in a less-desirable neighborhood. I stayed in Les 3 Poussins last year -- the rooms there are much bigger, but I didn't like the neighborhood so much. The room there even had a small kitchen. I cannot comment on the breakfast, only to say that it is 15 Euros.... so I went to the bakery 4 doors down and the grocery store 2 doors down to make my own breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berg2010
Reviews.Content: We loved the Lenox Montparnasse! The hotel is in a perfect location in Paris with many stores and restaurants just around the corner. The room was very clean and we got free movies and free internet in the room which was a pleasant surprise. The beautiful park Jardin du Luxemburg is just a short stroll from the hotel. The staff were always nice and helpful. We wold love to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2103
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with helpful staff. It's located near to lots of restaurants and the metro. Although the room was small, it was very clean and quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel and we'll be staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: danrm
Reviews.Content: This is a remarkable hotel on a nice, relatively quite street in a super neighborhood. The site is spotless, the street has little traffic and there are a countless good bars/restaurants and historical sites within walking distance and/or easy Metro access. I'm not a Parisian building expert, but I suspect this hotel was once adapted from an apartment house. Whoever did this conversion did a remarkable job. The lobby/bar areas have marble floors and trendy/modern finishes. The hotel is charming, comfortable and cozy. We stayed here 2 days. We opted for an upgrade at check-in to a suite; room 54. One thing to note about room 54 is that the toilet is in a separate area from the sink and bathtub. Since there is no sink in this toilet room, it requires that you go to the sink/bathtub room to wash your hands; nothing too horrible, but certainly something to note. The room has above-average wall-to-wall carpeting and the bathroom areas have marble floors and walls and new plumbing fixtures. The suite itself is about the size of a standard U.S. room with a nice balcony overlooking the street in front of the hotel. Our suite had a fireplace, which I'm sure was once functional but is now just a showpiece. It was nonetheless, a nice touch that we both appreciated. Included in the room is free WIFI/internet and movies that we utilized without issue. We did notice that the noise from adjacent rooms was rather high and on occasion we we're awakened by the noise from the early-morning trash pick-up. Most notable was the bathroom noise from the room above ours and the late arrival of guests on our last night. We would characterize the noise issues as being acceptable for a hotel of this type of architecture. The staff was very helpful. We would like to especially note the efficient check-in process and presentation, which was outstanding. We will be staying here again on our next visit and would encourage travelers with similar tastes and expectations to stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: ctocm_aw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for 6 nights, and booked a club room w/Queen bed via Expedia. I had high expectations due to all the great recommendations on Tripadvisor, but was sadly let down due to the noise. The Hotel Location is good, and it's near two metro lines, and several restaurants, stores, and shopping. The Staff was friendly, efficient and explained all the extras the hotel was offering, as far as internet access, movies, bar, and breakfast, etc. We were assigned room 26, which is on the street. We generally stayed out until 10-11 pm sightseeing and were tired by the time we returned to our room. I don't recall one night we slept through without being woken by an adjoining room or the Theater across the street, which generally had a movie that let out around 0200. There was also the traffic and trash service early in the morning (0530 -0600). So if you aren't a heavy sleeper or can't sleep using earplugs, I don't recommend staying here. Had I gotten a courtyard room, I may have been able to sleep in till I was rested. My recommendation is - ask for a courtyard room if you decide to stay - you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: frasiers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed five nights at the Lenox. It is conveniently located near two Metro stations, that are very easy to manage. On the same street of the Lenox, there is a grocery store and pastry shop. There are plenty of restaurants in the Monteparnasse district. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed siting in the bar area. The hotel rooms are small, which we were expecting. They are very clean and managable. The only concern with the room was with the size of the shower. My husband is tall and was uncomfortable showering each day. The free internet service was very helpful in staying connected. They also have a computer in the lobby for use. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull!!!”
Reviews.Author: gabe2755
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to Paris and did not know what to expect in regards to the hotel accommodations.
