But our stay at the Lenox hotel was wonderful (better in some ways than the hotels in the US). Great staff, great location, incredibly clean! Overall a great value. Weâ€™ll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: siscobay
Reviews.Content: We loved the Lenox - it is in a great location - few minutes walk to the Metro. Lots of stores and cafes around it. Rooms small by North American standards but nicely furnished and very clean. Staff were absolutely wonderful. In fact I would say they were the nicest hotel staff I have ever dealt with. Every request handled with a smile. The hotel breakfast was pricey (17 Euros per person) but a fabulous deal compared to the surrounding cafes and since it is a buffet you can eat as much as you want of your favorite foods. If I go back to Paris, I would definitely stay at the Lenox Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: PeterHarvey
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel without TA initially as it was temptingly close to the Gare Montparnasse - seeking convenience whilst being prepared to compromise. But - actually this place is pretty decent and we positively enjoyed our 3 -nights stay. 10 mins walk from the station, equi-distantly placed between 2 metro stations 2 mins away, and also just a stone's-throw from the Boulevard Montparnasse - Formidable ! Very helpful and welcoming staff, manned 24/24. Breakfast unusually better value than nearby bistros. Honesty bar, room in the minibar fridges for your own champagne, air con, free and fast wi-fi, copies of today's Guardian, acceptably quiet rooms.... What's not to like ? Well, the price actually, though admittedly seems to be the going rate for Paris these days, ie Hideously Expensive. Mais ca y est as they say....

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: willi348
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse has certainly earned its reputation and one of the best values in Paris. For the money that you pay to stay here you will not find a better hotel. The rooms are spotlessly clean, the staff the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered and the location provides excellent access to 3 metro stations and 1 major train station. The have freen Wifi in the rooms, a computer with printer in the lobby and they even allowed unlimited free access to all of their pay-per-view movies (quite a selection). There are many bakeries and restaurants nearby and a grocery store 1/2 block away. The rooms were very nice although very small. I have read quite a bit to tell me that this is the standard for Paris and I'm sure that it's true. To close the bathroom door you had to squeeze yourself in back by the toilet and there was nowhere to tuck suitcases away so we were constantly stepping over them. I did pay extra for a Club Room and our room was still smaller than the ones advertised on the website so I'm not sure quite what the Club Room upgrade meant. I wouldn't pay for it again. The room also had a small double bed and we are used to a king at home so sleeping was a bit difficult. I don't know if there is an option to upgrade to 2 twins or not. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. It sounds like you'll have a small room no matter where you stay and this hotel is truly a wonderful one, especially considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: SP1jockey
Reviews.Content: Don't disagree with some comments in previous reviews about the rooms being slightly small and some noise from adjacent rooms (e.g. showers running early in the morning) but nothing significant enough to detract fom the overall experience. A long way from being the flashest hotel in Paris but certainly doesn't feel 'budget'. Friendly, relaxed, clean, well maintained, nice locale, TREMENDOUS location for getting about (three Metro stations within a few minutes walk), plenty of good restaraunts and brasseries nearby (with a range of prices from the more expensive on Boulevard du Montparnasse to less costly in the side streets) , nice atmosphere - small Parisien hotel rather than one of the big, nondescript chains that feel like you're on business. Enjoyable and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and area”
Reviews.Author: mattk23
Reviews.Content: First visit to Paris and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Though the room is a bit smaller than what we stayed at in Amsterdam earlier in the week, the staff was absolutely fantastic. They were helpful, and polite. There are some nice restaurants in the surrounding area (great escargot and oysters!), every server we had spoke english and was very friendly. A grocery store is a few steps down so you can buy water and other essentials for your room. The Metro (Vavin stop on the 4) is only a half block away. Head down to Denfert/Rochereau and you can catch the B train to Charles De Gaulle. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Wish it were a little less (but hey, it's Paris!)”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFlyerGuy
Reviews.Content: First, realize that this is Paris. For the money, it's actually a good value, but it is a little more than I usually like to spend on a hotel. My expectations were middle of the road, and I have to say that they were solidly met and exceeded in many regards. The rooms were clean, smallish (again, Paris), and ours was located on the third floor with a little balcony towards the inner courtyard. The room was quiet and comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and reasonably sized. The provided shampoo and conditioner was good, and I helped myself to the bottles on the last day for the road. Total we were here for 5 nights, and never really needed anything from the concierge but they were constantly present and helpful when we needed some direction or help printing our boarding passes. They have a (slow) computer in the lobby that you can use and print out information for free (just don't abuse it). We never tried the honesty bar or the breakfast and that was probably a good idea: For the 15EU per person you can get whatever you want elsewhere at probably better quality. Location is very good with lines heading in different directions nearby. Finding the hotel is very simple and if you happen to be there in the afternoon there's also free coffee/tea in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox Montparnasse!!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelPNW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for 3 mights in early April and LOVED this hotel!! The staff was amazing- so warm and friendly. The room was modern and clean. Yes, it was cozy (small) by American standards but I loved it because it felt very authentically French. Our room faced the courtyard in back of the hotel. It was very quiet (no street noise). We ended up having breakfast in the hotel each morning. In part because it was convenient but more because it was wonderful and the staff was very friendly; what a great way to begin a day in Paris! I was concerned the hotel might be too far away from the sights but having metro stops at either end of the street and tons of wonderful cafes within blocks put the best of Paris at our doorstep. I also loved that we were just a short walk to the gorgeous Jardin du Luxembourg. It is such a romantic park to sit, stroll and spend an afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “The best 3 stars that I stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mageslu
Reviews.Content: We've been in Paris a few times and this was the best hotel that we have found in category 3 stars. The location is excellent within walking distance to two Metro stations and also very close of the Tour Montparnasse. The street of the hotel is filled with small boutique of the breads, cheeses, hams, fruits and there is a small grocery store beside the hotel. The region has several bars and restaurants. The hotel staff are very friendly and prompt in attendance. The rooms are clean, ventilated with furniture in good condition, mini bar and kitchen utensils that they can be used to make coffee or tea in the room. The bed and bath clothes are very clean and well cared for. The bathroom is spacious, has natural ventilation (window), clean, containing shower and bath which is rare in this category hotels in Paris. The internet, already included in the daily hotel, worked perfectly in the room. Very good idea of the â€œhonesty barâ€�. When we took the breakfast we went very well attended at the hotel bar.One negative point(?) is the price of the breackfast,but we think that there isn't hotels in Paris with breackfast with quality and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “charming, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinaStockholm
Reviews.Content: Lenox is a cozy hotel in the middle of Paris. Clean, cozy rooms. Lovely comfortable bed with clean sheets, clean and nice bathroom and a fantastic location. Close to the metro, many restaurants and shops within walking distance but quiet and peaceful. We can really recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: thebrolga
Reviews.Content: I don't know what good things to say about this place that haven't been said so many times before in other reviews. I booked two nights here on the strength of these reviews and found that it was even better than I'd been led to believe. From the moment we arrived (earlier than check in time) to the moment we left, the staff couldn't have done more for us. The room is spacious for a Paris hotel; the bathroom huge; everything so clean; crisp white linen; fluffy white towels; free wifi; free newspapers; great location close to metro stations, shops, restaurants and the best creperie in an adjoining street - I just couldn't fault it. For the price I don't think anything would beat it. I'll definitely stay here again if in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this delightful Montparnasse hotel and, as usual, both the hotel and the staff exceeded our (good) expectations. Start with the killer location, charming lobby and rooms, reasonable pricing and good breakfast and you're most of the way there. In this case, however, we were standed in Paris because of the Icelandic ash cloud and thus couldn't leave on schedule for the rest of our vacation. Under the circumtances, one might have expected prices to rise, tempers to flare, but nothing of the kind happened. We were in fact given a better room at the same price and told we could stay on as long as we liked and even return if we couldn't get a flight out of the airport. These are wonderful people at a great hotel. Only possible downside were garbage trucks outside the window at 5 AM but one can solve this by asking for an interior room, as we did after a few days. Our highest recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Rog3r
Reviews.Content: The Lennox is welcoming, clean and efficiently run. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Situated in a central location the Lennox was an excellent base to visit all the sites in Paris. The hotel is surprisingly quiet considering it is surrounded by cafes, bars and restaurants. A great place to stay whether you are wanting to visit the sites or just wanting a quiet break. We would definitely consider coming here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, good room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: natp23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently during a trip to run the Paris Marathon. The Hotel is very accessible being located near 3 or 4 Metro stations. The rooms are not huge but nice and clean and reflective of the price. Lots of shops, cafes and parks nearby. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Katielou17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to access from Paris du Nord Eurostar (one metro line, quite a few stops but quick enough). It was also very easy to see all the sights from here. The room was clean and lovely. Ours had nice big windows with a view over the courtyard of another hotel behind it. The bed was very comfy and the decor was nice. The shower was also very decent. Free tea and coffee were available at the bar and an honesty bar system operates for the rest of the drinks. The staff were very helpful and efficient. I got a good deal on the room via an early booking on hotels.com. This was definitely more than I expected for my money from a Paris hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone. Oh, and the area was good too with lots of brasseries etc (not the most veggie friendly but it is Paris!). There's even a lovely boulangerie (boasting excellent croque monsieurs, so I'm told), a cheese shop and a wine shop on the same street as the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Romantic trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ZipporahRose
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Easter in 2010. The hotel is in a great location just outside the centre, less than a minute's walk to two metro stations and only a few stops from all the sights. The breakfast prices in the hotel (as all hotels) are steep but there are several reasonably priced cafes close by. The staff were the friendliest people we met in Paris, always greeting us with a smile and spoke perfect English. The room was small but spotlessly clean, with a very comfy bed, large bathroom and small balcony. There were tea and coffee facilities in the room, and was available for free in the bar in the afternoons. The films (normally 11 euro) were offered to us free, due to a problem they seemed to be experiencing with the system, but it didn't affect us much and it was nice to enjoy a film without having to think about the bill. The reception desk is manned 24 7 so you can stay out at night. The otherall feel of the hotel was more of a 4 star than a 3 star, it was excellent value for money and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: mulled01
Reviews.Content: I kind of feel like I'm wasting time writing another positive review for this hotel, but it was so nice that I feel like I should. We stayed here two nights and had a lovely time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. Here's why: 1. The location is great. It's on a relatively quiet street that is just off a very-busy street. It is very close to two metro stations (both within a block). The stop you need for most of the sites is the Edgar Quinet and the other one is Vavin. This also makes it easy to take a train from CDG. Also, there are great pastry shops and restaurants in the area. 2. The staff was very, very nice and helpful. We arrived from the U.S. at 7:30 a.m. and they let us check-in and gave me a room upgrade. They also told us how to get to the places we wanted to get to and arranged for a shuttle to take us to the airport upon our departure (we had enough of the train by the time we left). 3. The rooms/decor/bed were great. The room as fairly small, but I expected much smaller given what I had heard of Paris hotel rooms. I was comfortable in it and I'm used to U.S.-sized rooms. And, it was clean/modern. The free internet was a nice touch. Lastly, it's all non-smoking, which was great. 4. The hotel was a tremendous value. We paid $160 through hotels.com. This seemed like a great value for a hotel this nice in Paris. The only negative I would give it is that it has the smallest elevator I have ever seen. Two people max. But, the stairs are convenient and we were on the second floor, so we rarely used it. This is a great hotel and it's positive reviews are well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: andream114
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel - helpful staff and clean accommodation. Stay was too short!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandRatbag
Reviews.Content: Well placed in a side street off the main boulevard but very close to a boulangerie and a small supermarket. Several eating places within walking distance offering food for various palates. Paris is excellent - so much to see and do. Restaurant food & drink are expensive, Le Metro is a great way to get about 1.60 euros per journey. Only down-side ....... hope you enjoy queuing to access everything touristy!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYteacher
Reviews.Content: Just got bavk from Paris and stayed at this hotel ofr 3 nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. They helped us with dinner reservations and sightseeing . The room was comforable and clean. There was enough room for all your stuff. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was hot . I liked the free coffee and tea in the afternoon. The breakfast was delicious-french breads!!!! The staff in the breakfast room were polite. The location was great-near 2 subway lines and you if you like to walk, you can walk to almost anywhere. The neighborhood has a lot of restaurnats and stores. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: ledatron
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault this hotel at all......friendly, helpful staff, good location, lovely and clean and FREE WIFI! The only thing is that you can hear clearly what's going on next door but I knew this from other reviews so brought ear plugs and slept like a baby! We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely atmosphere and very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: issyellis
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hotel. I think it was brilliant value for money. The service was great, the hotel was clean and the atmosphere very nove. I was only there for one night but I would have liked to stay for longer. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox was our "home" for great week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jerryeco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great; the location "the best". Check-in and check-out was friendly and efficient; the facility spotless. As many have mentioned, the room was very small, but the worst part was no dresser or drawer space and little place for 2 suitcases to be kept open and accessible. Front desk personnel was very helpful with directions, information, in English, except for one who didn't seem as knowledgeable, albeit willing. We would return to the Lenox. We did check that our room was in the back of hotel--it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “In Depth Review of A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: insightout
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for 5 nights. Overall my expectations were met. Only two small things were slightly bothersome, which I'll explain after I go through everything we enjoyed. The location is astounding, if you want to be away from the crowds, but want access to everything this is the place. The Metro is right down the street as well as an ATM, a grocery store, a pharmacy, and tons of cafes and bars and pastry shops everywhere. All it takes is a mile walk through the gorgeous Montparnasse area and you're at the Seine right across from the Louvre. A little farther out and you're at Notre Dame Cathedral and very close to the Latin Quarter. The Hotel itself is clean and the lobby and adjoining bar area are smartly decorated and give it a nice little ambience. On arriving we met Fuzia (sp?) and she was courteous and helpful. The rooms are very well maintained and the beds are comfortable. WIFI is free as well as any PPV movies on the TV. Our room faced the street, the terrace doors are from floor to ceiling and open out onto a tiny terrace. So there's ample ventilation and outside light. The bathroom was very clean, the fixtures all seemed fairly new, and there was a combo tub/shower that instead of a shower curtain used a swinging pane of glass that covered about half the tub. A little odd at first, but perfectly fine for us. If you have a hanging toiletry bag, it would help considerably as there is not a lot of counter space. The blow dryer worked well and we requsted an iron several mornings and it was delivered immediately. The elevator is tiny, so if you have large suitcases, you'll probably have to go one at a time! Echoing other reviews here, I'd also skip the relatively expensive breakfast and simply walk down to the main Montparnasse Blvd and hit the Patisserie shop on the corner. We ate ample quiche and pastries here every morning for under 6-8 euros. The turn-down service was IMPECCABLE. We would leave around 7-8 am every morning and come back for a small break around 3-4pm and find a spotless room with fresh towels every day. There is an electronic Do Not Distturb button, which malfunctioned the one day we decided to sleep in haha, and we had to tell them several times "Non merci!" The front desked fixed it immediately. One night after midnight our safe wouldn't open and we called the frontdesk, he was there in less than a minute gave us a safe key. Overall, very courteous efficient staff and a very nice clean hotel. One glaring ommission that the staff didn't explain was that there is some heavy construction going on in that section of the rue Delambre. We wake up early and I can sleep through almost anything, but my fiancee is not an easy sleeper and could hear it as early as 4:30am. In addition, you might hear a very loud trash truck. As far as local restaurant recommendations, the information we received was more of a cursory "Why yes there many of them down the street" versus a "Well what exactly are you looking for?" If you are a foodie, you're obviously going to do the research on your own anyway. If you are very hungry after your long trip to Paris and want something fast, relatively inexpensive and unpretentious, and fresh and good quality. Go to EXKI. It's right around the corner and down Montparnasse blvd a bit. It's kind of like a Panera bread, just eco-friendly and all natural. If I was going to return to Paris and stay in this district, I would stay at the Lenox again in a heart beat. Au Revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, cozy hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Fauchonlover
Reviews.Content: We had booked the club room for a little extra and got a free mini bar, a slightly larger room though as with Pairs hotels not very big. Quite spotless, free internet station downstairs, nespresso for about 1 euro at the lobby, friendly staff. We did not eat the breakfast but looked ok. Metro stations are very close with easy access to things. A very nice walk to the main Paris attractions. We walked to the Place Vendome, Place de la Madeleine, the Eiffel Tower and there were many nice bistros nearby where we had some delightful meals by the Pantheon. Overall a good experience, and the mini bar with its 3 free soft drinks and a couple of small snacks was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money at this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankCC
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris and stayed at the Lenox 4 nights. Can't fault any element of the hotel, the staff were excellent and very welcoming, the room was comfortable and accomodating and the location was perfect. All in all a very enjoyable experience and I would certainly go back again......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, really lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: Nick1212
Reviews.Content: Clean, polite efficient staff, lovely stay. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: MrsLFC
Reviews.Content: With 3 metro stops on different lines within 5 mins or less walk this was a great location to explore Paris. 2 stops down was also the main RER trainline to the airport so getting around could not be easier. The rooms were small but adequate and even had a bonus balcony that, at another time of year, may have been a delight. But it was freezing outside and the doors were only opened for a few moments to cool down a warm room. The shower is a little small but fine - just kept accidentally turning it off as I turned around! I have marked lower for sleep quality because the hotel is on a street with a couple of bars and one or two shouters may bother some people. It is by no means what you call a bar scene though, more that the few disturbed the otherwise peaceful setting. Unfortunately Paris seems to be good generally with their cleanliness as we were hit on 2 mornings (Fi & Mon) by early morning bin collections in the street - another reason for lower sleep quality. Had breakfast at the hotel only once as it was expensive but it was good. We tended to just pop into the local patisseries and found a favourite on the corner of Boulevard Raspail opposite Rue Delambre where you could sit in or take out. Local restaurants to the hotel I have also reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: studyabroadmom2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were terrific. We never ate the breakfast - thought it was too pricey. The rooom was very comfortable and well decorated. They kept it very clean. My only complaint was that the room was stuffy. I didn't expect that to be a problem at the end of February. There was a beautiful and comfortable down comforter, but that was too warm and there was nothing else. When we had the window open, the street noise kept me awake most of the night - singers and revellers until 3 am or so, then garbage or delivery trucks starting around 6 am. I would gladly stay here again if I could get a room in the back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and solid value”
Reviews.Author: TheOffSeason
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, but is situated between 3 metro lines that will get you all over the city. Eateries abound in the immediate area. Bonus: the Lenox is flanked by two pastry shops.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: dansun82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights last year. Did some sightseeing and went to Roland Garros for two days. This hotel, while small, is absolutely amazing. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and free internet was a big plus. Absolutely loved the honesty bar downstairs and loved the hotel's location. Very conveniently located near two subway stations and many small cafes, a supermarket, and some great restaurants. Enjoyed the stay and would return without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline J
Reviews.Content: We were staying for three nights originally until Eurostar fell apart (but that's another story) and on first entering the hotel, we felt very welcomed. The front desk was helpful on the many occasions we had cause to speak to the staff there during our stay, and check-in was no exception. Prompt and speedy meant we were quickly up in our room and settling in for the night after a late arrival. The room was on the fourth floor and was an upgrade to a club room (offered to us, not requested). Having stayed in many hotels in recent years, I'm not sure what the upgrade here really offered abover the norm, but having heard poor reviews of other hotels, we were happy with our room. It was very small, but the bathroom was much more spacious than I expected with a small bath in it, which we were glad of after days walking in the freezing temperatures of wintry Paris. The room had free internet access via the television and a wifi keyboard, plus there was a terminal downstairs from which we were able to print boarding passes. Tea and coffee facilities were also provided, plus there was a mini-bar if needed. Downstairs by reception was a lounge, very modern and comfortable in decor, in which breakfast was served at a fairly reasonable rate for hotels (the options start at approx. 8 euros for cafÃ© complet). We tended to go to a local bakery for pain au chocolat, but did have breakfast one morning and it was fine. Later in the day there is free tea and coffee offered in the lounge, and for evenings an honesty bar is offered. All the usual array of drinks are laid out together with sheets for you to tally up your drinks and hand it in to reception. We were impressed - it really gave us a welcoming feel as the lounge did indeed feel more like home from home. The location in Montparnasse is great - we were on a street with two metro stations, one at each end, and if you are interested in the surrealists, one of them had a studio in one of the rooms of the hotel, and another lived down the street. Two streets up we found a street full of creperie's and about 100 yards from the hotel is the intersection with La Coupole and Le Select, two of the classic art deco cafe's where people have come to watch the world go by for decades. Although Montparnasse is clearly not the place it once was, there are great restaurants and shops and it is very easy to get to anywhere in the city. As we were delayed returning home by the Eurostar fiasco, we spoke to reception about extending our stay and the reception manager did us a deal at the original price for the upgraded room, for which we were grateful as the additional costs of flights home a day later was all hitting the credit card too. All in all, we had a great stay at this hotel and I would definitely recommend it to anyone I knew was going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location To Experience Local Life And Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Polaroider
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. We stayed two weeks in junior suite 54 facing Rue Delambre. The street noise was minimal at this height due to very effective noise cancelling/insulated balcony doors. Front desk staff was always courteous, friendly and helpful (especially Julia!) as was the housekeeping staff. Junior suite was spotless and spacious and included an espresso maker, fireplace and sleeper sofa, as well as a very comfortable queen-size bed. Slept like a baby after getting over jet lag. Cozy lounge and dining area. The breakfast is good, although a bit higher priced than what you can find in the neighborhood. The neighborhood is mostly locals and non-touristy feeling. Many cafes, restaurants, crepe stands, etc. Your are only a few minutes to all major attractions via the three nearby easy to use Metro stations. For a real local experience (and reasonable prices), go to the Monoprix supermarket next to Tour Montparnasse. Everything you need, including a huge and inexpensive wine section. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel and a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Jan1942
Reviews.Content: We were for a short cultural visit in Paris (26-30 dec.) with opera Platee and different musea. Lenox Montparnasse was the ideal hotel and the ideal location. Pleasant clubroom no.52, good breakfast with enough variety, metro Vavin or Edgar Quinet a !00 m. and a scale of restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, reasonable price, QUEEN BED”
Reviews.Author: egranville
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel because of the positive reviews we read on Trip Advisor, which we found to be accurate during our 8-night stay over Christmas and New Year's 2009. STAFF/CUSTOMER SERVICE Even before we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised by the courteous service we received in the form of help booking a dinner reservation for Christmas day. Since our red-eye flight arrived to Paris at 6:30 a.m., we also had to request that our room be ready well before the hotel's normal check-in time, and it was! BEDROOM & BATHROOM The bedroom and bathroom were small, but tidy, clean, and attractively decorated. We were able to find a "Utell promotion" rate on room with a QUEEN-size bed, which was a huge selling point, since most other hotels only offered double beds or two twins. The queen bed also meant we had a considerably bigger room, based on our observations of the floorplan that was posted on the back of our door to show fire evacuation routes. The bathroom had a full-size shower + bath, which was another big selling point since many Parisian hotel rooms only have a bathtub. Noise from the street and adjacent rooms was not an issue in our third floor room facing the street. We are light sleepers, but did not have any trouble sleeping. LOCATION The hotel was extremely close to two different Metro lines, one of which (the #4 line) went directly to the St. Germaine neighborhood and Ile de la Cite, where Notre Dame cathedral is located (very central location). Within a few minutes, you could walk to American-style amenities, like McDonalds and Starbucks, and the Montparnasse train station. The hotel was also two doors down from a full-size city grocery store, which was very convenient for purchasing snacks to keep in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bien Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: harblinger
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of minutes from 2 Metro stops and down a quiet street just off Bld Raspail near the montparnasse tower, the Lenox is ideally situated for exploring Paris. As is typical of Paris rooms, things are a little cosy especially if you have a lot of luggage, but for a long weekend or a light traveller it's just about right. The beds are comfy and everything was clean however, which is the most important thing for any hotel room as far as I'm concerned! Staff are very friendly and helpful, offering assistance instead of waiting to be asked. Instructions for connecting to the free wi-fi were clear and easy to follow (why this isn't free in all hotels these days is beyond me). There is complimentary tea and coffee in the pleasant lounge area of an afternoon and in the evening it becomes an honesty bar which is far preferable to sitting cooped up in your room. We didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on the food. Would recommend this hotel if you want a good base for exploring Paris but don't want to pay over the odds. There are many good restaurants and bistro's nearby as well as a small supermarket, making this an ideal location for a stay. Will be staying again when I next visit Paris

Reviews.Title: “We loved Paris, the hotel, and our room”
Reviews.Author: mokuyobi
Reviews.Content: For our second honeymoon, our 25th anniversary, we spent a glorious week in Paris. The location served us well, with shops and restaurants a close walk and easy access to the Metro. The people at the front desk were very nice, and quite helpful. After a day of sight-seeing, it was delightful to return to our room, which they were kind enough to upgrade since the hotel didn't seem to be quite full. My wife said the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed she has ever slept in. The bathroom was very modern and nice, but being clumsy Americans, we would have liked to have had a shower curtain. It took us a while to learn how not to soak the floor every time we showered, which involved a lot of crouching. And watch out for the doorstop-it hurts if you jam your toe into it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anduska
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very well located - you could even walk to the Eiffel Tower if you fancy a longer walk. Really nice! Also, there are plenty of restaurants around the hotel. The room was comfortable - not very big, but not small at all, just enough for 2 people - with pretty decoration and the most important thing - it was clean. Receptionists were friendly and we were very satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming and just perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: pollywouldbe
Reviews.Content: We love the Montparnasse / Luxembourg area of Paris but have stayed in bigger hotels before. The Lenox has been a very happy experiment! Its location, between Metro Vavin and Edgar Quinet is perfect; LIgne 4 takes only 20 minutes from Gare du Nord and 10 to the River Seine. There are some wonderful places to eat nearby from the economical to the very expensive. The reception staff were welcoming and helpful, and looked after us well. The honesty bar was a lovely warm retreat from the absolutely freezing Parisien weather! Free tea in the afternoon when we collapsed after many hours of exploring is a great idea! Gentle jazz music in the backgound was relaxing too. The bedroom [ we opted for a slightly larger one] was fine, quiet and overlooked a courtyard. It was very nicely decorated, although a slightly wider bed would have been an advantage. Free internet access from the TV in the room was a great feature as well. Masses of hot water for bath and shower and good quality toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: ssm28
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for a special occasion (and they offered to upgrade us for free without us even asking), and it was a great hotel, especially considering Paris standards. Downside: it was small in relations to American standards, but pretty decent compared to Paris standards. Location was absolutely great -- it was away enough from the "touristy" spots, yet not too far way to be able to reach all the greatest attractions in Paris. There were 3 metro lines nearby. The beauty of Paris: metro gets u EVERYWHERE. Don't take taxi anywhere, please, it's just not necessary. Everything was about 10-15 mins away by metro from this hotel. This hotel was a great choice for us. It wasn't the most luxurious, but it was super decent, clean, great value, & comfortable. There was a free computer in lobby for guest use (but the keyboard was not an American keyboard). There is also free internet from the TV screen in the room, although a tad bit difficult to use via their keyboard, but still good to have. Plus, the service was its greatest asset -- Fouzia, Houman, & 2 other gentlemen working at the front desk whose names i did not catch gave the absolute BEST service possible. Overall, an amazing experience. And don't believe what you hear about Parisiens being rude to Americans, it's NOT true. As long as you are polite, and as long as you ask in french whether they speak english ("Pardon, vous parlez anglais?"), you will be treated with respect in return. I would grately recommend this hotel. Paris was amazing, enjoy it! Thanks so much, Fouzia, Houman, & the rest of the front desk staff!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming, comfortable - great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: SlowDance
Reviews.Content: This is a well run hotel with a friendly atmosphere. The staff are helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable with all amenities. The hotel is located conveniently for metro stations and bus routes. Also there is a very wide choice of restaurants and bistros withing easy walking distance of the hotel. It is excellent value for money. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value”
Reviews.Author: chrisgherts
Reviews.Content: The room and facilities were scrupulously clean, the bed very comfortable. The room was compact but for our use as tourists, quite adequate. The situation is very convenient, the Metro line from Gare du Nord (Eurostar) has a station not much over 100 metres from the hotel entrance. With another Metro line station at the other end of the street about the same distance away. There must be a couple of dozen eateries within 200 metres, ranging from tiny sandwich bars and bistros to very large restaurants ands also fish restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: MuddyYorker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on a fairly quiet street midway between Edgar-Quinet and Vavin metro stops, and also close to Montparnasse Station, so it is easy to get anywhere in Paris. Nearby there are lots of shops, cafes, and restaurants and we made our own breakfast by buying some croissants and fruit and making coffee on the maker in the room. Although our room (#47) faced the street, it was on the fourth floor, and we were not bothered by street noise. The room, though small, was spotless and nicely decorated. The bed was a bit uncomfortable as it was made up of of two single beds pushed together so there was that annoying gap! Ask for a real queen or king bed. The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful and their attitude was a real plus. All in all, a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: Geoff S
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the internet and as the price was very reasonable our expectations were of a moderate standard only. What a lovely surprise! The hotel is furnished in a boutique style with excellent taste. Even the stairs and landing areas are very attractive with subtle lighting effects and art befitting the decor. The room was small, but the bed was large and overlooked the front of the hotel from 2 large french windows. The staff were very freindly, spoke excellent English and made us feel very welcome. The location is very close to the Eiffel Tower and across the road from a Metro station. We did not eat in the hotel, so I cannot comment on the food but if it was up to the same standard of the rest of the hotel I would imagine it is very good. We will certainly stay there again in our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Polhis
Reviews.Content: Lenox Montparnasse was a perfect choice for a hotel for travellers who need a comfortable place to rest after a day of walking around Paris. It was good value for money in that while rather simple, it was very suitable for our needs - the bed was comfortable, rooms were clean and the hotel has a lovely "Honesty bar" in the lobby, which worked very well and was great for relaxing. The location is also surprisingly quiet - we had a french balcony overlooking the street yet didn't have any problems with noise coming from outside. Concierge was friendly and helpful (gave a great recommendation for a restaurant near by called Le Parc Aux Cerfs!). The only critisism is that breakfast offered at the hotel (not included in the price of the room) was too expensive (18e for buffet) in our view and we simply picked up fresh croissants and juice from the boulangerie on the same street for a fraction of the price. But overall, a very pleasant experience of a 3-star hotel if you're not looking for anything too elaborate, but something sweet, comfortable and handy location (just around the corner from Vavin metro station and 5 min walk to Jardin du Luxembourg!). Also direct connection from Vavin to Gare du Nord for those travelling on the Eurostar as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, room, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: billybob235
Reviews.Content: The room was small as would be expected, but the double bed was comfortable, the room was clean and the bathroom was nice. We even lucked out and got a little balcony. The staff was great, they helped me secure restaurant reservations before and during our trip, and even offered to call the places when we were running late. Great location near the Dome, and a few other nice little shops and bistros along the street. Very close to Metro station Edgar-Quinet. Would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lucy042
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse was one of the cheaper hotels offered as a package by Eurostar. It is centrally located with good access to several Metro lines - plus has a good rating on tripadvisor - so we selected it for our one night weekend stay in Paris. We were not disappointed. We were greeted warmly and professionally. The clerk gave us excellent information about the facilities offered and what each would cost. Yes, the room was small and the bathroom was tiny, but both were spotlessly clean and newly decorated. We will stay here again when we visit in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Carca_9
Reviews.Content: Very good location, the hotel looks knew, the room was very well decorated and the staff were very kind. Close to a lot of good restaurants and two metro entrances.

Reviews.Title: “second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: anthony49London
Reviews.Content: Never been to Paris before but would go back again especially to the Lenox. Celebrated our 20th Wedding Anniversary with a dinner cruise down the Seine and it was out of this world. Couldn't fault the hotel in any way. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: rainbowmaya
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my husband for a short break. Hotel was lovely, very well positioned in a street with supermarket, patisseries, bars, restaurants, and very close to 3 metro stations. Staff were very friendly and helpful, room comfortable and both this and bathroom were extremely clean. Honesty bar serving free tea/coffee each afternoon was a lovely idea. Only thing missing was tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Did not eat breakfast in the hotel (we eat very little for breakfast and at 15 euros each this seemed expensive) but bought pain au chocolat in the nearby patisserie. Would definitely stay there again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Rog
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a beautiful small hotel just off the Boulevard Montparnasse. It has comfortable rooms and nice beds. We got upgraded to one of the "Club" rooms facing the rear courtyard (of the neighboring hotel). The courtyard had a soothing fountain. This particular room had a more spacious bath than most. Housekeeping kept everything very clean and orderly. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. It was a most satisfying stay. The neighborhood is very pleasant. There is a small grocery a few doors up from the Lenox and a variety of shops, bakeries, and restaurants. The skyscraper Tour Montparnasse is nearby; its not much to look at but it offers some great views of the city. The area is also a bit out of the way; we did walk to Notre Dame, but its more than 30 minutes. Fortunately there is a Metro stop at the corner and several bus lines run near by that will take you to the Musee d'Orsay and the Lourve (on the #68), the ÃŽle de la CitÃ© (on the #58); the Hotel des Invalides and the Arc de Triomphe (on the #92) and the Eiffel Tower (on the #82). You can catch the train to Versailles at the Gare Montparnasee, a few blocks away. Its about a 10 minute walk (2 two stop bus ride) to the RER station at Port Royal to go to the airports.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jjoselee
Reviews.Content: Like all the Review, this hotel was perfect for our stay. Super close to the Metro with tons of stores/restaurants/shops within walking distance. Grocery store practically next door was a huge plus. Room were comfortable and clean. Somewhat small but definitely manageable for 2 people. Free Wireless Internet unlike the hotel in London we stayed at. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Hotel has a "Honesty Bar" throughout the night which I thought was kind of cool.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: needingadvicefl
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse was what I expected from reading previous reviews. The location was excellent with two metro stops within a block of the hotel. The rooms were small but clean. The service was very good and welcoming. The breakfast buffet was good with many choices. The only problem I had was with noisy neighbors on the last night of our stay. Since I didn't notify the front desk, I can't really complain. We had a wonderful time in Paris and the Lenox Montparnasse was a good choice and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: HIltonMagic
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days in France; six nights of which were spent at the Lenox Montparnasse in Paris. We really enjoyed our stay there. We upgraded our room to a junior suite based on the myriad reviews mentioning the base rooms were "tiny". I am so glad we did! We had a sitting room with fireplace, large bathroom, and bedroom. Both the room and the bathroom were spotlessly clean upon arrival and every day after. Not sure if this is due to the fact that we were on the top floor or perhaps just heavy sleepers, but we did not encounter issues with the street noise that others have mentioned (trucks making deliveries to the nearby restaurants/grocery store, etc). The staff all spoke very good English which was a plus at times. The neighborhood is filled with cafes and restaurants, and there is a grocery store a few doors down which came in handy for drinks and snacks. You are in between two metro stops (Vavin - line 4 and Edgar Quinet - line 6) so getting anywhere you want to go is not an issue. At the very most I think we made two transfers and that was only on one occasion. The patisserie a few doors down (past the grocery store) has great pain du chocolate and croissants, so breakfast was never an issue (although the hotel does offer it, we never elected to have breakfast there). They do have a computer in the lobby for guest use, but the rooms all have free wi-fi access, which we found to be fast and easy to use. Great for downloading photos from your camera at the end of a long day of sightseeing. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: GRG
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from 5 nights at the Lenox. This is my third visit to Paris and finding a reasonable hotel that does not break the bank can be a challenge. The LM fits the bill. Pros include: our "superior" classed room was clean, compact and comfortable, there was a safe for storing passports, etc., the lighting was excellent, pillows were comfy, a duvet cover was freshly laundered, staff spoke English and were friendly, and the hotel was very close to numerous restaurants, shops and metros. The only cons for us were the noise that echoed from a courtyard shared with another hotel (the lovely fountain is turned off at 10 p.m. and noise reverberates off adjacent bldg walls) and the distance from the Seine rendered walking to and fro a bit of a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: strawberryMaryland
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with the quality of service and the hospitality received during my stay. In addition, I was most pleased with the cleaniness of the room. This hotel is an excellent choice and I will certainly return when I visit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: SOHEL5272
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days in Paris to celebrate our anniversary. The room was superb, the staff were very nice and very helpful. Location wise, it's great. There are 3 stations nearby - Vavin, Edgar Quinel and Montparnasse. Montparnasse is very big, so only use this station if you have to. Even though on a map pf the metro, the location appears to be southern and not central Paris, the metro is so efficient and quick that this doesn't matter. We went by Eurostar. Fron Gare du Nord to Vavin is 14 stops on the metro. That took about 15 minutes maximum!! Superb. The hotel is in a lovely quiet street, but it is just off the main road to superb restaurants and shopping facilities. Fodd is expensive. However, there is a supermarket next to the hotel e.g. bottle of water in the hotel I think costs 3.5 euros, from the supermarket it costs 0.65 euros - quite a difference. Breakfast I bought from the local bakers - a lot cheaper. The hotel room was beautiful and I would definitely stay there again. Infact, I intend to.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Flowergirl1959
Reviews.Content: You simply cannot go wrong with booking this hotel. Great location, surrounded by plenty of restaurants and cafes. Conveniently located to metro stops. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Would definitely recommend you purchase the hotel's breakfast -- better deal than eating at a nearby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is as good as the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: treaclebob
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel mid September and it really is as good as the reviews we had read on here before we booked. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The staff were very friendly and efficient. The hotel is well placed for seeing the sights - the Tour Montparnasse is practically on the doorstep and well worth a visit. We actually walked to the Eiffel Tower though it is a bit of a hike. All in all, a lovely hotel at a good price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “small, friendly and very clean”
Reviews.Author: mr2610
Reviews.Content: A small clean hotel, with helpful and friendly staff. Rooms were clean and cosy. Located in a quiet road surround by a range of typical French shops. Would stop here again. Missed the tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but these were freely available in the dining area in the afternoon, together with a self service bar and honesty box.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Donna9197
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are a metro (subway) traveler. There are three metro stations close to the hotel, the closest being the Vavin station. The Edgar Quinet and Montparnasse stations are just 2 or 3 blocks from the hotel. If you arrive in Paris via the Nord station, take the metro line to the Vavin station, just a block from the hotel. The staff was courteous and spoke English. They have a buffet breakfast (min. charge 8 euros), and an honesty bar which is open 24 hours. There is also free internet use available, as well as a computer in the lobby you can use. Our room was attractively furnished, small, yet comfortable, with a full bathroom, complete with bidet. On Rue Delambre, where the hotel is located, there is a great bakery a few doors from the hotel, and a fresh produce market, as well. We Americans like our breakfast, but did not want to use the hotel buffet. We had a little difficulty getting something to fuel our heavy duty sightseeing days, but settled into coffee at the hotel (2,60 euros each), then fresh fruit and a croissant from the neighboring shops. The area where this hotel is located is busy (as is all of Paris, it seems), but safe, well-lit and clean. There were several restaurants and bars on rue Delambre, but we did not try any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, lovelly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Gabiru
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 days at Lenox hotel with my wife on our honeymoon on september/09. We find this hotel at trip advisor website based on the guest reviews and we can say that it exceed our expectations. The staff was especially kind and eficient. Our room was very clean and well decorated as the whole hotel itself. There were many metro stations around the hotel and we found its location very good. We certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: mark7kram
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lenox Montparnasse based on recommendations on this site. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is lovely, with small but well appointed and clean rooms with free wireless internet. The street is perfect, with restaurants, wine stores, and even a laundromat. Vavin and Edgar Quinet metro stops are 3 minutes away. We were given a room upgrade with a balcony immediately on checkin. We originally planned to stay here for 4 nights, but liked Paris and the hotel so much that we asked to extend our stay for 4 more nights. The hotel staff immediately changed the reservation and extended us the initial rate and let us keep our room. A bit pricey, but I can't really think of anything they could improve on, so well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, impeccable service and cleanliness, central location in a walkable neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Bubu_2002
Reviews.Content: This place deserved 5 stars. We would stay here again. Such a pleasant small hotel. Very courteous and wonderful staff, regardless of whether you're a native French speaker or a beginner. The staff was so great- checked us in early without prior notice, reliably called cabs at very early hours, and mailed out our postcards for no extra charge. The rooms are comfortable and clean, but small, which we didn't mind. Both courtside and street rooms were quiet for sleeping. The neighborhood around the hotel is vibrant, filled with restaurants, bakeries, specialty stores, not posh but not at all unsafe, just a place where actual families live. The location is 2 minute walk to metro, great for exploring Paris. You won't regret your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleFussy1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after consulting Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. It was perfectly located with plenty of fantastic restaurants close by. In fact you could easily spend your trip exploring the area around the hotel, there is so much to see and do. Having a metro station at either end of the street meant it was easy to go further afield and we both felt the area was very safe. The only slight drawback was on our last night when we could hear noise from the room below. But taking everything into consideration I would definately stay here again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lioness728
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides exceptional service at comfortable prices. The front desk staff were outstanding in assisting with all our needs. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The hotel is centrally located near the metro, great restaurants, cafes, bank/atm and grocery store. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we look forward to returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: halifaxns
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 night stay at Lenox Montparnasse with my spouse. It's a great little hotel in a wonderful neighbourhood and I'd return there if I'm ever back in Paris. Location: For a sightseeing trip to experience Paris, I thought the location was ideal. The hotel is located between two metro lines (Vavin on line #4 and Edgar Quinet on line #6). The metro stations are no more than a 3 minute walk away. On the hotel's street, there are two very good wine merchants, a bakery, small grocery store, meat store, cheese store and a few great cafes. This neighbourhood doesn't feel as touristy as others we visited during our trip and made the location of the hotel for us even better. It was great to come back in the evening and have supper (or a drink) within a few steps of the hotel. Neighbourhood felt very safe in the evenings as there were always many people around. Rooms: We stayed in room 29. It was quite small, but big enough for 2 people who are pretty comfortable with each other ;) Our room overlooked the courtyard at the back of the hotel and was very quiet in the evenings. Bed was comfortable. Good water pressure and hot water in the shower. Staff: All were great! Front desk staff always greeted you with a smile and were eager to help. Amenities: The hotel has an honour bar. We didn't use it as there are so many cafes in the neighbourhood. There's a computer in the lobby and you can print from it for 0.50 euro/page. Free wifi in the room worked great with my blackberry. For the 8 nights, we were very comfortable. It was a great place to stay and was well located for seeing the rest of the sights of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Directions needed..”
Reviews.Author: dreamcometrue21
Reviews.Content: Hi, after reading the reviews and checking out the photo's I have fallen in love with this hotel so my partner and I are going to stay here in November. I was just wondering if anyone could tell me directions from Metro Vavin to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: Pamhain
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through tripadvisor. It was a great find. The location is perfect. 3 metro stations wih 2-3 mins walk from hotel. Plenty of nice restaurants and cafes close by and Jardin De Luxembourg for a picnic (if money is a bit tight) is only 5 mins walk away. The room was small as mentioned before but not uncomfortable. They are very clean and quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris. Staff were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great neighborhood and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelopalooza
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great little neighborhood in Paris. We used Google Maps to "walk the streets" with a street view before we booked our Hotel to make sure that their were restaurants, shops and metro's near by. The Positives: Great neighborhood - not a tourist trap. Good location: We walked to the Isle de City, the Eifel Tower and the Louvre all within 20-30 minutes while we took in the sights on the streets. Great Location to metro: The M4 is at one end of the short street and the M6 is at the other end. You can cover almost all of Paris with these two lines. Tons of restaurants within one block (from French to Creperie's to Lebansese to Thai). Convenient: A Boulangerie/Patisserie, a fruit shop and a grocery store all literally within a few doors of the Hotel. Free WiFi! The negatives: Breakfast is way over priced. You are looking at 50 euro or $75 US dollars for a croissant, cheese and coffee for 2 adults and 2 children. So go to the patisserie/grocery store instead. The rooms are small by non-european standards like in every hotel in Paris/Europe. Rooms could maybe use some touch ups but they were in pretty good shape and clean.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: acwilcheck
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse exceeded our expectations. It is in a wonderful area, close to great restaurants, grocery stores, and metro stops. The rooms were clean, internet service is included, the staff is unbelievably helpful and friendly. We booked the hotel for the first part of our 2 week trip then booked them again for our two return trips to Paris. It is an older boutique hotel, with no restaurant, but they do have a small buffet breakfast, and a bar in the evening. I would definitely return to them again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Hanseatin
Reviews.Content: If you wanted to stay in Montparnasse the Lenox is the hotel to be. The hotel is not only in the middle of a vivid district but also in walking distance to many points of interest plus several metro lines taking you wherever you want. My single room was huge, nicely furnished and exceptionally clean compared to many other hotels I stayed in Paris. A big plus is the staff (my personal favorite was Yadira) who always welcomes you with a big smile and makes you feel very welcomed. I absolutely recommend the Lenox and am sure you will enjoy your stay there as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: streakybird
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel, staff were really friendly and spoke in a variety of languages. There is a bar in the hotel called the Honesty Bar, great concept, where you serve yourself and 'honestly' write down your orders, to which you hand in at the desk. Once you check out, you pay for the drinks. Internet is also free in the rooms, all come with a flat screen tv with general channels. The rooms facing the street means that there will be a little noise in the mornings, especially mondays with all the deliveries etc, just close the window. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL !!! There are 2 stations nearby, use the Vavin metro as it is far less busier unless of course you need to use the Montparnasse one then its a short walk in the opposite direction. Most tourist sights are all located next to metro stations and the stations are all really close and fast, so should not take longer than 20 min underground. Metro prices are 10 Billets for around 12 Euro. We needed 30 billets, which is still cheaper than if you buy the 3-4 day passes at 30 euro per person. Food is a very touchy subject, AVOID if you can ordering too much from the cafe nearby as you could easily spend 30 euro on 5 drinks. Try visiting typically french restaurants, ones that do not include an english version, then you will pay the prices they pay. AVOID CHAMPS-ELYSEES... waste of money for fairly poor food. Tips. buy wine as its cheap, eat breakfast at the many pasties and cakes shops, take advantage of happy hour (6-9pm), eat in cafes where the parisians eat, speak a little french even if you cant...try, dont take children not much for them and you will be paying the same prices, visit attractions very early otherwise you will queue for hours, dont bother with the eiffel tower got up the tower of montparnasse...amazing views...cheaper price, watch your bags, ignore the sellers and enjoy yourself

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: GoingPlaces30
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on others' trip advisor reviews and it lived up the the expectations. It was a bargain, close to the metro and many excellent restaurants. Don't worry about breakfast not being included--there are several little bakeries nearby. Also, there is free internet on the room TV's.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucygfromlondon
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a lovely small hotel in Montparnasse - it's very clode to the metro and Montparnasse is quite a hip area so there are lots of cool bars and cafes nearby. The montparnasse cemetry and the Montparnasse tower are both very close tot he hotel and definitely worth a look - the tower provides the best views of Paris, much much better than the eiffel tower. We got a deal for one night at 110 euros - and I think this is pretty typical of this standard of hotels in europe - it was very comfortable, compact (but not uncomfortably so) and very clean - I would recommend it to anyone. It's especially good if you're arriving via montparnasse or leaving paris via montparnasse, as the station is a 6 minute walk away (with luggage!).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy, great location, and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Milbau
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the service and accomodations at the Lenox Montparnasse Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful (and also spoke English which was beneficial due to our inadequate French language skills). The room, although small in size, was very clean and tastefully decorated with a wonderfully comfortable bed. The bathroom was very spacious, and the shower had excellent water pressure with plenty of hot water. We appreciated having a computer with free internet access readily available in the lobby. The hotel location couldnâ€™t have been better as it was on a quiet street but mere steps away from busy Montparnasse Boulevard. There was plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby, along with several convenient Metro/RER stations. We were absolutely delighted with our visit and canâ€™t wait to return to Paris someday. We will definitely stay at the Lenox Montparnasse Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little gem”
Reviews.Author: Bonedigger
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel. The front desk staff spoke great english, always welcomed me and was helpful. The room was small but very tastefully done. The bathroom was quite large, the toiletries were high end and the wifi in the room (free) worked great. A few english TV stations, an elevator ( a definite bonus) and a computer in the lobby for guests. I would stay here again in a second and would recommend it highly. It is easily accessible from three metro stations (Vavin, Montparnasse and Edgar Quintet). There is a very good food street market on Sunday mornings one street over.

Reviews.Title: “Check if breakfast is included in your deal..”
Reviews.Author: tripkettle
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hotel over the last weekend..my stay was very comfortable and the rooms are also kept very clean..housekeeping was very good at the hotel..the only thing you might want to check is whether breakfast is included in your deal..i had booked a package through Eurostar and was surprised to learn that breakfast was not included..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TommyJoan
Reviews.Content: During may we enjoyed a lovely stay in Paris at the Hotel Lenox Montparnasse. Plus Points Location - excellent, 2 mins walk from the Edgar Quinet Metro station and just 3 or 4 mins from the Vavin Metro station, so you can reach all parts of the city pretty easily. We went to the French Open at Roland Garos and it took us about 30 mins each way. Service - staff were friendly without being exceptional, displaying a high quality business style service rather than that of a small Paris leisure hotel. Hotel - small but very clean, quality fixtures and fittings throughout. A relaxed, comfortable atmosphere. It has a smart modern bar/breakfast room area, but the prices of both breakfast and the drinks were expensive and unrealistic. Room - despite concerns in other reviews, we found our room to be just about ideal, but typically small like many of Paris's petit hotels. Special Mention - we again had lunch at a little cafe just off the Champs Elysees - It was called Cafe Week-End (Rue de Washington). Well worth visiting, great food and service - a busy, lively little place. If popularity equals quality, then this place is 5 star!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lzw2v7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Recommended by my Co-worker and we were not disappointed. Great location! Metro and Main train stations 5 min walk. Hotel staff was extremely helpful. Room was small but very clean. Free wireless internet is an added bonus. Location is very nice within walking distance of great restaurants and coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect French Experience”
Reviews.Author: kbdelapaz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on others' Trip Advisor reviews and were not even remotely disappointed. We arrived at the hotel after a long overnight plane ride and several wrong turns within the city - in other words tired and frustrated. We were immediately made to feel welcome by the young woman at the desk. The sense of hospitality was incredible and very much appreciated. Despite the very early hour, our room was ready within the hour. We immediately relaxed. The room itself was comfortable and more than adequate. The hotel's footprint is small, but they make the most of it. Not much city noise - though our room overlooked the courtyard in back. EVERY encounter with the hotel staff was a pleasure. They were always polite and accommodating in every way. The hotel's location was excellent as well. Literally a two-minute walk to two Metro stops with easy access to many of the major sights of Paris. If you're in a walking mood, you can be at Notre Dame in half an hour and Jardin de Luxembourg (gorgeous) in five minutes. The hotel is surrounded by wonderful patisseries and creperies and cafes. You will not go hungry (except maybe on Sunday, when most of them are closed.) This hotel was a major part of why my experience in Paris was so wonderful and memorable. If I ever return to Paris (fingers crossed) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: OhioSkier
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel beyond our expectations in location, amenities, front-desk help (superb). It was a delight to stay there. What I, as American, would think of in a typical French hotel. Not huge or touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for a trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: saich
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to affordable rates and the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was quite pleased overall.....the rooms were clean, the hotel staff was helpful. The map they give you upon checkin was great, it has little maps of the metro and the RER, versus the HUGE ones that they give you when you buy tickets. The complimentary umbrella was a nice touch. The honesty bar is handy but WAY overpriced...you can buy a bottle of wine in the store on the street for what you pay for a glass. Visit the cheese shop for some excellent selection, and the little bakery for good pain de chocolate. We did not spend much time in our room since we were out enjoying the city, but it is a tight sqeeze for two adults with one medium piece of luggage each. We had to maneuver and strategically store our luggage to be able to move around. The bathroom was spacious and has a good hair dryer. Also, the in room free wifi was excellent. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything going on around you, but I always sleep in ear plugs so this didn't bother me too much. One more comment...my husband and I could barely fit in to the lift with our luggage and the two of us. It is a tight sqeeze. Overall, this is not a five star hotel, but is a great option for budget travellers with two metro stops three minutes away and great lunch options to pickup lunch before you venture into Paris. Do not hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: KAllan26
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived back from an amazing romantic weekend in Paris with my boyfriend, I really can't recommend this hotel highly enough! Our club room was clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated, and was the perfect size for our three night stay. Great sized bathroom too! The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the free tea and coffee between 2pm and 6pm was perfect, and the location of the gorgeous little hotel itself was ideal! This hotel gets 10/10 for everything - a fantastic choice for our one-year anniversary city break!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Stuff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAvg
Reviews.Content: Great stay and very quiet room. Very clean and bright. Professional staff and great service. Absolutely recommended for pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: ExetermONKEY
Reviews.Content: The is a very well priced 3 star hotel in a fantastic location. We will return. We stayed here for 4 days to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday. The hotel is located in a lovely quite area close to two Metro stations (Vavin & Edgar Quinet). If you arrive from Charles De Gaulle, then simply jump on the train to Gare du Nord (they leave every 7 minutes or so) and then get on Metro line 4 heading towards Port d'Oleans. When you get off at Vavin the hotel is located 2 minutes walk away on rue Delambre. We purchased a "Paris Visite" card which allows you unlimited use of metro, bus and train services within zones 1 - 3 of Paris. These zones are more than adequate for the main tourist sites in Paris, but if you want to go out Versaille or Charles De Gaulle then you will need to buy an additional ticket to cover the travel outside of zone 3. The area around the hotel has numerous restaurants and bistros. We did not take advantage of them as we had already seen other places that we wanted to visit; the guys on reception can recommend ones nearby if you fancy something local to the hotel. The hotel is well maintained and the staff are super friendly and speak fluent english (they are also happy to put up with poor attempts at speaking French!). The rooms are small but perfectly formed. They are very clean and the showers are fantastic - just what you need after walking for miles around the various tourist sites. We did not have any issues with noise in the hotel and our request for a courtroom facing room on the 4th floor was granted without any fuss (I emailed the request to them 4 weeks before arriving). There is an honesty bar system next to reception and the hotel also offers free tea and coffee in the afternoons. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel and I would recommend that people save their holiday money and instead buy coffee and a croissant from one of the many cafes/patisseries near the hotel. For great restaurants I would recommend jumping on line 4 of the Metro and getting off at Saint Germain des-Pres. There are loads of good restaurants within 5 minutes walk and the food quality was a little better than some of the mass tourist joints in the Latin Quarter. Finally, if you want to vist the Louvre or the Tour Eiffel then I would suggest getting there at 09.00. The queues in July and August can be crazy and getting there early will mean you can take in both of these fantastic locations without being crushed by fellow travellers. (If you are reasonably fit and healthy then use the stairs for the first two levels of the Eiffel Tower. It will save you loads of time vs. queuing for a lift, help you lose a few of the croissant related pounds and give you an amazing view of Paris as you climb the stairs!)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: velocitytime
Reviews.Content: We didn't spend much time in our room, but enjoyed every moment of our stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. The friendly staff, the pleasing room decor, the complimentary wifi in the room. We were traveling with our young son and were upgraded to a mini suite on the 5th floor facing the street which included a nice balcon and a coffee maker. We loved that the blanket was a comforter with a duvet cover, rather than blanket and topsheet which somehow always come apart. Water pressure was great, and we were intrigued by the very eco/euro 2-flush option for the toilet. We loved being in a vibrant neighborhood - check out Rue du Montparnasse a block away for more Crepe options than you'd ever imagine. Street noise was never really an issue, but then again, we came from Manhattan, perhaps we just don't hear it as much. Our son enjoyed the afternoon cookies downstairs, which accompany tea and coffee. In addition to being right by 2 good metro stops, there are also several convenient bus stops nearby, one of which took us to the heart of Paris (Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Opera, Boulevard Haussmann) and another to the Eiffel Tower for the price of a metro ticket. (You can take an unfolded stroller on a Paris bus!) Nearby rue Vavin leading to the Jardin du Luxembourg is also a great shopping street for old and young, crowned by Amorino Gelato before you enter the Jardin. Lenox Montparnasse was the perfect base for all of our Paris adventures. One comment - the in-room safe in our room was only large enough for passports or other small items. It will not accommodate a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Drai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox from July 2-6th. I had read the reviews on TA prior to booking, so I requested a room on an upper floor facing the courtyard which is what we received. We never heard any noise from the streets as mentioned from other travelers. The room was tiny, but once we unpacked and stored everything away it was more than fine. The bathroom was much bigger then expected with a tub and everything. It was quite comfortable for the small amount of time we spent there. They have free WiFi in the rooms which is very convenient and a computer in the lobby. We arrived in the afternoon and enjoyed free tea in the Honesty bar before hitting the streets of Paris. The hotel is conveniently located near two subway stops. We took the metro everywhere, itâ€™s a great system. The hotel staff made reservations for us as required, they were always very helpful. They lent us a corkscrew and gave us ice as we brought back a bottle of wine to our room after a long hot day. There is a wine store across the street from the hotel. We never ate breakfast at the hotel as we found it expensive but we did fill up our bottles of water every morning prior to leaving. Be careful if you call for a taxi, they start charging you once the hotel calls so you might be best to flag one out on the street. Montparnasse is a nice area and for what we paid (120 Euro) a night, I believe this was a steal. We went to Williâ€™s Wine bar for dinner one night which was very good.
