We had the best chicken Shawarma at Al Diwan on George V just across from the Four Seasonâ€™s. Cost us like 12 Euro for two and a coke then went to Laduree on Champs ElysÃ©e for tea and dessert. It was perfect. I suggest doing the bateau mouche at night. We brought wine in our stainless steel water bottle and then went to Pont des Arts where we enjoyed the rest of our wine and people watching. Enjoy and donâ€™t get caught up in the craziness of Paris just go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PFPJ
Reviews.Content: Like others, we booked because of the good reviews on tripadvisor. I would agree with all the other comments - the staff were friendly (not something you tend to expect in Paris!), and the room (on the front, third floor, with small balcony) was comfortable. The staff's attention to detail was excellent - our air conditioning was not functioning one morning, and without even being asked, it was fixed by the time we came back from our day's outing. The location is convenient to metro and to the Gare Montparnasse, and there are a number of good restaurants in the immediate vicinity, ranging from mid range up to gourmet/luxurious (le Dome). The honesty bar was an excellent idea - we availed, but (unlike another reviewer) we COULD remember what we had(!). A nice way to treat guests... and it allowed us to have a nightcap and talk to other guests as well. We did not try the breakfast, preferring to grab a coffee and a croissant/baguette nearby. All in all, the best hotel we have experienced in any European capital for a city break - and I have seen most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: MickQ
Reviews.Content: Booked the Lenox on the basis of previous reviews and was not disappointed. Close to main railway station and Metro stops, very easy to walk from the Air France bus terminus. The complimentary afternoon tea in the lounge and the honesty bar more than make up for the typical small Parisian bedrooms. Very friendly staff only too happy to provide any advice required. As for location ..... surrounded by restaurants, pastry shops and cinemas with ashort stroll to a Galleries Lafeyette. For an introduction to Paris it is hard to go past Lenox and Montparnasse. Within a short walk to Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, Sorbonne, Tour Montparnasse, etc it gets very close to working Parisians without the mass tourist numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Great recovery from a possible mess”
Reviews.Author: PerthBobcat
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris after a long trip from Western Australia to discover that there had been a mix up with our Wotif booking at the hotel. The staff immediately offered us a drink in the lounge and got to work. They found us an alternative, good hotel at no extra charge and offered to escort us to it. In addition they offered us a drink that evening in the hotel and breakfast the following day before we set off for the south (which was a very good breakfast). The staff showed a great recovery to an earlier mix up and left us feeling very positive about the hotel in a situation that could have been pretty bad. We will try them again (But we will check all our e-bookings again before departure in the future!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: isis109
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and wasn't at all disappointed. The hotel is about 2 mins walk from Vavin station which is one stop South of Montparnasse on metro line 4 ( the purple one), so the location was just fantastic. The hotel is on a lovely street with a Monoprix supermarket 2 doors away, and a patisserie, a fromagerie, a chacuterie and more, all just a stone's throw away. We were in a club room on the 2nd floor and it was extremely spacious compared to past experience of Paris hotels. There was a flat screen TV and a keyboard so you could access the internet, although we never figured out how to work it., a cupboard with an electronic safe and plenty of space to hang clothes, and a minibar. No tea/coffee facilities but the hotel provides free tea and coffee during the afternoons from 1 or 2pm onwards although we never used this as we were always out sight-seeing. The bathroom was also big and clean with a fully functionning shower and plentiful hot water. . The window blocked out pretty much all noise. I read other reviews on this site where people said they were disturbed by the bin men in the mornings but we barely heard them. We followed Tripadvisor advice and ate breakfast outside the hotel - there are so many places to choose from, and all close by. We never used the honesty bar. There is a quiet pub directly opposite the hotel, which we went to instead. We were pretty shocked at the prices of alcohol everywhere in Paris. Expect to pay around Â£8 or Â£9 for a pint of beer. Wine was more reasonable. We also found it impossible to eat a sit down meal in a restaurant for less than Â£70 for the two of us. On that note, we absolutely loved the food at "Le Relais" just opposite Vavin metro. Its a chain that only offers one main course - steak frites,but was it amazing. Save room for the Creme Brulee there. I have visited Paris maybe 15 times and the Lenox is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I would definitely be happy to return there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Albertine21
Reviews.Content: Thoroughy enjoyed my stay at the Lenox and would recommend it for business or leisure trips. Yes, the rooms are on the small side but it's a pleasure to spend time in the lovely bar (which also has wireless access) . Rue Delambre has a lot of history and there are some great photos of the Left Bank writers and artists on display. As well as all the cafes and bars around, you can put together a really good picnic lunch from the Italian deli, cheese shop and bakery in the street - a small M&S cool bag comes in handy - and it's a short walk to either the Luxembourg Gardens or the atmospheric Montparnasse cemetery . I felt quite safe getting back late in the evening after seeing a play or film as the cafes are busy till around midnight. The standard of housekeeping in the hotel is very high and the reception staff couldn't be more helpful. I'll certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, and great staff - location nice but a long walk from the centre, and noisy!”
Reviews.Author: GBland
Reviews.Content: I have very little more to add to the previous reviews which are pretty accurate. The location is excellent if you are planning to use the metro, but if you are like us and love to walk rather than use the transport, you may find this hotel much further than you wish from the centre and the main attractions (about 45mins walk to the eiffel tower). There are however loads of lovely restaurants, cafes and bars and pretty much all you need in the area. I would also recommend that you visit Montparnasse Cemetery which is pretty and peaceful, and have quite a few celebrity plots - a five min walk from the hotel. The metro's are 2 mins either side of the hotel, depending on where you are going and which line you need. The staff at this hotel were lovely, and friendly and speak good english. Though we speak little french and arrived speaking french the receptionist asked would we like to speak in french or english - we opted for french as we needed to learn more and the receptionist helped us out on this - speaking in english where we were struggling - she was very patient...... The bar was very plush and we liked the decor. The honesty bar was a great idea and to be honest, not much more than the bars and restaurants were. The white wine was a lovely Sancerre and 6â‚¬ a glass. If you know your wine then you will know that in the UK a glass of Sancerre in our restaurants and bars would be about Â£6 a glass so I found this normal pricing. The beer however was very expensive, but it was everywhere else also, with a bottle of Budweiser being also 6â‚¬ ! There is a computer in the lobby which has free internet access for guests and also there is free internet access in the rooms via the TV which is a little slower but more private. You can also get free internet access in your room if you have your laptop with you. The rooms are small but adequate. We were upgraded to a club room (I think this just means we get a bath in the ensuite). Everything was adequate and shower lovely and powerful and easy to control the temperature. Complementary toiletries were also nice. TV has a range of channels, but limited english speaking ones - unless you find a programme or film that is still in english with french subtitles. But when your in Paris - you wont want to watch much tv! The only compliant was had was the noise. We only stayed one night for a flying visit to Paris, and we had room 10 - first floor next to the lift and facing the back courtyard. We were woken at 6am by a lot of banging and music which seemed to be coming from the within the hotel. We could hear people walking around and music from downstairs, and the lift being used. This is the only thing that put a damper on our trip, as we knew we had a long day ahead. If we had been staying longer we would have asked to change room to maybe one on a higher floor. There is a place to leave your luggage if you need to, but as before, remember the hotel is a bit of a trek from the main attractions, so bear in mind that you will have to travel back to collect your items. Overall we liked the hotel and had a good stay. For a 3 star and for the price they charge for the room this is a bit of a hidden gem and I dont think you can go wrong here.... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Although I would return, this Hotel is Not a "5"... Here's the honest TRUTH, Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: cigbar1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful 7 night stay in Paris, all of them spent at the Lenox. I too, chose this hotel because of the rave reviews on this web-site. Some of the reviews were accurate, and some, not so accurate (in my opinion). Some things criticized, cannot be discounted, especially if they're true. This holds true for the positive things about this hotel, as well. The PROS... -Absolutely Great Location- everything you need is within walking distance, including: Metro, restaurants, bistros, cafes, bakeries, bars, shops, markets in every direction, down every street, and on every corner... you name it, it's there. All in a safe, clean, non-touristy, peaceful, but not secluded neighborhood. No matter where we went in Paris (and we went everywhere), we were glad to be "home" in what we felt was the best area of all. -The Hotel Staff was fabulous. Just about everyone spoke English. All were polite and extremely friendly. The room was clean and the beds were appointed with nice linens and spreads, and very comfortable. -The Honesty Bar, although a bit expensive (as are most drinks in Paris), was in a beautiful room (also used for breakfast). Bathroom in my room (Club Room) was quite large and clean... (don't know why Europe uses half glass shower doors) The CONS... -Rooms are tiny (Standard & Club). I know this is Paris, but I've seen larger rooms. I opted for the "larger" Club room, which measured approx. 10'X12'... throw in a desk, chair, wardrobe, TV stand, mimi-bar, Queen size bed, 2-night stands, 2 people and luggage; you're talking tight quarters. It took us a half hour to figure out how to arrange everything to fit. Other than the small wardrobe, there's no place to put your clothes, or suitcases. Better travel light. What's crazy is that the bathroom is about half the size of the main room; large, with wasted space that could have been used in the bedroom area. -Bathrooms and some rooms need updating and repair. As some posters have mentioned, there are broken tiles and missing grout. In my room (#59) there was also some damage to the ceiling above my bed. While looking a a Standard room, I notice damage to the mirror frame and damage to the wall. This detracts from the overall level of class of this hotel. -The elevator is Tiny, (as some have posted). There is no way you can fit a wheel chair and 2 people with luggage in there (as some say they have). It's suitable (but tight) for 2, with 2 pieces of luggage. There is only one elevator in the building. -There's no courtyard, as depicted in some posters photos. Yes, there is a courtyard behind the hotel, however, it belongs to another hotel. This was a disappointment for me, because I had anticipated sitting out there with a bottle of wine and eating lunch. Maybe you can get away with it, but I opted to avoid the embarrassment of being asked to leave, so I didn't. Overall, I'd probably return here, mainly because of the location. It's a good Hotel... you are getting what you're paying for, nothing more, nothing less. In saying that, in all honesty, this is not a hotel that deserves a rating of "5". If you expect that, you may be somewhat disappointed, as I was. If you want a hotel with a true "5" rating, you may have to review more hotels, very carefully and probably pay more money. Also, don't overlook some of the compaints posted by others. They may be true. I found that some of them were.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - everything i read was true”
Reviews.Author: choldca
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week-long stay at Lenox Montparnasse. As this was mine and my daughter's first trip to Paris, we were not sure where to stay so we really relied on the travel reviews when we chose this hotel. And disappointed we were not! The hotel was wonderful; all the reviews accurately described the rooms, cleanliness, friendliness of staff, location, location, location! As much as you will travel througout Paris to see the museums and attractions, we did not find any nicer spot or areas we would rather be in. The Montparnasse area is loaded with streets and streets of busy cafes, restaurants, shopping and even outdoor markets. It was a great, lively area. We also felt very safe in the area while out and about each evening. My tips: we found it was much cheaper to go out and purchase our own coffee and pastries in the morning, rather than eat at the hotel . As well there is a grocery store (Franprix) just 2 doors away and for even slightly cheaper prices ; and a few short blocks away (Monoprix), were great spots to pickup beverages which could be kept in the room's mini bar fridge. I would not recommend taking the RER train from CDG airport if it is your first time and you have heavy luggage! We made this mistake and we found connecting to the Metro was very difficult since there were MANY stairs! For 16E for two of us I would rather have spent double that to have a shuttle directly to the hotel. IT also took us close to 2 hours which I know was based on lack of knowledge where to go, etc. For those who even pack umbrellas, there is no need. The hotel has a rack complimentary tfor guests right at the front door. Another nice touch by the hotel was the complimentary tea/coffee and biscuits each afternoon. The free internet is another bonus easy to use in room in case you want to bring your own laptop. And finally the comments on the rooms being noisy on the street side.....we did not find this bothered us at all. We liked to have the french doors open and feel alive while in gay Paree. I would defintely consider this hotel on my next trip to Paris...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jswaddell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse and found it to be a perfect hotel in a lovely neighborhood. We arrived in Paris at the Gare du Nord and from there it was about a 15 or 20 minutes ride on the Metro to the Vavin stop, approx. half a block away from the hotel -- very convenient for us as we pack lightly, but heavy packers may want to avoid the Metro, especially at rush hour. It seems like a lot of people have complained about the noise in the hotel room, we had a club room, facing the courtyard and it was very peaceful and quiet. We often left the window cracked to hear the small fountain in the courtyard. IIRC, the Classic room faces the street and is less expensive, if you want a courtyard facing room you must book a Club room. They cost a little more but they are also a little bigger and noise was not an issue for us. If you book far enough in advance (think 2 months) you can get a promotional rate booking through the website. We found it to be a fantastic price for what you get. In regards to location, we found that we could get all over Paris via Metro with a minimum amount of transfers. The Vavin station is half a block in one direction and the Edgar Quinet stop is half a block in the other direction. Many of the places we went were on one of these 2 lines which was marvelously convenient. The staff were very courteous and spoke fluent English. High speed internet and wifi in the room for no extra fee was a great bonus as well. The immediate neighborhood has a small grocery (more like a large convenience store), cinema, bars, restaurants, cafe, brasserie, laundromat.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GiGi202
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Paris and first stay at the Lenox Montparnasse hotel. I would definitely stay there again. Yes, the rooms are on the small side but most rooms in Europe are so get over it. When you're in Paris you should be enjoying the city and not spending a ton of time in the room. I was splitting the cost with a friend so it wasn't that bad but with the exchange rate rooms in Europe are just going to be more expensive. We were in Paris for 6 nights so I preferred paying slightly more for a better stay since we would be there for a longer vacation. I loved the fact that the Hotel had free internet in the room as well as a business center downstairs that you could use. I also loved the fact that there was someone at the desk 24 hours. Not all of the smaller hotels in Paris have this. The location of the Lenox is great. It might be slightly further away from some of the main tourist destinations if you are looking to walk everywhere but it is only a short Metro ride to everything you want to see. There are actually a couple of different metro lines within a very short walk from the hotel which was very convenient. The Hotel is in a great area that is really vibrant and one that I actually prefer over being in the main tourist center. What was really convenient was that the Lenox is within walking distance from one of the stops for the shuttle busses that Air France operates that will take you into the city from the airport. This was really great. Another plus about the Lenox is there are tons of great places to eat and even great shops and boutiques within walking distance from the hotel. On the weekends they run a market a block away from the hotel. On Saturday you can find fresh meat and produce and on Sunday art from local artists. We never ate the breakfast at the Lenox but would rather stop and get coffee and a crepe on the street. I think this is probably a better deal than the breakfast they offer in the hotel. There is also a grocery store on the same block as the hotel if you want to pick up a few munchies for the room. Or you can run across the street to the cheese store and grab some fabulous cheese. I really don't have anything bad to say about my stay here. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: braingirl
Reviews.Content: The staff exceeded my expectations. Very friendly, knowledgable,and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. A great location to immerse yourself in a great neighborhood and live like a parisian...not a touristy area. Also close to the most beautiful park in Paris, Jardin de Luxenbourg for relaxation or exercise. If I return to Paris I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spotted_TN
Reviews.Content: Great location, right near two metro stops, and in a lovely neighborhood with restaurants, a cinema, bakeries, and a laundromat. The desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and the room was wonderful, especially the spacious bathroom. I have zero complaints! We loved it. Tip: We got a great price by booking early, about six weeks in advance.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Small Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: PrinceRaider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on May 22-24th and what reviewers have said is absolutely true and accurate. The staff are overwhelmingly wonderful, friendly, and extremely helpful. When you approach the front desk, you are greeted with smiling staff members that are genuinely ready to help and provide any type of advice. We would particularly like to thank Julia for her hospitality and helpfulness. The hotel has a bar but very different from what you expect - it is an unsupervised honor bar open 7x24 where you can help yourself at will, record your purchases, and then turn the selection card into the front desk. This is the type of atmosphere that this hotel is built on and is very pleasant and easy going. Transportation by subway to any tourist location is extremely easy with two stations within two minutes walking distance from the hotel - the Edgar Quinet and Vavin Stations are right there for your convenience to anywhere you might like to travel. When we arrived in Paris at DeGaulle Airport, we took the Air France Bus to Montparnasse, unloaded at Gare de Montparnasse, and then just walked to the hotel - it was so close that it was not difficult to walk there even with heavy luggage. If anyone reading this should wonder where this hotel is visually, you can always locate it anywhere in Paris by locating the Tour Montparnasse (the tallest black building in Paris) as the hotel is just about a block from this location. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is non-touristy and quaint with many sidewalk cafes and bakeries which makes for a pleasant walk - I should add that Le Coupole Restaurant is just through an archway across from the hotel which will take you right to the next street next to the restaurant. It was very helpful to have access to free internet in the lobby by the front desk. I don't think you can go wrong staying at this hotel: the value is excellent, the location is perfect, and the staff is wonderful. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: danslenoir
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a most amenable hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff, and most importantly in a decent location not too far at all from the majority of places in town a visitor to Paris might want to check out. I was very pleased to find free internet access in our room via the TV which came in handy for checking out restaurants, opening times of places etc, even if it was a little slow and cumbersome to use. There was also free internet access in the reception area at a PC terminal. We only used the honesty bar once, mainly because we were out most of the time and too tired from activities during the day to want a drink on returning to the hotel, but what a pleasant concept! Help yourselves to drink and let reception know what you consumed after you leave. Prices were a bit on the high side (6 Euros for a glass of wine or bottle of beer and 8 Euros for a spirit) but not entirely unreasonable compared to the cost of drinks in most bars and restaurants. Breakfast was also pricey at 17 Euros (I think) but it really isn't necessary to have to pay this much at all, with a boulangerie and Franprix supermarket seconds away from the hotel allowing you to buy goodies to fill you up until lunch time for not much at all. The minibar came in handy for keeping yoghurts etc in for this purpose. The room was small, but what more can one really expect from a 3* hotel near the centre of town? The only downside was, as others have noted, the noise - primarily from bin men, delivery men etc in the mornings . I assume this was largely due to us being in a room that overlooked the street below and might not be so bad in other rooms not overlooking the street. The walls were also very thin and we could hear people turning on taps, flushing toilets and even conversing on occasion. The bathroom was tiny, but well stocked with toiletries that were replenished (even after using just a small amount) and a shower that although a larger person might struggle to fit in, had excellent water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: jonesm99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and things initially didn't start out so well at the Lenox. When we went to check in, they said because of "technical problems" that they didn't have our room and that we'd have to stay down the street the first night and that they would upgrade us upon our return for our final 3 nights. Now I've worked in a hotel before, though I've never heard it called technical problems, basically they oversold and didn't have a room for us. When we did return after spending the night at another hotel, the room they upgraded us to was beautiful. Roomy, beautiful and with a nice view of the street. We had been on holidays for 3 weeks and this was such a nice hotel to end our trip. We were also given brunch for one day and it was outstanding. I believe it was 17 Euro each (which we didn't pay, but we would have!). The best part of the hotel was the Honesty Bar. You basically help yourself and then let the front desk know what you had. It was so calm and comfortable in there. We played cards, I wrote in my journal and of course we had a few beverages. It was rainy in Paris when we were there, so the lounge was a perfect way to crash at the end of a cold, wet day. The locations is great too with 2 different metro stops very close.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: NewportMarine
Reviews.Content: I decided to book the Lenox after reading the reviews here. I can say it did not quite meet my expectations. Service was good, but the main reason I cannot score it higher is the almost perpetual noise outside the room we were staying in. Shop deliveries, binmen etc making lots of noise in the very early hours right through the day. Room was small but cosy. Shower was very small and restricted and the walls seemed to be very thin. Location was great and Montparnasse area seemed ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: walnut_169
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated close to the Montparnasse Tower - arguably the best view in Paris and a great way to get your bearings. There are several metro stations close by with excellent links to Paris' main transport hubs such as mainline stations and airports. Hotel is in a sidestreet so is relatively quiet compared to the surrounding bustling area. Location is equidistant from attractions such as the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. This does mean there is a bit of a walk to either (or a few Metro stops) but both are easy to get to. Room was well appointed and decoration relaxing and clean. Bathroom tiles could do with a bit of maintenance as a couple were missing however the shower itself was powerful and and aside from the damage the bathroom was very clean. On a final point, rather than a staffed bar, the hotel operates an 'honesty bar' whereby you note down what you have drunk and it is added to your bill - an interesting idea....drinks did however seem a little overpriced so it was a considered a novelty rather than a facility...

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: LindaSLC
Reviews.Content: Lenox was great! Clean, friendly, helpful, great English. Paris hotels are expensive, but relative to that, this was a great deal. We loved Montparnasse, it was safe for 2 women walking around at night. The train station is close. There are lots of places to eat, shop, etc nearby and it's an easy train ride to the Eiffel tower and Arc de Triomphe. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: EssexTrinity
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I took my wheelchair bound Mother-in-law for a three day short break to this hotel and couldn't have made a better choice. Reception staff were very helpful, always smiling and spoke better English than us! Adjacent rooms to the rear of the hotel overlooked the courtyard and proved to be clean, comfortable and quiet. The shower was as powerful as previous reviews had led us to believe. The hot and cold breakfast served until 11am everyday was a nice touch, as was the honesty bar. The lift, although small, took 2 people and a wheelchair with comfort. There were a variety of restaurants within walking distance as were a number of major attractions (Effiel Tower, Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame and the Montparnasse Tower). We've already recommended this hotel to friends and have only been back 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: mschneider
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel based on TA reviews and price, and enjoyed my stay. Staff was excellent, spoke English and were very accommodating...I checked-in at about 9am after my transatlantic flight arrived at CDG, and the gave me my room immediately. This is an older hotel, but rooms are very clean and modern. Walls are a bit thin as I could hear rumbling around from other rooms, but wasn't an issue at night when sleeping. Rooms are also equipped with AC and free WiFi, and in-room safe. I choose a rate which included the breakfast buffet. Small selection but very tasty, scrambled eggs were very good, the fresh fruit wasn't so fresh though. Location is in a residential section of the city, away from most of the main tourist sites. The Vavin and Edgar Quinet metro station are at opposite ends of the street and will quickly get you to the city center. I found that I used the EQ station most often. Be aware that you can only purchase tickets and passes via machines at these two stations, and they only accept coins, or cards with smart chips embedded in them. If you need to use a manned ticket window, you will have to go the Montparnasse which a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Lamy_Singapore
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews online as well as receiving prompt email responses, my wife and I decided to stay at the Lenox Montparnasse for 3 nights during our honeymoon. It proved to be one of the best decisions made during our entire trip in Europe. We could only arrive in Paris late in the evening and upon arrival, gave Lenox a ring to inform. A nice gentleman by name of Biaggio (though was very tired by then, hope I got that one right!) assured us our preferred room reservation was still intact despite the very late checking-in. Preferred because being fussy travellers, we preferred rooms on higher floors, with a view and away from lifts. Upon arrival (which was very convenient for us as it was only about 300 metres away from Edgar Quintet metro station), Biaggio gave us a warm welcome and check-in was a breeze. Maps, directions and other info were given, without our asking and it was truly appreciated. We were pleasantly surprised to find ourselves upgraded to a more spacious room and were pleased the Hotel remembered it was our honeymoon. The room was spacious with a couch, full length windows that opened out to a huge balcony. Mineral water, a welcome pack consisting of any 6 bottles of soft drinks (costing EUR 6 in total) as well as a coffee making machine were a real treat. The bed was very comfortable and we had plently of space to store our luggage and clothings. We even had a fireplace in our room! Having free wifi was a major boost because we could keep in touch with family and friends from the other side of the world. The hotel also provides free usage of a PC in its lobby as well as free printing services, which we found really useful for next leg of our journey. As for meals, we skipped breakfast because there were so many cafes near the hotel and even a morning market that sells plently of food and local produce. The hotel itself provides free tea and I think some finger food in the afternoon in its bar, called the Honesty Bar. It was a real pity we did not have time to just laze around there. Julia and Karina were also extremely helpful in recommending typical French cruisine around the area and one such place, called Wadja served food that was so delicious, both myself and my wife would definitely go back in the future. Upon departure, seeing we had so much stuff to carry and were late for our train, Karina offered great help to get us a cab. If you are looking for a extremely huge room with a personal butler and mind blowing technology, then Lenox Montparnasse is probably not for you. However, it is probably right for anyone looking for professional and warm staff, great and quiet location, modern convenience in a romantic setting, all at an affordable price. Both of us agreed in our entire 1 month stay in Europe, Lenox Montparnasse ranks as the best hotel we have stayed in and we will definitely be staying there in our next trip to Paris. Thank you, Biaggio, Julia and Karina!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: ggtirevite
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a long weekend, from Friday early morning, till Monday Morning. This hotel is located in a small and quiet street behind the Boulevard Montparnasse. We got to the hotel at 9 AM, and even though checkin is at 3 PM, beause I had indicated in my reservation that I was planning to arrive early, the woman found us a room that we could check in immediately. Even though the room was not very big, it had a nice bathroom with shower, and unusual/natural amenities. The souble bed was very comfortable. The service at the front desk was always excellent, from recomendations for local places, to directions, etc. Great service at all times. The rate was very reasonable, so it was an incredible value as well. Breakfast was not included, but they had two options at their cafe. Minibar in the room, and free wireless internet that worked great. From 4 PM on, they have an 'honesty bar' at the hotel, where you serve yourself, and hand in a form to be charged. Nice way to have a nightcap when you come back to the hotel. Last time I was in Paris, I stayed in the Place de la Republique, but Montparnasse is a great neighborhood in the left bank, walking distance to a lot of great paris landmarks, and a hop away from the Metro. I cannot recommend this place enough, we had a great time. This will be where I stay next time I come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base”
Reviews.Author: aloneinkyoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights on the 8th and 9th May 2009. Our room was well appointed and in good condition (though quite small, like many Paris hotel rooms). The staff were friendly and helpful. Free internet access was useful fo us. Breakfast was available and there was a good choice, though quite expensive, we thought. The Lenox is very near La Coupole, which I can heartily recommend for dinner (service and atmosphere was great). This hotel is also handy for Le Tour Montparnasse (great views) and the cemetery where you can see the final resting places of Baudelaire, Gainsbourg, Beckett, Philippe Noiret etc. etc

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: la6ofee
Reviews.Content: I've just came back from my trip to Europe where I spent 4 night at this hotel. I would definitely stay again. The location is close to Metro station "Vavin" 3 minutes walk. A great deal of restaurants and shopping stores near by. The staff were polite, friendly and helpful. The room decoration was good and the bathroom was large enough. The only issue I disliked about the hotel is the room size, which is on the other hand, the standard European size. I would like to thank you all for recommending this hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is great!”
Reviews.Author: atlbeme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for 7 out of 8 nights on our Paris trip (see other my other review for Hotel Duquense Eiffel) After staying the first night at the other hotel we were happy to move on to The Lenox and man were we happy in the difference. The Staff- always friendly, extremely helpful and informative from the moment we arrived, each time we walked through the lobby,and the day we left. The Room- bigger room than the other hotel, room to walk around, with a table and two chairs, we had a view of the courtyard behind the hotel. The Bathroom- It was BIG, probably 3 times the size of the one at the other hotel. very nice to have room to move around in. Internet Access- is available in the lobby or on the TV in the room (that was extremely slow however) Location- The neighborhood is on the border of the 6th and 14 arrondisement. There are shops, restaurants, groceries on the same block of the hotel and many many more with 3-4 blocks. it is a very residential neighborhood, not touristy at all. There is a farmers market twice a week on Bvd Edgar Quinet which is only 2 blocks way! great place to buy fresh food. Metro- So convenient! The Vavin stop is less than a block away, the Edgar Quinet stop is 2 blocks away. both lines take you to any part of the city in 30 minutes or less. You can be to the Eiffel tower in under 20 minutes including walk time. Food- we did not take the hotel breakfast, it was very expensive, and truthfully we enjoyed getting our snacks at the FranPrix grocery just two doors down or getting a sidewalk Panini, croissant, or crepe for cheap. There are plenty of higher end restaurants as well nearby My one complaint is the noise in the room- it took a few days to get used to it. There was a big problem with slamming entry doors and closet doors from other rooms. Jar you out of bed slams. We found out that it was best to close the doors slowly by hand instead of letting the springs close them, that's what makes them slam. Also, the courtyard behind the hotel serves as the entry for another Hotel, it's a lovely courtyard but the accoustics ring the noices right up the back of the Lenox and into the rooms. That being said we got used to the noise and loved the Hotel would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to rest up after a long evening of engagement celebration!”
Reviews.Author: LIZEEBRD
Reviews.Content: And the engagement wasn't even half the excitement. Guys, forget Eifel Tower. It's all about the terrace atop Tour Montparnasse. ON THE 59TH FLOOR. Not only was the line to get to the top of the Tower over a 4 hr wait, but the Tour is very unique and lacks the tourist screams. And if you've just gotta get the premium Tower experience, you'll have the most spectacular view of it lit up from the roof of the Tour. Trust me. It's amazing. Ring or no ring. Ask anyone in the area how to get there, or, scope the skyline and it's only a matter of seconds before you find it. Ok, good news or bad news first? You're right, bad. The service. Not as warm and fuzzy as what many of my fellow "advisors" experienced, but definitely not horrible. The skinny, dark-haired fellow was particularly aloof. Case in point: early morning desire for Baileys for my coffee prompted me to go to the desk and request an honesty bar ticket (to fill in what drink, how many, etc. Quite convenient to say the least). He looked at me like I was NUTS and reluctantly handed me a ticket. Of course, I bravely snatched the ticket and proceded on my mission. But he made the hunt a little more than uncomfortable. The good news! Everything else! Location, food, night life (literally right across the street, best little bar), metro, taxis, food, location, everything! Loved our room. Bathroom was tollerable. And, as one recent advisor noted, the bed had me in the sweats a few nights as well. Not sure, though, if it was the plastic under-sheet or the champagne. Stay Montparnasse. You will not be dissappointed. We'd def stay again. Who knows....maybe for our ten-year :)

Reviews.Title: “The Real Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tech&NAU
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like a local - this is your hotel. In a lovely neighborhood that has wonderful pastry, cheese, and wine shops. Restaurants at every corner .Two metro lines are with-in a 5 minute walk from the hotel (one line goes to the Eiffel Tower the other to Notre Dame). The Rosebud is a wonder neighbor bar that I highly recommend and you end your day with a spectacular cocktail (the Irish coffeesâ€™ are the best!). The room is cozy and clean. The bathrooms are fabulous (larger than normal, great water pressure, and clean). The staff is very nice â€“ beyond accommodating. Afternoon tea was lovely and a nice rest before you venture out to the evening air. In room email was great! We sent the family updates every night and we didnâ€™t have to find a internet cafÃ©. This was my second stay at the Lenox Montparnasse â€“ and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room - not perfect but still nice”
Reviews.Author: SissyGreen
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very central and really close to the metro station Vavin so handy for getting around. There were plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, as well as patisseries and a supermarket - definitely recommend stocking up on water for the room from there. We arrived late but reception was still open and staff were always friendly, although we spent very little time at the hotel. Breakfast seemed expensive at the hotel (we didnt see the breakfast) but then we ate at La Rotonde nearby and thought that was extortionate - 40 euro for 2 omelettes, 2 OJs, a tea and a coffee!! The room was really cute and cosy but I was slightly disappointed, it was really small! I paid extra for a superior club room hoping for extra space but the room was still a squeeze and we were only there with our overnight/weekend bags. Our room was overlooking the courtyard and we left the window open as it was quite warm and the fountain outside was quite loud - didnt stop me sleeping though. There was aircon but it didnt seem to make much of a difference. We didnt have a balcony either. The bathroom was large though with a bath with a shower in it and lovely complimentary toiletries. Housekeeping changed our sheets after the first night so it was apparent that everything was clean - however the sheet on the second night was ripped. Free internet in the room through the TV was a nice extra though. The bar area was really lovely as well and I was disappointed not to sample the famous honesty bar. I'd like to point out that despite the few negative points I would stay at the Lenox Montparnasse again and I would recommend to a friend. It is a charming Parisian hotel with a lot of character in a lovely area with plenty of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huglsas0309
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was great, the metro less was than a five minute walk away and the local area is very nice. The hotel staff were friendly upon arrival and throughout our stay, they gave us advice about good restaurants in the area, provided us with umbrellas in the rain and even some plasters and antiseptic when my boyfriend hurt his hand! Our room although a little small was lovely, very quiet, clean and the free internet access was really useful. We were also very pleased that daily copies of the Guardian were provided in the lobby along with some helpful maps. All in all it was a really lovely hotel, would definately recommend it :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuperSolveig
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and I had spent a long time looking for a nice hotel in our price range that was centraly located. Everything discribed on this hotels web page is true, the pictures don't lie. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The whole hotel looked as if it had resently been remodelled. Our room had a high ceiling, plenty of storage, a large bathroom, great waterpressure in the shower, big towels, a desk, a chair, a minibar, a flatscreen TV, a huge window and the room was very clean. The room was nicely decorated, with soft colours and beautyful paterns. The people working at the hotel are helpful and polite, everyone at the front desk spoke excellent English. We had two metrostops close by, one at each end of the street (and the street is short), so getting around Paris was easy. The area was great, close to shops, sights, and an inredible amount of places to eat. Anyone can find something they like here, in any price range. Everything you need, you'll find on this street; groserystore, laudromat, ATM machine, dosens of great places to eat, pubs, souvernir shop, patisserie, chocolatier and so much more. The only negative things we found, was the size of the bed, it was too narrow for two people, and the TV had only two English speaking channels; BBC World and CNN. All we watched the whole week was news... But who comes to Paris to watch TV right?! Go to Paris and stay at Lenox Montparnasse, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: jdtravels09
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. We found the hotel and its location charming and with very good access to the metro. The room was small-ish, but clean and with a terrace. There was some street noise, but this is to be expected in a city, and we weren't too bothered by it. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a nice but reasonably priced place to stay while enjoying a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: abisnail75
Reviews.Content: We found the Lenox a great choice for our three night stay in Paris. It was easy to get to on the Metro from the Gare du Nord, it took only about 20 minutes and the hotel is literally a few hundred yards from the Vavin station. On our arrival, the receptionist at the Lenox seemed to appreciate our stumbling attempt at French before agreeing, in good humour, that we should converse in English from that point on! Throughout our stay we found the reception staff extremely friendly and efficient. Our room was on the second floor right next to the lift which we found a little noisy especially first thing in the morning but nothing too annoying. The room was very clean though the bathroom was tiny. Internet access in the room via the TV was very useful. My partner found the bed a bit uncomfortable (plastic backed sheet made her sweat in bed!). The bar area is very nice. We took advantage of the free tea/coffee which we were very grateful for after a day's sightseeing. As others have said the Honesty Bar works really well. Overall a really good hotel for the price in a great location with exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel with amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: mirrimab
Reviews.Content: Would definately recommend this hotel. It was in a great spot, easy to reach metro stations and get around Paris. The rooms (as people have pointed out already) are small but they really are perfect for a short stay. The shower was also lovely. We e-mailed ahead after reading some reviews about noise and asked for a room on a higher floor overlooking the small courtyard at the back - which we got, so we had no problems with noise. The best thing about the hotel has to be the customer service. I have found in many places I have stayed that staff can be quite rude and unhelpful - here, however, they were extremely helpful and very friendly. The honesty bar was great - a lovely spot to have a drink at the end of a long day. On our last day we left our luggage with the hotel after check-out, and after a lot of walking went back to the hotel and were told to help ourselves to tea and coffee before leaving for our flight, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / great location”
Reviews.Author: tony_105
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Lenox Monteparnasse on Saturday last with my wife to celebrate our wedding anniversary in Paris. We booked this hotel solely due to the price, and more importantly the positive reviews posted on Trip Advisor , we weren't dissapointed. The receptionist greeted us by name even though she couldn't have known who we were, so I reckoned we were either the last guests to book in that day or she was telepathic, all in all she was brilliant, she wished us happy anniversary and upgraded us to a club room (number 26) at no extra charge. The room was quite spacious by contenintal europe standards, nice balony and lots of goodies in the bathroom which by the way had a shower that would take the skin off your body if it was on full power. There are Metro stations at both end of the street and the bakery a few doors down does excellent take away patissiries and crossaints (just grab a coffee and eat in your room). As the other reviews note the corridors are quite dark and the elevator is miniscule, but if your looking for value ,cleanliness and a super Hotel experience in Paris look no further than The Lenox Monteparnasse. (p.s. I dont think letting the Irish into an honesty bar is a good idea...we tend to forget what we,ve drunk)

Reviews.Title: “Only one moan......................”
Reviews.Author: LondonJenny
Reviews.Content: As stated by so many this hotel is in a great location, easy to get to anywhere and everywhere as the metro is so close. Hotel spotless, staff extremely helpful BUT no chance of any sleep after 6 am. We had a good room (No 16) on the first floor at the front of the building. Not huge but a good size, very clean etc but the bin men come every morning at 6 am and it gets worse after that. The double glazing did nothing to stop the noise. There is nothing the hotel can do about this and it could probably be a problem in most hotels in Paris. First visit so no idea. Ask for a back of the hotel room and your stay will be brilliant. A great area to stay and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: MysteryPoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Lenox Montparnasse. We had selected the hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. Important to us was that it was within easy walking distance of the Gare Montparnasse (train station), since we would be hoofing it with our luggage. The staff was very helpful, especially the daytime clerk. They all spoke at least some English. The lift is tiny, 4-person, 300 kg. max, but that is very usual. Our room, #43, was suprisingly large and extremely nice and very comfortable. The bath had both tub and shower and also had plenty of room. The best part, for me, was that the window opened and you could quite safely look out over the street below ("We're in PARIS!") We were not disturbed by noise from other guests or from the street except for the trucks which began making restaurant deliveries at around 6:30a or so to the businesses on the block. Lots of small pastisseries and cafes for breakfast and lunch, and many restaurants for dinner all on the block. Our favorite was an Italian restauran, just down the street and on the opposite side. Found some lovely pashminas at a gift shop, Tera Vila, almost opposite the hotel, and wish I had bought more!

Reviews.Title: “Truly classy and cozy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sar-yu
Reviews.Content: After all the reviews here, there's little I can add except that I agree with all of the positive comments. The staff is so professional and courteous, yet warm and helpful as well. I had them book restaurants for me, find locations, recommend fastest routes, and arrange an airport shuttle - definitely the best way to get to the airport in comfort and economy (17 euros a person). (BTW - I booked with [-] when I arrived, who were there and waiting - the only problem is they tell you to call them before you pick up your baggage but there are no phones! - had a kind man at the Air France desk help me out) I booked my room through booking.com but the rates would probably have been the same with the hotel at ther site. The room was small (got the least expensive) but perfectly fine. Everything was tasteful and comfortable. We stayed for four nights and never felt cramped. I loved the decor, the view, and the bed was heavenly. Both my husband and I have spinal issues and we have never slept in such comfort outside of our home. Cleaning was thorough and courteous. The honesty bar is great, but best of all is the breakfast. It was 17.50 euros a head, but worth double. Scrumptious fruit salad (with canteloupe, pineapple, watermelon...) and just about everything you could think of plus an oh so hospitable lady serving it. You would think you entered her home. It's worth having breakfast at a local cafe if you want more local color, but don't do it if you want to fill up for a long day of walking and have high quality cooking. Breakfasts with eggs (no ham or sausages, no all you can eat and drink, no fruit, though a great croissant) is about 12 to 14 euros, down the street. There's a colourful street market towards the metro station which had produce one day, and local artists' work the next. About the location, I found it perfect. After all the museum/Disney/sightseeing, it was nice to stay "close to home" for the evening and still have a great choice of restaurants and bars. Everything from cozy creperies (apparently this is where the crepe took first took off) to delicious Korean barbecue and pleasant but pricey Italian. In closing, when you have a staff that are skilled but actually enjoy their work, you can provide an excellent hotel experience. This is exactly what the Lenox Montparnasse does, and hopefully, will keep doing. Oh, and please do not hesitate to give 5 stars to this hotel when rating it, if you agree that it is deserved. It used to be much higher on the list, the golden underdog competing with outrageously priced luxury hoteIs, and I would love to see it back up there again!

Reviews.Title: “A charming Parisian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alisasha
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night only but was plesantly amazed at the level of service and the charm that often lacks in many "so-calledâ€� boutique/hip/charming hotels. Rooms are small including club rooms but if you want to spend an extra 50-90, you can get an upgrade to a suite. The suite that I was given was immaculately furnished with original furniture and a comfy bed. Views were restrictive but it did not matter much. Some other rooms had balconies but overlooking a busy narrow street! Bathroom was very good size with and good fittings and toiletries! Room had tea/coffee facilities as well as wireless internet. Breakfast was served in the room and was not bad. Overall had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien!”
Reviews.Author: superchickridesagain
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Lenox for 5 days in May 2008, and loved Paris (and the hotel) so much we extended our stay there for another 5 days. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff...they recommended restaurants, gave sound advice on all manner of things, told us how to get wherever we were going and admirably tolerated us practising our very basic French! Eric the bar attendant was especially helpful, and his cocktails were lethal. Our room was thoroughly cleaned everyday (room 22, very small and nowhere to really store our luggage so a bit awkward, but we didn't spend a lot of time in it so who cares?), and for my fellow Australian travellers - the shower pressure was awesome. The breakfast was abundant and catered to vegetarians as well as meat eaters, and the coffee was delicious and addictive. Our breakfast was included in the room rate I booked online, which I would recommend doing as I understand it is quite expensive. As in the other reviews: Metro is very convenient and close by; All kinds of shops/markets in walking distance; Wonderful cafe's and restaurants with highlights being La Creole, Chez Berber, and the bouillabaisse at Le Dome is unfrigginbelievable; Good nightlife - plenty of bars and crepe/kebab/pizza places when needed. I have fallen head over heels in love with Paris and when I visit this wonderful city again I will definitely be staying at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “A truely fantastic hotel with a”
Reviews.Author: QuinnCola
Reviews.Content: Ok so firstly i would like to make clear that i searched trip advisor and the reviews from approx 100 hotels before booking a 3 night stay at The Lenox in Montpasnasse. I am grateful for all those who take the time to write a review and so hopefully i can do similar and help convince someone that this hotel is superb! My heavily pregnant parnter and I have just spent 3 wonderful days in Paris for my birthday and the hotel certainly played a significant part in making our trip so enjoyable. Upon arriving you are welcomed and immediately made to feel at home, (wishing me bon anniversaire)!! The hotel has a great atmosphere to it, intimate and private and deocrated to a high standard. Our room was immaculate, not huge but what room in Paris is? There is an honesty bar where chilled wine, champagne, beers, sprits and soft drinks are available and you simply fill in a card of what you have drank and hand it in to reception. The cost is expensive 10 euros for a glass of champagne but anyone going to Paris and thinking it will be cheap will be in for big shock! The pound to euro rate is not helping at present, however this is a fantastic city but a very expensive one! The front desk speak good fluent english, however for what my opinion is worth i always find it more respectful to at least make small talk in basic french! The Parisians seem to appreciate your efforts! Location is great, two metro stations at either end of road can take you to centre of Paris within 10 mins, however if like me you will quickly discover that Paris is not all about the Effiel Tower but much more about all the superb quarters (districts) . The metro is superb, quick, efficient and safe it can get you from the north to the south, east to west in minutes. Paris was superb! Go Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Honesty Bar, Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: trvlbuff
Reviews.Content: - My wife and I, along with another couple stayed at the Hotel for four nights in January '09. I can recommend the hotel. We booked two junior suites. They are located on the 6th floor which necessitates using the very small but typically European elevator. The suites themselves vary in size. You may want to visually check out the available suites to find one to your liking. The hotel is on a quiet street, street noise was never a problem. - After arriving at CDG we took the the RER to the Denfert Rochereau stop, transfered to the Metro and got off at the Vavin station. It's a short easy walk to the hotel. The Lenox is almost equidistant between the Vavin and Edgar Quinet stops. There are several nice Brasseries next to the Edgar Quinet station. They're a great place to enjoy a glass of wine and .people watch. - The hotel provides free WiFi. We had great connectivity in our room on the top floor. A real plus if you need to conduct business or check email. The hotel provides a computer next to the reception desk. It has the European keyboard and if you're used to the style used in the USA it will take some getting used to. - The staff was superb. They were always friendly and helpful. Our request to move to a different room was met with a positive attitude and they were most accommodating. - The hotel has an "Honesty Bar" in the lobby. What a great idea. Everything was 8â‚¬. A glass of white wine, 8â‚¬, a shot of single malt scotch 8â‚¬. There are drink lists at each table, you just jot down what you drink, give the note to reception when you're finished and pay your bar bill at checkout. Yes, it can be a surprise, it's easy to have a little too much fun! - We ate a La Coupole it was OK. Chartier was not OK. You never know if you've ordered the wrong thing or if the kitchen was having an off night. It was worth the visit to see, but I can't recommend the food. The Jules Verne restaurant in the Eiffel Tower is quite an experience. Just to give you an idea, the cheapest bottle of wine on the list is 65â‚¬. Lunch can be tres expensive. - In summary it's a good hotel in a nice area. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: dancer62
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in Paris for 3 nights at 2 days notice. First stop -Tripadvisor. It's never let us down.....and this was another great recommendation. The location is perfect - Vavin metro stop literally round the corner, a short walk to Gare Montparnasse for trains to Versailles, busy Montparnasse with lots of (sometimes touristy) restaurants, shopping at Centre Montparnasse....we love this area! We chose the superior room, and had number 46 facing to the street. For size of bathroom, see if you can get 49, which faces the courtyard.... if I had got that room it would have got full marks. But I only saw it when the maid was cleaning. Our bathroom was teeny tiny. Lucky we are only short. Everything was there - bath, toilet, basin, bidet....but you could wash your hair in the basin whilst sitting on the toilet, it was that cosy ;-) The bed was a double (queen to the US folks). Comfy, clean crisp sheets. Nice flat screen TV. Minbar. For Paris, quite a reasonable size - you could swing TWO cats.... We did not have breakfast - there are plenty of other choices, and if all you want is a coffee and croissant, you can get that for â‚¬5 in the patisserie on the opposite diagonal corner as you reach Boulevard Montparnasse (you'll see if as you come out of rue Delambre). Or go to the cafes, where you can also get fresh fried eggs or omlettes. In any case, we ate a variety of breakfasts, all in all paying the same for 3 days for the two of us as we would have paid for one day in the hotel. QED. Just watch out - not all places are open on Sunday morning..... The staff were friendly, and they have an honesty bar. Help yourself and fill in the form. A brandy costs â‚¬8, but there is no measure, so you have to use eye level..... ;-) For great restaurants, just walk along Boulevard Montparnasse and peer down the side streets. There you will find the real Parisian food! However, we love La Coupole, and if you visit Tour Montparnasse for the rooftop view, you get a voucher for 15% off your bill! So we got our entry fee back at one of our favourite bistros. All in all, we will go back without hesitation, assuming the prices stay at the same reasonable level we got. We booked via Venere - the hotel own prices are too high. Thanks to all reviewers at Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: GwennSingapore
Reviews.Content: The staff has made our stay very comfortable, providing assistance when required. The location of the hotel is excellent too. Probably 2 minutes walk away from the Metro. And it has fantastic restaurants around the vicinity. La Coupole...Chez Clement...etc...

Reviews.Title: “Ditto....Wonderful Stay, Great Location, Friendly Staff! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Passtraveler
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed first week in December and could not have been any happier with our choice! Upon arrival we were met with a pleasant smile and gracious hospitality! WIth our French being minimal to greetings and simple requests, our English was met with pleasant acceptance and regard. This was one of the friendliest hotels I have stayed at in Paris - this being my 6th visit in 4 years. Kudos to the front desk and to making their travellers feel welcome! Arriving from Brussels by train into Gare du Nord - it was an easy metro ride to station Vavin - turn right at the corner by the station exit and the hotel is a very very short walk up the street on the left Hotel located in a beautiful, quiet area with wonderful restaurants, buildings and cafes right there! (During our stay there was renovation going on across the street - so while the view was not picture perfect, please note that the construction did not interfere with our enjoyable stay at all and was never bothersome - just a sign of progress) Room (Queen deluxe) was beautifully decorated with toile fabrics, lovely draperies, headboard and bed coverings! Size generous for european standards. Extremely well kept and clean! Bathroom with tub while not huge was sufficient with nice toiletries and the tub was an essential after walking all around paris and versaille all day! It is worth the upgrade. Hotel is very computer friendly and very "connected" at no additional cost. Like the other reviews state....Lenox Montparnasse is a charmer with friendly service, wonderful staff, up to date and current amentities (computer) settled in a charming and very parisian left bank address with the metro very close by to get you to any part of Paris quickly. We were delighted with our choice! We found booking the hotel directly at their webiste to be the most cost effective. Breakfast, like others stated, expensive. Honor bar, pricey but worth it if you want a late night drink, Afternoon tea a plus! I never stay at the same place twice when I return to Paris - only because I like to experience the many diverse areas around the city, but....I am returning in the spring with my sister, a first timer to paris...and Lenox Montparnasse will be our residence - she will feel the Parisian charm the minute she gets off of the metro! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Greekophile13
Reviews.Content: Using the reviews on Tripadvisor I chose this hotel for a combination of price, quality and location and I was not disappointed. I don't think it is exceptional but then you are not paying exceptional prices. It is, however, clean, friendly and has elements of restrained but unmistakeable style which all add up to a very satisfying experience. I was upgraded on arrival, though to be honest I'm not sure what elements comprised an upgrade as the room, though perfectly acceptable and very nicely decorated wasn't anything I wouldn't have expected anyway. However, it had a nice bathroom and good products and as it was at the rear and on 5th floor, it was extremely quiet (apart from the rather early maid service on Sunday morning - she started banging about outside before 8am!) As others have said, the staff are friendly and helpful and were very tolerant of my attempts to communicate in (long-forgotten) schoolgirl French, though clearly their English was far superior to anything my French had ever been! As I was travelling alone, in Paris for the first time and rendezvous-ing with friends living in and staying in different parts of the city, I wanted somewhere convenient for the Metro and also where I would feel safe at night. This was certainly the case - there are 2 metro stations very close by. One of these, Vavin is on the same line as Gare du Nord and as I was travelling by Eurostar and arriving in the evening this was a factor in my choice. It is worth noting that this line is particularly busy - I used it in the day and in the evening, including around midnight on Saturday and it was jam-packed full (and this from a Tube-using Londoner!). The hotel is also within a few minutes walk of a number of other Metro stations so you can easily get about. You can also walk, as I did, into the centre via the Luxembourg Gardens and Ile de Citie in 30-40 minutes. I didn't eat in the hotel at all, so can't comment on the food. However it is worth noting that in the area around nothing seems to open before 10am, so if you want an early breakfast, as I did, you have to go futher afield. Not sure if this is true all year round but it was certainly the case over an early December weekend! All in all, I would certainly consider going there again - the acid test in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection...”
Reviews.Author: LionJag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lenox when we visited Paris in mid-November 2008. We also had our 18 month daughter with us. Upon arrival, we were told that a cot had already been set up for said daughter. The room and bathroom were a little small, but we expected it to be the case after reading the reviews on TripAdviser. However, it was tastefully decorated and the bed was so relaxing. Free wi-fi seals the deal! Underground car parking is available at 20 euros per night, which is reasonable for a major city. A buffet breakfast is available, although at 17.9 euros, a little expensive. However, it does set one up for a day of serious sight-seeing! There are good restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel. Montparnasse is a lively area and one in which we felt quite safe to walk around in the evening. We were really pleased with all elements of our stay but most of all the friendly staff. They speak impeccable English and cater to every need of the hotel resident. We were so impressed with them and would gladly go back when we next visit Paris. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring!”
Reviews.Author: Jayjay5555
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend stay at the Lenox Montparnasse for my girlfriends birthday and it fitted the bill perfectly. Paris hotels are pricey for what you get but this place was great value. The hotel is immaculate and the service was friendly. The room wasn't big and the shower was tiny but you shouldn't be spending too much time in your room with all that there is to see in this fab city. The district is bustling with a good choice of restaurants and two metro stops very close by, so getting around is easy. A word of warning, it can be a bit noisy at night though if you are located on the street side of the hotel at the weekends. Breakfast is expensive at the hotel, so choose to pop out to a cafe and get the real authentic french experience. Overall, i would recommend the Lenox if you just want a clean, smart hotel in a good location and budget is more important then size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs UP for the Lenox Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: JManhattanTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is in beautiful Montparnasse on the Left Bank -- it's newly renovated, clean, convenient to the Metro, and the staff were all extremely polite and helpful at every turn. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in terms of exceedining our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: PeterFinchSingapore
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near Tour Montparnasse where I had business meetings to attend. We liked the quartier and have stayed in other small hotels there before.....we avoid large hotels... The Lenox was a pleasant surprize with attentive and helpful staff, well decorated and maintained, a well stocked honour bar and good breakfast fare... we will return!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel wasPerfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: Mjonespc
Reviews.Content: When we think back on our trip, the Lenox Hotel is part of our wonderful memories. It is in a great neighborhood on a very interesting street. Close to two Metro stops and the Gare de Montparnasse which is the station for out-of Paris trains. There is a small grocery, a chinese take-out, an Italian take out, a patisserie, a tabacco shop on the rue Delambre and several cafes and bistros at the squares at each end of the street. It is an extremely convenient location for hanging around or setting out to explore Paris. This was Hemingway's neighborhood. Read "A Moveable Feast" by Hemingway and you will be reading about the very neighborhood of the Lenox. There are many mentions of places within steps of the Lenox. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The hotel itself is very clean and nicely decorated. We enjoyed arriving back each day after our exploring around town. The only negative I can say is what you would say about every hotel in Paris - the rooms are small. We actually became very fond of our little room and felt very comfortable spending our down time there. We will be going back to the Lenox when we return to Paris. If you accept the fact that European hotel rooms are small, then you will be delighted with the Lenox in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Perfect! Stay Here...”
Reviews.Author: RoyalHome&Body
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lenox is very conviently located, near the metro lines, you can get off on the 6th or the 4th. Hotel front staff was very helpful, spoke wonderful english. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. We felt safe, and lots to do and see around the hotel. the park near by was wonderful.. Ride the metro, its fun, cheap, and fast..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Alarcon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and I was not disappointed. My husband and I stayed there for three nights in September. The hotel staff was helpful, the room was clean and quiet, the location is fantastic, and the breakfast was delicious. However, the room and bathroom are small. This is not to take anything away from the hotel itself, but what anyone should expect for a hotel under $300 a night in a major, densely populated city like Paris. Despite its size, we had a comfortable stay. When we arrived at the hotel in the morning, bleary eyed from our transatlantic flight, the staff let us store our luggage, and freshen up in the bathroom that they have downstairs. They also had our room ready a couple of hours early! At 16 euros, the breakfast seems steep, but we highly recommend it. It's delicious, filling, and a bargain if you have a caffeine addiction like we do. Also, the location was great. Paris is an easy city to navigate and we never felt as if stopping by the hotel for a short nap before going out at night was a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “GreatLenox”
Reviews.Author: londoner25
Reviews.Content: We have spent a September week in Montparnasse every year since 2001, staying at different 3-star hotels, and have been particularly pleased with the Lenox this year. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was a "junior suite" on the top (6th) floor. It was well designed in traditional style, spacious (by Paris room standards), well-maintained, bright with natural daylight , pleasant lighting, and very comfortable beds. Also a spacious well-equipped bathroom with natural daylight. The price was rather more than a standard room, but not excessive by Paris standards. GC

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: llcoolal
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a great stay for the price. The Good: 1. Location - Neighborhood is fantistic. Metros close by, plenty of restaurants, etc., and safe. 2. Service - Very nice front desk people. Always had a smile and willing to assist when asked. 3. Cleanliness - Hotel and room was very well kept. 4. Amenities - Our package included breakfast each morning. Mostly standard continental b'fast, but was perfect to start a day of sightseeing. 5. Price - Very competitive compared to other 3 stars in Paris. The Bad (few): 1. Noise - This is my only real issue with Lenox. Could have been bad luck or whatever, but our room was pretty noisy in the early (early) morning hours (some, not all days...we were here for 7 nights). Sounded like they were doing construction above us (things dropping on the floor, weird "scraping" noises, hard to explain), but a/t the front desk there were folks staying in that room. Front desk was willing to intervene if we called while it was happening. Also, garbage trucks every morning around 8am, which wasn't a big deal as we were up around then anyway. 2. We were given an occupied room upon check-in. This was quickly resolved by the front desk and we were given another room with apologies. Overall, I was very pleased with the stay and would recommend it if you're looking for an affordable hotel in a great neighborhood. Having said that, my advice would be to look for 2 star hotels in Paris that offer similar amenities for less $$ (they're out there). I stayed in one such a few years back and probably would have stayed there again if they had availability (different but comparable neighborhood, with similar offerings for probably 30-40 euro/night less).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: torigin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lenox was great. It's reasonably priced, the rooms are clean and the hotel is convenient to the metro. There is free wifi and internet in the lobby. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included and it was fine. There is a supermarket (which closes at 9 pm) and laundromat (which opens at 7 am) on the same street. There are plenty of restaurant choices nearby (including Japanese and Korean (?!?)) to boot. Lastly, we liked the fact that it's in a more residential neighborhood and not in a overly touristy locale.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, simple and friendly”
Reviews.Author: TheScottsGermany
Reviews.Content: Room clean. Bathroom high quality and clean. Friendly service. Well located and price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Superfine!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjdavey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the weekend, check in was good having a room available for us at 11am. The room was small but ok for the money, the free internet is an excellent bonus. The breakfast was ok because it was included in our rate, but if I was paying I would have looked elsewhere, the cost was â‚¬21 and this was for a cold buffet (no eggs or sausage?). The location is excellent, very close to metro lines 4 & 6, 4 is a direct line from the eurostar and 6 will take you straight to the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrl14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very quaint, clean and is close to the Metro. The staff were friendly and courteous. Internet included (computer available in hotel lobby). We loved our stay and only have good things to say about our time in Paris. Good value. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: mlrossLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in mid-August, on the recommendation of a friend. It couldn't have been better - the location was surprisingly convenient, the staff were wonderful, the room was clean, quiet, tastefully decorated, and there were countless little touches - the free Herald Tribune, afternoon tea, umbrellas available in case of rain...we give it our strongest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMabhena
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my sister on a 2 night Eurostar break. The hotel is on the same Metro Line as Gare du Nord and only 2 minutes from Vavin station- very convenient, even with luggage. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean, with newly refurbished rooms and great bathrooms and efficient air conditioning. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Montparnesse Tower, great shops and surrounded by fantastic creperies. It is also just around the corner from the famous (and fantastic) 1927 American diner, La Coupole. I will ceratinly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value and Location at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Motmas
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just spent 4 nights staying at the Lenox Montparnasse in Paris and had a wonderful time. The hotel is ideally located with a couple of metro stations within a 2 minute walk of the front door. It is also easily accessible from Charles de Gaulle airport which is where we flew in to. When booking the hotel I searched around to make sure that the we booked a room with breakfast included.
