Whilst not essential, I managed to get the room for only 10 Euros a night more than booking without breakfast - which in Paris was a bargain as it was an excellent spread and set us up well for the day. The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English, however, they did encourage me to practice my French only switching to English when they could see I was struggling which I felt was a nice touch. The only possible down side was that the room we were in was very small, however, given that we were there to see Paris we spent very little time inside the room when we weren't asleep so it didn't really matter. Free internet in the hotel lobby was also a bonus in terms of organising your day's activities. If you are after an excellent meal within a 5 min walk (though admittedly this is only one I'd recommend to carnivores), we can highly recommend Les Grillades de Buenos Aires which is located just round the corner from the hotel at 54, rue de Montparnasse and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very much loved the stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yumihime
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lenox Montparnasse for 4 nights and the saty was very much lovely and comfortable. I stayend in room 51, a double bed with bath + shower, though was originally adviced only with shower...! The room was very clean and sophisticated. Staff were all nice and friendly. Location was perfect! You can use both Metro Line 4 (by Vavin station) and 6 (by Edgar Kuinet) and both stations are within 5 mins walk. FranPrix is only 30 seconds away. I will definitely stay with Lenox Montparnassse again next time I visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, good part of town, Free WIFI!”
Reviews.Author: breazey
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this place with my boyfriend for 3 days in Paris this month (July 2008.) Was in a nice area of town with a ton of restaurants and bars nearby, the metro wasn't too far away... The room was nice, double bed, desk, loved the comfy linens on the bed, and we had a balcony!! The bathroom had a huge bathtub as well. It was nice to stay here as a couple. Room wasn't the largest, but that really didn't matter. I had to do some work on my laptop while we were in town so I was VERY PLEASED they had FREE WIFI!! --and it was fast! Would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccasosa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel in April 2008. We had a wonderful stay! The Hotel Staff was so very nice and polite. Prior to our stay we advised them that we were celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary and we were upgraded to a Superior Room. Before I arrived, I emailed them requesting directions from the airport on the Metro. They were very prompt with their response and gave me great directions. From the CDG: Air France Shuttle bus to Gare Montparnasse (9euro) takes about 20 minutes and itâ€™s a short 8 min walk to the Lennox. Check-in was a breeze. The rooms are small, but that is common for Europe. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated and the bed was super comfy. The bathroom was half the size of the actual room. It was pretty spacious with fluffy white towels, a towel heater and luxurious Lâ€™Occtaine soaps and lotions. One weird thing is that you have to leave your key FOB with the Front Desk every time you leave and then p/u when you return. The breakfast room is nicely appointed with a great assortment of breakfast items. They have the usual continental with eggs, meats, wonderful cheese and croissants. Getting Around Itâ€™s so easy to get around in this city. We were there for 5 days and never took a taxi or bus. We walked and took the Metro everywhere we went. There are several metro stations near the Hotel that can take you to all the sites. There are a lot of restaurants, cafes and bars in this area as well. Very metropolitan. You can be closer to the main sites but it will cost you a pretty penny. Especially since the Euro is kicking the dollarâ€™s butt!!! I couldâ€™ve stayed in the American Chain Hotels, but I opted to try a Parisian hotel to experience Paris fully. We were really impressed with this quaint hotel and can not wait to return to the City of Love.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !, "VALUE 4 MONEY"”
Reviews.Author: SwedenLuxury_lover
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and two children 5 & 7y) stayed here from the 13-15 of July, i think this is the first 3* hotel i have stayed in for 15 years... I normally only stay in 5* hotels, tryed all kinds in paris from George V to Hilton. We where arriving rather late the 13th so I thougt why not try a cheaper hotel for the first nigtht and save 1000â‚¬... But the Lenox where so nice and pesonal so we canceld George V and stayed for three days (then we left for Disneyland and Dinsneyland hotel wich was a HUGE dissapontment). We stayed in a rather large room, wery clean and nice, if I schuld degree this hotel it would defently be a 4+*, next time I visit paris I will defently choose the Lenox. I have absolutley nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “charming boutique hotel in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: traveller3080
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Lenox Montparnasse Hotel on Rue Delambre in Paris. It was a delightful stay. A full breakfast including scrambled eggs and meats was served every morning downstairs in the lovely bar/breakfast/tea area, but we had croissants, cereal, yogurt and coffee delivered to our room as our daily wakeup call. The rooms are, as others have reviewed, small by US standards but absolutely cozy and well appointed. Very nice bathroom with lovely white and printed tile, beautiful towel holders, nice amenities, fresh big white towels daily. The rooms were cleaned promptly and smelled absolutely wonderful. Large door-windows opened onto a little landing where we had a nice view of the streets below. The people at the desk were most helpful. We were around the corner from the metro stop and within walking distance of haunts of Hemingway, F. Scott Fitzgerald and others. Le Select around the corner was one of our favorite spots to have a cafe creme/au lait and people watch. Very French. Highly recommend this hotel for its charm and accessibility. Daily International Herald Tribune or other English paper available, and free internet in both the room and downstairs lobby (the latter being faster, but have to accomodate to the European keyboard - some letters are in unusual places compared to a standard US keyboard)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: R_Marmaduke
Reviews.Content: The staff are wonderfully helpful and pleasant. The hotel itself is a wonderful little gem tucked away in a great walking neighborhood. It is close to several Metro stations, and one can go to any other part of Paris easily. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Curiously, the bathroom is rather ample, considering the size of the overall accomodation. The free wi-fi is also a nice plus. For the price, you cannot beat this nice little boutique hotel in Montparnasse. It is marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Paris, Je t'aime!”
Reviews.Author: Rheumo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on our first trip together, my visit the 4th I have made to Paris, hers the first. My previous hotels have been chain hotels (eg Hilton) but I wanted a more Parisien feel and frankly, a cheaper price. Getting to the hotel from CDG was simpler than the instructions given on the booking form as the Air France bus has extended its route to Gare Montparnasse, perhaps 200 metres from the front door. I was attending a conference at the Palais de Congress, and access was easy via the Metro with one change. We arrived early, the long trip from NZ via Singapore landing us at 7 am, and the welcoming front desk staff easily accommodated our luggage whist prioritising our room availability. Rooms are intimate, but clean and well presented. We appreciated the free internet in the room and the faster unit downstairs. Local cafes are good and the inimitable Dome at the end of the short street serves wonderful seafood. The problem with France in general, Paris in particular and the Lenox specifically is that they are an awful long way from New Zealand. I have found the Parisian hotel that we will be coming back to on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: LondonUK1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from July 8th to 11th on a business trip. I booked the hotel through a web-site, but checked up on the Trip Advisor reviews first. The hotel is in a good location and has friendly staff. The rooms are not huge but are comfortable with air-conditioning. The breakfast in the bar area is fine with a reasonably good choice. I stay in Paris on business a lot and this is as good a place as any I have stayed for the money. I would definitely stay here again and probably will in the next couple of months!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay.”
Reviews.Author: mikeheth
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I and two teenage sons) really enjoyed our stay in Paris, and the Lenox Montparnasse provided a consistently good home base. Julia at the front desk was fantastic, making us feel welcome from the start, and speaking fluent English while trying to help us with our very poor French. The rooms were small but clean, and the bathroom was in like-new condition. Free wireless internet really came in handy as we researched restaurants and museums from the comfort of our room. The area surrounding the hotel is quaint, with many bakeries, brasseries and restaurants just a short distance away. Two metro stops are very close, one at each end of the street. Montparnasse is an friendly area, and while filled with activity, retains a local feel to it, unlike some places on the right bank which felt crowded and touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Nikowalkie9
Reviews.Content: As Americans travelling to France, we highly recommend the Hotel Montparnasse. The staff was very friendly, spoke English, and were very knowledgable about how to travel to as well as the schedules of various tourist destinations. Out room was small but certainly acceptable for the price. The room and especially the bathroom were very clean. The hotel is not located directly adjacent to the major tourist destinations, but all are very easily accesible, especially by the multiple subway stations available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place!”
Reviews.Author: StarlightandYou
Reviews.Content: After having read dozens of reviews on Trip advisor and elsewhere, my friend and I decided on the Lenox for a romantic four nights in Paris. Arriving separetely, he asked for a quiet room, as many of the reviews found noise, "thin walls," to be a problem, and he was given a very nice, but small, double bedded room in the back of the hotel. When I arrived a couple of hours later, although I loved the large bath, I had had my heart set on one of the rooms in the front with the little balcony that opened onto the street, witha queen bed, which we had reserved. One word to Catherine, the warm, efficient and wonderful front desk manager, who I must thank for making our stay an enjoyable one, but the rest of the staff was also first rate, quickly moved us to room 36--the perfect room for us! Though the bathroom was a bit tight for both of us, it was fully equipped with a bidet, nice bath tub, and a hand held shower head which was a nice touch. one thing I asked for was face cloths, which they did not supply, only hand towels and two large towels per room. Loved the linens, duvet, and the pillows were fine! The bathroom amenties were very nice high end products, The mini bar which doubled as a fridge for us was great,and the a/c worked well. The room despite the compliants by other travelers posted here, was very quiet, houskeeping was consistent....the breakfast which was included in our orbitz rate was ample and very good. as was the bar, and overall appearance of the hotel and lobby --I loved coming home to the Lenox after long days of sightseeeing. The stores on the street had everything we needed, wine, pharmaceuitical items, even shrimp dumplings, and green tea, when i had a craving. surrounded by great resturants, we skipped the famous ones, and took the front desk's recommendation of Le Parc aux cerfs, which though not the warmest servcie had very good food. But if you are looking for the best meal in the city try Les Bouquinistes...it was truly amazing, though pricey, and this is coming from someone who frequents famous NYC restaurants regularly. And just over the bridge is one of those romantic Seine cruises...The hotel was also close like minutes from the Vavin metro, and the RER....and good shopping...Overall , the Lenox was a great hotel, and Id stay there again. Sure there are many more expensive choices, but the Lenox was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ollie99
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this hotel in a classic room that overlooked Delambre street. The hotel overall was fine. No real complaints but nothing great about this hotel either. The room was very cramped for two people...just enough room to move around the bed but that's about it. No storage for suitcases made it even worse. The shower was also uncomfortably small. However, the room was clean, modern and in good condition. The hotel is in a good location. Montparnasse is frequented by many locals during the weekend. As such, you'll find many restaurants, shops and cafes in the area at reasonable prices. Do expect however a good 30 + minute walk to the main sites. I actually discourage taking the Metro. Sure you'll save time but it's a seedy subway system and most of the pleasure of being in Paris is walking around the discovering things you'll never see by being underground. A taxi to the main sites (Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, La Seine, etc.) is a bit less than 10 euros so it's a decent option. The area is safe so don't worry about stumbling in late at night. The staff was courteous but nothing extraordinary. There were some renovations going on so we did get woken up early in the morning. If I had to do it over again, I'd stay in the Saint.Germain area. It's closer to the main sites and has better although more expensive restaurants. If you decide to stay there, I recommend La Rotonde for breakfast. It's a one minute walk away from the hotel and has excellent crepes. In the end, you'll have a fine stay there but don't go in expecting anything great. To get there from the airport and back, I recommend a shared shuttle service (www.airport-connection.com). It's affordable and relatively quick.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyndylouDubai
Reviews.Content: After spending hours looking at the reviews of other travellers staying in Paris I finally decided on Hotel Lenox. I could not have chosen anywhere better. Firstly it is in a beautiful part of Paris, called Montparnasse and is surrounded by quaint cafes and incredible seafood restaurants seemed to be on every corner. It is a traditonal Parisian style Hotel with geraniums growing on the window ledges and my room looked onto the small bustling street. The rooms were larger than I had hoped, the bathroom was uptodate with a great shower, the hotel is serviced by a lift and there is a small bar off the foyer where Eric makes a good cocktail!. The reception staff could not do enough for us and I will definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Compact and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Yasunde
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Lenox after a last-minute search for an affordable yet pleasant place to stay in Paris and were pleasantly suprised. The receptionist was very welcoming, spoke excellent English and gave us helpful tips on what to do during our stay. We booked a standard double room (all our Â£500 budget could stretch to). It was compact, but had everything we needed: tasteful furnishings, comfortable bed, excellent bathroom, nice balcony and best of all, spotlessly clean. The free wireless internet was a bonus, as was the 10% off at the bar on our first visit and the free range of European newspapers at reception. Less welcome was the price of breakfast (â‚¬16 - we avoided by buying pastries at a local patisserie) and the thin walls. If you've got quiet neighbours, it's no problem, but I got the overexcited chatter of 2 other guests untill the wee hours one night which was no fun. We actually liked the area. It's safe, un-touristy and has excellent transport links. The local eating options are also good - a fantastic range of creperies on the nearby rue de montparnasse, a few nice bars on the road including Rosebud (sounds naff but atmosphere, service, food and wine superb). Would we stay here again? Yes. The longer we stayed there the more we liked it and realised that you don't need acres of floorspace to have a quality hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: MissJennb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse for eight nights and really enjoyed it. The hotel is clean, well appointed and very comfortable. Of course the rooms are small, but it's Paris! All rooms are small in Paris but the ones at Lenox have lots of storage space and plenty of places to stow your clothes and make it feel like home. The staff was lovely. So helpful and polite despite my awful French. They speak English wonderfully and will teach you a few words if you ask. (Definitely get used to saying your room number in French so you can tell the hostess each morning at breakfast). The included breakfast every morning was great. Always plenty of spaces to sit and croissants to fill your belly. I will definitely stay there again. So convenient too. Just steps away from the Edgar Quinet metro stop and Vavin as well. Then another few blocks and you are at the Montparnasse metro station and the huge Gare Montparnasse. You have access to tons of metro lines and the regional trains as well! The neighborhood is vibrant and great to walk around day or night. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located near Metro Stations, bakeries, market”
Reviews.Author: MacGyver_D_Nuts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lenox for 4 nights. We got there around 3pm and they were still cleaning our room from the previous guest but we kept ourselves entertained with the free internet in the lobby and the free coffee. The hotel staff are all very nice and helpful. The ladies always had a smile on their face and were friendly to us. We were pleased with their caring attitudes. It rained one day and they provided free umbrella rental too. The free internet on the hotel room TV screen made it very convenient and was preferred over the french tv shows and adult entertainment. The mini bar/refrigerator was nice to have too. The air conditioning worked well as did the bathroom faucets. The shower was a little odd in that it didn't have a shower curtain ..so the water would be all over the bathroom floor after a shower. The lasting impression I have is the disgusting sheets...the sheets had black stains on it as did one of our pillows. It grossed my wife and I out pretty bad. Although we were facing the street, rue Delambre, there wasn't any noise from the street below..very peaceful nights of sleep(other than noise from our neighbor) . The hotel had a beautiful and modern lobby but the rooms were a little older and the walls were paper thin..we heard the man next door snoring up a storm a few nights in a row. It didn't affect our sleep though. The thing that I really loved about the location was the location..it was within a 3 minute walk to the Metro station #4 and Metro station #6. Also, it was a few doors down from a market which had great prices compared to everywhere else. Also, there are several great crepe places one street over...it seemed like there were about 6-7 different crepe places on that one street...We enjoyed the Creperie Josselin which was near the hotel. There were many bakery kind of places nearby too which we really enjoyed. Overall good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MammaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Lenox this May, and had a great time. No problem with early check-in. We had room 47, and I've read a recent review saying they were disturbed by street noise at night. We had no problem with this at all, and we stayed a friday night, so I guess it's very individual. We booked through hotelbook.com for the best price, and breakfast was included. It had everything you needed and then some. I love beacon and croissants with jam, so for me even that would have been good. The staff was really nice, always saying hello as we walked by, so did the maids when we saw them. A fun twist was when Julia in the reception spoke swedish to us. We are from Norway, so it was easy for us to understand. The rooms are not huge, but they never are in older buildings in Europe, so that's ok. Free on-screen internet in the room is a big plus for me. Got some emails sent when I needed to. The location is so good. Easy to reach from Gare Montparnasse coming from Orly, ant two great Metro stops at both ends of the street. One will take you straight to the Eiffel Tower. Also Rue de Rennes is close by for some good shopping. Lots of places to eat and have coffee in the area. A large Monoprix at the one street end. Go there for some good and cheep wine and champange and food and do lunch by the Eiffel tower! Go back at night and bring the Champange and see the lights twinkle on the hour. Then catch the Metro back to the hotel for a good and peaceful night's rest. It's really nice to stay in a area that aren't crowded with tourists. I'm sure they are there, but they aren't as easy to spot as in other parts of Paris. Enjoy your stay, we'll be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, everything worked”
Reviews.Author: peba
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Reasonable price, friendly. Everything: mattresses, AC, breakfast, showers etc. worked. We are used to living in inexpensive dumps for around 80â‚¬ per night. A modest increase in nightly cost is perhaps in line with having grown older and appreciating a good mattress, hot water and working air conditioning more than when we were eighteen years old. The Lenox is a block away from two metro stations and only around 500m from the Montparnasse RER station, which is served by the RER train from Charles de Gaulle airport. The street the Lenox is on has good restaurants as does the whole neighborhood. Try the Korean Barbecue, if you are bored with French food. The hotel breakfast is good, but at 16â‚¬, a bit steep in price. If a croissant, coffee and some OJ is good enough, try the Odessa Cafe a block away on Rue d'Odessa for 8â‚¬.

Reviews.Title: “excellent well mannered and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: tomspring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lennox from 14/21May 08. We found the staff very helpful. unfortunately there are some circumstances such as noise from people going down the stairs or the lift in the moring which is beyond thier control. We would recomend that the traveller specifically ask for a room at the back if they want peace and quite. Ensure that this is not on the same side as the stairs or the lift we stayed in room 21 which was noisy in the morning and which was on the same side as the stairs and the lift. The staff were very helpful and moved us to room 47 which facing the street this room was very niceand you could have tea on the small balcony. Unfortunately this was also noisy at night especially at the weekends as there is a pub across the street which can be busy. We ordered a taxi at the hotel front desk to the airport. We were both very tired and happy to arrive at the CDG airport. However the driver charged 75 Euro 's the normal price is around the 40 to 50 euro mark, so check the price when you book your taxi through the hotel at the time you order it, to get a rough estimate of the cost inorder to ensure that you are not ripped off. Overall great hotel staff, clean rooms, a great area, Metro access nearby. Just get a nice quiet back room and you will have a ball. Tom & Nora

Reviews.Title: “The best stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NotParis
Reviews.Content: The location, service, atmosphere, cleanliness and hospitality of the Lenox Montparnasse Hotel are unsurpassed for Paris - and all at a reasonable rate, breakfast included! We stayed for 5 unforgettable nights at the Lenox. When we arrived early on the day of our reservation, the hotel staff offered to keep our bags safe until our room was ready (unfortunately it was still occupied by the previous guests so we were unable to claim the room early). The hotel lobby had a computer for guests' use and we later even used the printer to print airline boarding passes. Rue Delambre is an active street, with many brasseries, cafes and restaurants, but not busy with traffic as is Rue Montparnasse a few hundred feet away. This made for a peaceful stay. The Metro has stops at either end of the street, a very quick walk and easily managed with baggage. Even Gare Montparnasse, a main train station, is close by and can be managed with baggage as well. The street also has a movie theatre, a small groceteria, wine store, laundromat, fish monger, cheese shop, bakery, delicatessan, internet cafe - the easy makings of a great picnic en route or in your room. We finally claimed our room later that afternoon after touring the quarter, and were extremely pleased. We booked the Superior Room through Travelocity for 130 Euros a night, which had an elegant queen sized bed, a desk/chair, and television which included Internet on TV, a bar fridge with snacks, and a marvellously appointed bathroom - with tub/shower, fine toiletries, sink, toilet and bidet. The facilities looked very new. We overlooked Rue Delambre, which got busy in the early morning - but if you kept the balcony door closed, the room was very quiet. We didn't think the room had air-conditioning but we were surprised one afternoon upon entering a refreshingly cool room - the air conditioning unit was so silent that we were unaware that we even had it! The room was not large by North American standards but perfect for our stay. The room had a closet with hanging room and shelves and included an in-room safe that was large enough to hold documents, jewellery and even a camera. We used this continuously. The maids were very friendly, courteous and did a fabulous job keeping our room well stocked, neat and clean. The room rate was all-inclusive (not the bar items or telephone) - and included a marvellous continental breakfast with hot fresh coffee/tea, fresh squeezed juice, choice of cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, pastries, bread, eggs, sausage, cold cuts and delicious croissants! Kudos to the attentive and friendly staff who cared for us during breakfast! The front desk staff were extremely friendly. The desk is occupied 24 hours/day and your room key is left at the front desk before leaving the hotel. We never had a problem coming/going and felt secure the entire time. For families, our room was next to a slightly smaller room, but could be made into a suite with an outer door that could be locked. Some rooms overlooked a rear courtyard with a fountain, which would be even more peaceful. The hotel also has larger suites that we did not see, but can be viewed on the hotel website. I found the best rate by booking through Travelocity, but you could even try calling the hotel direct. All of the front desk staff that we spoke with could also speak English. We will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hendlebaby
Reviews.Content: Lenox Montparnasse is a great and affordable place to stay the next time you go to Paris. My friend and I had both been to Paris before and knew the importance of location location location in Paris. We believe we have found it with Lenox Montparnasse. The hotel has a great location with two metro stations close by and a railway station directly linked to the airport within walking distance. There is a great bakery, little supermarket, cheese shop, deli (and FANSTASTIC shoe shop!) all down that same street, as well as busy restaurants and cafes at either ends. There are also markets, however make sure you go on the Saturday if you are after food as Sunday is antiques. The hotel staff are lovely, helpful and informative and in the afternoon you get free coffee and tea in the bar. The room is a typical European room size but there is no scrimping on space for the bathroom and the shower has so much pressure, it's fantastic! We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Fussytoo
Reviews.Content: Well placed near two Metros and excellent restaurants. Clean, comfortable (with small but not cramped bedroom), usual splash problems with over-bath shower and half screen, plenty of hot water, reasonably quiet, breakfast satisfying (although not cheap), lift small but works, aircon efficient, bar excellent, plenty of English inside and out, rates reasonable for area. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A PLACE THAT MADE YOU FEEL LIKE A PARISIAN”
Reviews.Author: mrsluckycat
Reviews.Content: I like many of you on this site, I research and agonize over where to stay on my vacations, and this time did not have many choices since I had to make plans on late notice. Once again trip adiviser got it right I have trusted this site for 5 or 6 hotels and have never been dissapointed. ok the hotel...its not perfiect, but nothing is. the staff is very friendly like everyone says. wer arrived exhasuted after a 7 hour flight and they let us check in about 4 hours early...no charge the room is a bit small but never felt oppresive. ( they could use a bathroom fan) the double glazed windows kept most of the noise out and I am a very light sleeper. True the garbage trucks are a bit noisy at 8 a. m. on some days, but you should be getttin up by then anyway. You dont go to paris to sleep all day. AND IT IS ONLY ONE BLOCK TO THE METRO- plus one block to the bus and a couple of blocks to other metro stops and the major train station. (I dont know what the torronto reviewer is talking about ) there are great restuaraunts all ethnicities, types and prices great bakeries, a grocery store a few doors down. every day you'd come back exhasuted and there was free coffee and tea and your room was spotless and fresh smelling. and the luxemburg gardens are within a few blocks and they are more beuatiful than the tulleries the breakfast is fine...especially if you can get it included in the room price We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireLyn
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel with a warm welcome on reception and the young ladies are both knowledgeable very helpful with suggestions to help you make the most of your stay. Several languages are spoken. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The journey from CDG airport is easy - a RER train and then the Metro to Vavin. It is only a 5min walk from the Metro. The area is charming with excellent restaurants close at hand also a lovely street with delicious crepes. Many locals eat in the area so that is always a good sign. This was our second stay at Hotel Lenox and we know it won't be our last. Since last year there have been changes and one feels they are always looking to add to guests experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes87
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse hotel was a lovely place to stay. If your going to Paris for sightseeing you dont want to be spending all your money on fancy 5 star hotels or the likes as all you'll need is a place to sleep at night. I found the staff very friendly and welcoming, the hotel was gorgeous and very clean. Staff were very helpful in directing you or giving information on various sites. The rooms were cleaned every day. There's a mini bar, internet, wi-fi, satalite TV, selected movies and much more available in the rooms. Landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Champs ElysÃ©e, Seine, Lourve, Notre Dame aren't too far away. The metro system is very fast and efficient and is the best way to get around the city. There is a metro station just around the corner from the hotel, and another two 5 mins in each direction that can bring you to most destinations or close to them. If your walking back to hotel and your lost, it's hard not to find it because the Montparnasse( Big Skyscraper) is just up the road from the hotel and can be seen over most buildings(I reccomend you go up that as your first visit as it overlooks the whole of Paris and will give you an idea of where you are, and also go up some evening as the sun sets). Overall its location is excellent, staff and hotel were brilliant and i would defintely recommend anyone who's going to paris to consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Not_fussy_Toronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox late last year, first impression... i thought it was excellent. But after reflection 1/2 year later.... i think that the Lenox is over-rated. 1) You're paying a lot if you think you're paying for a location. The location is mediocre at best. I'd much rather stay in the Latin Quarter than there. Restaurants and shops are more expensive near the hotel. However, I can't really complain about the room itself. They are clean, super quiet and comfortable (we had a Club room for price of deluxe). It did have the most comfortable bed on my entire 3 week vacation. (The shower had one of those half glass set-ups... which i always find annoying since i tend to soak the floor) 2) Reception was semi-helpful but they seemed a little aloof. Almost charged me for room service which i didn't have. 3) Would i stay there again... only if i got a good deal on the room. It was nice but i can't really recommend it to others since i found the location f the a little far from the attractions that interested me. It was a bit of a walk to the metro stations so that made it a little more difficult to get around. To be honest, it think the room was quiet pretty and modern but i just think that i could find a better room, with a better location for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Mumanddaughter08
Reviews.Content: After hours of searching the internet, I decided on this hotel for my daughter and I to stay in on our first visit to Paris. We were not disappointed. The location is excellent, being in close access to 2 metro stops and easy walking to restaurants and shops and to St Germain. The area felt safe and comfortable even when coming home late at night. Hotel Lenox was warm and inviting and all the staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly. The hotel room was not as small as i had anticipated and was extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable. The room faced the street but had double glazed windows and so was quiet at night. Some noise occasionally, but nothing much to speak of. The bathroom was new and quite large with a lovely bath and shower and big soft bath towels, all very necessary after hours of walking around Paris. I was surprised at the size of it as it also had a bidet. It was always cleaned beautifully and we always had plenty of lovely fresh towels. We did not have breakfast but did enjoy a couple of afternoons enjoying the tea and coffee and biscuits provided free of charge every day. I guess this was because there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but that was not a problem. This is a lovely little hotel, quiet and with a nice bar downstairs if you want a drink at night. There is a little supermarket just next door and some cheap little eating places nearby. All in all a great hotel in a good area and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EveryAprilinParis
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse has an excellent location near the railroad, 4 Metro lines, and the airport bus. The neighborhood is one of the best in Paris for a visitor, with many restaurants, cafes, and shops. The hotel staff are extremely welcoming and helpful. The hotel is beautifully maintained, spotlessly clean, nicely decorated, and all rooms are nonsmoking. Towels and tolietries are outstanding. A few minor quibbles: There is some noise, the maid staff does not always honor the "do not disturb" sign, and the breakfast buffet is good but very expensive. Some tips: The famous La Rotonde is perfect for sitting outdoors and sipping wine. Chez Clement is good and less expensive than the more famous restaurants in the area. There is a nice small patisserie on Rue de Depart near the train station for breakfast. Don't eat in the Lebanese restaurant on Rue de l"Odessa--the only really bad meal I've ever had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: war_eagle_8
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a very pleasant week-long stay at the Lenox. Room was small -- to average continental standards -- but so clean and nicely appointed that the size didn't bother us. Staff are very friendly and helpful as other reviewers have observed. The breakfast seemed rather expensive at 16 Euros, but I broke down and had it the last day. It turned out to be a very nice buffet with an assortment of high-quality cheeses, hams, eggs, pastries, and beverages. Location was a very nice surprise. I have stayed in Paris over 20 times and somehow never really explored the Montparnasse area. Lots of fancy restaurants, modest restaurants, boulangeries, cafes, and so on. Public transportation is also very convenient in this area. The Lenox will be my hotel of choice on my return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: spiken
Reviews.Content: As it was my first time in Paris, I relied on tripadvisor's reviews to choose a hotel. Frankly, it seems the major complaints regarding a majority of hotels in this price range are 1) size 2) service 3) noise 4) cleanliness. Actually, despite the large number great ratings this hotel received on tripadvisor, I still had lower expectations based on the few negative comments. Perhpas that served me well, as I was very pleasantly surprised with the Lenox. First, the staff was most welcoming. We didn't require special treatment (change rooms / directions / etc.) so I cannot comment on the helpfulness of the staff. However, their willingness to please seemed evident. Yes, the rooms are small, but we booked a club room (#311) and it was everything we needed. It was in the back of the hotel away from the elevator, with a cute bathroom and double (queen?) bed. The room was very clean and tidy, and the cleaning staff did a great job each day keeping it that way. Although we didn't have a problem with noise, I can see where others may complain if the neighbors are rowdy (the walls are a little thin, but not too bad). The breakfast was fine, but not really worh the 16EU given all the good choices around the hotel. There is even a grocer 50meters away where you can buy some breakfast food to keep in the mini-bar fridge. We liked the location very much... very easy to get to all the sites via metro, and is a bit closer to versailles for a side trip. Our best meal in the area was at the Le Dome Brasserie (~80EU for two of us). We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh la la”
Reviews.Author: MNDC
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers report, this is a great hotel for a reasonable price. The location is perfect. Staff are friendly and helpful. Tthe decor is "tasteful," but the place still has real character. The rooms are very clean. Next time I go I might spring for a "club room." We stayed in room 405, which was great in many ways - quiet, bright, facing the street, with its own little balcony. But the room was small for two people, and the shower was truly tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox - just great !”
Reviews.Author: Paul_and_JoJo
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. You hear some bad stories of hotels in Paris but the hotel Lenox ticks every box and more. The location, the staff, our room and the breakfast were all excellent and on top of all that, there is free tea, coffee and biscuits on offer in the bar area every afternoon, a lovely touch. I will definitely try to book this hotel for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox is Top Choice!”
Reviews.Author: traveler_2_7_8
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful, 4 night stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. I arrived at 9am directly from the airport. Since my reserved room was still occuppied, they upgraded my room, so that I could immediately recover from the overseas flight. The service was excellent and the room was very comfortable. The Montparnasse area is also excellent and surrounded by a wide range of restaurants and metro lines. I will stay here again on my next trip to Paris. I had stayed at other hotels on this street on previous trips, and the Lenox is by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: James1987
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several 3 star hotels in Paris. This is the best of them by far. The location is excellent, only a short walk to the Metro. Even the RER station is a reasonable walk, so don't be afraid to take the RER from CDG airport and walk to the hotel. I recommend it as a very good value in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JoJoMichelle
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. The room was adequate, the size was expected, but it did not feel cramped. I was impressed at the large size of the bathroom. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. They gave us great recommendations for where to eat and directions when needed. Hotel is in a great area, safe, clean, close to three metro stops so that changing lines isn't needed very often. Had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: blowout
Reviews.Content: Spent a long time researching where to stay in Paris and glad i did as we hit the top with Lennox Montparnasse. Cannot find fault with it at all. The room was fantastic - not as small as i had expected for being in Paris, super clean, huge comfy bed, plenty of hanging space for 4 days, bathroom very spacey, even the hairdryer was quick and efficient and the shower pressure was fantastic (though i did tend the flood the bathroom!). Hotel amenties were great - loved the little bar area. As for breakfast, well we had expected the worst and were stunned at the selection and freshness of the food. Didn't try the cooked breakfast so can't comment on that but the fresh fruit, freshly sqeezed juice, assortment of pastries, breads, cold meats, cheese, preserves and numerous types of tea kept me very happy. Also breakfast ran till 11am which was handy after late nights.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the place - but ask for a room at the back”
Reviews.Author: CAW1971
Reviews.Content: Great location, to start with. Very near three Metro stops and some nice cafes nearby. You can get straight from the Gard du Nord to Vavin without having to change. The room was small but very nice and clean while the staff were absolutely excellent. Extremely helpful, particularly when I needed some things photocopying. The bar was nice while the breakfast was average but then, that's normal for France. The only problems were that the room walls were so thin and that the double-glazing wasn't great. As a result, if you have a room overlooking the street, the rubbish carts will wake you up at 6am every morning which did pee me off a bit. For this reason only, that's why I am not giving the place 5/5. But, I had a pleasant four nights there and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, great situation.”
Reviews.Author: gtcnick
Reviews.Content: We organised a family celebration in Paris at fairly short notice at the Lenox Montparnasse and found the whole experience very pleasing. The staff at the hotel were genuinely interested and most welcoming, we were kindly given an upgrade, a very pleasant room and the hotel was in every way ideal for our requirements. It was wonderful to be close to so many excellent restaurants - we celebrated at La Coupole. The hotel is good value and very warmly recommended by all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vanillaa
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a truly wonderful experience. I am very happy to have stayed with Hotel Lenox for my first three days in Paris! I especially loved your delicious breakfast buffet, boutique-style toiletries, and very friendly receptionists. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: rturk
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Lenox Montparnasse was very enjoyable. I found the prices to be very reasonable, and the staff at the front desk was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. The room itself was nicer than I'd come to expect from my previous trips to Paris. It was large by European standards, recently renovated, and luxurious. There were a few things I found odd, like being asked to leave my room key when I left the hotel and needing to activate the lights in the hallways, but they were ultimately very convenient and thoughtful and probably just reflect that things work a bit differently in different countries. The location is convenient to public transportation, and I was able to rapidly get anywhere I needed to go. My experience was very pleasant and I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity at its best”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: For anyone not willing to spend more than â‚¬300 a night, there can't be many better options (I've tried a bunch). Lenox is a modest but charming and clean, perfectly located hotel with very friendly staff. Highly recommended, we will keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: ken-n-anne
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lenox simply for itâ€™s position, however the quality and ambience of the hotel did much to contribute to the success of our visit. To celebrate our Ruby wedding our intention was to explore a limited area of Paris on foot, soaking up the atmosphere, searching for good food and views, Montparnesse is perfect for this. The artistic history of the area provides a still living backdrop - even extending to the Lenox itself with Room 37 once housing the photographic studio of Man Ray - whilst the graves in the nearby cemetery broaden to the story. The hideous gigantic tombstone of the Tour Montparnesse becomes acceptable after a visit to the roof and 56th floor lounge, preferably before and after sunset, better than the view from the Eiffel Tower since it contains the icon itself. The mixture of parks and architecture, cafes and independent shops (including the biggest art materials shop we have ever seen), museums and street markets, this is a Paris of detail which bears close examination. We did not consult â€œtrip advisorâ€� before we visited and weâ€™re a little disappointed with some of the comments, so here is our view: Rue Delhambre is a delightful little microcosm of Paris this is a thriving, working environment made up of real businesses, shops, hotels, restaurants, even a cinema and of course peoples homes, obviously rubbish must be collected, bottles need to be recycled and yes this can involve noise and exhuberance, a city with the depth of history that Paris enjoys tends towards the crowded. Do not come to this type of community expecting a package holiday type of tourist cocoon - this is part of the real world and accepting it as such will offer a wonderful flavour of Paris life. As a final note the staff are extremely helpful and friendly - especially considering that this is a capital city not often known for the patience of its citizens.

Reviews.Title: “All we've expected and more”
Reviews.Author: Honichi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Lenox for 7 nights. The hotel is perfectly located at the heart of Montparnasse area, minutes walk from the tower of Montparnasse. Our room was at the fifth floor of the hotel, facing the street. It was a bit noisy, especially in the mornings (we woke up late). The room and the hotel are spotless (It seems like they've just finished to renovate) , The room size is just fine (in European standards) The hotel stuff are amazing - they speaks english fluently and ready to help in all your needs. We'll definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is a notch above the rest”
Reviews.Author: benjiboy32
Reviews.Content: After spending a long time searching for the right hotel that was not an arm and a leg I was very please as was my wife we thought it was an excellent Hotel, very well placed in a nice area. Very friendly and helpful staff, we booked the club sized rooms which are not very big but big enough and definitely bigger than the standard rooms. The breakfast was well worth the money paid. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable, we would definitely recommend the Lenox as we felt it was good value for money. We booked through Eurostar as a package from London.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 79bronco
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on other reviews. We were not disappointed. This was our first trip to Paris and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bar/breakfast area is nice and convenient. The free internet terminal in the lobby was helpful for us. The location is great and we walked everywhere in Paris from here. The train/bus station is a few blocks away. Tip - use the Air France shuttle to the Montparnasse station (cheap and easy). Go and eat in the Latin quarter near Notre Dame (everywhere we ate in Paris was great but we liked this area the best). The price was right and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, local shops but convenient, slightly noisy”
Reviews.Author: Aaroncheang
Reviews.Content: After visiting Paris several times from London and staying in the Latin Quarter, we decided to stay somewhere else for Valentines day. Quick review and pros and cons Pros - easy to get to from Gare du Nord (where the Eurostar comes in) as its on a single metro line (20 min ride) - Reasonably priced hotel in Paris - Clean, easy to get to from 3 metro stops on different lines (less than 5 min walk from 2 metros - Vavin and Edgar Quinet) - Local flavour as there are local shops on the street (cheese, seafood, butcher, supermarket) and local markets on the weekend (Sat - food, Sun - artist) - Decent rooms and facilities - Hotel staff speak English - Free wireless internet in rooms - Free tea in afternoon - Bar - Quiet street - Food and restaurants are nearby (2 min walk) Cons - Room walls can be a bit thin so you can hear muffled noises from your neighbours in bathroom, etc - Breakfast is not included (around 16 euro?) - Rooms are a little small (we were in #45) Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable small hotel, excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: simonbg
Reviews.Content: We came for a weekend break with Eurostar, and this was very convenient to get to from Gare du Nord - the metro line stops at one end of the street the hotel is on, and at the other end is another line that goes to the Eiffel Tower. Ideal for getting around town. The area around the hotel is also great for dining out, with plenty of small restaurants and brasseries of varying price. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, but found a great place at the end of the road. We also ate dinner one time nearby, which was a good choice. The hotel itself is quite small and seemed very peaceful. Our room overlooked a pleasant courtyard at the back and, although not large, was comfortable enough. The bathroom was big and clean, with plenty of hot water, though there was only a small glass panel around the shower, so plenty of water ended up on the floor (good thing there were lots of towels). Good choice of TV in many languages, and a free Internet browser in the room, which was handy when we wanted to look up a particular restaurant but hadn't brought a computer with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cr0d
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with the Lenox - well priced (relatively, for Paris), very clean ans well-appointed rooms. Staff were very helpful and allowed us to check in 3 hours early. granted, this may have been because the hotel wasn't busy when we stayed, but was a great timesaver for us. Location was excellent, with Montparnasse and many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Ice-Bear-Sailing
Reviews.Content: What a quandary - do we keep this gem a secret - or do we let others know about it? Well, in fairness to the wonderful staff - here's a review. We travel to Paris about once a month, and returning to the Lenox is like coming home. Great friendly and helpful staff - good English and not hesitant to use it - always make us feel welcome. Nice bar for tea in the afternoon or a nightcap; limited - but some - room service until 23.00; a very nice breakfast; compact (the European norm) but very clean and well-appointed rooms with satellite TV and in-room movies; perfect location to experience 'real' Paris, but close to the sites; plenty of dining options to fit all budgets - this place has it all. The sporadic problems with the internet (free!) have been fixed - it booms across all floors. We enthusiastically recommend the Lenox - as long as they always have a room for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: aimstern
Reviews.Content: I had no idea what to expect and found this small, lovely hotel to be a real find. The staff is friendly, helpful and all speak English. The rooms are nice, with free Internet and flat screen TVs, there is a small bar that stays open late, and a Continental breakfast similar to those you find in other European hotels. The location is great - away from the really touristy areas, but close to many Metro stops and a nice walk to the Luxembourg Gardens and the Rue St. Denis. There are some good brasseries and restaurants nearby if you want to stay close to the hotel at night. Considering the price, it was a real value. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “MANY THANKS”
Reviews.Author: UsaSpring
Reviews.Content: Bonjour Staff of Lenox Montparnasse! Steve and I wanted to write and thank you for the wonderful stay we had in your hotel 11 January - 16 January! You were all so helpful and kind as we worked to fit as much as possible into each day! We were celebrating my in laws 50th wedding anniversary, and since they had never been to Paris before we were trying to make their trip extra special - you all helped us do that and we appreciate all of your efforts! We found the hotel to be very clean and cozy - very comfortable, and the staff to be the best! We're looking forward to spending more time with you in the future. Special thanks to Foussia, Catherine, Julia, Eric and Bridget and to the cleaning staff who are top notch!! Many thanks again for making our stay in Paris so wonderful !! With kindest regards, Steve and Leigh Ann Sadler

Reviews.Title: “Small in a cosy way, very clean and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Ritienne
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Lenox as our first stop for our honeymoon trip to France and Italy in Dec 2006. We had read the reviews on this site and got lucky in booking a doubled bed with an ensuite shower (no breakfast) for an unbelievable offer of 95 euros per room per night. Getting to Au Lenox was not difficult at all since the hotel is very close to two metro stops. First they gave us a room and it had quite a smallish bathroom. When we politely asked if it is possible to get a room with a slightly larger bathroom, the hotel staff was very accomodating and changed our room on the spot. Our room was on the top floor over the internal yard of the hotel and it was always very quiet and the windows are very well insulated. The hotel is not big, but very well maintained, cosy and though the rooms are not very big, they have all the necessary comforts. We remember it was so cold in Paris that we used to look forward to go back into the warm reddish hues of the Au Lenox interior. We were very impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel with regular re-stocking of toiletries and towels every day, good central heating and warm water always available. There was a free internet access spot in the hotel which we found to be quite convenient. The hotel is in Rue Delambre, just a few metres off from Rue Montparnasse, but so close to everything..there is a really good boulangerie down Rue DeLambre, a pharmacy and a market. We loved Montparnasse and getting to the centre of Paris was so easy and quick. Rue Montparnasse is so lively, full of good restaurants, creperies and in the evening it was sheer pleasure to stroll the whole avenue. We ate quite often at a turkish restaurant. a few hundred metres round the corner from Rue Delambre in Rue Montparnasse. We did not book breakfast at the hotel because reviews said that it was not good value for money and there are a lot of places in Rue Montparnasse where to go and have breakfast. The reviews were right even though most of the time we ended up having brunch rather than breakfast. ;) We have a lovely 7 night stay in this hotel, and we will surely look for it again shoud we decide to go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on Paris”
Reviews.Author: Deacon_John
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the vibrant district of Montparnasse. Very near the Vavin and Edgar Quintet Metro stations. Staff are very friendly, rooms are good but not great, the bar is pleasant but the best feature of the hotel is the vicinity - with plenty of lovely bars, restaurants and markets on certain days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel + Great Price + Great Location + Great Service”
Reviews.Author: chutneypopcorn78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and it was splendid. This hotel is relatively cheap for Paris. Here are the plusses: Service: 1. The staff is very helpful and show how you should get around, warn you when some things may be closed. 2. The rooms are adequate, they are not spacious, but the linen+bedding+ambiance is perfect. Location: 1. Adjacent to smaller station within 2 min walk and close to the major Montparnasse station. 2. Plently of places to eat.. There is a nice Italian/French deli near by which is awesome. 3. Laundromat with in few minute walk from the hotel. Was very convenient. Cons: 1. Even though they have non-smoking rooms, which are perfect, the hallway has a slight odor of smoke. In my opinion this is unavoidable (Europeans smoke A LOT)

Reviews.Title: “Dignified coziness/wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ilexandra
Reviews.Content: The Lenox was a great base for a much-needed romantic four-day between the holidays getaway. We did a lot of walking -- Montparnasse Cemetary, Luxembourg Gardens, Hotel de Cluny -- but were happy to have metro stops just around the corner to get back quickly at the end of the day or to head for more distant destinations. Loved the numerous art deco cafÃ©-brasseries within steps of the hotel where people of all ages were eating, drinking coffee or having a beer or cognac all at the same time. I can only drink so much coffee or wine but I discovered and worked my way through the entire exciting (to a lactose intolerant) gamut of French sorbet flavors. After arriving late our first evening we did some great people watching over desert at La Coupole, had our best meal at Le Dome (fish), and especially liked the cafÃ© atmosphere and friendly/funny waiters at Le Select where we spent a long evening with a Parisian friend. Our room was a perfect little retreat of classically diginified comfort. It was a pleasure to return to it. The staff was friendly, intelligent, attentive. The only downside was the breakfast. There I would have been happy to forego a few of the ample buffet offerings for better coffee and decent orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: new_york_paris
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler to Paris and switched to the Lenox in 10/07 for a 6 night stay and it was a great value, a true three star, in an excellent location just off the blvd. Montparnasse. Staff is courteous and professional, room was very comfortable, clean and as advertised. Returning next week (1/08) for a longer stay and look forward to the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: smiley052
Reviews.Content: Trying to select a hotel for our first trip to Paris was overwhelming for me. We decided on the Lenox Montparnasse, based on the price, location, and the positive reviews here. We were not disappointed at all. Yes, the rooms and the lift are small. But the warm, knowledgeable and pleasant staff more than made up for that. The beds were comfortable, and the rooms were clean and quiet. We enjoyed the friendly bartender after a long day of sightseeing, and made use of the free Internet access on the computer in the lobby. There are two metro lines nearby. Because of the rail strike, we decided to walk to some of our destinations, like the Eiffel Tower (a little far but a very pleasant walk) and le Louvre (20 minute walk at a comfortable pace). We picked up a few last minute gifts at the mall and supermarket in the Montparnasse Tower, only a couple of blocks away. We will definitely stay at the Lenox Montparnasse on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl50
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Paris, and we loved the Lenox. It was a key player in making this an amazing visit. Comfortable beds and an all around perfect location. The very friendly and English speaking staff helped us expand our limited French. Just across the street were several shops selling bread, sausages, cheese, and wine, and there was even a small grocery store for buying fruit and yogurt. We really enjoyed going from shop to shop in the evenings and selecting fresh food for a few simple suppers and breakfasts in our room, which was nice when our tired feet could think of nothing better than having their shoes off! One morning we spent 3 hours walking in the light rain around the Cimetiere de Montparnasse. It was so interesting to see the tombstones of many of France's famous intellectuals, poets and artists. On a Saturday morning, a fairly large street market took place in the neighborhood. The sights and smells of markets are always a treat for us, as we nibbled our way through and took photos of people living their lives. Because of the Lenox and it's location, we felt much more assimilated into the neighborhood than when we were here 3 years ago and would have to say that this approach to Paris was much more romantic than taking in all of the museums and tourist sites (although we did do some of those at night).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: len0x
Reviews.Content: How I love Paris! This hotel made my stay even more wonderfulâ€”the staff was friendly and courteous, and quickly made me feel welcome. The rooms were pretty and clean. Just the right size for a single traveler. They even leave the radio on with classical music, a really nice touch you appreciate as you enter your room. Also, they provide free wi-fi access and tasty breakfasts (in Paris, what could be not tasty). Most importantly, I could tell they cared about my comfort and felt comfortable sharing any needs or concerns. Location-wise, this is a great choice, right by the Vavin Metro stop and close also to Edgar Quinet. Really on the heart of so many things. A lively and pleasant area. So, look no further and make the Lenox your home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Chic”
Reviews.Author: bibliogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox during off-season, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to afford it. Our room was tiny but beautifully decorated, and the staff was friendly. The location is excellent, with lots of creperies and restaurants right down the street, and a Metro station only a couple of blocks away. It was really nice to spend our first time in Paris in a non-dumpy, elegant hotel. The walls are thin, though: we had one uncomfortable evening listening to frisky neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 2smiles
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable room and an incredible staff. The Metro is just a short walk around the corner, which enables easy access to everywhere in Paris. All prices and types of wonderful restaurants are in walking distance. The room was quiet and nicely decorated. The Staff was the best part of our stay in France. They took care of us as though we were their personal friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox-Montparnasse- A Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: PuppyToes
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with a very helpful staff. Our room was smaller than we believed we had reserved. The staff offered to move us the following morning to another larger room that was coming available. While there is no concierge, the front desk staff were knowledgeable about Metro lines, directions, etc. There were no loud or boisterous guests. The only negative comment (and it could happen anywhere) was a new bartender. My traveling companion and I each ordered a mixed cocktail from the menu. He had no clue what to prepare. My drink contained no mixes whatsoever...just pure whiskey...my friend's drink was like drinking sour dish water! I did mention it to the front desk....and I did not see the same bartender for the remainder of the stay. I would definitely return to this charming, clean, well maintained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accomodations and Courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: heather143
Reviews.Content: We stayed for my 30th birthday this September. I did a ridiculous amount of research and decided to stay here based on price and location. It was my 2nd choice, but thought the trade off was worth it. The hotel is nice - I expected small. It's a further walk from the RER than people make it sound unless you take the metro a stop, but is still walkable. Several metro stops within a couple blocks (Montparnasse Bienvenue has many connections to other lines) make it convenient, but I would have rather stayed in closer to Lux Parc nearer to the Latin Quarter. Also, the only english channel was CNN. I know that people don't go to Paris to stay in the room and watch tv, but after a long day it's nice to unwind - or to distract the insomniac. These are flat-screen tv's, so are fairly new, but did not offer subtitles. I think I would've liked my first choice better, but for my first stay in Paris, I wasn't disappointed. Paris is a much larger city than I thought! No better way to spend my 30th!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: happytravellerbc
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Expedia and were not disappointed. The staff were very welcoming and all spoke english, which was a relief as our knowledge of french is somewhat limited. But it is still good to try and speak a little french if you can -- just hello, goodbye, thankyou. It's surprising how much better you are treated if you make an effort! Our club room was small but not too cramped. We had requested a room facing the courtyard but there was none available, so our room faced onto the street, which could be a little noisy at night (people in paris are definetely night people -- bars and cafes are open till about 2am) but we were able to sleep ok. If you need complete quiet to sleep ask for a courtyard- facing room. We did not get bathrobes as was listed on the room amenities so it should be removed from the list. Bathroom was nice and roomy, closet space not too bad and there was a safe which was handy for storing our documents and extra cash. There is a bar in the hotel and breakfast is also served but costs too much in my opinion. We ate breakfast at one of the local cafes for about 1/2 the price. The Metro was at the end of the street and there are lots of bars and restaurants in the area. There is also a supermarket close by which was handy to pick up drinks and snacks. Be prepared to pay high prices in the bars and cafes if you want to sit outside -- you are essentially paying for the experience -- we paid 9 euros (about $13 ) for a coffee and a small glass of coke. when dining In the resaurants wine is much cheaper than pop or bottled water! Overall we really liked the area as it was not too touristy and was close to the centre of Paris -- about 5-10 mins on the Metro. We would certainly stay at the Lenox again when we are in Paris. Great location, friendly staff, clean and nicely decorated room, it was well worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: fung1964
Reviews.Content: Basically the US price was $100/for each star, so a 2 star hotel = $200+/night. You get the picture. This is a 3 star hotel for under $300. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood. Great metro train access, lots of restaurants, cafes and grocery stores. The stand up shower is very tight but how long does the shower last compare to your night's rest. The front desk was helpful with our luggage storage and directions. I would definetely come back and stay here again when visiting Paris next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: ozcazz
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The area is wonderful, not very touristy at all but with good cafes and restaurants all around. The Vavin metro station is so close so it's convenient to almost anywhere in Paris being on the 4 line. The staff have to be met to be believed - they were charming and they really turn this little hotel into a home away from home. They take a genuine interest in you and are really nice people. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and the reasons are the staff and the location. It feels safe being there and it feels like you're actually in Paris and not in tourist hell. There is a market a few doors away, a great patisserie and a cheese shop in the same street as well as a kids school! It's a bit noisy at night / early morning if you're on the street because of restaurant traffic and shop keepers opening up but I slept with the windows wide open because it all felt so wonderfully exciting and safe and if I stayed there again I'd want to be on the street definately. The rooms are pretty small but clean and comfortable and there is breakfast available and at night the breakfast area is a very nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MatildaOxford
Reviews.Content: We booked an Expedia weekend package (to include Eurostar fare and one night's stay at the Lenox). This hotel is wonderfully well situated in a safe, lively area, near the Metro, and we couldn't have been happier with the location. The reception staff are outstanding - very tactful about assessing how much French you can manage, helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable, clean and elegant, with a spotless, well-designed and well-equipped bathroom. The bar was a lovely place to unwind after a busy day in Paris: it was comfortable, quiet and the bar staff were attentive and professional. There are books to read there, and I noticed that they were not the usual motley collection, but all up to date - two thrillers published this year, for instance, and a 2007 Paris guide. This attention to detail is what makes a hotel excellent rather than just OK. I certainly stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone who is tired of flashy, soulless hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “lenox so so”
Reviews.Author: jonjonandbabs
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel because of the rave reviews about it it was nothing special rooms clean but small ours had a reasonable bathroom friends was very tiny shower room female staff on reception were very good barman seemed to have not muchtime except if you were buying very expensive champagne prices for drink very expensive in hotel and area eg two whiskies two small beers ranging from 20pounds not euros to extorionate 35 pounds depending on bistro do not know how the parisians can afford this watch out for taxis only take four people if you beg from station to airport around 60 euros but again had to beg tham to take four the montparnasse area seems to be expensive would choose another district if we go back louvre good value eifiel tower bit dissapointing only one side working delays to go up about 4hours sacre coeur well worth going to see the waiters can be rude but do not tip as there was always a service charge on your bill even in cafes and pubs

Reviews.Title: “Average for the money”
Reviews.Author: HikerIreland
Reviews.Content: Decent average hotel, expensive for the room size,even though I got a free upgrade.We would not have fitted into anything smaller. Staff good, breakfast good if on the expensive side

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, friendly and helpful staff, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: togernor
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Lenox was enjoyable as always. I've stayed there several times over the last decade, and look forward to returning. It is reasonably priced, and the rooms, although small, are very comfortable and well-kept, and all seem to have memorable views, either of the quiet street or a picturesque courtyard. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help. They all speak English and are also indulgent to people who want to try out their rusty French. I had been in Europe for several weeks and realized that I had not brought the information on my return flight (booked online, no paper); I envisioned having to get to Charles DeGaulle hours in advance just to find the correct terminal, but two members of the staff found everything for me, so I could relax and enjoy my last night in Paris. The Lenox was recommended to me by friends and since then I have recommended it to others. I could cite other examples of the excellent staff helping me in the past, for example, when my luggage did not arrive with me in Paris. Oh, and you can't beat the neighborhood. It's definitely the best part of Paris to stay in, and that's saying a lot in a city with so many great neighborhoods (all of which are easily accessible fronm the nearby Metro stop)!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise 60th Birthday began at the Lennox.”
Reviews.Author: Rodders43
Reviews.Content: After a lot of searching through the internet I kept coming back to The Lenox Montparnasse. Our visit was to be part of a 60th.Birthday surprise celebration that was to include other members of our friends family arriving from England at the chosen Hotel mid afternoon on Sunday 19th.August 07. When I contacted the Lenox directly by telephone, I began speaking with Julia, well if ever staff can make the right sort of impact Julia certainly did! immediately I began asking the normal questions Julia had all of the answers and represented the Lenox Montparnasse with such professionalism and enthusiam I decided immediately that this was where we would be staying. She became part of our group for the whole of our stay, acting as an unpaid tour organiser, places to see, routes of interest to walk, places to eat, taxi's, and through all of this managing to keep little surprises secret from the recipient. I had read reports that the rooms were small! maybe they are but they are big enough!! why would you want to go to Paris and sit in your room? if you walk Paris what your Hotel room should have is good shower and washing facilities, and the Lenox has. Ideally placed on the South side of the Seine within a 35 minute walk from the Eifel Tower in one direction and a 35 minute walk in the opposite direction will find you at the Notre-Dame. If you want a good solid foundation to your stay in Paris, above average decor and staff (especially "Julia") that truely care, then look no further than The Lenox Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bonnieb333
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and for once was not only happy to find that they were right, but the hotel was even better than described. It was very clean and well decorated. I even had my own balcony complete with well maintained flower boxes. So adorable! For what you get, including the location, the price is amazing! I almost don't want anyone to know so I can get a room there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Small but really nice”
Reviews.Author: Slick58
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the freindly staff and cleanliness of this small Lenox hotel. The rooms were decidedly small but clean with nice fresh sheets and thick towels and a bright and clean washroom. Ours had a view of the street and a nice new opening window with the typical paris iron railing and flower box. In room internet service was great and we used it to plan our Paris touring. There must have been 100 cafe's with in easy walking distance, we didn't have a bad meal in any of them we tried. The Lenox bar was also small but very nice and the drinks and wines were excellent although a little pricey. Altogether we had a great experience here and would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: GAJunebug
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Lenox Montparnasse. The staff spoke English and was very friendly and helpful. The room was small but very comfortable and clean. It is very close to the Vavin metro stop and not far from the the Port Royal RER station. There were many good places to eat nearby. One morning we were pleasantly surprised by a wonderful street market that appeared on Raspail. Great place, great location. Judy Augusta,GA

Reviews.Title: “Lenox..great experience, highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: havetogothere
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay:Sep 11th to 15th I normally don't do reviews but I was compelled to do this one. From the moment we (4 of us) walked trough the door at Lenox we were greeted first with a smiles and then by there professionalism towards one tired crew and let me tell you this service did not stop there..entire staff made sure that our stay was pleasant and enjoyable for the entire 5 days. Thanks to the staff of Lenox for the great Paris experience. Oh yes..I forgot...if you are there the female bartender that served us has one of the nicest bums I have seen..lol JK(Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Fairlocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and found it to be a lovely, convenient, hotel that had small but quiet, clean, tastefully furnished rooms, yet was incredibly convenient for Parisian streetlife, with the nearest Metro station [Vavin] about 100 metres away. Various other stations are merely a short stroll away, as is the Montparnasse Tower with [hem hem, watch your money disappear!] Les Galleries LaFayette. Montparnasse itself, with the iconic restaurant La Coupole' is also merely a very short stroll away. Despite the fact that we had inadvertently arrived during the Rugby World Cup, the hotel [and area] was refreshingly devoid of any 'gangs'. Breakfast, as has been mentioned, is expensive and there are plenty of places nearby to sit, and watch the world go by with your croissant! We did, however, eat there on our final morning as we were about to drive south, and it is fine and filling. The advantage for us was also that you can park your car there, which was great as this is hard to find in central Paris.
