However, be aware that there are only 3 spaces [the Lenox rents spaces from the hotel next door] so let them know in advance if you intend driving, and they are pricey at E20 per day. We loved our stay here, the staff are friendly, and we'll certainly stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Base”
Reviews.Author: southy007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing. We stayed four days in mid june. The underground is located at the end of the street and is one of the best lines to be on, about ten minutes journey to the eiffel tower.....be warned though that this line is unbelievably busy at peak times!!!! The hotel is nice, small rooms but good comfort, flat screen telly which they leave playing music so when you come in late on its quite relaxing. The bathrooms are small with shower. The walls in our room were thin, we could hear the baby crying down the hallway all night, but others may be ok. TIP:- just down the road from the hotel, (turn left when leaving) is a nice bakery to get a fresh baguette in the morning, and if you turn right, there is a local supermarket to get your fillings. Saves a little money during the daytimes! ALL IN ALL IF YOU GET A GOOD DEAL ITS A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Montparnasse neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: FairWinds1
Reviews.Content: When we travel to Paris we have found the Montparnasse area to be a great spot to stay; e.g., Metropolitain access to all of Paris, good restaurants, a neighborhood feel with shops and open market, and not scruffy or rundown. This was the first time at the Lenox Montparnasse and we found it to offer a very good value (clean, but small, air conditioned rooms, friendly front desk service that is helpful, internet access as well as available lobby computer, onsite bar for winding down at the end of the day, etc) compared with other hotels in the area that we have experienced through the years. Ask for a "superior" room. We did not see the "junior suites", but they may be the answer for those needing more space. -Washington, DC traveler

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a lively area”
Reviews.Author: jn21fish
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at the Lenox, and found the area to be a great starting off point for our Parisian adventures. There is a metro just a half-block away, which is how we did the majority of our traveling in the city. Metro trains come every few minutes and will take you literally anywhere in the city. You can buy a "carnet" of tickets, a pack of ten, so that you don't have to buy a new ticket every time. The hotel is off Boulevard du Montparnasse, a street that's filled with restaurants, cafes and bars. Just around the corner from Rue Delambre is Le Select, which serves breakfast late (perfect for Americans suffering from jet lag) and is more affordable than the hotel prices. We didn't order room service, but you could get food delivered to your room anytime according to the menu. In the middle of our stay, we took a side-trip to Germany, and the hotel permitted us to leave our luggage there while we were gone. That was a huge help! In general we found the staff very friendly and helpful, and their English was easy-to-understand. Actually, we rarely used our broken French to communicate. The only time we pulled out our phrase book was in the restaurants, where even the English translations (if you can find a menu that has them) will leave out important details. My husband ordered a beef dish, but the menu failed to mention the beef was raw! One note of caution: If you print out the hotel map to navigate your way to the hotel when you arrive in the city, look at it very closely. We took the RER train from the airport, then a metro to where we thought the hotel was located. The process worked great until we stepped out onto the street, only to realize that the hotel was nowhere to be found. (Street signs are small and fixed on the sides of buildings.) It turns out we were in a completely different neighborhood because we were looking at the hotel logo and not the tiny little arrow pointing to a small street. Another bonus is that there is market on the same street as the hotel, and we bought water there and other food. Just beyond that is a bakery where you can buy delicious sandwiches. Try the "poulet" (chicken); that was our favorite. We bought one every morning and took it with us to eat for lunch wherever we were. If you want to explore further than Montparnasse for dinner, try the Latin Quarter. We stumbled on a great little place called "Odeon" and loved the food and atmosphere. Also worthwhile is taking a dinner cruise; they're expensive but well worth it for the nighttime city views and unique vantage points.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: Scrimshaw
Reviews.Content: No problems here. Room a bit on the small side, but very clean and comfortable. A new area of Paris, for us, and very nice Montparnasse is too, with some excellent restaurants and bars just down the road. You can walk to the Seine in less than 30 minutes as well. Not hugely cheap, but not expensive either - pretty good value for Parisian hotel. Extremely quiet as well. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and a great value, too!”
Reviews.Author: lizindubai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great place to stay for a Parisian adventure. My husband and I stayed there for three nights in July, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The front desk folks were super nice and helpful. The room was small, like almost all rooms in Paris, but quite nice. We liked being able to open the window/doors to the outside and watch the hustle and bustle of the street below. It was fun to be within walking distance of so many cafes, and it was also nice to be close to a metro station. All in all, we highly recommend this hotel. It's a great value and a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: FergusWellington
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff who spoke english and were very helpful. Close to Metro and ideal for onward Eurorail travel. The room was very clean and comfortable. Great value for money and would stay here next visit. Would recommend to any traveller to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: ansobol
Reviews.Content: Certainly a very good and a very Parisian hotel, in which I would be happy to stay again on a future occasion. Unlimited WiFi access worked as advertised (and was an important option indeed); the room was rather small but very clean, quiet, and neat, and had as many as three power outlets (which was good for checking email with a drained laptop battery while simultaneously charging camera batteries and my mobile phone). Staff at reception is friendly, competent and, I would say, elegant. I like the way they operate the baggage room (locked, supervised, you get separate receipts for all items left). The neighborhood is very nice: the street is lively but not noisy, there are several nice places to eat out literally next door, and the Luxembourg gardens are in 5 min walk. On the other hand, having a small electric kettle in a room would be nice (I am a heavy tea drinker) but perhaps the hotel provides it as additional option for which you should ask at reception (I did not try this). When leaving, I was asked to complete a questionnaire, and one question was "Did we surpass your expectations?" I answered no, because my expectations were already set high by other reviews on TripAdvisor, but I must say that they were exactly fulfilled by the hotel, which I would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMREM2
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse is a cute little hotel... good location, close to several metro lines... very nice & helpful staff... our room was very small, we barely fit in the shower but otherwise very clean and nice... overall thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: joyka
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful gem of a hotel. It is located close to great restraurants and the metro. It's an easy ride into downtown Paris. We enjoyed walking around the neighborhood and eating at local restaurants. The staff was so freindly and helpful. Their English is great, which was good ,because my French is barely passable. The breakfast each morning was lovely--the best we had anywhere in France. We stayed two nights in the beginning of our trip and returned to the Hotel Lenox the last two nights. Our room were clean, spacious and quiet. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: TripAdName
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was very nice and was above average for the other hotels I stayed in south of Paris. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English which was important for me as I don't speak much French. They also had a computer with free Internet access which was great for staying in touch with home. The rooms were very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: Well_travelled34
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnesse is a wonderful hotel in every way. Our room was elegantly appointed, well maintained, and very clean with a full bathroom, desk space, and free wireless internet (there's also a free terminal in the lobby). The English-speaking staff was helpful, and there were free New York Herald Tribune, Guardian, and other newspapers able to be picked up. The hotel is located on a quiet, pleasant street with excellent food shops and restaurants there and in the surrounding neighbourhood. Their presence makes it unnecessary to have breakfast in the hotel, except for those wanting a great deal to eat. The Gare Montparnesse station, from which Air France buses go from and to the airport, is in easy walking distance, as are several Metro/underground stations. We booked sight unseen through Expedia, but next time in Paris we'll be back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophiecaniche
Reviews.Content: We (me, husband, two teenagers) stayed here for three nights in June and loved it - the rooms were clean and comfortable and the front desk staff was wonderful. They were friendly and most helpful, making dinner reservations for us our first night there and calling a cab for us when our shuttle to the airport didn't show up. They were also most gracious when we attempted to communicate in our rudimentary French. The hotel is located on a small one way street that is within easy walking distance of three Metro stations and numerous restaurants. My daughter and I especially enjoyed the patisserie a few doors down from the hotel - the pain au chocolat was a favorite. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Both me and my husband loved our stay at the Lenox.”
Reviews.Author: LovemyBerner
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a great little hotel. The room was large and very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and everybody spoke good English. Most of all the location was super! Very close to the metro station, restaurants and movies. Can't wait to go back! Highly reccomend this hotel. Safe area for women travelling solo...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker
Reviews.Content: We had not stayed in Montparnasse before and it is such a great location - 10 good restaurants all within 100 metres of the hotel and easy access to a number of metro lines, the RER and Montparnasse station (for trips to Chartres and Versaille). The hotel itself is surprisingly quiet, friendly staff and well kept. Our rooms were compact but cosy. The layout is such that there are a number of adjoining rooms which makes them good for families. We would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler518
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was a good stay for Paris. The price was great and overall my husband and I liked the hotel. They were doing some remodeling but it really didn't bother us during our stay. The staff was nice and friendly. A computer was downstairs if you needed to use it. We kept our luggage in storage the day we checked out. The rooms were clean but small (as is all of Paris). I have pictures if you want to see the room/bathroom. Our only complain was that at 7am on Friday morning the smoke alarm went off! It woke us up, we didn't know what to do, and the reception didn't answer the phone. We finally got in touch with someone who said not to worry about it. It went off for about 5-10 minutes. This hotel isn't so much in the city centre. Paris really doesn't have a city centre though. You go everywhere by metro because the city is so big. This hotel is right next to the metron station so that was convenient. The hotel was in a good part of the city, lots of restaurants/bakeries nearby. We didn't find the location of the hotel a problem at all. Overall, you can't beat the price of this hotel for Paris! You should only be sleeping in the rooms and if that's the case, this hotel is perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: tarptt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The front desk staff was very helpful, giving recommendations for trains and helping with our lost luggage. There is a central computer with FREE internet access and the breakfast was wonderful. The rooms were small, but we assumed this was standard for Paris. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: macgreg8
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, modern hotel just a little off the beaten path for most tourists. However, all major sites are still easily accessible by foot. We stayed for nine nights and had a wonderful time. The room was small by North American standards and the bathroom was very small but they were certainly sufficient . . . one doesn't spend a lot of time in one's hotel room in Paris! The staff was friendly and spoke english well. The price was quite reasonable (for Paris). I think the best thing tho was the neighbourhood. There were many, many restaurants, bars, cafÃ©s, cinemas. A very good hotel, in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “A sheer delight!”
Reviews.Author: frabra
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I booked a room at the Lenox for a week's stay, we mentioned that we were planning to celebrate two special anniversaries while there. The hotel responded by offering us a superior room at regular room rates - a very kind gesture! We were warmly welcomed on arrival and pleasantly surprised with our room on the 4th floor overlooking a colourful courtyard and very quiet. The room itself was comfortable and the bed excellent, while the well-equipped bathroom was spacious. We were extremely impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the reception staff and appreciated the free internet facilities in the lobby. However, breakfast at 16 euros a head was a bit pricey, so we usually ate a tasty breakfast at the Cupola restaurant round the corner for much less. Montparnasse we found to be a delightful area: truly Parisian without a noticeable touristy atmosphere, and with easy access to the central attractions. We certainly look forward to staying at the Lenox Motparnasse when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value and service”
Reviews.Author: xtnjohnson
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse was a wonderful place to spend a week in Paris. The hotel - sparklingly clean and new - offers up-to-date (if somewhat small) rooms and wonderfully helpful staff. The location, on a side street in Montparnasse, is the only minor drawback. Montparnasse itself is not the highest-priority tourist attraction, and although there's ample access to the Metro, the RER, and suburban SNCF trains at Montparnasse Station, it's still a bit far from my favorite neighborhoods. Nevertheless, it's just a moderate walk to the Latin Quarter, where inexpensive and excellent restaurants abound - including a great jazz bar, Cafe Universel. Our room was a "standard double," with a large en-suite bathroom (excellent shower/bathtub and bidet both included) and a small terrace that opened onto a courtyard. Although the bedroom was a bit tight - most Paris hotels seem to be - we found it very comfortable and quiet (the one exception was the day the garbage trucks served the hotel across the courtyard - standard urban hazard). The staff were unfailingly gracious, whether we spoke in French (me) or English (my boyrfriend). For the price we paid - Euro 105 per night - this really couldn't be beat. I just wish we could move it to the Marais!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SugarLandCarey
Reviews.Content: My daughter chose The Lenox after a recommendation from a coworker. The location between two Metro stops (Vauvin and Edgar Quintet) made it easy to navigate around Paris. The hotel staff was extremely helpful -- especially Julia who spoke excellent English. We chose not to have breakfast at the hotel because it seemed pricey (quoted 16 Euros). There were so many quaint cafes and food shops around that served our needs better. Be sure to try out the Italian food deli on the corner -- excellent grilled vegetables marinated to perfection. The hotel room was on the small side but we thought the bathroom was more than adequate. Watch out for the shower partition because it is easy to flood the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic 35th. Wedding Anniversary Holiday”
Reviews.Author: ChefDad
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, and friendly hotel employees who went out of their way to accommodate their guests. Timely check-in upon arrival (club room reservation). Hotelâ€™s extremely small elevator required more than one trip with luggage. Our room was exceptionally clean and newly decorated on the 3rd. floor. It offered a beautiful street view from the open double doors to a mini balcony, c/w potted flowers. The free Internet service in the Hotelâ€™s lobby was also convenient. I researched a few jazz clubs on line and decided to consult with the Hotelâ€™s front desk attendant for his suggestions and/or recommendations. Upon briefly conducting his own research, he recommended a place within a 10 minute walk from our hotel (The Swan Bar) and even contacted the club to ensure â€˜live jazzâ€™ entertainment was being offered and subsequently made reservations on our behalf. One word describes our eveningâ€¦ â€˜FABULOUSâ€™, as well as our stay at the Hotel Lenox Montparnasse !

Reviews.Title: “great location, exceptional and personal customer service”
Reviews.Author: abarclaylevine
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Montparnasse was ideal from the perspective of budget and level of comfort. Well situated on the edge of the 14th and 6th arrondissements of Paris, the hotel was most accessible, and surrounded by a number of historic, fine dining options. The hotel staff was more than accommodating. The one downside was the size of the rooms, as the bed accounted for the majority of the space in the room. However, the room was well furnished and charming. Breakfast was also of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Break”
Reviews.Author: moselmeister
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an ideal base for 3 nights for our 18th Wedding anniversary in an ideal location with a couple of metro stops nearby and restaurants within walking distance. The room was pretty good by paris standards, we had 39 and had no problems with smoke overlooking the fountain at the rear. The staff are very friendly and approachable. On our way home we had a problem with the Air France pick up and the staff gave us all the information to make our way to the Vavin metro via Denfert Rochteau then onto the RER B for CDG. We would definitely visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggieScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Lenox. Our bedroom was a good size for central Paris, with nice clean linen and towels. As stated by other reviewers the bathroom wasn't huge but was perfectly adequate and very clean. The flatscreen TV allowed us to watch CNN or BBC World and be informed on the news situation at home while the free internet access in the lobby let us check email (and the weather!). The room has a mini fridge and in-room safe, both of which we used. My only disappointment was that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom. We opted for the continental breakfast in the hotel on a couple of mornings (At â‚¬8 each it was half the price of the full breakfast. This provided a variety of bread/croissants to choose from, plus juice and unlimited coffee or tea and was a good deal I thought.) All the staff we encountered were cheerful and helpful and the bar was just perfect for a late nightcap (it closes around 2am!). We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T_Monstah
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 6 night stay at the Lenox Montparnasse. The decor was trendy and the room was very clean. Room 23 was a spacious double (by European standards). I was expecting a much smaller room, so I was pleasantly surprised. We found the location to be extremely convenient to several Metro lines, and there were plenty of restaurants and bakeries in the area. Try Chez Papa across the cemetary for a very good valued lunch with many locals. Note: the touristy area is the area surrounding the Gare Montparnasse. If you want to avoid the tourists, you only have to explore more side streets. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the free internet workstation was great. The one downside was that our room did smell of smoke, especially in the evening (I think it was wafting up from bar), but we got used to it since the smell of smoke is everywhere in Paris. Also I was not a fan of the open shower with small pane to block the water, but again we also got used to this. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Just a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: GrahamC926
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights recently. Very convenient location with 2 Metro stations within 200 yards. The room cost was not cheap at 150 euros a night which, given the location and quality of the room was OK but buffet breakfast at 16 euros seems a bit steep. The room was small but very well presented with digital TV. Not that we watched much TV but at this price I would have expected to choose major satellite sports channels. There was one PC in the lobby with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Regular guest”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Lenox about once a month and have stayed at many hotels around Paris of different standards. I think it is a great hotel for the price you pay. If you aren't a regular Paris hotel visitor you have to bear in mind that rooms in this price range are always very small. On the plus side: - price - clean, stylish rooms - large bathrooms (for Paris) - great breakfast (try to get included in the rate) - (long) walking distance to most of the left bank On the minus: - the immediate surroundings are not beautiful. The 14th is not the top spot (for my taste)

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, if it wasn't for the noise.”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh_visitor51
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel to stay in, but really pretty noisy. This was noise from inside the hotel itself (banging, shouting; even something that sounded like an electric drill) - the insulated windows stopped most noise from outside. Staff v. friendly, lovely bar downstairs, room size generous, spotlessly clean. I would think twice about staying again, though, as Paris isn't as much fun with little sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Fjellpi
Reviews.Content: We got married in Paris, and booked this hotel for us and our guests. We had a just wonderful time! The staff were so helpful and nice, and the rooms were clean and lovely! The location of the hotel was good! Near all the touristattractions, but still in a quiet neigbourhood. We will recommend this hotel for everyone! We will come back :o)

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox was O.K. but....”
Reviews.Author: Lilyismyprincess
Reviews.Content: I don't have much experience staying in Paris to compare it to. What we didn't like was that the whole hotel was extremely smoky smelling and that is a big turnoff for us. I think the odor is in the walls from years past but it may be in the worn carpet. The area of town seemed a bit touristy and the restaurants overpriced compared to other parts of Paris that we visited. The cheapest draft beer I found in the area was 6 Euro. We have mixed reviews for the hotel staff, some very helpful and some not so helpful, aloof. In particular I asked for advise for a reasonably priced restaurant nearby that had good escargot and we were sent to an expensive place at the end of the street that didn't even offer snails. On the good side. The air conditioner worked well. The showers were immediately hot and had good water pressure. The room was clean even though it had a stale smoky odor. There are Metro stations at both ends of the short street. There is a grocery store two or three doors down.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at the Lenox again.”
Reviews.Author: itsolutionz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days as part of a Rick Steves tour of Paris and northern France. If you know anything about Rick Steves, his selection of this lodging tells all! As the other reviews state, it is close to the metro, quiet, clean, interesting neighborhood, superb staff (English spoken well enough to answer any question or need for language-deficient folks from America), and the breakfast is truly unusual for Parisâ€”eggs, meat, yogurt, great pastries, fresh fruit and juice, strong coffee, and on and on. There is internet access (I didnâ€™t use it but other tour members did), some of the local restaurants are excellent (I did not find *all* Paris food to be great, but there are guides to lead you to the right place), it was safe to walk at night (not everywhere in Paris feels good at 11PM), the flat-screen in-room TV had BBC and CNN in English (if you need to keep up with news); and the hotel graciously let me keep luggage stored there, without charge, when I traveled outside of Paris and no longer kept the room. As for room size, I found mine to be fine, but remember that most Paris hotels under $300 a night have rooms smaller that American big-city hotels. I would stay at the Lenox again without hesitation, and I am comfortable recommending it to anyone other than those requiring the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox was great”
Reviews.Author: Floridatraveler05
Reviews.Content: Three generations of my family (13 of us including a 2 month old) stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse in May to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. Everyone was very pleased with the hotel and the staff. They enjoyed the availability of WiFi, free Internet, cleanliness, and location. It is very close to 2 different Metro lines, a grocery store, laundromat, Luxembourg Gardens, Gare Montparnasse, and restaurants of many nationalities. We have stayed at 3 other Paris hotels and this was by far the best. The only negative was that the buffet breakfast was very expensive, but you can get a croissant and coffee for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobobagins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on business. Location is convenient for underground and in a good location for restaurants. The hotel is functional with good clean rooms. Satff friendly and helpfull. Only critisism is the room I was in was quite noisy, It was on first floor directly over the bar and facing onto the street so could hear music untill 1-2 in morning. Also deliveries to local shops and restauracts seem to start at 5am with a street facing room this was very noisy. On holiday this may not bother you but having to go to work the next day was not the best.Overall an OK hotel but noisy. If staying on business again would probably look for another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* experience”
Reviews.Author: MarkBarnes
Reviews.Content: A great 3* hotel set in a first rate location for a weekend break. Excellent access to Metro stations & great walks around, plus close to Jardin du Luxembourg. Try local cafes for your breakfast and the market in Edgar Quinet. A must is the view from Tour Montparnasse. Rooms are small but clean and of a high quality. Showers are bijou! A great stay - WE WILL RETURN!

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: BishboshLeeds
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach from Gare du Nord - straight down to Vavin metro station. Five minutes walk from the Jardin du Luxembourg, Hotel Lenox is on a quiet street on the left bank. On arrival thought that the room was too small to be a 'Superior' so questioned this at the front desk. Very polite staff confirmed it was right but moved us without a quibble to room 43 which was bigger. (See pics for floor plan). Parisien hotel rooms do seem to be smaller than in the UK and the big room on the hotel website is a 'Junior suite'. Room was clean and in good repair - everything worked well and all the staff, including the cleaners were really friendly and helpful. Didn't go for the 16 euro a head buffet breakfast but found the great patiserie/cafe just down the road to be a source of great coffee and pain aux raisins. Tip get a 'superior' room ending in '3' or '6' for more room!

Reviews.Title: “No problems when you go to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ogir
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied and we are going to stay there again. Clean and proper hotel. Nice district, a lot of sopping facilities, cloce to a lot of great things - the Montparnasse Tower etc. Near the Metro - we arrived at night and took the metro from the airport to the Mont Royal station - then there was only a short walk to the Lenox. We are danish. We went to Paris for five days in marts 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler71
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We loved our room on the 4th floor and complementary drinks upon arrival. Lenox Montparnasse is close to everything - shops, creperies and restaurants. Located on a quite street in between two metro lines. There is a cinema/movie house just across the street. Absolute recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley perfect, 10* service!”
Reviews.Author: rebz6999
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a 5 night stay in Paris and can't believe how amazing this hotel was! The room, which was very smartly decorated, had a decent sized beautiful bathroom and also a balcony which led onto a court yard with a fountain. The hotel has a brilliant electronic system in place which allows you to notify the front desk when you do not want to be disturbed. Thanks to this, we did not have any face-to-face encounters with the cleaners and instead, we would return from a long day's sight-seeing to find our room absolutely spotless, with soaps and towels replaced and also a bit of french music playing from the flat screen tv to welcome us back. This was done everyday! The hotel offers breakfast (which we did not try) and also has a really classy bar and lounge area where the drinks were no more expensive than anywhere else. As for the staff, I could go on and on. I have never before (certainly not in hotels) encountered such a friendly and professional service. The staff go out of their way to help you and they are always there at the desk, no matter what the time. The location is great, a minute away from the nearest metro -which is all you need. Plenty of restaurants nearby too, although that did not make this a noisey area. Overall, a fantastic trip which was hugely influenced by our stay in this hotel. We will return to Paris but would not consider staying anywhere else -even if we had to re-arrange our holiday dates to get a booking, it would be worth it. Don't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grandslam1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Europe for 3 weeks and of all the hotels in France and Italy, only this one had internet service in the lobby that was free. Also we arrived a bit early and the staff very cheerfully let us into our room early, Very nice staff and the breakfast is to die for although a bit pricey. Nice room and the hotel is situated between two subway (Metro) stations which was very convinient. Add to this the fact that there are several cafe's and shops on the street and up the block on weekends is a street fair. Also when we asked to leave our luggage at the hotel on the day of our check-out it was not a problem. We came by later in the evening..around 1900 hours I remember...to pick up our luggage for the overnight train from Paris to Venice Italy, and all our belongings were kept in a safely locked room. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, and hammock bed”
Reviews.Author: Snowdog999
Reviews.Content: Although a friendly staff greeted us, we found our room to be very small, saved by a window that opened fully to a small balcony overlooking the street. The bed had a hammock effect, and was really in need of replacement. Our room was the smallest layout in the hotel, so maybe other rooms felt somewhat spacious. Bathroom was tiny, couldn't turn around in the shower. Would definitiely try another hotel, although for price, maybe this was OK afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: laurenrs
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with Hotel Lenox. Good location for transport links and on a quiet road. Very helpful and friendly staff who go to extra lengths to help you find bars and restaurants that only the locals know about. Rooms were small but clean, nicely decorated and ours had a view over the courtyard with a plasma TV. Modern bar with a classic touch - and comfy sofas if you fancy lounging. Also - my boyfriend was delighted that the pub across the road (very quiet) had a TV so we could watch ManU V Chelsea FA Cup on Saturday! So, smiles all round! I really recommend the Lenox Montparnasse and will go back there the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjbcentral
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel and would stay there again. My wife and I spend 5 nights at the hotel. We booked a standard double room with shower directly on the hotel's website. The website was easy to use and the transaction processed smoothly. When we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded at the same rate to a double room with bath, room 51 on the 5th floor. The sixth room pictured on the room pictures shown on the hotel's website (lavander patterned bedspread and curtains, with white cabinets on either side of the bed) is representative of our room. The room was relatively spacious by Paris standards and was very clean. The daily maid service was excellent. The hotel staff was courteous, helpful and pleasant. They were polite enough to endure our attemped communications in French, but were happy to switch to English as needed. The hotel appears to be frequented by a lot of anglophones from the U.K. and U.S. Our room was on the back side of the hotel and was reasonably quiet. The back side of the hotel faces a large courtyard (a real courtyard, not a large light well) and some of the surrounding buildings are not as tall, meaning that the view from our 5th floor window was more expansive that we would have expected. Also, the room had excellent light, especially in the morning. Our only possible issue with the room was that we did have a smell of cigarette smoke that permeated into the room a couple of nights for awhile, either coming from an adjacent room, the hall or in through the window, but it was not major and did not persist. As reported by others, this hotel is well located. We took the RER train both from and to the Charles de Gaulle airport without incident. The RER station (Port Royal) is an easy 10-12 minute walk down Montparnasse Bourlevard from the hotel. I would not recommend the train if you are carrying a lot of baggage or have large bags. We travelled with a 24" roller bag and a small backpack each. We put the 24" roller bags on the overhead racks on the train. Larger bags will not fit on the racks. We did see some travelers on the train with large bags, but clearly they were struggling. As an alternative, we noticed that Air France has a bus stop near the Montparnasse train station (an easy walk from the hotel) with service to the Charles de Gaulle airport. The hotel is also located near several metro stops serving metro lines providing access to many differnent parts of the city. We expected to use the metro a lot, but actually ended up walking everywhere. Also as reported by others, there are a lot of eating establishements (of a variety of price levels) around the hotel. We did not purchase the hotel breakfast, but went out every morning. We especially liked the boulangerie on rue Brea, where rue Brea and rue Vavin converge, on the way to the Jardin du Luxembourg. They have a nice counter facing the street where you can sit and have coffee and something to eat while watching activity on the street. Two espresso drinks, two croissants and two yogurts for a bit over 7 euros. We also found the Vavin Cafe, across the street from the boulangerie, to be a welcoming bistro. We also went to Noura (Lebonese cuisine), near the hotel on Montparnasse Boulevard, one night and found the food excellent. Noura is apparently a chain with multiple restaurant locations in Paris and London. The street on which the hotel is located is not touristy, and does have some nice shops. We especially enjoyed the fromagerie across the street and down a bit toward Montparnasse Boulevard from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob2007
Reviews.Content: I booked my two night stay based on the reviews on this site. The hotell is located on a quiet street in between several very busy streets, which was nice because this gave me the flavor for the area without the noise. The staff are very nice and speak English well. The room was small, but I think that is to be expected in Europe. The bathroom was quite roomy. Both rooms had windows that opened to a lovely courtyard. There was a flat screen TV in the room, although very few english channels, which I also expected. The location is superb. Right between several Metro stations and tons of restaurants. There was no shopping nearby, that I could tell, but I didn't go out of my way to find it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mauricio_Prado
Reviews.Content: It's a great small hotel. Nice location, near three metro stations. It's not The Ritz, but comfortable rooms, a nice bathroom, great breakfast and a friendly staff. If I'll go to Paris again, I would not hesitate to stay in Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: ApoHal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we wanted: reasonably priced, good location, very clean and with a great, friendly staff! For a trip to Paris -where most of the time you'll be out sight-seeing anyhow- the Lenox is a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: brussow
Reviews.Content: Myhusband and I stayed here for one week during our honeymoon. The hotel decor was beautiful, with flat screen t.v.'s and roomy bathrooms. The area is beautiful and great seafood restaurants around. Very close to the metro which made getting around easier. The staff are very friendly and always willing to help. We would definitely return. Another added bonus was that it was right next to a grocery store which made buying snacks much cheaper. We absolutely loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a quick foray in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HaroldofHastings
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money, the staff was as attentive as in a four or five star and the room was comfortable without being overwhelming. Good selection of restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “No bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: SidneyB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location close to cafes and shopping but they also have a cozy bar on the main floor. I went with my mother (age 79) and we were both comfortable. The hotel is lovely, friendly, clean and provides all the comforts of home. Well, almost. We were really glad to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0netrack
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very good for the price, easy to get to from montparnasse train station. Free WiFi in room when I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: PJDAC
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite for 3 nights and were really pleased with our choice. The room was comfortable and spacious (but lacked tea and coffee making facilities). Staff were really helpful and friendly and spoke excellent English. Our only complaint was that breakfast was not complementary and was an expensive extra considering the choice of eateries located nearby although on the one occasion that we did have breakfast the food was delicious. The hotel is well situated - a 2 minute walk from two Metro stations (serving different lines) and 5 minutes from the Gare Montparnasse. Numerous cinemas (showing English language films) shops and restaurants made this an ideal location. We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Quaint place”
Reviews.Author: JonaVSeattle
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the hotel for 5 days. It is in a great location! Tons of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. Also you are next to the train station so very easy to commute places. THERE IS NO FREE SHUTTLE FROM AIRPORT. Another couple and I both told there was a free shuttle from our different travel agents. No, there isn't. Ask the hotel to be clear on what bus to take from the airport and directions from the drop off. That part was sort of a struggle. The hotel is cute, safe and clean. The bar staff is nice and Jules at the front desk is so sweet. A couple of the other staff weren't very helpful when I asked for help on how to get to the Eiffel tower or other major sites. She told me it was an easy walk. Well, I think I would have preferred if she helped with directions to the metro instead. (Ok..I figured the metro after day 2) Stay here if you want to avoid the tourist areas but want a great taste of Paris. I miss all the cafes and food already!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: jammiedodger1806
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay at this hotel with my boyfriend and couldn't fault it at all. Arrived early and although our room wasn't ready the reception staff sent someone to get it ready straight away. We had a room on the front of the hotel (number 33) that was one of the larger ones with a queen size bed. The room was a good size for Paris and was very clean with mini bar, flat screen tv, wardrobe and desk. The bathroom was also very clean and well equipt with a bath/shower, sink, toilet and bidet. The hotel has an underground carpark which we used at a rate of 20 Euros a night, which seems steep but is a much better option that leaving the car on the street due to the amount of traffic wardens and the way the Parisians carelessly squeeze their cars into very small gaps!!! We had breakfast only once in the hotel, not because it wasn't good, because it was but just because we wanted to get out and explore the Parisian cafes. Hotel breakfast was 16 Euros each, which may sound steep but it was all you can eat with croissants, pastries, bread, ham, cheese, sausages, eggs, drinks, cereal, yoghurts and fruit salad, and was very yummy. Definately worth it if you famcy a big brekkie to set yourself up for a day of sight seeing!!! Good value seeing as though typical cafes offered one hot drink, orange juice, one croissant, one piece of french bread, butter, jam and an omlete for 12 Euros. The hotel is in a great location, 2 roads away from the Montparnasse tower, which is definately a must! Great views over Paris including the Eiffel tower. Loads of cafes, bars, restaurants, creperies etc in the streets surrounding the hotel. Our favourite restaurant being the Montparnasse 1900, along the Boulevard Montparnasse, 5 mins walk from the hotel. Had heard about this restaurant and the reception staff were very helpful in ringing to book us a table. Lovely posh french restaurant, wonderful service and atmosphere. About 95 Euros for 2 people (3 courses). Well worth it though, food excellent and even better than Altitude 95 in the Eiffel tower where we also had dinner. Eiffel tower only 30 mins walk from the hotel which is a great way to see the Parisian streets and shops. However, there are two metro stops, one at each end of the road the hotel is in to get you to the further away attractions, eg the Sacre Coeur, which is well worth a visit in the sunshine, however the surrounding area of montmartre appreared dirty and not as expected!!! All in all the hotel is fantastic, clean, well staffed, in an excellent location and well worth a visit. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient, helpful”
Reviews.Author: maglinders
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a second time having been impressed first time round (last year). Service with the personal touch from the friendly efficient staff who will remember if you have stayed there before. This is a small, quiet hotel conveniently located in a quiet street just off a main avenue and right by a Metro 4 stop (Vavin) - you are about 10 minutes on the Metro from Notre Dame (CitÃ©). There is a great selection of restaurants at all prices within 2 minutes' walk including some really excellent fish restaurants. The hotel has clean, neat rooms with comfortable beds, hair drier, tissues and plent of towels in the bathrooms. I plan to go back any time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 457khz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, close to the Montparnasse Station so it was very convenient to catch a shuttle bus to/from the airports. As mentioned in other posts, the Metro is also close/convenient for access all over the city. Room was a bit snug, but very comfortable and clean. Free Internet access was a nice perk. Nice big windows that open for fresh air were great, and made the room bright. Great neighbourhood and restaurants around... found this to be a great home base while visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding People Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kardell
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the desk and bar were very friendly and helpful. They could not have been any nicer. The room was, as expected, small, but immaculate. It had bath sheets, not towels. Even though we were on the street is was not noisy, with the windows closed. For, Paris, the rate was reasonable, and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “A good find!”
Reviews.Author: Popularpress
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay at this small but lovely hotel. Excellent location for the tube and easy to get all around Paris from here. the hotel was clean and the people were very helpful and friendly, the 'club' room was more expensive than the standard room and although small (this is a Paris thing) it was clean and the room with ensuite was a good quality. We didn't eat breakfast here as it was 16Euros and not too exciting, there are loads of places within easy reach to choose from - we tried most including starbucks!! we met with other couples who gave grave reports of their accomodation so we were very happy to have find this one!! the cab ride from Orly airport cost 20 euros and took about 20ish minutes in rush hour. overall a really good experience and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwaanders
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very close to Montparnasse station. Easy to book online and convinient for a business trip. Breakfast is also good, and you get a free wireless access to the Internet. Location is ok as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night to Remember”
Reviews.Author: NatRoHan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend our wedding night at the Lenox Montparnasse and we'll always keep a fond memory of this hotel. The entire staff was friendly and welcoming, and the room was cozy, warm, calm and impeccably clean. I appreciated details like the fuzzy bath robes, the quality bath products, and the services like the delicious breakfast in bed, always delivered with good humor. We left well-rested and relaxed. This place is a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Travel0city
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Montparnasse in June 2006, found it to be a very pleasant hotel in a friendly neighbourhood. It is conveniently located between 2 metro stations and you'll be in St Germain in no time. Hotel staff is very friendly, rooms are clean and well decorated. It would have been a 5-star rating if the finishing were immaculate, but that's just details. I really recommend this hotel, it is not well known with the major organisations - let's keep it that way :-) Bear in mind that the prices on the website don't include the â‚¬ 15 breakfast. Plenty of breakfast cafÃ©s just around the corner though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellilou3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had one night in Paris and chose this hotel based on the photos and reviews from tripadvisor. The hotel itself is beautiful and in a location convenient to many good restaurants and a couple of metro stops. After many hours of driving just to get to Paris (and even more time trying to find the place), my husband and I were tired and frazzled and happy to see what a lovely and spacious room we'd gotten. When we laid down to sleep later that night, I kept hearing loud music playing and thought it was the person in the room next to me, but it turned out to be the hotel bar downstairs. If you're going to stay here, make sure you ask for a floor higher than the first, otherwise you'll hear the lame bar music playing all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: degrassiyau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for a few days in December 06 and I highly commend the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. Despite not knowing French, I still found the hotel staff very helpful, especially in providing out-of-hours internet access. The room was comfortable and whilst the hotel was within walking distance of shops, etc, I wasn't bothered by the roar of traffic near the hotel. I highly recommend the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean and Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: crsezz
Reviews.Content: We had no idea what to expect as we booked this online - but we were very pleased with the results. Best thing about the hotel - LOCATION. Steps away from the Metro, but within walking distance of many of the great tourist spots too! Plenty of great restaurants nearby as well. Just a great spot - very clean - very friendly - with free internet access right in the lobby. Breakfast was included for us - and it was a really nice spread - both hot and cold. I would certainly recommend this hotel as great middle of the road accommodations - (with regard to price and frills). Only "drawback" - as with most european hotels - rooms are a bit small - but we were fine with ours!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenfrog2007
Reviews.Content: Great location and price for what it was worth. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was smaller than what I had expected but clean (It was a Club Room, supposingly larger). Breakfast buffet was average. I was in Paris with my Toddler and the stroller barely fit into the elevator. Paris is a beautiful city but isn't really a place for young children (not too stroller friendly anywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoHappyScots
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on first ever visit to Paris and fell in love with the hotel and Paris and will return soon to Paris and the hotel. Service excellent, room quality ideal, location superb close to 2 metro's and in a part of Paris which gives the real flavour of Paris. Would recommend to everyone. Well done to the whole team at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nibnord
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel in Nov 2006 with my girlfriend and we couldn't really fault this hotel. 1. Great location, bars, restaurants and shops nearby as well as a metro station at the end of the road so you can easily get to virtually anywhere in Paris. 2. Rooms (we did upgrade) were very nice although a little small (but I think this is the same everywhere in Paris) with LCD TV, fridge, safe, small balcony. Very nice bathroom which was cleaned every day and fresh towels provided. 3. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, although I wouldn't bother with the breakfast as there are a couple of boulangeries just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Apuliamore
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff with good English. A nice room with the usual features. A free to use internet computer in the lobby. I chose it because it is close to Montparnasse station for my journey on. It is also very close to 2 metro stations from which you can get anywhere in Paris. There's a reasonable buffet breakfast. The hotel does not have a restaurant but is close to several excellent ones, including the Bistrot du Dome with great fish dishes but only modest English.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel Lenox!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler4
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved this hotel!! It meet all our needs and is in a great, safe location. Granted our room was small in size but it was very clean and provided everything we needed. We spent most of our time sight seeing so the room size wasnt a big deal to us. The staff was wonderful and met any request we had. The hotel is close to several underground subway stops, but we chose to walk to many of our destinations as it was in the area of many locations we wanted to vist. There is also a grocery store right next door to the hotel where you can pick up pretty much anything you would need.I booked this hotel based on the recommendations from Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. We will certainly stay at the Hotel Lenox again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities, price”
Reviews.Author: oski99
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, Oct 06. This hotel is within short walking distance of at least 3 different metros, so a stay with a Carte Orange was perfect. Great prices (appx $180 per night?), had a room that looked onto the courtyard behind the hotel. Nice and quiet. Never smelled any cigarette smoke. Room has a bed and plenty of room to walk around, not much more. Our bathroom had full bath, shower, lots of room. Had 2 grocery stores on the same block - had cheap yogurt breakfasts and walked a little farther to find cafe. Starbucks is just a little down Blvd Montparnasse if you're hooked. Would absolutely stay again for level of amenities at the price and a great neighborhood, with Metro almost at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: MaryJq
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is in a fantastic area - close to some lovely and very French cafes, excellent restaurants and plenty of shops. The bedroom was small (and the bed wasn't the biggest either), but it was nicely decorated. The bathroom was tiny - fine for us but if you like a bath you may be disappointed! We also occasionally got the faint whiff of cigarette smoke in our (non-smoking) room. We thought the bar was extortionately priced (about 10 euros for a pint of lager!), but we then realised that everywhere in Montparnasse is about that price! Breakfast is OK (standard hotel fare), but it's better value (and better food!) if you walk a few paces down the road to the Cafe de la Place, which does lovely coffee, croissants or omelette and juice. We also recommend the duck salad from there - nothing like any salad I've ever had before! All in all, the Lenox Montparnasse is good value considering the location, and it does have character, but I wouldn't shell out more than the Â£75 (about 100 euros) a night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Budget Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pacifica_gal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a seven night stay at the Hotel Lenox Montparnasse and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris - especially if budget is a concern. Having recently spent two nights at different hotels in NYC (where the rooms are really small and very expensive), we were very pleased with the Lenox. We were able to get a great rate of 112 Euros per night for a room with double bed and bath. And even though we were on the second floor (facing the courtyard), we did not have any problems with street noise. Although our room was small, our two large suitcases cramped the room, there was sufficient closet space. The bathroom was much larger than we expected. I didn't find the shower to be exceptionally small like some other people have mentioned. The bathroom looked as though it was recently remodeled. There was always plenty of hot water and the water pressure was strong. There were also nice French bath products. The location of the hotel is great - it is a short walk to several metro stations. The closest metro station to the hotel is Vavin - line 4. You can take this line to get to Notre Dame and Sainte-Chapelle. The Edgar Quinet station is at the other end of the street (line 6) and makes it easy to get to the Eiffel Tower. The Montparnasse station is only a few blocks away and is a big transfer station for many lines. I think someone else may have mentioned this. Upon check-in, you receive a big, heavy brass key. You don't have to worry about carrying a hotel key around with you - you leave the key at the front desk when you leave and pick it up again upon your return. The front desk staff were all friendly, helpful and spoke English well. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel. We went to La Coupole a few times - they have a nice continental breakfast for 8.5 Euros. There are many restaurants in the area. If you want to splurge, I'd recommend Le Dome (just around the corner from the hotel) for excellent seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: sully0108
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from our 4 nights New Year stay in Paris staying at the Lenox Montparnasse hotel. I can honestly say I found this hotel to be perfect in every way and was more than adequate for our short visit. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the maids did an excellent job in keeping our room extremely clean, the bathroom was spotless. We opted for the "club" room (number 56) which wasn't a very large room but I would describe it as cute and comfortable, and so was the bathroom, it wasn't very spacious or too small, but it looked new, the shower was excellent and the towels were lovely and soft. The finishing touch to our room was the balcony which had the street view. Neither of us were disturbed by the noise, in fact the little noise we heard added to the charm of the location, being able to watch Parisian life of the surrounding area. And the location of the hotel was better than I had anticipated. Montparnasse has plenty of restaurants and cafes and there was a market at the weekend selling local produce from cheeses to seafood to jewellery. The hotel street itself had plenty to offer...a supermarket, cheese and bakery shops, a wine shop, bars and a pharmacy at one end, cash machines the other. And of course not forgetting the 2 metro lines Vavin and Edgar quintet at either end of the street which in 10 minutes took you to the main tourist sights. Mentioning sights, I would agree, the Montparnasse tower is a definite especially with it being in the area. We did walk from the Eiffel tower back to the hotel on New Years eve night which only took around 30minutes, we just headed in the direction of the Montparnasse tower. With regards to the other services the hotel provided, the bar at night was relaxing offering alcohol or hot drinks, the breakfast was good if a little pricey and then there is the free internet access which was a nice added bonus. Overall our stay was excellent, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone as for a 3 star hotel you get more than you pay for. When we visit Paris again we will definitely stay at this hotel. It was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “2 very comfortable nights ...”
Reviews.Author: cuddlyfunbundle
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading other reviews we were pretty confident that the Lenox would deliver ... and it did, bar a couple of very minor points, which i will mention later. Easy to find, just follow the signs from 'Vavin' metro stop for Rue Delambre, up the steps into the street, walk 30 metres straight on and hang a right into Rue Delambre. We took 10 minutes to complete a 3 minute walk-reading menus at the restaurants on the right as you walk down Delambre to the hotel. Checking in was fine-my above average French went a long way to break the ice, however, my language skills were not up to those of the friendly, helpful staff on reception. Our room was a 'club' room on the 2nd floor(3rd floor for the Amercans amongst us..) .... clean, tidy, and overlooking the cinema over the road..! Not the best view that we have had in Paris but hey, if you want a view, sleep on the roof of the Montparnasse tower...!! To be very critical, there were some cracked tiles behind the bidet in the bathroom and the vent for the aircon was a bit dirty but the matress on the bed was great...I am 19 stone and it supported me and my wife fine. We managed to lock our passports in the safe in our room and forgot the code....no problem for the staff, it was sorted immediately...much to my embarrassment..! We didn't have a problem with smoke in the corridors, as mentioned by other reviewers .. however, I was awoken by late night (or should that be early morning) visitors to the bar over the street. However, the rooms are double glazed and kept out nearly all the late night noise you get in any city. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel...no disrespect to the Select but we don't ever...it's better value and more fun eating out.. Our flight home was on Sunday PM...the staff were fine about us leaving our bags at the hotel...the room is locked and safe enough... The hotel clearly values the reviews on this site,,,it asked us to comment in an honest fashion about both the good and bad about our stay. All in all an above average rating from us.....however, our last hotel was the Select in the Latin Quarter....if you want 'quiet' than that beats the Lenox as it is a pedestrian area. Would we stay there again....no...but only because there are so many other 3 stars hotels in other areas we want to be in... If we were visiting Paris for the Contrescarpe area then yes...it is a reliable bet and easy going, comfortable place to be with good local places to eat. One last point...the best view of Paris really is from the Montparnasse tower....turn left out the hotel and it is a 5 minute walk...enjoy it!!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parkslope2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed during Thanksgiving weekend for $145. Room was much smaller than other three star hotels in Italy and Barcelona. Shower was very small but clean. Bed was clean. Staffs were very friendly and let us check out one hour late. I could hear some noise from the street at night so I used ear plugs. 3-4 homeless men with a big dog were hanging out in the block and they made lot of noise on Friday and Saturday night. Hotel is located near RER station (Port Royal) so we took RER tain from Airport and walked only three blocks. Make sure to buy round trip tickets. It will save you lot of time. We used two metro stations near the hotel all the time. It was so easy. We also took open tour buses (Yellow ones) to rest our legs. You can buy tickets on the bus. Ask Hotel for a brochure. Open tour bus system in Paris is very slow. Be prepared to wait for a long time. We didn't eat hotel breakfast. It seemed too expensive. Our best breakfast was at a small bakery store on the Vavin Street on the way to Luxemburg Garden. Overall we enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: mookdogg
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights at the end of November. We checked in to find four walls built around a small double bed. You could see a noticable slump in the matress in the room, normally that would indicate that it is time for a new matress, or at least to flip the matress. Thought the hotel is located on a side street, It is an extremely noisy street. There is a pub across the street, and some other restaurants/Cines & apartments, which people feel the need to yell down the steet late at night. As an added bonus, the Trash pick occurs between 5am and 7am and lasts about 40 minutes. Taking a shower was an expericnce, it was not big enough for me or my wife to turn around in. The wine at the Hotel bar was expensive, and prices were not disclosed The Location of the Hotel is outstanding, it is close to 2 metro Stations, and many fine restaurants. the rooms are very well decorated, and the staff was helpful. When we return to Paris we will not stay at this hotel. If the bed was a newer, or we would have been moved off the street, I could then give an Okay rating

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hibrow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two midweek nights and got a good rate for a club room. The room was a good size with a good bathroom. As below review, smoking in the hallway was a bit annoying. Also annoying was that the receptionist on booking in gave us a free upgrade to a club room - I told her that we had booked a club room, but remembering previous reviews, didn't bother to argue. The hotel location is excellent, one end of the street has the Dome and the other end has 100s of creperies. There are restaurants and cafe's everywhere. On the first night, we had the usual bullish unhelpful French staff in restaurants when asking for a space or a high chair for our baby and pram (what do the French do?) so went back to the hotel to ask for advice. Got recommended the excellent Le Parc aux Cerfs, 50 rue Vavin - the food was excellent in this hotel and the staff were amazing with our toddler, keeping him entertained and giving him treats. An absolute star find for travellers with kids. Also nearby is Hippopotamus - an average French chain but with high chairs! Good hotel in excellent area and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jklw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox hotel for four nights. It was comfortable, although small (we booked the cheaper of the rooms, the other rooms were a decent size). The staff were pleasant and helpful, and spoke English well. The location was great (short walk to 2 metro lines), and had an abundance of patisseries, creperies, and small restaurants nearby. We did not do breakfast at the hotel; instead we opted for a great pastry or crepe from nearby. Our only complaint was that smoking was allowed in the hallway outside of our room, and when someone did smoke, we were definitely bothered by it inside our room. Unfortunately the hotel was full or the management would have moved us to another room. Overall we had a great time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or tourism”
Reviews.Author: LopatOSI
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel close to everything in central Paris. The hotel is very clean, the breakfasts tasty, and the staff is warm, friendly, bilingual and helpful. The rooms are cozy by US standards, but ample and the private bathroom was generous. The hotel is a short walk to two Metro stations, a main railroad station, and a major bus terminal. Who needs a car? Ask the staff for local restaurant recommendations-you won't be disappointed! This hotel is a keeper and a great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: aldale
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I can now say confidently that we have a "favorite Paris hotel." We can't wait to return to Montparnasse, the nearby restaurant Wadja (where we got engaged), and to reconnect with the wonderful staff at the Lenox. Regular rooms are small, and an upgrade was dear, but we still rank our six nights there as tremendously enjoyable. The pleasant, professional, friendly staff could not have been more helpful. al dale in atlanta, ga

Reviews.Title: “Great location, solid value”
Reviews.Author: RowerinVA
Reviews.Content: A good, English-language-friendly hotel in the heart of one of the best restaurant districts in Paris. I paid $180 per night (via Expedia) for a queen bed and private bathroom and did not experience any hidden charges at checkout. The room had a desk, closet, and safe, and was about 13x10 -- that's small by American standards but quite good for Paris. The breakfast, 15 Euros extra (optional), was a good selection of eggs, meats, pastries, fruit, yogurt, etc., much better than the usual Paris hotel fare. But it's the location that really makes this place. One block (really) from the Vavin stop on the #4 line (which takes you directly to Cite, the stop for Notre Dame and Sainte Chapelle) and from the Edgard Quinet stop on the #6 line (which takes you directly to the Eiffel Tower) -- about 7 minutes to each. Or you can easily walk to both places: Notre Dame is 31 minutes at a brisk walk (I timed it) and the Eiffel Tower is a bit closer. On the same block as The Dome (one of the better seafood restaurants in Paris - try the langoustines) and surrounded by the Montparnasse area of wonderful food, particularly seafood; also, about three blocks to the Galleries Lafayette if you want to shop. Nicely appointed, relatively quiet, completely clean, very nice staff. A tourist hotel (read - not luxury) - a perfect hotel for couples on a moderate budget. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Service”
Reviews.Author: retnam
Reviews.Content: We took the airfrance bus from the CDG and got directions from the conciergo of the Hilton to direct us to the hotel. It was a pleasant walk except that my wife did not take too well to the October morning winds. So i got her tucked into a cafe as i sought the exact location of the Lenox. When we got there, the recpetionist a young lady - friendly and efficient got our rooms orgainsed despite our early check in. We got the room at a rate of Euro 120 ( relatively steep for a three star hotel - but this is Paris !) This was my wife's first stay in a quaint boutique hotel as she's used to five star hotels in asia. So it was a shock to walk into an extremely small room. Though it was very clean, well painted and smell good. It was on the third floor and facing the lovely fountain in the open area. I specifically asked for a room that was not facing the streets. As we were from tropical warm Singapore we were not used to the cold and it would have been good to have a heating system. Which i only noticed on our last night in the toilte beside the shower. The area is relatively safe - lots of cafe and pastry shops on the street. I discovered the metro ( train station ) was a stone's throw on the left hand side of the hotel. We took a train to the eiffell tour - it was 4-5 stations away. The next morning, with a six hours time difference we got hunger pangs at 5.00 am and decided to check out the breakfast. The man in the reception, was extremely pleasant and helpful. Despite single handedly doing everything he made sure my wife was comfortably seated in the breakfast area and had a hot chocolate. The lady in the kitchen was an equal delight, being in an advance stage of pregnancy she was serving with a smile. I must add that most of them spoke excellent english. I was equally concern as this was our first trip to paris and that i don't land up in some shady hotel. On the contrary , it was a pleasant stay though a short one. To all the staff of the Lenox Montparnasee - well done and keep up the great work !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CGB9
Reviews.Content: My third stay at this hotel. Friendly staff on reception, spotlessly clean room, comfortable bed, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Bert
Reviews.Content: I chose the Lenox in large part because of the favorable reviews for it on TripAdvisor. I agree with virtually all of the comments made therein. On the positive side: the hotel was clean and all furnishings were in excellent condition, all of the personnel at the front desk spoke English, and the maids did a great job of tidying the room. On the down side: the shower (standard room) was too small for me (6' 0"), I was unaware that breakfast was extra (moreover, I was charged for 4, but had eaten only 3), and checking out took nearly 30 minutes. Given the opportunity, I would stay here again, but would opt for a larger room because of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalie_T
Reviews.Content: I was here 2 separate times during my trip at the end of September. The rooms were small but clean which is very important, had working AC. The 1st time, I got a nice decent room facing the back courtyard with an ample size bathroom with windows that open to the courtyard. The 2nd time I stayed at the hotel, I got a room facing the front street with a tiny bathroom. If you're taller than 5"5, you will be uncomfortable because there's no legroom for you from the toilet, you'll need to ask for a room with a bigger bathroom. The hotel is in a good location, 1 -2 minutes walk from 2 metro stations - Vavin and E. Quinet, 15 minutes from Gare Montparnasse, about 5 minutes from LaFayette shopping center. There are many restaurants, creperies, shops in the area; a small grocery store is a few steps from the hotel. I really enjoyed the breakfast then found out it was not included. I was under the impression it was because when I booked this hotel through Expedia, they told me breakfast was included. And during check-in, the clerk pointed to the dining room and told me 'breakfast is served here'. Later, I noticed a note posted on your room door that says breakfast is available at an extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: VizslaGirl
Reviews.Content: Paris in October is fantastic, and even if I'd hated my hotel, I'd have had a good time. But the Lenox is much more than I dared hope for for the price. I stayed in one of the lower-end rooms. It wasn't big- indeed, I would have liked a dresser to unpack in. But everything was clean and comfortable, the bed was nice, the light was excellent. I had tall French doors that opened onto a little patio where I could sit above the street, looking out at the bustle of town, and using the very good high speed wireless internet on my laptop. I've lived and traveled in Paris quite a bit, and I can tell you that the staff was unusually friendly and helpful. The lobby is surprisingly chic and glamorous, considering the low-key neighborhod and price. The hotel is incredibly convenient, with several Metro lines and major avenues nearby, as well as some of the city's most famous artists' cafes, which are literally on the corner. I only had 2 even vaguely complaint-like things to say. The first is that I felt the staff gave the impression that the breakfast in the lobby was complimentary, when in fact it is 15 Euros (that's more than $20 for coffee, eggs and croissants). And secondly, I had the hotel wash my Teeny, tiny bag of delicates, maybe 10 items all together, and it came out to $100 or so. Outrageous. But then, don't do your laundry at a hotel. I will stay here again, and I am sending my parents, who are major world travelers, to stay as well. Overall, better value, elegance and quality and more bang for your buck than I had ever expected. It's not a "luxury" hotel. But it takes an affordable hotel to the next level of comfort and pleasure. I highly reccommend it for anyone but the luxury-oriented traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at Lenox”
Reviews.Author: cyngen
Reviews.Content: We've been back from our stay in Paris just over a week and we're already set to go back. The Lenox Montparnasse is a wonderful place to stay. We were there a week. We had one of the smaller rooms the first night and it was just too tiny so we upgraded and it was much better (esp. the bathroom). The place was spotless and the staff was lovely and extremely helpful. We absolutely adored the neighborhood. So much history! I was reading A Moveable Feast on the plane back to the US and Hemingway talked about walking down rue Delambre on his way to Le Dome. Our favorite thing was to go out the front door, turn left and head down to the cafe for breakfast each morning. There are probably 20 creperies down that way, too. Then we were fortunate to discover Wadja just a few blocks away...extraordinary food. The first night I had a 7-hour-roasted leg of lamb that was the best thing I've had in ages. Modigliani and Giacometti used to eat there (I'm an artist... this info blew me away). Also, was reading Art Buchwald's book I'll Always Have Paris and he mentions Wadja as his favorite restaurant from his days in Paris in the late 40s early 50s. I'll love it forever because I got engaged there last Monday night!! Next time we go to Paris we'll certainly stay at Lenox Montparnasse again. Great location, staff, clean rooms. Never got around to eating there because there was so much beckoning us right out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good little find”
Reviews.Author: francesl
Reviews.Content: Was looking for somewhere for a quick Autumn weekend in one of my favourite cities, and this place really fitted the bill. We paid for a slightly larger room, and thought that the hotel was great. Staff were fantastic - very helpful - and the breakfasts definitely worth having. The location overall was great too - a short stones' throw from the nearest Metro station, but we walked most places anyway! Have already recommended it to some friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: rossharris
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel for its value and location. The staff is extremely friendly and service-oriented. The rooms are typical Europe-small but clean and fucntional. The walls are thin. I recommend requesting a high floor to avoid noise from downstairs and people climbing the stairs. Noise fades later into the evening. The neighborhood is great with plenty of places to enjoy. Don't miss the crepe window at the Cafe de la Place just down at the West corner of rue Delambre. The Vavin metro station is stone's throw from the front door of the hotel. Easy walk to the station.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, nice neighborhood, Tiny bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for the Lenox after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I can only guess that mgmt had changed since then. When we checked in, our room was not ready. I specifically requested and confirmed a room not next to the elevator, and the first room they gave us couldn't be closer to the elevator. After having to throw a pretty major fit to get any attention, they moved us to another room that was also a bit larger. The bathrooms are very small, even by Paris standards.
