I mean you cannot take a shower without getting everything in the bathroom wet - the whole bathroom is maybe 12 sq. ft. - no kidding! The staff is less than helpful, and breakfast is not included in your rate, even if it says it is! They will charge you another 15 Euro for it per person. The neighborhood is nice and you can walk to many nice restaurants. Very close to two Metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lenox Montparnasse in mid-August and found the hotel to be clean, hospitable and cozy. We arrived early and were able to check into our room when we got there which was nice. We had a room on the third floor in the front of the building. Our room was lovely, it had a comfortable big bed,desk, and french doors to a small balcony with flowerboxes on it! So romantic! Breakfast was included and there was quite a spread. Cereal, crossiants (of course!), deli meat and cheese, fruit, tea and coffee were available. To other travellers, I would make a few recommendations. . .1) Ask for a room in the back because there was some street noise 2) If you're at all nervous about getting around a major city I would recommend staying closer to the sights, I was constantly turned around and confused (thankfully my husband can navigate even with a language barrier) 3) Bring an alarm clock- we requested a 3 am wake-up call to catch a 6 am flight and it never happened. Luckily we woke up and the front desk held the taxi for us but it was rather stressful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and very central. Will return!!”
Reviews.Author: SamCulver
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this website, we booked 2 nights here for our first trip to Paris. They communicated well before the stay, spoke English - if you're not feeling brave enough for French, was clean and comfortable. It was the location that was the bonus for us. We were a minute's walk from the metro (Vavin) and 2 minutes from the G Montparnasse. We walked to St.Germain de Pres and even got to the Notre Dame after a pleasant 1/2 hour's walk. The hotel offers a late booking reduced rate (up to 10 days before your arrival date), this meant that we really felt that we got value for money - book direct on their website! I really recommend it and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Job”
Reviews.Author: BEVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a stopover for one night in August following reading the reviews. Its a really OK place and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: IslingtonTexan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night with my boyfriend last week. We came down from London on the Eurostar to have a quick Parisian break. The Lenox Montparnasse was a perfect choice! The staff were lovely, especially the woman who worked the front desk during the days. Luckily for us, they were overbooked and we were bumped up to the Junior Suite at no extra cost! That certainly helped make the trip nicer. The bathroom was HUGE, particularly given the normally tiny state of Parisian bathrooms. There was ample sitting room, a flat screen tv, nice furnishings and a comfortrable double bed. As we were on the top floor, we had some nice views of the courtyard and surrounding buildings. The free internet downstairs was very nice, and it was helpful that they let us store our bags there after we checked out, until it was time for us to catch our evening train. The location was very convenient - you can walk all around the Left Bank no problem, and there are two Metro stops on either end of the street. If you need other lines, the Montparnasse-Bienvenue station is about a 7-minute walk away. On the second day I was cold, and asked the woman at the front desk if there was a Zara or H&M nearby where I could buy a jumper. She got out a map and pointed me to four Zaras within a 10-minute walk! Montparnasse is a great neighborhood; its very lively and has lots of restaurants and residents. I've stayed in the 1ere arondissement before and I hated how dead it was at night. It was nice to have so many people always around here. We'll definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: RandR-London
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for two nights here - having read the reviews on tripadvisor. But our experience was disappointing... We paid 20 Euro extra per night for Club doubles - because they sounded better in the reviews, but when we turned up, they had booked us into one Club room and one standard room. The person at reception was helpful but said they had no other rooms. We asked for confirmation that they would charge us the lower price, and he said they would but then he said that it could not be as much as 20 Euros per night difference. We then had to get the person to check their website, and then he agreed that we were right. The next day, we checked again with reception (as the person the day before did nights only). The woman said there was no way we could be entitled to 20 Euros off - she was rude and started shouting at us. In the meantime, our friends who were hungry were waiting outside the hotel to find some breakfast! We decided to give up arguing and take it up with the manager who was due to be there the next morning, This time, we were again told that the difference could not be 20 Euros a night, and we had to get them to check the hotel website - at this point, it got resolved and we got our first apology for the inconvenience. This time, the person was very helpful (even if their information about the hotels own rate was mistaken!). Its a shame that some of the service was so poor - because we really liked the hotel in other ways. The room was very small, but well designed and comfortable. The bed was good, the pillows nice, the bathroom spotless and not too small. The location was very good - and there is a wonderful bar next door called Rosebud.

Reviews.Title: “Great, flawless stay”
Reviews.Author: TJ_&_SMB
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Lenox Montparnasse. My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights and had an unbelievably good stay. The room was good sized and very clean. Both the sleeping area and bathrooms had large French-door style windows that opened up into the courtyard behind the hotel. It was unseasonably hot when we were there and we were extremely grateful to have the air conditioning. The staff was fabulous. The cleaning staff even left the TV set to a classical music radio station when they were finished; very nice touch. We found the area perfect. It was very close to two Metro stations on two different lines, making it easy to get around (you can get directly from Gare du Nord to the Vavin Metro station near the hotel on one line). There is a very good cheese shop, friendly wine store, two very good bakeries, and a market on the street the hotel is one. There are also many good cafes, restaurants, and bistros nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with character and elegance”
Reviews.Author: PADMIESTA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris having stayed here in this little charming hotel â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™. If you are Looking for a top hotel that has still got its Parisian charm oozing character and class, then trust me and look no further cos here it isâ€¦ IMPRESSED is the word Iâ€™m looking for..... I have stayed in many hotels allover the world, I am quite well traveled, but this Hotel is one of, if not the best I have stayed in.. I stayed here with my girlfriend and we had a huge room as per the piccies I have put on tripadvisor... â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ is lovely by the way that you are treat and the surroundings of the place, but without the hussle and bussle of a central hotel and the lost personal touch.. I booked a double superior room through Expedia and had no trouble at all with the booking. The room that we got was beautiful complete with a bathroom to die for as all Paris bathrooms are tiny as the rule, but not here, we even had a bath. :-) The room came complete with a plasma T.V and the nicest furnishings to make you truly feel that you were in Paris. We also had a balcony overlooking the street (Rue Delambre) and it was nice to sit and watch the world go by, with the added pleasure of the best double glazing, to ensure a good nights sleepâ€¦. Even though the street isnâ€™t rowdy anyway. All the staff of â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ make you feel really welcome and cant do enough for you, thus ensuring that your stay with them is a pleasurable one. All the staff that I came across spoke very good English but they would let you have a go at the French if you fancied it.. :-) â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ is ideally located as it is about a 1 hour stroll to the centre of the action and the furthest tourist point which was the Arc De Triomphe and about a 20 min walk to Saint Germain, despite this, you are literally a 2 second walk from where all the action is by the way of shops, bars and restaurants etc at the end of the road that â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ is on which is Rue Delambre is two roads one called boulevard Raspail and the other Boulevard du Monteparnasse and both of these roads are heaving with action by way of restaurants and bars/cafÃ©â€™s etc at night and also cafÃ©â€™s/bars and shops in the day. If you want to eat near to the hotel there are some of the nicest restaurants you will find in Paris situated approximately 100 meters from the hotel door. The breakfast at â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ was gorgeous, you can tell that the owners only use the finest ingredients in their cooking, this was nice to see, as I have sometimes stayed at places where corners are cut and the breakfast usually suffers with cheap food etc... once again NOT at the â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™... quality and fresh produce only... YUMMY!!! If you have done a lot of looking for Paris hotel as I did then you will have seen numerous comments about Bad breakfasts, NOT here folks it really is excellent and you can have as much as you like in the lovely restaurant. if you want to eat the way the french eat the there is a gorgeous pattisserie only 4 door away from the hotel and also a great supermarket for all your goodies for your room. I felt the only way to see Paris is on foot but if you want to use the metro there is a station at the end of the street again only feet from the hotel door. If there is anything else you want to know about â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ or indeed about paris, then please ask and I will try my utmost to assist.. pc2416@yahoo.co.uk If you are planning a trip to Paris and you can get into â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™ then book it you will NOT be disappointed I assure you... Me and my partner will be back again soon to Paris and we will definitely be staying at â€˜Lenox Montparnasseâ€™... Paddy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Such a darling hotel!”
Reviews.Author: meridionale
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at Hotel Lenox for three nights. It was our first time in Paris, so I booked because of the things I've read on here (trip advisor). The price was right as well. I can not express how happy I was with this hotel! It was very charming, out of the way but yet still close to everything because of the metro which is easy to figure out. The staff is absolutely one of the friendliest staffs I have had the pleasure of dealing with. They do speak english, and one gave us an excellent dining recommendation for our first night there. We just told him what we were looking for, and he handed us a card and told us how to walk there. There's a computer downstairs with internet open to guests, and they also have breakfast in the mornings for a fee. I didn't partake in it, but I did ask if I could buy one croissant to which the woman just told me to not worry about a payment. The bedrooms have a self control air conditioner that goes down to about 16C. That's actually a really cool temperature for European standards, so no complaints there. Our french window doors faced the courtyard rather than the street. The street is a quiet side street, so I'm sure those are quiet rooms, but the courtyard has a fountain in it, so when you open the french doors, you can here the fountain trickle. The only thing I could say badly about this hotel, and I hate doing it because the good outweighs the bad (and no hotel is perfect), but the walls are paper thin. In the mornings you can hear a lot of walking around and doors shutting, but I solved this by using the ear plugs virgin atlantic gave me. So, don't let this frighten you away! Just pack some earplugs. Overall, the price was excellent for this cute hotel in Paris. It lived up to all the hype on here, and my friend even commented he would love to honeymoon at this hotel. As far as the neighborhood, itâ€™s very nice and full of conveniences. Iâ€™m a 23 year old woman, and I always felt safe walking by myself. There is a grocery store a few doors down, numerous restaurants, pharmacy shops, boutiques, a starbucks, McDonalds, ect. There are two metro stations right around the corner on opposite ends that will take you to all the â€œhot spots.â€� Taxi fair from Gare du Nord (eurostar station) was about 10-12 Euro.
